<P_I,1>

{ED:1._TO_JOHN_STAYNFORD:DRAFT_1425}

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:JOHN_STAYNFORD:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_001:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Sount duez a mon sir Will Bardolf de sez gages en lez lyuere`s a Caleys
de mon treshonnure` sir le Count de Warrewyk , capitayn illeoqes ,
jusqes al iiij=te= iour de fevrier l'an de Roy Henri Sysme tierce
ccccxiij li. xvj s. x d. q=a= . PASTON,I,1.001.1

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:JOHN_STAYNFORD:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_001:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
To my weel beloued John Staynford of Furnyvales Inne . PASTON,I,1.001.2

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:JOHN_STAYNFORD:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_001:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
+Te instruccion to comune of to John Robynson of Carleton bysyde Snayth
. $To enquerre and wyte whether +te stoon may be sawed or nought , and
whether it wille chippe or chynne or affraye with frost or weder or
water . PASTON,I,1.001.3

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:JOHN_STAYNFORD:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_001:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Al-so +tat euery pece of +te stoon be iij foote longe and +tat xv tunne
$tyght of +te stoon be euery stoon weel bedded in-to +te walle and a
foote thikke +tat it ryse in heighte a foote in +te walle , and x
stones of +te stoon must be ij foote brood and at +te leste a foote and
an half thikke . PASTON,I,1.001.4

<P_I,2>

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:JOHN_STAYNFORD:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_001:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
A stoon wil drawe +te wighte of a pipe , as I suppose .
PASTON,I,2.001.5

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:JOHN_STAYNFORD:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_001:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
+To grete stones and nought +te smallere stones shuld be sawed so +tat
euery pece sawed shuld holde +te seid lengthe of iij foote and +te seid
brede of ij foote , and to be , after it is sawed , half a fote or
lesse on thikkenesse ; PASTON,I,2.001.6

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:JOHN_STAYNFORD:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_001:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and thenne +to brode sawed stones shulde euere stonde in +te werk
betwen +te seid weel bedded stonys +tat shuld rise but a fote in +te
walle and ben ankered iche of hem with other ; PASTON,I,2.001.7

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:JOHN_STAYNFORD:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_001:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and +tis werk shal be strong j-nowe , as werkmen seyn , and drawe but
litill cariage . PASTON,I,2.001.8

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:JOHN_STAYNFORD:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_001:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
I wold haue swiche stoon a xx=ti= tunne tight caried to Moneslee in
Norffolk , betwen Crowmere and Bromholm and but a myle fro Bromholm .
PASTON,I,2.001.9

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:JOHN_STAYNFORD:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_001:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
To reporte plein answere of this bylle writen and how sone I myght haue
the seid stoon caried to Monesle` a-forn seid , and for what price .
PASTON,I,2.001.10

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:JOHN_STAYNFORD:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_001:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
+Tis werk is for a myll . PASTON,I,2.001.11

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:JOHN_STAYNFORD:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_001:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
$per W. Paston PASTON,I,2.001.12

{ED:2._TO_AN_UNIDENTIFIED_LAWYER_IN_ROME:DRAFT_1425,_5_NOVEMBER}

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_8:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_002:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Do writen ij copies of +tis note in papier wyde writen ,
PASTON,I,2.002.13

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_8:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_002:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and gete a copie of +te writte in +te Eschekyr ageyn yow .
PASTON,I,2.002.14

<P_I,3>

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_8:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_002:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Right worthy and worshepefull ser , I recomaunde me to yow
PASTON,I,3.002.15

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_8:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_002:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and thank yow for +te good , trew , and diligent labour ye haue hadde
for +te matier betwen +te Priour of Bromholm and his commoigne apostata
John Wortes , +tat namyth hym-self Paston and affermith hym vntrewely
to be my cousyn . PASTON,I,3.002.16

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_8:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_002:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
God defende +tat any of my pouere kyn shuld be of swych gouernaunce as
he is of . PASTON,I,3.002.17

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_8:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_002:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Maister John Ixworth told me +tat he hadde lettres fro a frend of
yowres in +te court of Rome +tat is of +te seyd Prioures counseill in
+tis mater as ye be , whos name I knowe nought , specifyeng +tat +te
seyd John Wortes , aduersarius Prioris , desperat in causa et
concordiam querit . PASTON,I,3.002.18

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_8:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_002:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
It is told me sithen +tat +te seyd John Wortes is in +te $court of Rome
sacred a bysshop of Irland , videlicet episcopus Corcagensis ; wherby
it is seyd here +tat his pretense of his title to +te priourie of
Bromholm is adnulled and voide in yowr lawe . PASTON,I,3.002.19

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_8:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_002:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
+Te seyd John Wortes and a $contre`man of myn in +te seyd court ,
Maister John Vrry , haue sent me lettres wher-of I send yow copies and
a trewe instruccion of +te seyd matier closed with +tis bille , +te
whiche lettres and +te matier ther-of me semyth meruaillous and
straunge . PASTON,I,3.002.20

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_8:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_002:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
A prest of Norffolk +tat spak with yow in Jull or August last passed
told me +tat he yede with yow to +te cardinales hous Trikaricensis to
espie if any swych processe were sued ageyn me as +te seyd lettres
specifien , and +tat ye told +te same prest at alle tymes +ter was +tan
no swich processe sued ne had ; +te which relacion I trust and beleue
bettre +tan +te seyd lettres . PASTON,I,3.002.21

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_8:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_002:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
I haue , by aduys of counseill , in makyng a procuracie ad agendum
defendendum prouocandum et appellandum to yow and +te seyd Maister John
Vrry and +te Wynsolaw de Swysco , and also a general appelle +te
engrossyng of wych +te messager of this bill myght nought abide ; +te
which procuracie and appelle I shal sende to yowr persone tantumodo
with moneye onward on trust . PASTON,I,3.002.22

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_8:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_002:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
My wille is ye haue +te chief gouernaunce of +tis matier and +tat +tis
article be counseill ; $wher-vpon I prey yow <P_I,4> hertily to be
saddely auysed in +tese matieres and , as nede is , so to gouerne hem
by yowr wysdam +tat +te seyd Prioures estat and honeste` , and myn also
, to yowr worshepe be saued , and +tat in alle hast resonable ye lyke
to sende me rede` lettres of alle +te seyd matier and +te circumstances
ther-of , and whou ye wil I be gouerned in +tis mater .
PASTON,I,4.002.23

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_8:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_002:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
I was neuere somouned PASTON,I,4.002.24

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_8:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_002:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
ne neuer hadde tydynges of +tis matier but by seyd lettres and other
fleyng tales +tat I haue herd sithen , PASTON,I,4.002.25

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_8:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_002:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
ne neuere hadde to do more with +te seyd John Wortes +tan is specified
in +te seyd instruccion . PASTON,I,4.002.26

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_8:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_002:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Al-myghty God haue yow in his gouernaunce . PASTON,I,4.002.27

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_8:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_002:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Writen at London +te v day of Nouembre . PASTON,I,4.002.28

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_8:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_002:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER

<P_I,4>

{ED:3._PROBABLY_TO_MASTER_JOHN_URRY:DRAFT_1425,_NOVEMBER}

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:JOHN_URRY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_003:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Right worthy and worshepefull ser , I recomaunde $me to yow , preyeng
yow to wite +tat I haue resceyued yowr goodly lettres makyng mencion
+tat Ser John Paston vt asserit hath optyned me condempnyd to hym in
ccc marcz and c s. and +tat +te same John , atte reuerence of yowr
right worthy persone , hath cesed of his sute of certeins processes
ageyns me vp-on +te seyd condempnacion , takyng continuance of +te same
matier vn-to Cristemasse next comyng ; by whiche lettres ye conseille
me to make ende with +te seyd John ne deterius inde contingat .
PASTON,I,4.003.30

<P_I,5>

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:JOHN_URRY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_003:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
I send yow closed with this bille copie of vn frendly lettre +tat +te
seyd John hath sent to me late touchant +te same matier .
PASTON,I,5.003.31

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:JOHN_URRY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_003:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
+Te seyd Priour hath sent also to yow and to Mayster Will Swan , which
longe tyme hath be his procuratour , a procuracie for my persone and v
marcz of moneye onward . Wher-vp in +te seyd Prioures name and in myn
owyn also I prey yow hertily to sette al these matieres in continuaunce
vn-to yowr comyng in-to Ingeland , PASTON,I,5.003.32

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:JOHN_URRY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_003:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and be-cause ye arn here beneficed , owr cuntre`man , and of worshepe
and cunnyng worthyly endowed , +te seyd Priour , his brether , and I
also willen gladdely in these matieres be treted by yow ;
PASTON,I,5.003.33

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:JOHN_URRY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_003:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and if +tis mesure be accepted and we may haue knowyng here ther-of ,
it shal cause +te attemptacion of diuerses matieres a-geyn summe
frendes of +te seyd John to cese . PASTON,I,5.003.34

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:JOHN_URRY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_003:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And if +tis continuance be refused I prey yow with al my power +tat of
yowr wysdom and good discrecion ye wille in +te seyd Prioures name and
myn defenden +te seyd sutes , and alle other +tat +te seyd John sueth
a-geyn +te seyd Priour and me , in yowr best maner , and to be of owr
counseill in +tese matieres ; and as ye lyke resonablely to write to vs
so we wil be gouerned in yowr rewarde and al other circumstaunces of
+te same matieres . PASTON,I,5.003.35

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:JOHN_URRY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_003:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
I conceyve by yowr seyd lettres +tat +te grete of +te matier conteigned
in +te same ye haue of +te informacion and assercion of +te seyd John ,
and as he hath enformed yow I wot weel ye trewely writen ;
PASTON,I,5.003.36

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:JOHN_URRY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_003:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
but I hope and trust verrayly +te matier of his informacion is vntrewe
. PASTON,I,5.003.37

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:JOHN_URRY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_003:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
+Te Priour of Bromholm sued a-geyn +te seyd John and other in Ingeland
a wryt of premunire facias , PASTON,I,5.003.38

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:JOHN_URRY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_003:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and I was ther-in of +te same Prioures conseill , as +te lawe of
Ingelond and myn office willen , PASTON,I,5.003.39

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:JOHN_URRY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_003:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and more I haue nought hadde to do with +te seyd John ;
PASTON,I,5.003.40

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:JOHN_URRY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_003:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and I can nought beleue +tat in +tis cas +te same John myght by yowr
lawe any swich sute haue ageyn me as yowr lettre specifieth .
PASTON,I,5.003.41

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
RECIPIENT:JOHN_URRY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_003:M3:1425:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Also Will , +te prest specified in yowr $lettre , told me +tat he ,
after +tat ye told hym of +tis matier lyke as ye $write , he comuned
with Maister Will Swan , and he told +te seyd prest +ter $was no
processe in +te courte ageyn me in no maner . PASTON,I,5.003.42

{ED:4._WILLIAM_WORSTEDE,_JOHN_LONGHAM,_PIERS_SHELTON_1426,_1_MARCH}_ @

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:48
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WORSTEDE_&:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_004:M3:1426:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
A mez treshonnure`s meistres William Worstede , John Longham , et
Meistre Piers Shelton soit donne` . PASTON,I,6.004.43

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:48
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WORSTEDE_&:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_004:M3:1426:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Right worthy and worshepefull seres and maistres , I recomand me to yow
PASTON,I,6.004.44

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:48
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WORSTEDE_&:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_004:M3:1426:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and thank yow with al my herte of +te gret tendrenesse ye lyke to haue
of +te saluacion of my symple honeste` , preyng yow euermore of yowr
good continuance . PASTON,I,6.004.45

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:48
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WORSTEDE_&:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_004:M3:1426:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
I haue , after +te aduys of yowr lettre , doon dwely examyned +te
jnstrument by +te wysest I coude fynde here , and in especial by on
Maister Robert Sutton , a courtezane of +te court of Rome , +te which
is +te chief and most chier man with my lord of Gloucestre and his
matier in +te seyd court for my lady his wyff . PASTON,I,6.004.46

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:48
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WORSTEDE_&:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_004:M3:1426:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And here aunswere is +tat al +tis processe , +tough it were in dede
proceded as +te instrument specifieth , is not suffisant in +te lawe of
Holy Cherche , and +tat hem semyth by +te sight of +te instrument and
by +te defautes $+tat ye espied in +te same and other , and in maner by
+te knowelech of +te notarie , +tat +te processe in gret part ther-of
is <em> false and </em> $vntrewe . PASTON,I,6.004.47

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:48
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WORSTEDE_&:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_004:M3:1426:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
I haue taken aduys of Maister Robert Bruus , chaunceller with my lord
of Cantirbury , and Maister Nicholl Billesdon , $chaunceller of my lord
of Wynchestre , and Maister John Blodwelle , a weel lerned man holden
and a suffisant courtezan of +te seyd court ; PASTON,I,6.004.48

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:48
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WORSTEDE_&:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_004:M3:1426:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and alle +tese acorden to +te seyd Maister Robert Sutton .
PASTON,I,6.004.49

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:48
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WORSTEDE_&:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_004:M3:1426:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Nought with-stondyng +tat I herde neuere of +tis matier no maner lykly
ne credible euidence vn-to +tat I sey yowr lettre and +te jnstrument ,
yet I made an appell and a procuracie and also a prouocacion at London
longe beforn Cristemasse by +te $aduys of Maister Dauid Aprys , Maister
Symond Kempston , and Maister James Cole , PASTON,I,6.004.50

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:48
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WORSTEDE_&:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_004:M3:1426:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and sent al +tis with an jnstruccion of al +te matier to my
procuratours to Rome by yowr frere my <P_I,7> maister suppriour ,
PASTON,I,7.004.51

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:48
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WORSTEDE_&:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_004:M3:1426:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and gaff hym gold +tat he was content . PASTON,I,7.004.52

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:48
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WORSTEDE_&:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_004:M3:1426:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And ouermore now here by aduys I make +tis day a newe apelle and a newe
procuracie , PASTON,I,7.004.53

RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WORSTEDE_&:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_004:M3:1426:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and vp-on +tis alle +te seyd worthy men here seyn and informe me
pleynly I haue no maner cause in lawe ne in conscience to drede aught
in +tis matier . PASTON,I,7.004.54

, which I prey yow to kepe as pryue` as ye may . PASTON,I,7.004.68

<P_I,13>

{ED:6._THE_VICAR_OF_THE_ABBOT_OF_CLUNY:DRAFT_PROBABLY_1430,_APRIL}_C
ODE

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:52?
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_9:MALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_005:M4:1430?:AC:OTHER
My ryghte worthy and worshepeful lord , I recomaunde me to yow .
PASTON,I,13.005.71

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:52?
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_9:MALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_005:M4:1430?:AC:OTHER
And for as meche as I conseyue verrayly +tat ye arn vicar general in
Inggelond of +te worthy prelate +te Abbot of Clunie , and have hys
powre in many grete articles , and a-mong other in $profession of
monkes in Inggelond of +te seyd ordere . And in my cuntre` , but a myle
fro +te place where I was born , is +te povre hous of Bromholm of +te
same ordre , in wheche arn diuers vertuous yongge men , monkes clad and
vn-professyd , +tat have abedyn +tere $wythowt abbyte ix or x yeere ,
and be lenger delaye of here profession many inconuenientez arn lyke to
falle . And also +te Priour of <em> +te seyd hous </em> hath resigned
in-to yowre worthy handes by certeins notables and resonables causes ,
as it apperyth by an instrument and a symple lettre vnder +te comune
seal of +te seyd hous of Bromholm , which +te berare of this hath redy
to shewe yow . Wher-vp-on I prey yow wyt al my herte , and as I euere
may do yow seruice , +tat it lyke to yowr grace to graunte of yowr
charite` by yowre worthy lettres to +te Priour of Thetford in Norffolk
, of +te seyde ordre of Clunye , autorite` and powere as yowr ministre
and depute` , to professe in dwe forme +te seyd monkes of Bromholm
vn-professed ; and +tat it lyke yow ouermore to accepte and admitte +te
seyd resygnacion by yowr seyd autorite` and powere wyth +te <P_I,14>
fauour of yowr good lordshepe , in confort and consolacion of yowr
pouere prestes +te monkes of +te seyd hous of Bromholm ; and ther-vp to
graunte yowr worthy lettres wittenessyng +te same acceptacion and
admyssion of +te seyd resignacion , and al yowr seid lettres to
delyuere to my clerk , to wham I prey yow to gyve feith and credence
touchant +tis matier , and to delyuere hym in alle +te hast resonable .
PASTON,I,14.005.72

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:52?
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_9:MALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_005:M4:1430?:AC:OTHER
And I am yowr man and euere will be , by +te grace of God , which euere
haue yow in his kepyng . PASTON,I,14.005.73

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:52?
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_9:MALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_005:M4:1430?:AC:OTHER
Writen at Norwich +te {ED:LEFT_BLANK} of Aprill . PASTON,I,14.005.74

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:52?
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_9:MALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_005:M4:1430?:AC:OTHER
Yowres , William Paston PASTON,I,14.005.75

after ensong , seyd oponly in +te cherch-+gerde +tat he wyst wyll +tat
and +te wall were $pud $doun {TEXT:puddoun} , +tou he were an hondryd
myle fro Paston , he wyste well +tat I wolde sey he ded yt and he xuld
bere +te blame , seying , ' Telle yte here ho so wyll ,

euyn-songe Angnes Ball com to me to my closett PASTON,I,36.014.240

<P_I,53>

{ED:37._TO_AN_UNIDENTIFIED_PERSON_IN_LONDON:DRAFT_ABOUT_1449}

<P_I,54>

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:28?
RECIPIENT:UNKNOWN_RECIPIENT_4:MALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_018:M4:1449?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Ser , I pray yow +tat ye will send sum chyld to my lord of Bukingham
place , and to +te Crown , wich as I conseiue is callid Gerardis Hall
in Bredstret , to inquere whedir I haue any answere of my letter sent
to Caleys whech ye know off , and that ye will remembre my bro+tiris
ston so +tat it myth be mad er I cumm ageyn , and +tat it $be klenly
wrowgth . PASTON,I,54.018.354

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:28?
RECIPIENT:UNKNOWN_RECIPIENT_4:MALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_018:M4:1449?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
It is told me +tat +te man at Sent Bridis is no klenly portrayer ,
$wherfor I wold fayn it myth be portrayid be sum odir man , and he to
graue it vp . PASTON,I,54.018.355

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:28?
RECIPIENT:UNKNOWN_RECIPIENT_4:MALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_018:M4:1449?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
$... It is informyd sum personis in +tis cuntre` +tat ye know +tat +te
frere will sew a-nodir delegaci fro Rome direkt to sum bischop of
Ingland to amend his mater , &c. , PASTON,I,54.018.356

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:28?
RECIPIENT:UNKNOWN_RECIPIENT_4:MALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_018:M4:1449?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and how be it +tat it may not gretly hurt , yet +te seyd personis , &c.
, wold not he shuld haue his entent , in $asmoch as his suggestion is
vntrewe , PASTON,I,54.018.357

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:28?
RECIPIENT:UNKNOWN_RECIPIENT_4:MALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_018:M4:1449?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
but ra+ter +tey wold spend mony to lette it . PASTON,I,54.018.358

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:28?
RECIPIENT:UNKNOWN_RECIPIENT_4:MALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_018:M4:1449?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
I suppose +te Abbot of Bery shuld labor for him rather +tan anodir
becawse $+te $seyd Abbot is aparteynor to +te lord +tat is +te freris
mayntener , &c. ; wherfore , ser , my modir and I pray yow $inquere
after a man callid Clederro whych is solisitor and attorne` with
$Master Will Grey , +tat late was +te Kinggis proktor at Rome ,
PASTON,I,54.018.359

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:28?
RECIPIENT:UNKNOWN_RECIPIENT_4:MALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_018:M4:1449?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and +te seyd Clederro sendith maters and letters owth of Ingeland to
his seyd master $euery monith , &c . PASTON,I,54.018.360

{ED:39._TO_JAMES_GRESHAM:COPY_1450,_4_SEPTEMBER}

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
RECIPIENT:JAMES_GRESHAM:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_019:M4:1450:COPY:FAMILY_SERVANT
James Gresham , I prey yow laboure forth to haue answer of my bille for
myn especial assise and the oyer and termyner accordyng to my seid
bille that I delyuered to my lord Chaunceler , letyng hym wete that ,
as for that <P_I,57> his lordship conceyved the graunt of suyche a
special matier myght cause a rumour in +te cuntre` , owt of dowte the
cuntre` is not so disposed , for it is desired ageyn suche persones as
the $cuntre` wolde were ponysshid . PASTON,I,57.019.384

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
RECIPIENT:JAMES_GRESHAM:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_019:M4:1450:COPY:FAMILY_SERVANT
And if they be not ponysshid to refourme that they haue do amysse , by
liklynesse the cuntre` wole rise up on $them . PASTON,I,57.019.385

Ser John Fastolf , Ser Thomas Fulthorp , and William Yeluerton ,

matier in awarde of my lord Chaunceler and in what juge he wole take to
hym , &c. , whiche offre as I suppose shall be tolde to yow for to make
yow to cesse your labour , thanne lete +tat be answerid and my lord
Chaunceler enfourmed thus . PASTON,I,57.019.396

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
RECIPIENT:JAMES_GRESHAM:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_019:M4:1450:COPY:FAMILY_SERVANT
The matier was in trete` by th'assent of +te Lord Moleyns atwene his
counseil and myn , whiche assembled at London xvj dyuers dayes , and
for +te more part there was a sergeant and vj or vij thrifty
apprentisez ; at whiche tyme the Lord Moleyns title was shewed and
clerly answerid , in so meche +tat his own counseil seide they cowde no
forther in the matier , desiryng me to ride to Salesbury to +te Lord
Moleyns , promyttyng of their part that thei wolde moeve the Lord
Moleyns so +tat +tei trusted I shuld haue myn entent or I come thens ;
of whiche title and answer I sende yow a copie that hath be put in-to
+te parlement , the Lord Moleyns beyng there present , wherto he cowde
not sey nay . PASTON,I,57.019.397

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
RECIPIENT:JAMES_GRESHAM:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_019:M4:1450:COPY:FAMILY_SERVANT
Also by-fore +tis tyme I haue agreed to put it in ij juges so +tei
wolde determyne by our euydences the right , moevyng nother partie to
yeve o+ter by ony mene , but only the right determyned , he to be fully
recompensed that hath right ; wherto he wold not agree , but alle tymes
wolde +tat thoe juges shulde entrete the parties as they myght be drawe
to , by offre and profre to my conceyte as men bye hors . Whiche
matiers considerid , my conseil hath alwey conceyved that the tretees
+tat he offred hath be to non othir entent but to delaye the matier ,
or ellis to entrete me to relese my damages , PASTON,I,57.019.398

comunycacions . PASTON,I,57.019.400

Dyuerse men of my freendis auyse me to entre in-to +te maner of Gresham
by force of my writte of restitucion , whiche I wole not do by cause
+te maner is so decayed by the Lord Moleyns ocupacion that where it was
worth to me l marc. clerly by yeere I cowde not now make it worth xx
li. ; for whiche hurt and for othir hurtis by +tis special assise I
trust to haue remedye . PASTON,I,58.019.413

<P_I,64>

{ED:42._PROBABLY_TO_THE_SHERIFF_OF_NORFOLK:DRAFTS_1452,_23_APRIL}

{ED:A}

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
RECIPIENT:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_020:M4:1452:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
$Reuerent and Right wurchepfull ser , we comaund vs to yow .
PASTON,I,64.020.414

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
RECIPIENT:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_020:M4:1452:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Please it yow to wete that we and othire jentilmen of the shire of
Norffolk hath be in purpose to assuyd to +te hygh and migthi prens and
owr right gode and gracyous lord the Duke of Norffolk to $Framyngham ,
to haue enformyd his Highnesse of dyuers assautis and riott mad be
Charlis Nowell and odir ageyn +te $Kingis pees vpon Jon Paston and odir
of owr kyn , frend , and neyboris , ne had be +tat dayly +tes x days jt
hath be do vs to vndirstand +tat hys Highnes shuld com in-to Norwich or
Claxton , <P_I,65> we not being in $serteyn yet where he shall $remeue
; $praying yow , as we trust +tat ye tender +te welfare of +tis shyre
and of the gentilmen +terin , +tat ye well let owr seyd lord haue
$knowing of owre intent , and after to send vs ansewere whedir it plese
his Hynes we shuld com to his presens and at what plase , or to send
owr $compleynt to him , $trosting to his god $lordshep of remedi in
+tis mater , whech do semith vs shall be to owr seyd lordis honure and
gret rejoy to +te gentilmen of +tis shyre , and cause +te pese to kep
be +te grase of God , ho haue yow in his blesid $keping , &c .
PASTON,I,65.020.415

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
RECIPIENT:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_020:M4:1452:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Wret at Norwych on Sent Georgis Day . PASTON,I,65.020.416

<P_I,66>

{ED:43._PROBABLY_TO_THE_SHERIFF_OF_NORFOLK:DRAFT_1452,_23_APRIL}

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
RECIPIENT:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_021:M4:1452:AC:OTHER
Reuerent and ryth worsepfull ser and my god master , I recommand me to
yow . PASTON,I,66.021.417

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
RECIPIENT:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_021:M4:1452:AC:OTHER
Plese yow to wete +tat Charlis Nowell , with odir , hath in +tis
cuntre` mad many riot and savtis , and $among othir he and v of his
felachip set vp-on me and to of my seruantis at +te Chathedrall chirch
of Norwich , he $smyting at me whilis on of his felaws held myn armis
at my bak <P_I,67> as the berer herof shall more playnly inform yow ;
whech was to me $strawnge cas , $thinking $in my $conseyth +tat I was
my lordis man and his homagere or Charlis knew $hys $lordschipe and
+tat my lord was my god lord , +tat I had be with my lord at London
within viij $days be-for Lent , at which tyme he grantyd me his
godlordship so largely +tat it must cause me euer to be his trew
$seruant to myn $power . PASTON,I,67.021.418

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
RECIPIENT:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_021:M4:1452:AC:OTHER
I thowt also +tat I had neuer geff cawse to non of my lordis hous to ow
me evill will , ne +tat +ter was non of +te hows but I wold haue do
fore as I cowd desire animan to do for me , and yet will , except my
aduersare` . PASTON,I,67.021.419

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
RECIPIENT:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_021:M4:1452:AC:OTHER
And +tus I and my frendis haff mwsid of +tis , and thowt he was hired
to do +tus , PASTON,I,67.021.420

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
RECIPIENT:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_021:M4:1452:AC:OTHER
and +tis $notwithstanding , assone as knolech was had of my lordis
coming to $Framingham , neuer attemptid to procede ageyns him as justis
and law wuld , but to trust to my seyd lord +tat his Hyghnes wold se
+tis punischid , PASTON,I,67.021.421

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
RECIPIENT:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_021:M4:1452:AC:OTHER
and desirid my $master $Howard , mi cosin Tymperle` , +te dene , and
odir to dayly hath be redy with such $jentilmen as dwelle here-a-bought
that can record the trought to haue come compleyn to my lord ,
PASTON,I,67.021.422

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
RECIPIENT:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_021:M4:1452:AC:OTHER
but we haue had contynually tydyngis of my lordis comyng heder that
causid vs for to a-bide there-vp-vn , besechyng your gode maystershep
that ye wull lete my lord haue knowlech of my compleynt , and that ye
wull tender the gode spede of the entent of the letteris wretyn to you
fro jentilmen of this shire , prayng you that ye woll yeve credens to
the berere here-of , PASTON,I,67.021.423

$demening of Charlis Nowell to me ward , $withowt $occaciun gef on mi

vs to awayt +teropon ; $beseching yow , cosine , as my trust is in yow
, +tat ye will help to kepe +te god rewle of +tes shire and my pore
honestte` , and geff credens to +te berer herof and be his god master
if any querel be mad to him . PASTON,I,68.022.433

{ED:45._TO_RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:DRAFT_PERHAPS_1452,_20_JULY}

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31?
RECIPIENT:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_023:M4:1452?:AC:OTHER
Brothir Suthwell , I comand me to yow , $sertifijng yow +tat on
Thursday be +te morwe I spak with my cosine $Wichingham at London ,
where he lete me wet of yowr letter sent to Lee , wherby I conseyve +te
stedfast godlordship and ladiship of my lord and my lady in +tis mater
&c. , whech geuith cause to all her seruantis to trost verily in +tem
and to do hem trew seruise . PASTON,I,69.023.435

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31?
RECIPIENT:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_023:M4:1452?:AC:OTHER
I lete yow wete that the seyd Wychyngham , whan I departid from hym ,
had knowleche that Jane Boys shuld that nyght be come to London ,
PASTON,I,69.023.436

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31?
RECIPIENT:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_023:M4:1452?:AC:OTHER
and he put jn a bylle to the lordis for to have delyuerauns of hyr and
to haue hese aduersarys arestid ; PASTON,I,69.023.437

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31?
RECIPIENT:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_023:M4:1452?:AC:OTHER
and this nyght at Norwiche was told me newe tydynggis that she shuld vn
Thursday after my $departing a be before the lordis , and there a saide
untrewly of her-selff , as the berer hereof shal informe yow if ye know
it not before ; of wheche tydynggis , if they be trew , I am sory for
her sake , PASTON,I,69.023.438

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31?
RECIPIENT:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_023:M4:1452?:AC:OTHER
and also I fere that her frendys shuld sew the more feyntely , wheche
Godde defende ; PASTON,I,69.023.439

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31?
RECIPIENT:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_023:M4:1452?:AC:OTHER
for <P_I,70> her seying vntreuly of her-selff may hurt +te mater in no
man but herselff , PASTON,I,70.023.440

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31?
RECIPIENT:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_023:M4:1452?:AC:OTHER
and thow she wol mescheue her-selff it were gret pete` but if the mater
were laborid forth - not for her sake but for the worchepe of the
estatys and other that have laboryd therin and in ponyshing of the gret
oryble dede , wherfore I send yow dyuers articljs in a bill closed
herin wheche preue that she was raveshid ayens hyr wel , what so ever
she sey . PASTON,I,70.023.441

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31?
RECIPIENT:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_023:M4:1452?:AC:OTHER
+Tes be prouis that Jane Boys was rauischid ageyn her wil , and not be
her own assent : PASTON,I,70.023.442

RECIPIENT:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_023:M4:1452?:AC:OTHER
On is that she , the tyme of her takyng whan she was set upon her hors
, she revylid Lancasterother and callid hym knave , and wept and kryid
owte upon hym $pitowsly to her , and seid as shrewdly to hym as coud
come to her mende , and fel doune of her hors vnto that {unto}_P she
was bound , and callid him fals $traytur +tat browth her +te rabbettis
. PASTON,I,70.023.443

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31?
RECIPIENT:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_023:M4:1452?:AC:OTHER
Item , whan she was bounde she callid vpon her modyre , wheche folwyd
her as far as she myght on her feet , PASTON,I,70.023.444

they have be-gonne . PASTON,I,71.023.454

{ED:47._TO_JOHN_NORWODE_NOT_BEFORE_1453}

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_NORWODE:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_024:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
<font> To John Norwode . </font> PASTON,I,74.024.468

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_NORWODE:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_024:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
I lete you wete that Hache hath do no werk of myn where-fore he aught
to haue receyvid any mony savyng only for the makyng of the litill hous
a-bove the halle wyndownes , PASTON,I,74.024.469

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_NORWODE:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_024:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
for the remenaunte was that fell down in his diffaute .
PASTON,I,74.024.470

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_NORWODE:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_024:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
And as for the makyng of that litill hous , he toke that in a
comenaunte with makyng of too chymnyes of Ser Thomas Howys for xl s. ,
which comenaunte may not hold be-cause that I must haue thre chymnyes
and in a-nothere place . PASTON,I,74.024.471

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_NORWODE:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_024:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
Item , the seid litill hows drawyth not v thowsand tyle , which after
xvj d. the thowsand shuld drawe vj s. viij d . Notwithstandyng , if Ser
Thomas thynk that he shuld be a-lowyd $mo , he shall be .
PASTON,I,74.024.472

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_NORWODE:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_024:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
And ye must remembre how that he hath receyvid vj s. viij d. of you ,
and of Robert Tolle be-fore Halwemesse , as apperith in his accompt ,
viij s. . PASTON,I,74.024.473

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_NORWODE:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_024:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
And he hath receyvid of Tolle sith Halwemesse v s. iiij d .
PASTON,I,74.024.474

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_NORWODE:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_024:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
And than be this rekenyng he shuld be xiij s. iiij d. a-fore hand ,
which I wuld ye shuld gadere vp in this newe werk as wele as ye myght ,
PASTON,I,74.024.475

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_NORWODE:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_024:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
for I am be-hold to do hym but litill favour . PASTON,I,74.024.476

<P_I,75>

<P_I,80>

{ED:49._TO_THE_EARL_OF_OXFORD_1454,_31_MARCH}

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
RECIPIENT:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:11
LETTER:PASTON_025:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
Right wurchepfull and my right especiall lord , I recomaund me to yowre
<P_I,81> gode lordshep , besechyng youre lordshep that ye take not to
displesauns thow I write you as I here sey : that Agnes Denyes , be the
meanes of your lordshep and of my lord the Cardynall , hos sowle God
assoyle and forgeve , was set in preson beyng with child ; which , and
the sorough and shame there-of , was nygh here deth , and yet dayly is
vexed and trobled , and here seruauntes in like wyse , to the vttermest
distruccion of here person and godes . In which , my lord , at the
reuerens of God , remembre that she was maried be you , and be my
meanes be your comaundment and writyng , and drow there-to full sore
a-geyn here entent in the be-gynnyng , and was worth v c marc. and
better , and shuld haue had a gentilman of this contre` of an c marc.
of lond and wele born , ne had be your gode lordshep and writyng to
here and me . PASTON,I,81.025.480

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
RECIPIENT:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:11
LETTER:PASTON_025:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
And this considered in your wise discrecion , I trost , my lord , thow
here prisonyng were of oderes labore ye wuld help here ;
PASTON,I,81.025.481

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
RECIPIENT:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:11
LETTER:PASTON_025:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
and if she be distroyd be this mariage my conscyens thynketh I am bownd
to recompense here after my pore and sympill power .
PASTON,I,81.025.482

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
RECIPIENT:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:11
LETTER:PASTON_025:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
My lord , ye know I had litill cause to do for Thomas Denyes , savyng
only for your gode lordshep . PASTON,I,81.025.483

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
RECIPIENT:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:11
LETTER:PASTON_025:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
Also , my lord , I know wele that Watere Ingham was bete , the matere
hangyng in myn a-ward , right fowle and shamefully ; and also how the
seid Thomas Denyes hath this last terme , a-geyn your nobill estat ,
right vn-wysely demened hym to his shame and grettest rebuke that euer
he had in his lyve ; where-fore it is right wele do his person be
ponysshed as it pleaseth you . PASTON,I,81.025.484

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
RECIPIENT:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:11
LETTER:PASTON_025:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
But this not withstondyng , for Goddes loue , my lord , remembre how
the gentilwoman is accombred only for yowre sake , and help here ;
PASTON,I,81.025.485

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
RECIPIENT:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:11
LETTER:PASTON_025:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
and if aught lyth in my powere to do that that myght please yowre
lordshep , or cowde fynde any wey for Water Ingham a-vayll and wurchep
, I wull do it to my powere , and the rathere if your lordshep support
the jentilwoman , PASTON,I,81.025.486

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
RECIPIENT:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:11
LETTER:PASTON_025:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
for I know the matere and that longe plee is litill a-vayll ,
PASTON,I,81.025.487

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
RECIPIENT:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:11
LETTER:PASTON_025:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
and euery thing must haue an ende . PASTON,I,81.025.488

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
RECIPIENT:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:11
LETTER:PASTON_025:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
I haue told my brothere Mathew Drury more to enfourme yowre lordshep
than I may haue leysere to write for his hasty departyng .
PASTON,I,81.025.489

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
RECIPIENT:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:11
LETTER:PASTON_025:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
Right wurchepfull and my right especiall lord , I besech Allmyghty God
send you asmych joy and wurchep as euer had any of my lordes yowre
aunceteres , and kepe you and all yowres . PASTON,I,81.025.490

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
RECIPIENT:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:11
LETTER:PASTON_025:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
Wretyn at Norwich the iiij Sonday of Lent . PASTON,I,81.025.491

Yowre seruaunte to his powre , John Paston PASTON,I,81.025.492

{ED:50._TO_LORD_GREY:DRAFT_1454,_15_JULY}

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_GREY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_026:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
Dominus de Grey . PASTON,I,82.026.493

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_GREY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_026:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
Right worshipfull and my ryght gode lord , I recommand me to yowre
godelordship ; PASTON,I,82.026.494

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_GREY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_026:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
and where as it pleasyd yowre lordship to dyrecte yowr lettere to me
for a maryage fore my pore suster to a jantylman of yowre knowlech of
ccc marc. lyflod in cas she were not maryd , wherfore I am gretely
bownd to do your lordship servyse , forso+te my lord she is not marijd
ne jnsurid to noman . PASTON,I,82.026.495

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_GREY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_026:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
Ther is , and hath be dyvers tymys and late comunycacion of seche
maryagys wyth dyuers jantylmen not determynyd as yett ;
PASTON,I,82.026.496

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_GREY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_026:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
and wheddere the jantylman +tat yowre lordchip menith of be on of hem
or nay I dowth . PASTON,I,82.026.497

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_GREY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_026:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
And where as your seyd lettere specyfyith that I shuld send yow word
wheddere I thowght ye shuld labour ferthere in the matere or nay , in
that , my lord , I dare not preswme to wryte so to yow wythowte I knew
the gentylmans name . PASTON,I,82.026.498

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_GREY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_026:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
Notwythstandyng , my lord , I shall take uppe-on me , wyth the avyse of
othere of here frendys , that she shall nothere-1 be marijd ner inswryd
to no creatwre , ne forthere prosede in no seche matere , before the
fest of the Assumpcion of Owre Lady next comyng ; dwryng whyche tyme
yowre lordship may send me , if itt please yow , certeyn informacion of
the seyd gentylmannys name , and of the place and contrey where hys
lyfflod lyth , and wheddere he hath any chyldere . PASTON,I,82.026.499

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_GREY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_026:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
And after I shall demene me in the matere as yowre lordship shall be
pleasyd . PASTON,I,82.026.500

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_GREY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_026:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
For jn gode feyth , my lord , it were to me grette joy that my seyd
pore sustere were , $acording to her pore degre` , marijd be yowre
avyse , trustyng thanne that ye wold be here gode lord .
PASTON,I,82.026.501

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_GREY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_026:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
Ryght wurchipfull and my ryght gode lord , I beseche Almyghty God to
haue yow in his kepyng . PASTON,I,82.026.502

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_GREY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_026:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
Wrete att Norwych the xv day of Jull . PASTON,I,82.026.503

<P_I,83>

{ED:51._TO_THE_DUKE_OF_NORFOLK:DRAFT_PROBABLY_1455}

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_MOWBRAY_SR:MALE:_:1415:40?
LETTER:PASTON_027:M4:1455?:COPY:OTHER
Right hy and myghty prynce , my right gode and gracyous lord , I
recomand me to your godelordship , &c. ; PASTON,I,83.027.504

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_MOWBRAY_SR:MALE:_:1415:40?
LETTER:PASTON_027:M4:1455?:COPY:OTHER
and please itt your Hyghnesse to wete +tat Ser Philip Wentewurth
purchasid +te Kyngis patentis of the ward of the heyere and londes of a
pore kynnesman of myne called John Fastolf of Cowhawe , late passed to
God , to +te grett hurte and distrucion as-well of +te inheritance of
+te seyd heyer as interrupcion and breking of the last will of the seyd
John , and also to my grett troble and dammage . PASTON,I,83.027.505

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_MOWBRAY_SR:MALE:_:1415:40?
LETTER:PASTON_027:M4:1455?:COPY:OTHER
And for asmeche as it fortowned be grase the seyd patentes to be
mystake so +tat they were not laufull ne suffycyent , be avyce of
conceyll certeyn persones to myn vse purchesid be the Kyngis letteres
patentes suffycyent and laufull of the ward of the seyd londes ,
PASTON,I,83.027.506

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_MOWBRAY_SR:MALE:_:1415:40?
LETTER:PASTON_027:M4:1455?:COPY:OTHER
and the rigth of these bothe patentis hath be putte in juges and lerned
men , affor hom the seyd Ser Philipp ne his conceyll cowd neuer prove
hes tytill lawfull be his seyd $patentis ; PASTON,I,83.027.507

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_MOWBRAY_SR:MALE:_:1415:40?
LETTER:PASTON_027:M4:1455?:COPY:OTHER
and +tis notwythstanding , intendith be fors , as I vnderstand , to
take +te profytes of +te seyd londis ageyns all lawe and concyence ;
PASTON,I,83.027.508

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_MOWBRAY_SR:MALE:_:1415:40?
LETTER:PASTON_027:M4:1455?:COPY:OTHER
beseching your lordchip to tender me in myn age and sekenesse +tat may
not ryde ne help myself , and of your habundant grace to supporte me in
my right +tat I be not be fors , ageyns lawe and <P_I,84> concyence ,
kepte from +te possescion of +te seyd londes in this contre` wher ye be
prynce and souereyn next owre souereyn lord . PASTON,I,84.027.509

{ED:52._TO_JAMES_GLOYS:DRAFT_PROBABLY_1455,_25_JULY}

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34?
RECIPIENT:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_028:M4:1455?:COPY:FAMILY_SERVANT
To Ser Jamis Gloys PASTON,I,84.028.510

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34?
RECIPIENT:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_028:M4:1455?:COPY:FAMILY_SERVANT
Ther be dyuers thyngis in your letter , sent to me , on that a
$slawnderus noyse shuld renne ageyns Yeluerton , $Alyngton , and me to
brynge us owte of the conceytis of the puple be Heydon and his
dyscyplis of a bill that shuld haue do put uppe in-to the parlement
ageyns my lord of Norwich and odir . PASTON,I,84.028.511

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34?
RECIPIENT:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_028:M4:1455?:COPY:FAMILY_SERVANT
I lete yow wete this is the furst day +tat I herd of any seche ,
PASTON,I,84.028.512

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34?
RECIPIENT:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_028:M4:1455?:COPY:FAMILY_SERVANT
but I wold wete the namys of hem that vttere this langage and the mater
of the bill . PASTON,I,84.028.513

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34?
RECIPIENT:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_028:M4:1455?:COPY:FAMILY_SERVANT
As for my lord of Norwych , I suppose ye know I haue not <P_I,85> vsid
to meddel wyth lordis materis meche forther than me nedith .
PASTON,I,85.028.514

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34?
RECIPIENT:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_028:M4:1455?:COPY:FAMILY_SERVANT
And as for Ser Thomas Todynham , he gaff me no cawse of late tyme to
labour ageyns hym , PASTON,I,85.028.515

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34?
RECIPIENT:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_?

and also of seche mater I know non deffaut in hym . PASTON,I,85.028.516

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34?
RECIPIENT:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_028:M4:1455?:COPY:FAMILY_SERVANT
And as for Heydon , when I putte a bill ageyns hym I suppose he shall
no cause have , ne his discyplis nothere , to avante of so short a
remedy +ter-of as ye wrygth they sey now . PASTON,I,85.028.517

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34?
RECIPIENT:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_028:M4:1455?:COPY:FAMILY_SERVANT
As for that ye desyre +tat I shuld send yow word what ye shuld sey in
this mater , I pray yow to in this and all o+ter lyke ask +te seyeris
if +tei will abyd be +ter langage , PASTON,I,85.028.518

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34?
RECIPIENT:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_028:M4:1455?:COPY:FAMILY_SERVANT
and as for me sey I purpose me to take no mater uppon me butt +tat I
woll abyde by , and in lek wys for $Yeluerton and $Alington .
PASTON,I,85.028.519

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34?

langage and seyd shrewydly , and what they seyd , and that ye remembre
what men of substance wer ther that herde itt ; PASTON,I,85.028.520

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34?

for if this can be dreve to Heydon or his dissyplis , as ye wryte , it
wer a gode preve +tat they fere to be appelyd of seche materis .
PASTON,I,85.028.521

{ED:55._TO_MARGARET_PASTON_1460,_19_JUNE}

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:39
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_029:M4:1460:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
<font> To my trusty cosyn Margaret Paston at Norwich be this delyuered
. </font> PASTON,I,91.029.524

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:39
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_029:M4:1460:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
<font> To Richard Calle at Castere be this deliuerid in hast . </font>
PASTON,I,91.029.525

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:39
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_029:M4:1460:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
I recomaunde me to you , letyng you witte +tat I sent a letter to John
Russe and Richard Kalle that thei , by th'aduyse of Watkyn Shipdam and
William Barker , shuld send me word of whom alle the maneres , londes ,
and tenementes +tat were Ser John Fastolffes wern holde , preyng you
+tat ye wole do them spede them in +tat matier . PASTON,I,91.029.526

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:39
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_029:M4:1460:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
And if my feodaryes whiche lye in +te tye of my gret cofyr may ought
wisse ther-in , lete them se it . PASTON,I,91.029.527

<P_I,92>

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:39
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_029:M4:1460:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
Item , I wolde that William Barker shulde send me a copye of +te olde
trauerse of Tychewell and Beyton . PASTON,I,92.029.528

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:39
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_

And lete Richard Kalle spede hym hidderward , and come by Snaylwel and
take suyche mony as may be getyn there ; and +tat he suffre not +te
mony +tat +te tenauntes owe to come in +te fermours handes .
PASTON,I,92.029.529

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:39

{ED:56._TO_MARGARET_PASTON_1460,_28_JULY}

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:39
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_030:M4:1460:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
<font> To my wurschipfull coosyn Margaret Paston be this delyuerd in
haste . </font> PASTON,I,92.030.534

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:39
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_030:M4:1460:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
I recomaunde me vnto you , letyng you witte that your vnkyll John
Berney is deed , whoos soule God haue mercy ; desyryng you to sende for
Thomas Holler and enquere of hym wher his goode is and what he is
wurthe , and that he take goode eede to all suche goodes as he had ,
bothe meveable and on-mevable , for I vndre-stande that he is wurthe in
money v c marke and in plate to the valwe of other v c marke , beside
other goodes . Wherfor I wolde ye schulde not lete hym wete of his
dissese vnto the tyme that ye had enquered of the seide Thomas Holler
of all suche maters as be a-bovyn wreten . PASTON,I,92.030.535

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:39
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_030:M4:1460:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
And whan he hathe enformed you therof , than lete hym wete verely that
he is deede ; desiryng hym that no man come on-to his place at Redham
but hym-selfe vnto the tyme that I come . PASTON,I,92.030.536

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:39
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_030:M4:1460:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
Item , I lete you witte that gret parte of his goode is at William
Tauerners , as I vndrestande . PASTON,I,92.030.537

{ED:58._TO_MARGARET_PASTON_1461,_12_JULY}

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:40
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_031:M4:1461:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
<font> To my cosyn Margret Paston . </font> PASTON,I,95.031.549

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:40
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_031:M4:1461:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
I recomaund me to yow , letyng yow wete +tat the vndershreve doughtyth
hym of John Berney ; wherfore I pray yow bryng hem to-gedyr and set hem
acord if ye can , so +tat the seyd vndershreve be sure +tat he shall
not be hurt be hym ner of hys cuntrymen . PASTON,I,95.031.550

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:40
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_031:M4:1461:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
And yf he woll not , lete hym verely vndyrstonde +tat he shall be
compellyd to fynd hym suerte` of the pes , magry in hys heed ;
PASTON,I,95.031.551

Grey , where-in it were bettyr for hym to have the shreves good wyll .

spend xl s. a yere +tat were at the day of eleccion , whech of them
+tat had fewest to geve it vp as reson wold

. PASTON,I,96.031.561

{ED:59._TO_MARGARET_PASTON_1461,_1_AUGUST}

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:40
RECIPIENT:MARGARET[N.MAUTBY][&_RICHARD_CALLE]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:___CODE
LETTER:PASTON_032:M4:1461:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
<font> To my mastres Paston and Richard Calle . </font>
PASTON,I,96.032.565

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:40
RECIPIENT:MARGARET[N.MAUTBY][&_RICHARD_CALLE]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:___CODE
LETTER:PASTON_032:M4:1461:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
j. First , that Richard Calle fynde the meane that a distresse may be
taken of such bestes as occupie the ground at Stratton , and that
cleyme and $contynuans be made of my possession in any wise and that
thei be not suffrid to occupie with-owt thei compoune with me ; and
that aftir the distresse taken the vndirshreve be spoke with-all that
he make no replevyn with-out agrement or a-poyntement taken , that the
right of the lond may be vndirstand . PASTON,I,96.032.566

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:40
RECIPIENT:MARGARET[N.MAUTBY][&_RICHARD_CALLE]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:___CODE
LETTER:PASTON_032:M4:1461:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
ij. Item , I here sey the peple is disposed to be at the shire at
Norwich on Sen Lauerauns Day for th'affermyng of that thei have do
afore , wherof I hold me wele content if thei do it of her owne
disposicion ; PASTON,I,96.032.567

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:40
RECIPIENT:MARGARET[N.MAUTBY][&_RICHARD_CALLE]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:___CODE
LETTER:PASTON_032:M4:1461:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
but I woll not be the cause of the labour of hem ner ber no cost of hem
at <P_I,97> this tyme , PASTON,I,97.032.568

Not withstandyng , and the peple were wele auertised at that day they
shuld be the more redy to shewe the oribyll extorcions and briborys
that hath be do vpon hem to the Kyng at his comyng , desyring hym that
he shuld not have in fauour the seyd extorcioners but compelle hem to
make amendes and sethe to the pore peple . PASTON,I,97.032.588

Stapilton hath of the corte rolles of Gemyngham , that ye fayle not but
assay and do yowre devyr , PASTON,I,97.032.591

I wold a new dede and letter of $atorne` were mad owth theroff be tho

of Heylisdon , Jacobo Gloys , klerk , $Johanni $Pamping , and that the
ded ber date nowh and +tat it be selid at +te next shire ; for than I
suppose +te seyd feffe`s will be there , if it may not be don er that
tym . PASTON,I,98.032.600

secretly at Richard Thornis hows at Stratton , +tat whan I com $homward
I $myght fynd it ther and mak seson and stat to be take whil I wer
there . PASTON,I,98.032.601

{ED:71._TO_MARGARET_PASTON_1465,_14_JANUARY}

I recomaund me to yow , PASTON,I,125.033.603

RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_

and haue reseyvid your lettir , which causith me to write in the lettir
+tat I send to yow , Daubeney , and Richard Calle certeyn articles
touchyng the rewle of myn hows and myn livelode , as ye shall
vndirstand whanne ye see hem . PASTON,I,125.033.604

disclose nat what malt I haue , ne what I shall selle , ne +tat on
marchaunt knowe nat what an other hath ; PASTON,I,126.033.608

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44

LETTER:PASTON_033:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
for ther is gret spies leid here at London for ingrosers of malt to
heyghne the prise , hough be it myne is not but of myn owne growyng and
my tenauntes . PASTON,I,126.033.609

come the same tyme . PASTON,I,126.033.611

<P_I,126>

{ED:72._MARGARET_PASTON,_JOHN_DAUBENEY,_RICHARD_CALLE_1465,_15_JANUA
RY}

<P_I,127>

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]_&:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_034:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
<font> To my mastres Margrete Paston and to my welbelovid frendes John
Daubeney and Richard Calle . </font> PASTON,I,127.034.622

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]_&:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_034:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
I praye yow see to the god gouernaunce of my housold and guydyng of
other thynges touchyng my profite , and +tat ye , with Daubeney and
Richard Calle and with other such of my frendes and seruauntes as can
avise yow aftir the mater requirith , wekely take a sad communicacion
of such thynges as be for to do , or oftenner and nede be ; takyng
avise of the master and of the viker and Ser Jamis in +tat is for to
say , aswell for provision of stuffe for myn howsold as for the
gaderyng of the reveneus of my livelode or greynes , or for settyng
awerk of my seruauntes , and for the more poletik meane of sellyng and
carijng of my malt and for all other thynges necessarj for to be do ,
so +tat whanne I come home I haue not an excuse seying +tat ye spoke to
my seruauntes and +tat Daubeney and Calle exkuse hem +tat +tei were so
besy thei myght not attende ; PASTON,I,127.034.623

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]_&:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_034:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
for I woll haue my mater so guided +tat if on man may not attende
a-nother shall be comaundid to do it . PASTON,I,127.034.624

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]_&:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_034:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
And if my seruauntes faile I had lever wage some other man for a iorny
or a season thanne my mater shuld be on-sped . PASTON,I,127.034.625

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]_&:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_034:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
As for my livelode , I left with Daubeney a bille of many of my dettes
, wherby ye all myght haue be indused whedir ye shuld haue sent for
siluer . PASTON,I,127.034.626

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]_&:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_034:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
It liketh me evill to here $+tat my prestes and poremen be onpaijd ,
and $+tat no mony sent to me more thanne x mark be Berney of alle this
season . PASTON,I,127.034.627

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]_&:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_034:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
And yet therof telle Richard Calle he sent me viij nobills in goold for
v mark and +tat as longe as gold was bettir payment thanne siluer I had
neuir so moch gold of hym at onys ; PASTON,I,127.034.628

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]_&:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_034:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
and telle hym +tat I woll nat +tat he shall kepe +tat vse ,
PASTON,I,127.034.629

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]_&:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_034:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
for I trowe my tenauntes haue but litell gold to pay .
PASTON,I,127.034.630

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]_&:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_034:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
Also , remembir yow in any howsold , felaship , or company +tat will be
of good rewle , purvyauns must be had +tat euery persone of it be
helpyng <P_I,128> and fortheryng aftir his discrecion and powyre ,
PASTON,I,128.034.631

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]_&:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_034:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
and he +tat woll not do so without he be kept of almes shuld be put out
of the houshold or felachep . PASTON,I,128.034.632

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]_&:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_034:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
Item , where ye desire me +tat I shuld take your sone to grase , I woll
for your sake do the bettir , PASTON,I,128.034.633

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]_&:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_034:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
and will ye knowe +tat he shall not be so oute of my favour that I will
suffir hym to mischefe without be eftsones his owne defaut .
PASTON,I,128.034.634

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]_&:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_034:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
And hough be it +tat in his presumptuose and ondiscrete demenyng he gaf
bothe me and yow cause of displeasir , and to other of my seruauntes
ille exsaumple , and $+tat also guided hym to all mennes vndirstondyng
+tat he was wery of bidyng in myn hows , and he not insurid of help in
any other place , yet +tat grevyth nat me so evill as doth +tat I neuir
coud fele ner vndirstand hym poletyk ner diligent in helpyng hym-self ,
but as a drane amonges bees whech labour for gaderyng hony in the
feldes and the drane doth nought but takyth his part of it .
PASTON,I,128.034.635

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]_&:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_034:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
And if this myght make hym to knowe the bettir hym-self , and put hym
in remembrauns what tyme he hath lost and hough he hath leved in
jdelnes , and that he coud for this eschewe to do so heraftir , it
myght fortune for his best . PASTON,I,128.034.636

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]_&:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_034:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
But I here yet neuir from no plase +tat he hath be in of any poletyk
demenyng or occupacion of hym ; PASTON,I,128.034.637

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]_&:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_034:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
and in +te Kyngis hows he coud not put hym-self foorth to be in favour
or trust with any men of substauns +tat myght forther hym .
PASTON,I,128.034.638

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]_&:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_034:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
Neuirthelesse , as for your house and myne , I purpose not he shall
come there , ner be my will non other , but if he can do more thanne
loke foorth and make a fase and countenauns . PASTON,I,128.034.639

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]_&:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_034:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
Item , send me word whedir my glasier hath do at Bromholm and at the
Friers of the south towne , and whedir he be paijd such mony as I sent
home word he shuld be paijd ; PASTON,I,128.034.640

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]_&:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_034:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
and if he haue do all he must haue more mony , PASTON,I,128.034.641

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]_&:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_034:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
but I remembir nat certeynly what till I come home ,
PASTON,I,128.034.642

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]_&:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_034:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
for I remembir nat what his bargeyn was for +te werk at the south towne
. PASTON,I,128.034.643

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]_&:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_034:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
I trowe Master Clement can telle , and also fele hym-selff and send me
word . PASTON,I,128.034.644

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]_&:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_034:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
Also , +tat ye and Richard Calle and Daubeney see +tat Master Clement
and Master Braklee , which hath gret nede I wote well , and my prestes
and poremen be paijd , and also all other men ; and +tat ye see +tat I
be not callid on for +tat is my dewte` . PASTON,I,128.034.645

{ED:74._TO_MARGARET_PASTON_1465,_13_JULY}

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_036:M4:1465:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
<font> To my cosyn Margret Paston . </font> PASTON,I,134.036.784

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_036:M4:1465:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
I recummand me to yow PASTON,I,134.036.785

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_036:M4:1465:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
and thank yow of yowr labowr and besynes with +te vnruly felechep that
cam befor yow on Monday last past , wherof I herd report be John Hobbis
; PASTON,I,134.036.786

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_036:M4:1465:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
and in god feyth ye aquyt yow rygth wel and discretly , and hertyly to
yowr wurchep and myn and to +te shame of yowr aduersarijs .
PASTON,I,134.036.787

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_036:M4:1465:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
And I am wel content +tat ye avowid +tat ye kept possescion at Drayton
, and so wold doo ; wherfor I pray yow make yowr word god if ye may ,
PASTON,I,134.036.788

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_036:M4:1465:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
and at +te lest let myn aduersarijs not haue it in pees if ye may .
PASTON,I,134.036.789

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_036:M4:1465:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
Jon Hobbys tellith me +tat ye be seekly , whech me lekith not to here ,
PASTON,I,134.036.790

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_036:M4:1465:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
$praying yow hartyly +tat ye take what may do yow eese and spare not ,
and in any wyse take no thowth ne to moch labor for +tes materis , ne
set it not so to yowr hert +tat ye fare +te wers for it .
PASTON,I,134.036.791

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_036:M4:1465:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
And as for +te mater , so +tey ouercome yow not with fors ne bosting I
shall have +te maner sewrlyer to me and myn +tan +te Dewk shall haue
Cossey , dowt ye not . PASTON,I,134.036.792

Dewk comyth of wer borne to any lond in Norffolk or Suffolk ;
PASTON,I,135.036.799

to Mychel Pool , +te furst Erl of Suffolk of +te Polis , mad be King
Richard seth my fader was born . PASTON,I,135.036.804

jnformyd Herry Boteler to tell my old lady of Suffolk , be-cawse he is
of her cowncell , PASTON,I,135.036.810

<P_I,136>

{ED:75._MARGARET_PASTON,_JAMES_GRESHAM_RICHARD_CALLE_1465,_7_AUGUST} _@

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]_&:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_037:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
<font> To my mastresse Margret Paston , James Gresham , and Richard
Calle . </font> PASTON,I,136.037.825

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]_&:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_037:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
I recomaund me to yow , PASTON,I,136.037.826

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]_&:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_037:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
and haue reseyvid ij lettirs from John Russe wherin he remembirth me
that I shuld owe hym xix li. or ther-upon for diuers parcelles whech he
seith he shuld haue deliuerid in-to myn hows , wherof he seith xiiij
li. was deliuerid in-to myn howse ij yere $goo and that I had a bille
deliuerid me therof , and the remnaunt sithen , and desireth of me
payment of the seid xix li. ; wherfore I $certifye yow as I vndirstand
in the mater . PASTON,I,136.037.827

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]_&:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_037:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
Ye may lete John Russe come to yow and take such a direccion in the
mater as reason and trought woll . PASTON,I,136.037.828

paymentes , that is xij li. at the lest , or er the maner was trobelid
by Jenney or Yeluerton . PASTON,I,139.038.878

serche what he hath reseyvid sith Ser John Fastolff dyed , and what
tyme , PASTON,I,139.038.880

therof a titelyng . PASTON,I,139.038.886

Russe ; wherfore I remitte this to your discrecion .
PASTON,I,139.038.888

{ED:77._TO_MARGARET_PASTON_1465,_20_SEPTEMBER}

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_039:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
<font> To my cosyn Margret Paston . </font> PASTON,I,140.039.901

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_039:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
Myn owne dere souereyn lady , I recomaund me to yow
PASTON,I,140.039.902

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_039:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
and thank yow of the gret chere +tat ye mad me here , to my gret cost
and charge and labour . PASTON,I,140.039.903

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_039:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
Nomore at this tyme but that I pray yow ye woll send me hedir ij elne
of worsted for doblettes to happe me this cold wynter , and that ye
inquere where William Paston bought his tepet of fyne worsted whech is
almost like silk ; PASTON,I,140.039.904

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_039:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
and if that be moch fyner thanne +tat ye shuld bye me after vij or viij
s. , thanne bye $me a quarter and the nayle therof for colers , thow it
be derrer thanne the tother , PASTON,I,140.039.905

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_039:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
for I wold make my doblet all worsted for worship of Norffolk rather
thanne like Gonnores doblet . PASTON,I,140.039.906

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_039:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
Item , as for the mater of the ix=xx= li. askyd by my lady of Bedford
for the maner of Westthurrok , where as Ser Thomas Howes seith that he
hath no writyng therof but +tat Ser John Fastolff purchased the seid
maner and paijd certeyn mony in ernest , and aftirward grauntyd his
bargeyn to the Duc of Bedford , and so the mony +tat he toke was for
the mony that he had paijd ; paraventure Ser Thomas hath writyng therof
PASTON,I,140.039.907

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_039:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
and knowyth it not , PASTON,I,140.039.908

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_039:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
for if ther be any such mony paijd vpon any bargeyn he shall fynd it in
Kyrtelyngges bookes +tat was Ser John Fastolffes reseyvour .
PASTON,I,140.039.909

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_039:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
And it was abought such tyme as the Duc of Bedford was last in Inglond
, whech as it is told me was the viij yere of Kyng Herry the Fift or
the viij yere of Kyng Herry the Sext , PASTON,I,140.039.910

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_039:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
and the somme that he paijd for the seid bargeyn was ccc mark .
PASTON,I,140.039.911

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_039:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
Also he shall fynd , the xxij yere of Kyng Herry or therabought , in
the acomptes of on of Fastolffes reseyvours at London , that ther was
take of Ser Thomas Tyrell and of the Duchesse of Excestre , that was
wif to Ser Lowes John , fermours of the seid maner , certeyn mony for
repayment of part of the seid ccc mark . PASTON,I,140.039.912

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_039:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
Also he shall fynd in yeres after +tat , or in that yere or
there-aboutes , that Ser John Fastolff reseyved mony of my Lord Revers
+tat now is , by the name of Richard Wydevile , <P_I,141> for his owne
dette dew to Ser John Fastolff . Wherfore if Ser Thomas be trewe to his
master lete hym do his devoir to make +tat Worseter , whech is vphold
be hym with the dedes goodes , to be trewe to his master ;
PASTON,I,141.039.913

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_039:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
or ellis it is tyme for Ser Thomas to forsake hym and help to punyssh
hym , PASTON,I,141.039.914

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_039:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
or men must sey that Ser Thomas is not trewe . PASTON,I,141.039.915

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_039:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
And more-ouer lete Ser Thomas examine what he can fynd in this mater
that I sent hym word of , whech mater he shall fynd in the seid
reseyvours bookes , if he list to seke it . PASTON,I,141.039.916

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_039:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
Item , wete of hym whedir any writte of sub pena cam to hym therfore .
PASTON,I,141.039.917

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_039:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
Item , I send hym a bille whech on Edmond Carvyle for Robert Otteley
askyth of Ser John Fastolff , of whech , aswell as of a bille askyd by
on Fraunses for makyng of houses in Southwerk , lete send hedir an
answere ; PASTON,I,141.039.918

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_039:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
for and I coud answere hem I wold not send to hym .
PASTON,I,141.039.919

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_039:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
And that Richard Calle , or who so evir goo to hym of my seruauntes ,
lete hym vndirstand that such brethelles as be abought Ser Thomas wene
that I sent to hym for maters of myn owne , and that I myght not
forbere his frenship , whech is no-thyng so ; PASTON,I,141.039.920

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_039:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
and if it lay in his power to avayle me an c li. , as he can not avayle
me xx s. , I wold $not send to hym whill he is cuppilled with such
felaship as {with}_P he is . Wherfore he that shuld speke with hym were
best to mete with hym at a sodeyn , where he were with some
substanciall man that coud informe hym what were his trought to do in
the mater ; PASTON,I,141.039.921

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_039:M4:1465:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
for it grevyth me full evill to send often to hym till he be of a
sadder demenyng . PASTON,I,141.039.922

AUTHOR:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:HUSBAND:1421:44

ferthest by that tyme as James Gresham shall come hedir ,
PASTON,I,141.039.923
