My lord +te Archebyschop of Yorke departyd as +gysterday ,
PASTON,I,668.231.6929

AUTHOR:MARGERY_PASTON[N.BREWS]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:HUSBAND:1444:45
LETTER:PASTON_231:M4:1489:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR_CODE_METADATA
and my lord of Northethomyrlond schall goo as on Fryday ,
PASTON,I,668.231.6930

AUTHOR:MARGERY_PASTON[N.BREWS]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:HUSBAND:1444:45
LETTER:PASTON_231:M4:1489:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR_CODE_METADATA
and also all schuch folkys as schall goo in-to Breten schall be at
Portysmowth on Satyrday cum forthnyth , and +te Munday after on see
bord , at wech seassun +te Kyng intentyd to be +ter to take +te mustyrs
. PASTON,I,668.231.6931

AUTHOR:MARGERY_PASTON[N.BREWS]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:HUSBAND:1444:45
LETTER:PASTON_231:M4:1489:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR_CODE_METADATA
And as for thos jantylmen that toke schippyng to a gon over in-to
Breten vp-on a fortnyth a-goo , +tat is to sey Syr Richard Egecum +te
cowntrollere , Syr Roberd Clyfford , Syr John Trobylvyll , and Johon
Motton , sariant porter , be a-ryvyd a-geyn vp-on +te cost of Yngland ,
save all-only Syr Richard Egecum wech londyd in Breten and +ter was in
a towne callyd Morleys , wech a-non vp-on hys comyng was besegyd wyth
+te Frenchmen , and so skapyd hardly wyth hys lyff ; +te wech towne +te
Frenchemen have gotyn , and also +te towne callyd Breest , how-be-it
+te castell holdyth as we here say . PASTON,I,668.231.6932

AUTHOR:MARGERY_PASTON[N.BREWS]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:HUSBAND:1444:45
LETTER:PASTON_231:M4:1489:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR_CODE_METADATA
And +ter be apoyntyd serteyn captens as thys seasun , wech be Lord
Bruke , Syr John Cheney , Syr John of Arundell , Syr John Becham , Syr
John Gray , myn broder Awdley , myn vnkyll Syr Gylberd Debnam , and
Thomas Stafford and many odyr knytys and esqwyrys .
PASTON,I,668.231.6933

AUTHOR:MARGERY_PASTON[N.BREWS]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:HUSBAND:1444:45
LETTER:PASTON_231:M4:1489:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR_CODE_METADATA
And , syr , I thanke yow for +te lettyr +tat +ge sent me .
PASTON,I,668.231.6934

AUTHOR:MARGERY_PASTON[N.BREWS]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:HUSBAND:1444:45
LETTER:PASTON_231:M4:1489:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR_CODE_METADATA
Also , syr , I have fulfyllyd myn pylgremage , thanke-it be God .
PASTON,I,668.231.6935

AUTHOR:MARGERY_PASTON[N.BREWS]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:HUSBAND:1444:45
LETTER:PASTON_231:M4:1489:COPY:FAMILY_NUCLEAR_CODE_METADATA
Also , syr , we vndyrstond +tat it is anactyd of euery x merke of
mevable goodys xxd. to +te Kyng , be-syd +te tennyth of euery mannys
londys . PASTON,I,668.231.6936

be-cawse he was wyth +te Kyng at Westmestre +tat he myth not entend to
wryth it tyl nyth . PASTON,I,669.231.6938

Paston PASTON,I,669.231.6944

<P_II,1>

{ED:422._FROM_NICHOLAS,_PRIOR_OF_BROMHOLM_1425,_5_JULY}

{COM:TO_WILLIAM_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:NICHOLAS_OF_BOMHOLM:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
LETTER:PASTON_232:M3:1425:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
A William Paston soit donne` . PASTON,II,1.232.6945

AUTHOR:NICHOLAS_OF_BOMHOLM:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
LETTER:PASTON_232:M3:1425:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Dere syre and weel be-loued , I grete yow weel PASTON,II,1.232.6946

AUTHOR:NICHOLAS_OF_BOMHOLM:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
LETTER:PASTON_232:M3:1425:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and do yow to wetyn +tat Dawn John Paston was atte Norwich on Munday
last passed and dede settyn on Crystechyrche yates diuers letteres a
lytyl tyme , and ij copijs wheche stondyn +ter yet , for somounyn me to
+te curt of Rome . PASTON,II,1.232.6947

AUTHOR:NICHOLAS_OF_BOMHOLM:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
LETTER:PASTON_232:M3:1425:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And we supposyn to haue hym atte Bromholm , or sum man in hys name ,
wythinne a lytyl tyme ; PASTON,II,1.232.6948

AUTHOR:NICHOLAS_OF_BOMHOLM:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
LETTER:PASTON_232:M3:1425:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for Dawn Robert of Yorke was atte Norwich be sendyng of my lady of
Murlee , PASTON,II,1.232.6949

AUTHOR:NICHOLAS_OF_BOMHOLM:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
LETTER:PASTON_232:M3:1425:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and spak wyth hym in hyre hous on Munday afornseyd ,
PASTON,II,1.232.6950

AUTHOR:NICHOLAS_OF_BOMHOLM:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
LETTER:PASTON_232:M3:1425:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and +ter he told +te forseyd Dawn Robert +tat he wolde nedys ben Priour
of $Bromholm to leuyn and deyin +ter-vpon . PASTON,II,1.232.6951

AUTHOR:NICHOLAS_OF_BOMHOLM:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
LETTER:PASTON_232:M3:1425:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Also he seyde as for +te composission of Bromholm he hadde do sherchyd
$atte Clunye , PASTON,II,1.232.6952

AUTHOR:NICHOLAS_OF_BOMHOLM:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
LETTER:PASTON_232:M3:1425:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and +ter-inne he standyth clere , as he seyth . PASTON,II,1.232.6953

AUTHOR:NICHOLAS_OF_BOMHOLM:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:47
LETTER:PASTON_232:M3:1425:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And as for prouisyon he seyde he hadde spoken wyth +te $Chauncelere and
+te Chef Justyse and Ascam , PASTON,II,1.232.6954

AUTHOR:NICHOLAS_OF_BOMHOLM:MALE:_:_:_

{ED:423._FROM_ELIZABETH_ROTHENHALE_ABOUT_1426,_26_JAN.}

{COM:TO_WILLIAM_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_ROTHENHALE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:48
LETTER:PASTON_233:M3:1426:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
A moun trescher et bien ame` cosin William Paston soit donne` .
PASTON,II,2.233.6970

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_ROTHENHALE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:48
LETTER:PASTON_233:M3:1426:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Dere and weel beloued cosyn , I grete yow weel , thankyng yow of alle
trewe and frendely frendeschepes aforn +tis tyme on-to me schewed ,
euermore trostyng of yowre good contenewaunce . PASTON,II,2.233.6971

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_ROTHENHALE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:48
LETTER:PASTON_233:M3:1426:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And plese it yow to wete of my welfare , PASTON,II,2.233.6972

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_ROTHENHALE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:48
LETTER:PASTON_233:M3:1426:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
at +te makyng of +tis lettre I was in hele of body , blessed be God ,
but nothyng in ease of herte , for as mech as I haue vnderstande be
diuers persones +tat I schulde be gretliche indetted anemps Steyard for
my lordes dette , whos soule God assoylle ; which dette drawith vij li.
and j pype wyn , of +te wich I hadde neuere knowlech of my lord be his
lyue , nowthere be mowthe , be writyng , be taylle , ne be record ,
sauf only of ij pipes wyn for me and j pipe for my modere elawe , of
+te which I haue paied xx s . PASTON,II,2.233.6973

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_ROTHENHALE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:48
LETTER:PASTON_233:M3:1426:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And trewly , cosyn , myn herte is rith heuy for his ontrewe askyng ,
PASTON,II,2.233.6974

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_ROTHENHALE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:48
LETTER:PASTON_233:M3:1426:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for sithen +te deth of my lord he meued neuere +tis matere on-to +tis
tyme ; PASTON,II,2.233.6975

RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:48
LETTER:PASTON_233:M3:1426:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for which <P_II,3> tyme as I was at Jernemouth abydyng in +te Frere
Carmes +te tyme of pestelens his wif come on-to me at +tat same tyme ,
bisechyng me to be good lady on-to hym , PASTON,II,3.233.6976

for my moder elawe . PASTON,II,3.233.6977

RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:48
LETTER:PASTON_233:M3:1426:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Also in heruest last passed , swech tyme as he was seek and lich to
haue be ded , I sent on-to hym for +te seid mater .
PASTON,II,3.233.6978

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_ROTHENHALE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:48

He at +tat tyme , in presence of John of Berneye , cowde aske nomore
but fore +te seid iij <em> pipes , my </em> moderes and myn . Wherfore
me thenkyth his askyng is on-trewe ; PASTON,II,3.233.6979

his lyue $no gret nede to haue be dettour to hym of so gret a summe ,
PASTON,II,3.233.6980

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_ROTHENHALE:FEMALE:_:_:_

and if he hadde , trewly I knew hym so weel he wolde <em> ... </em> me
or summe of his concel pryue` to +te seid dette , as he dede of othere
diuers thynges . PASTON,II,3.233.6981

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_ROTHENHALE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:48
LETTER:PASTON_233:M3:1426:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And therfore , cosyn , I beseche yow for +te grete trost +tat my lord
hadde in yow , makyng yow on of his feffeez and also on his attorne`s ,
as for on of his best trosted frendes , and also for +te special trost
+tat I haue in yow aforn alle othere creatures , +tat ye wolde
vouchesauf in easyng of myn herte to concidere +tat ye and I be
disgarged anemps +te Kyng as for +te dette of Steyard , as ye wele I be
in hele and ease , whech wele nogth veryly be on-to +te tyme I haue
youre good auys in +tis seid maters . PASTON,II,3.233.6982

PASTON,II,3.233.6983

PASTON,II,3.233.6984

{ED:424._FROM_ROBERT_LORD_WILLOUGHBY_1431,_8_JANUARY}

{COM:TO_WILLIAM_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:ROBERT_WILLOUGHBY_1:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:53
LETTER:PASTON_234:M4:1431:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To oure right trusty and welbeloued frend William Paston ,
squier . </font> PASTON,II,3.234.6985

AUTHOR:ROBERT_WILLOUGHBY_1:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:53
LETTER:PASTON_234:M4:1431:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Right trusty and welbeloued frende , we grete yow wel with al oure hert
. PASTON,II,3.234.6986

AUTHOR:ROBERT_WILLOUGHBY_1:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:53
LETTER:PASTON_234:M4:1431:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And for asmuche as for the greet plaisirs and kyndenesses , good and
notable seruices and frendeships whiche oure brother Sire William
Oldhalle and Margarite oure suster his wyf haue doon and shewed vs in
tyme passed , and yit do daily in diuers wyses , and for the greet and
notable <P_II,4> sommes of good whiche oure saide brother Oldhalle hath
lent vnto vs and payed for vs out of his pourse at oure nede , the
whiche we owe hym yit in trewe dette for monneye lent and for noo
no+ter cause , we jn recompense of the saide seruices and in
acquittence of the saide dette haue yeven vnto oure said brother
Oldhalle and Margarite his wyff an annuite` and pension of vj=xx= marc
by yere duryng thaire lyffs and the lenger lyuyng of thaym bothe for to
bee taken and raysed by thaym yerely vpon certaine landes , lordships ,
and tenementes of oures withynne Northfolk and Suffolk , jn the whiche
ye stande by vs feffed vnto oure behooue , liche as by the lettres ,
deedes , and endentures whiche we haue doo make +terevppon vnto oure
said brother Oldhalle and Margarite his wyff ye shal more clerely see .
We pray and require yow right hertily ; and as oure faithful trust is
in yow in this matere , and also we charge yow as ye wol answere
+terefore before God and also vnto vs , that after the fourme , teneur
, contenue , and effecte of the deedes , lettres , and endentures maad
and passed +terevppon and after oure wil and entent in this matere , ye
make ful and plain estat vnto oure said brother Oldhalle and Margarite
his wyff duryng thaire lyffs and of the lenger lyuyng of thaym of the
saide annuite` and pension of vj=xx= marc yerely in the landes and
tenementes declared , named , and specified in the saide deedes ,
lettres , and endentures withynne the contees of Northfolk and of
Suffolk abouuesaide ; and +tat ye faille not hereof in noowise as euere
ye desire to doo +ting for vs and as oure ful trust is in yow , for
thees oure lettres shal bee vnto yow +terefore suffisant warant and
discharge at alle tymes and in alle places $where $hit {TEXT:wherehit}
apparteneth ; and that ye seelle the same deede endented whiche we send
yow with thees oure lettres . PASTON,II,4.234.6987

AUTHOR:ROBERT_WILLOUGHBY_1:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:53
LETTER:PASTON_234:M4:1431:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Writen vndir oure seel at Pontdelarche the viij day of Janiuer the yere
of oure Lord m=l=cccc and xxx and of the regne of oure souerain lord
King Henry the vj=the= after the Conqueste the ix=the= .
PASTON,II,4.234.6988

AUTHOR:ROBERT_WILLOUGHBY_1:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:53
LETTER:PASTON_234:M4:1431:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Wylughby Robert Lord of Willughby and of Beaumesnil
PASTON,II,4.234.6989

<P_II,5>

AUTHOR:JOHN_GYN:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:58
LETTER:PASTON_235:M4:1436:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Right worthy and worshipfull ser and my good lord and maister , I
recomaund me to yow . PASTON,II,5.235.6991

AUTHOR:JOHN_GYN:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:58
LETTER:PASTON_235:M4:1436:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And where-as ye by your lettre direct to my lady your wyf wold +tat my
seid lady shuld have Robert Tebald and me to-geder as sone as she myght
, and +te evidences which +te seid Robert receyved of yow at your last
beyng at Norwich , and +tat I shuld amende +te defautes +ter-jnne , and
+tat +tat doon +tere shuld of Baxteres place of Honyng be taken estate
to yow and to o+ter as your seid lettre requireth ; prey and beseche
yow to witte +tat on +te Friday next after your departyng fro Paston
Thomas Walyssh and William Burgh in his owen persone , and +te seid
Thomas by William Inges and William Walsyngham his attorne`s by his
lettre vnder his seal , were at Honyng and delyvred to my Lady Scarlet
seson in +te seid place and Colbyes and Dounynges in Walsham .
PASTON,II,5.235.6992

AUTHOR:JOHN_GYN:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:58
LETTER:PASTON_235:M4:1436:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And +te seid Thomas Walyssh , as +te seid Tebald told me , wold not
enseale +te seid lettre of attorne` til +te parson of Ingeworth come to
hym +ter-fore and required hym to don it . PASTON,II,5.235.6993

AUTHOR:JOHN_GYN:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:58

Wychyngham in his owen person in +te nyght next beforn +te seid Friday
, as +te seid Tebald infourmeth me , come to +te same Tebaldes hows
PASTON,II,5.235.6994

LETTER:PASTON_235:M4:1436:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
What is +te best to be don in +tis matier my seid lady your wyf kan not
thynke with-owt your advis and counseill . Wherfore as touchyng +te
takyng of +t'estate to yow and o+ter , as in your seid lettre is
conteigned , is yet right nought doon . PASTON,II,5.235.7002

lavfull a-state terme of my lyfe in the departyson that was grantid
betwex +gow and me to-fore soch that was there for my hosbond and for
me att that tyme ; prayng +gow that it may be done now and deliuerid to
my brodure Jon Chambre or to Jon Coke owre seruant , brynger of this
letture . PASTON,II,6.236.7013

{ED:428._FROM_JOAN_MARYOT:COPY_PROBABLY_1442,_COPIED_AFTER_1480}

{COM:TO_WILLIAM_PASTON_I}

<P_II,8>

AUTHOR:JOAN_MARYOT:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:64
LETTER:PASTON_237:M4:1442:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
To my ryght wurshefull and trosty master Wyllyam Paston ,
PASTON,II,8.237.7023

AUTHOR:JOAN_MARYOT:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:64
LETTER:PASTON_237:M4:1442:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Justice Wurshefull and ryght trosty master , I comaund me vnto you ,
desyryng to here of youre wurshep and welfare , the whych God kepe to
hys plesyng and to $youre owne hartes desyre , prayng you euermore of
youre good mastershep and of youre good continwanse ; prayng you at the
reuerense of God to hold me excused of $the lewde and on-connyng
langage the whych I answered you wyth at youre being at Crowmer .
PASTON,II,8.237.7024

AUTHOR:JOAN_MARYOT:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:64
LETTER:PASTON_237:M4:1442:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
For so helpe me God and holydom I seyd it nowt to you for $no bade
trost +tat I haue in you , but only to late you to wetyn what
temptaciones +tat I haue hadde by that same persone +tat I told you of
and be oder many moo +tat <em> wil not </em> awow yt in +te same maner
, savyng youre reuerence , as fals men don and my bodyly enmys .
PASTON,II,8.237.7025

AUTHOR:JOAN_MARYOT:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:64
LETTER:PASTON_237:M4:1442:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And , wurshefull and trosty master , and as for +tat I shuld $haue the
maner in ferme in swych fourme as +ge comoned of $before my neybores at
Crowmer , I prey yow at the reuerense of God +tat +ge wil do youre
$good mastershyp +terin as +ge haue don by-fore tyme ;
PASTON,II,8.237.7026

AUTHOR:JOAN_MARYOT:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:64
LETTER:PASTON_237:M4:1442:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for as +ge do I will stande therto , PASTON,II,8.237.7027

AUTHOR:JOAN_MARYOT:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:64
LETTER:PASTON_237:M4:1442:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for I haue comoned wyth owre veker and wyth oder frendes of $myn
PASTON,II,8.237.7028

AUTHOR:JOAN_MARYOT:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:64
LETTER:PASTON_237:M4:1442:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and +tey and I prey you euermore of yowre best counseyll therin .
PASTON,II,8.237.7029

AUTHOR:JOAN_MARYOT:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:64
LETTER:PASTON_237:M4:1442:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
No more to yow at thys tyme , but Jesu kepe yow both body and sowle .
PASTON,II,8.237.7030

AUTHOR:JOAN_MARYOT:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:64

{COM:TO_WILLIAM_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOAN_MARYOT:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:64
LETTER:PASTON_238:M4:1442:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
To my wurshefull maister Justice of the Kyng William Paston
PASTON,II,8.238.7032

AUTHOR:JOAN_MARYOT:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:64
LETTER:PASTON_238:M4:1442:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Wurshefull mayster and reuerent souerayn , I comaund me to yow euer as
yowre powr bedewoman , desyryng euer to heren of youre good welfare
wyth prosperite` and good lyf to the plesyng of God , praing you
euermore of youre good mastershepe and cownsell in the mater the whych
is for the <P_II,9> maner of Estbecham , of the whyche mater +ge and we
comound of at Crowmer the last tyme +tat my sone and I spake wyth you .
PASTON,II,9.238.7033

AUTHOR:JOAN_MARYOT:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:64
LETTER:PASTON_238:M4:1442:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And I hade lever , and so had John my sone , to haue an ende and ben in
seker possessyon wythin a yer to the bare maner wyth-outen ony reward
of dampmages than lenger abyden to stande in dowte of lawe and of youre
lyf and owre also ; PASTON,II,9.238.7034

AUTHOR:JOAN_MARYOT:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:64
LETTER:PASTON_238:M4:1442:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and how the ende be made and in $what tyme I consent
PASTON,II,9.238.7035

RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:64
LETTER:PASTON_238:M4:1442:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and am wele pleased . PASTON,II,9.238.7036

RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1378:64
LETTER:PASTON_238:M4:1442:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
No more at thys tyme , but the blysful Trynyte` haue you euer in kepyng
. PASTON,II,9.238.7037

of Trynyte` Hall in Cambrigge . </font> PASTON,II,21.240.7112

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_240:M4:1430S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER

yow . PASTON,II,21.240.7113

AUTHOR:JOHN_GYN:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_240:M4:1430S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Like it yow to witte +tat on +te Soneday next after +te Ascencion of
Oure Lord in +te high weye betwex Cambrigg and +te Bekyntre toward
Newmarket I fonde a purs with money +ter-jnne . PASTON,II,21.240.7114

AUTHOR:JOHN_GYN:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_240:M4:1430S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
+T'entent of +tis my symple lettre is +tis : +tat it please to your
good maistership by weye of charite` and of your gentilnesse to witte
if ony of youre knowleche or ony o+ter , swich as yow semeth best in
your discrecion , have lost swich a purs ; PASTON,II,21.240.7115

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_240:M4:1430S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and +te toknes +ter-of told he shal have it a-geyn , what +tat ever he
be , by +te grace of Oure Lord , who ever have yow in his blissed
kepyng . PASTON,II,21.240.7116

pover seruaunt John Gyn PASTON,II,21.240.7117

{ED:440._JOHN_MOWBRAY,_THIRD_DUKE_OF_NORFOLK_PROBABLY_BEFORE_JULY_
1443}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_MOWBRAY_SR:MALE:_:1415:28
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:22
LETTER:PASTON_241:M4:1443:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To oure right trusti and welbelouid John Paston , squier .
</font> PASTON,II,23.241.7118

AUTHOR:JOHN_MOWBRAY_SR:MALE:_:1415:28
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:22
LETTER:PASTON_241:M4:1443:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
The Duc of Norffolk PASTON,II,23.241.7119

AUTHOR:JOHN_MOWBRAY_SR:MALE:_:1415:28
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:22
LETTER:PASTON_241:M4:1443:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Trusti and right welbelouid , we grete you weel , lating you witte that
for the trust that as weel we as the heires of Edmund Swathyng haue
vnto you we haue appoyntid you to be one of the makeres vp
indifferently of the euydences betwix vs and the seide heires . Wherfor
we pray you hertily +tat ye wil yeve attendaunce at such day and place
as {at}_P ye and our right $trusti and welbelouid frende William
Yeluerton , with oure welbelouid seruaunt Jenney , shal mow attende to
the making vp of the $seide euidencez ; PASTON,II,23.241.7120

AUTHOR:JOHN_MOWBRAY_SR:MALE:_:1415:28
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:22
LETTER:PASTON_241:M4:1443:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and we shal sende summe of our seruauntz to awayte vpon you for your
reward and costis +tat ye shal be pleasid with , <em> by the </em>
grace of God , who haue you euere in his keping . PASTON,II,23.241.7121

AUTHOR:JOHN_MOWBRAY_SR:MALE:_:1415:28
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:22
LETTER:PASTON_241:M4:1443:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Wreten vndir our signet in oure Castel of Framlyngham the xviij day of
<em> ..._NP </em> . PASTON,II,23.241.7122

AUTHOR:JOHN_MOWBRAY_SR:MALE:_:1415:28
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:22
LETTER:PASTON_241:M4:1443:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Norffolk PASTON,II,23.241.7123

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:24?
LETTER:PASTON_242:M4:1445?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
and I pray yow to wete that I was at Katefeld in Cobbes place for to se
the armes as ye comaunded me , and +te feld is gold wyth iij bukkeles
of syluere mad on +te wyse as it is here wyth floweres of syluer on +te
bukkelis mad of iiij lyke a trewlove . PASTON,II,26.242.7125

<font> To my ryght wurchepfull $Master John Paston be this $deliuered
in hast . </font> PASTON,II,27.243.7143

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:27
LETTER:PASTON_243:M4:1448:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Right reuerent and wurchepfull ser , I recomand me to yow , desyryng to
here of yowre welfare , the which gracyows God contynually preserue and
kepe to yowre gostly hele and bodily welfare ; prayng yow to wete that
as for the broke syluer that my mastres wend for to a sent yow whan she
dede wryte here letter , there is non in yowre forcere .
PASTON,II,27.243.7144

{ED:446._FROM_ELISABETH_CLERE_NOT_AFTER_1449,_29_JUNE}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_245:M4:1440S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
<font> To my cosyn John Paston be thys letter delyuered . </font>
PASTON,II,31.245.7228

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_CLERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_245:M4:1440S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Trusty and weel be-loved cosyn , I comaunde me to +gow , desyryng to
here of +gowre weelfare and good spede in +gowre matere , +te qwech I
prey God send +gow to his plesaunce and to +goure hertys ease .
PASTON,II,31.245.7229

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_CLERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_245:M4:1440S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Cosyn , I lete +gow wete +tat Scrope hath be in this cuntre` to se my
cosyn +goure sustyr , and he hath spoken wyth my cosyn +goure moder ,
and sche <P_II,32> desyreth of hym +tat he schuld schewe +gow +te
endentures mad be-twen +te knyght +tat hath his dowter and hym ,
whethir +tat Skrop if he were maried and fortuned to have children , if
tho children schuld enheryte his lond or his dowter +te wheche is
maried . PASTON,II,32.245.7230

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_CLERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_245:M4:1440S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Cosyn , for +tis cause take gode hede to his endentures ,
PASTON,II,32.245.7231

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_245:M4:1440S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
for he is glad to schewe +gow hem or whom +ge wol a-sygne wyth +gow .
PASTON,II,32.245.7232

qweche is cccl marke and better , as Watkyn Shipdam seith ,

places . Whe {ED:r} for , cosyn , sche hath sent to me be Frere Newton
in gret counsell and preyeth me +tat I wold send to +gow a letter of
hir hevynes and prey yow to be hir good brothir , as hir trost is in
+gow . PASTON,II,32.245.7241

herd so mech of his birth and his condicions +tat , and +ge will , sche
will have hym whethir +tat hir moder wil or wil not , not-wythstandyng
it is tolde hir his persone is symple , PASTON,II,32.245.7242

for and my cosyn +gowre moder knew +tat I had sent yow +tis letter sche
schuld neuer love me . PASTON,II,33.245.7253

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_CLERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_245:M4:1440S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Nomore I wrighte to +gow at +tis tyme , but Holy Gost have +gow in
kepyng . PASTON,II,33.245.7254

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_CLERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_245:M4:1440S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Wretyn in hast on Seynt Peterys Day be candel lyght . Be +goure cosyn
Elisabeth Clere PASTON,II,33.245.7255

{ED:447._FROM_JAMES_GRESHAM_1449,_16_OCTOBER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JAMES_GRESHAM:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:28
LETTER:PASTON_246:M4:1449:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
After al due recomendacion , please it yow to wete +tat the Kyng is now
into +te marches of Wales , as it is seid , to th'entent +tat he may be
neer the cuntre` yf my lord of Bokyngham , whiche is commyssioner now
in Wales for dyuerses offences don +tere to +te Crowne , wolde sue to
haue his commyssion to be enlarged if he were repyned , &c .
PASTON,II,33.246.7256

AUTHOR:JAMES_GRESHAM:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:28

saue men deme +tat he wole be here $at $te {TEXT:atte} begynnyng of +te
parlement . PASTON,II,33.246.7257

{ED:449._FROM_THOMAS_LORD_SCALES_1450,_22_APRIL}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:THOMAS_SCALES:MALE:_:1399?:51?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_247:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER
<font> To my right trusty and right enterly welbeloued frend John
Paston , squier . </font> PASTON,II,34.247.7275

AUTHOR:THOMAS_SCALES:MALE:_:1399?:51?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_247:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER
Right $trusty {TEXT:tusty} and enterly welbeloued frend , I grete you
well PASTON,II,34.247.7276

AUTHOR:THOMAS_SCALES:MALE:_:1399?:51?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_247:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER
and wyll +ge wite +tat a man of Osberd Monford hath declared me how +te
said Osberd is infourmed +tat Danyell shuld be pourposed to enter in
+te place of Brayston . PASTON,II,34.247.7277

AUTHOR:THOMAS_SCALES:MALE:_:1399?:51?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_247:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER
And as fer as I can vnderstande Danyell is come in-to +tis cuntre` for
non other cause but for to haue such as the Kyng hath gifen hym in
Rysyng , which lieth not in me ner in non of the Kynges subgettes to go
ageyns hise graunte and plesaunce . PASTON,II,34.247.7278

AUTHOR:THOMAS_SCALES:MALE:_:1399?:51?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_247:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER
And in cas +te said Danyell wold enter upon +te said Osberd o+ter-wise
than lawe wold , seyng +te said Osberd is my tenaunt and homager it is
my part to holde with hym rather than with Danyell in hise right ,
which I wyll do to my pouer . PASTON,II,34.247.7279

AUTHOR:THOMAS_SCALES:MALE:_:1399?:51?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_247:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER
And as +get I can not apparceyue +tat Danyell wyll labore in any maters
in +tis cuntre` , PASTON,II,34.247.7280

AUTHOR:THOMAS_SCALES:MALE:_:1399?:51?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_247:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER
and if he wyll be of good gouernance I am wel paied .
PASTON,II,34.247.7281

AUTHOR:THOMAS_SCALES:MALE:_:1399?:51?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_247:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER
And in cas +tat he wold do wrong to +te lesse gentilman in the chirre ,
it shal not <P_II,35> lye in hise pouer , be the grace of God .
PASTON,II,35.247.7282

AUTHOR:THOMAS_SCALES:MALE:_:1399?:51?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_247:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER
He letethe me wite +tat he wyll be wel gouerned in tyme commyng .
PASTON,II,35.247.7283

AUTHOR:THOMAS_SCALES:MALE:_:1399?:51?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_247:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER

hise gouernance . PASTON,II,35.247.7284

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_248:M4:1450:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and haue soo wesshe this litel bille with sorwfulle terys that on-ethes
ye shulle reede it . PASTON,II,35.248.7290

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_LOMNOR:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_248:M4:1450:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
As on Monday nexte after May Day there come tydynges to London that on
Thorsday before the Duke of Suffolk come vnto the costes of Kent full
nere Dower with his ij shepes and a litel spynner , the qweche spynner
he sente with certeyn letters be certeyn of his trustid men vnto Caleys
warde , to knowe howe he shuld be resceyuyd . PASTON,II,35.248.7291

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_LOMNOR:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_248:M4:1450:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And with hym mette a shippe callyd <font> Nicolas of the Towre </font>
, with othere shippis waytyng on hym , PASTON,II,35.248.7292

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_248:M4:1450:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER

</font> hadde knowlich of the Dukes comyng . PASTON,II,35.248.7293

+tat considered he trustid veryly +tat +tere shuld non assise be
graunted to your entent . PASTON,II,41.252.7412

Wyltshire he wolde be but weel pleased +tat ye hadde your assise ,

<font> To my right trusty and intierly welbeloued John Paston , squyer
. </font> PASTON,II,42.253.7436

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29?
LETTER:PASTON_253:M4:1450?:COPY:OTHER
Right trusty and intierly welbeloued , I grete yow wele ,
PASTON,II,42.253.7437

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29?
LETTER:PASTON_253:M4:1450?:COPY:OTHER
and wole and pray you that ye dispose your-self to be with my lord of
Norffolk in al hast goodly , to that intent that where it was desired
by dyuers gentilmen of this shire that I shuld my-self a be with his
lordship at Framyngham , to excuse me to his lordship ;
PASTON,II,42.253.7438

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29?
LETTER:PASTON_253:M4:1450?:COPY:OTHER
for truly I haf suych writyng from the Kyng as it sitteth me not to
tary lenger from his Highnesse . PASTON,II,42.253.7439

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29?
LETTER:PASTON_253:M4:1450?:COPY:OTHER
I haf writyn to my said lord for myn excuse , which writyng I send to
yow by Thomas Denyes , to whome I pray you to gif credens .
PASTON,II,42.253.7440

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29?
LETTER:PASTON_253:M4:1450?:COPY:OTHER
And the Trinite` kepe yow . PASTON,II,42.253.7441

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29?
LETTER:PASTON_253:M4:1450?:COPY:OTHER
Wretyn at Bury Seynt Edmond the xxj day of August .
PASTON,II,42.253.7442

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29?
LETTER:PASTON_253:M4:1450?:COPY:OTHER
I pray you to speke with Ser Miles Stapilton and Brewes and to delyuer
to thaym my lettres , wherof I send you copies , and make Brewes to
send ouer a man to me with th'entent of my lord of Norffolk , and with
th'effect of your deligens , with a more credible message than Brewes
ded to my <P_II,43> wif ; PASTON,II,43.253.7443

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29?
LETTER:PASTON_253:M4:1450?:COPY:OTHER
for I had neuer a wers iurney for a iape in my lif , ne a lewder , as
ye shal wele conceyve . PASTON,II,43.253.7444

{ED:456A._THE_EARL_OF_OXFORD_TO_SIR_MILES_STAPLETON_THOMAS_BREWS:C
OPIES_ENCLOSED_WITH_NO._456.}

{COM:TO_SIR_MILES_STAPLETON,_COPY_TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29?
LETTER:PASTON_254:M4:1450?:COPY:OTHER
To my ryght trusti and wyth all myn hert intyerly welbelovyd Ser Mylys
Stapelton , knyght PASTON,II,43.254.7446

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29?
LETTER:PASTON_254:M4:1450?:COPY:OTHER
Ryght trusty and wyth all myn hert entierly welbelovyd , I grete yow
wele PASTON,II,43.254.7447

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29?
LETTER:PASTON_254:M4:1450?:COPY:OTHER
and wol that ye wete that a gentelman of your ally hath ben wyth me ,
at whos jnstans and steryng and by hese good avyce I wold ful fayne a
met wyth yow at Framyngham , but I may no lenger abyde here for the
strayte comaundment that I have to be wyth the Kyng . Wherfore I pray
yow to comown wyth Brews and Paston and to put in artycles be ther
avyses and be your wysdom the indisposicion of the people of this
counte` , and what were most necesary to be desierid of the Kyng and of
my lordis of the Councell for the restreynte of ther mourmur and the
peas , and to send it me be the brynger herof , to whom I pray yow gef
credens . PASTON,II,43.254.7448

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29?

and for as mouche as ye were wyth my wyf at Wynche in the name and
behalve of the substaunce of the gentelys of this shyer , and cause my
wyf to wryte to me for to turne agayn into Norffolk , be wheche wrytyng
and be your report it semyd to me that a gret asemble` had be purposid
wythin the counte` heer , I therfore sayd vn-to yow , wolyng and mevyng
yow , aftyre your trowth and as ye know , that ye do put in artycles
the indisposicion of the people and what your avyce is to be do for the
restreynyng of the same . PASTON,II,43.254.7453

{ED:457._SIR_JOHN_FASTOLF,_TO_PASTON_OTHERS_1450,_14_SEPTEMBER}_CO DE

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:72?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_255:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER
<font> To my ryght trusty cosyn and frendys John a Berney , John Paston
, and Ser Thomas Howys , parson of Castelcombe . </font>
PASTON,II,44.255.7459

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:72?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_255:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER
Ryght trusty and welbelovyd cosyn and frendys , I grete yow well .
PASTON,II,44.255.7460

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:72?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_255:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER
And forasmoch as I vndrestand that the oyer and terminer shall be
halden at Norwych vppon Thursday next commyng , and seth it ys soo that
y have materys attamed there ayenst Appul+gerd and othyrs that have put
me to grete wrong and dammage , as ye know best , of whych materys I
desyre that it myght take to a gode eende to my worshyp and proffyt ,
wherfor I seende vnto yow my ryght trusty seruaunt John Bokkyng , to
wayt vppon my lerned councell and othyr trusty frendys of myne , there
to help , solicit , and labour my chargeable materys as ye shall best
avise hym ; PASTON,II,44.255.7461

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:72?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_255:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER
and prayng yow to spare for no resonable cost to ley owt and do at thys
tyme there as it shall be thought expedient so as my mater may take a
gode ende to my worshyp . And in especiall ye labour effectuelly the
bill of meyntenaunce ayenst Appul+gerd , for as I vndrestand he was the
grettest cause that th'enquest past ayenst me so vntruely , where as I
gafe hym no cause ; gevyng credence to the seid Bokkyng in that at may
concern thys mater or onye othyr to my worshyp and proffyt .
PASTON,II,44.255.7462

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:72?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_255:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER
I ponder thys mater full gretly because it sownyth more to my worshyp
and hertys ease then onlye my proffyt . PASTON,II,44.255.7463

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:72?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_255:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER
Our Lord have yow in hys kepyng . PASTON,II,44.255.7464

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:72?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_255:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER
Wrytt at London the xiiij day of September the xxjx yeere of Kyng Herry
vj=te= . PASTON,II,44.255.7465

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:72?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_255:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER
J. Fastolf PASTON,II,44.255.7466

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_256:M4:1450:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
It is so that of my lord gete I no socour , PASTON,II,46.256.7477

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_256:M4:1450:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and lever I had to dy than gif vp the place sith I am ther-yn .
PASTON,II,46.256.7478

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_256:M4:1450:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And I wene if thei gete the place vpon me ther helpith my lif no
pardone . Wherfore I lowly beseche yow , Maister Paston , aduertise in
your wisdam that this was the first purpose of Tudenham and Heydon
whils thei regned , to gete this place , and to that intent thei
brought hider the Lord Roos , which now is ful simpely thought on with
my maister that I serue . PASTON,II,46.256.7479

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_256:M4:1450:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And ye wete wele that I haf most encountred the entent of Tudenham and
Heydon of ony pouer man on lyve , PASTON,II,46.256.7480

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_256:M4:1450:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and if I be lost or put to an vngoodly rebuke heryn my seruice is the
lesse of valu to you that be gentils of the shire . Wherfore I requyre
your maistership to come hider in your persone with suych as ye seme
not to that intent to take party in the mater but to that intent to
help to set peas in the shire and to stire my lord for his honour .
PASTON,II,46.256.7481

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29

and my seyd lord hayth putte a bille to +te Kynge and desyryd meche
thynge , qwych is meche after +te Comouns desyre ,
PASTON,II,47.257.7499

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WAYTE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_257:M4:1450:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and all is vp-on justice and to putte all thoo +tat ben indyted vndere
arest with-owte suerte` or maynpryce , and to be tryed be lawe as lawe
wyll ; in so meche +tat on Monday Syr W. Oldhall was with the Kynge
atte Westmynster more +tanne to houres and hadde of +te Kynge good
chere . PASTON,II,47.257.7500

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WAYTE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29

cosyn York +tat he wold be good lord to John Penycook , and +tat my
lord of York shuld wryte vn-to hese tenaunce that they wold suffyre
Peny Cookes officers go and gadere vp hys rentes fermes with-jnne +te
seyd Dukes lordsheps . PASTON,II,47.257.7501

and +terfor it is noon o+ter remedye but late <P_II,48> Swhafham men be
warned to mete with my seyd lord on Fryday nest comyng atte Pykenham on
horssebak in +te most goodly wyse , and putte sum bylle vn-to my lord
of Syr Thomas Tudenham , Heydon , and Prentys , and crye owte on hem ,
and +tat all the women of +te same towne be +ter also and crye owte on
hem also and calle hem extorcionners , and pray my lord +tat he wyll do
$sharp {TEXT:shap} execucyon vp-on hem . PASTON,II,48.257.7509

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WAYTE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_257:M4:1450:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And my mayster counceyll yow that +ge shuld meve +te meyer and all +te
aldermen with all here comoners to ryde ayens my lord , and +tat +ter
ben madde byllez and putte them vp to my lord , PASTON,II,48.257.7510

<Q_PAS_C_1450_T_RICHARDY> <L_PASTON_258> <A_RICHARD_OF_YORK>
<A-GENDER_MALE> <A-REL_---> <A-DOB_1411> <R_HENRY_TUDOR_VI>
<R-GENDER_MALE> <R-REL_---> <R-DOB_1421>

<P_II,49>

{ED:460A._DUKE_OF_YORK_TO_KING_HENRY_VI,_COPY_ENCLOSED_WITH_NO.
_460._1450}

{COM:TO_HENRY_VI,_COPY_TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:RICHARD_OF_YORK:MALE:_:1411:39
RECIPIENT:HENRY_TUDOR_VI:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_258:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER
Please it youre Hyghnes tendirly to considere the grett grutchyng and
romore that is vniuersaly in this youre reame of +tat justice is nouth
dewly ministrid to such as trespas and offende a-yens youre lawes , and
in special of them that ben endited of treson and o+ter beyng openly
noysed of the same . Wherfore for gret inconueniens +tat haue fallen ,
and gretter is lyke to fallen here-aftere in youre seid reame , which
God defende , but if be youre Hyghnesse prouysion couenable be mad for
dew reformacion and punyshment in this behalf ; wherfore I , youre
humble sugett and lyge man , Richard Duke of York , willyng as
effectually as I kan and desiryng <P_II,50> suerte` and prosperite` of
youre most roiall person and welfare of this youre noble reame ,
councel and aduertyse youre Excellens , for the conuersacion of good
tranquillite` and pesable rewle among all trew sogettes , for to ordeyn
and prouyde +tat dew justice be had a-yenst all such that ben so
endited or openly so noysed ; wher-jnne I offre and wol put me in
deuoure for to excecute youre comandementes in thes premises of such
offenders and redresse of the seid mysrewlers to my myth and powere .
PASTON,II,50.258.7552

AUTHOR:RICHARD_OF_YORK:MALE:_:1411:39
RECIPIENT:HENRY_TUDOR_VI:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_258:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER
And for the hasty execucion here-of lyke it youre Hyghnes to dresse
youre letteres of prevy seall and writtes to youre officers and
ministres to do take and areste all soch persons so noysed or endited ,
of what astate , degre` , or condicion so euer thei be , and them to
comytte to youre Toure of London or to othere youre presons , there to
abyde with-outen bayle or maymprice on-to the tyme +tat thei be vtterly
tryed and declared after the cours of youre lawe .
PASTON,II,50.258.7553

men , and +tat no gentilman of Norffolk had writyng to awayte on hym
but he ; PASTON,II,50.259.7556

and he bad me write to yow +tat as touchyng the matier of my lord of
Oxeford he shall lette +te awardyng and +t'entre` +terof als long as he
may . PASTON,II,52.260.7602

AUTHOR:JAMES_GRESHAM:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29

knowelage to haue called up-on +te matier with-owt counseil and
enformacion of Heydon , PASTON,II,52.260.7603

+tat he and alle his men wern endited of felonye in Norffolk , whiche
caused hym and his to be right wroth toward my maister and yow .
PASTON,II,52.260.7605

Styrop , whiche is a man of the Lord Moleyns , +te trouth +tat nothir
he ner noon of his is endited , PASTON,II,52.260.7606

shuld come in-to Norffolk in hast with grette pupyll , and as on of hys
men seyd +ter , with the vij=xx= . PASTON,II,53.261.7613

of hys men atte Norwych . PASTON,II,53.261.7617

Right trusti and welbelouid , we grete you well . PASTON,II,54.262.7641

AUTHOR:JOHN_MOWBRAY_SR:MALE:_:1415:35
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_262:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER
And forasmoche as oure vnkill of York and we haue fully appoynted and
agreed of such ij persones for to be knightes of shire of Norffolk as
oure said vnkill and we thinke conuenient and necessarie for the
welfare of the said shire , we therfor pray you , in oure said vnkill
name and oures bothe , as ye list to stonde in the fauour of oure good
lordshjp , that ye make no laboure contrarie to oure desire .
PASTON,II,54.262.7642

AUTHOR:JOHN_MOWBRAY_SR:MALE:_:1415:35
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_262:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER
And God haue you in his keping . PASTON,II,54.262.7643

AUTHOR:JOHN_MOWBRAY_SR:MALE:_:1415:35
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_262:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER
Wreten at Bury Seynt Edmondis the xvj day of Octobre .
PASTON,II,54.262.7644

til Friday ix of the clokke , and than they departed .

knyghttes of the shyre , PASTON,II,54.263.7648

you specially that ye will make you redy to awayte vpon vs at
Yippiswich toward the parlement the viij day of Nouembre in youre best
aray , with as many clenly people as ye may gete for oure worship at
this tyme ; PASTON,II,55.264.7654

LETTER:PASTON_265:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER
Th'Erl of Oxenford PASTON,II,57.265.7659

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_265:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER
Right tusty and welbeloved , we gret $yow well . PASTON,II,57.265.7660

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:29
LETTER:PASTON_265:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER
And for as meche as the Qwene and my lord of York haue wretyn to vs for
a matier that is dependyng betwix the toun of Salle and on Sechforth of
the same toun , we pray yow that at suche tyme as ye purpose yow to be
with vs now this Cristemesse at Wynche that ye lete the sayd Sechforth
haue wetyng ther-of , and that he may be with vs that same tyme for
diuerse matiers wich that we haue to speke with hym ; and that ye fayle
not , as we trust yow . PASTON,II,57.265.7661

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:42?

LETTER:PASTON_265:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER
Wretyn in owre manor of Wynche the xxiij=ti= daij of December .
PASTON,II,57.265.7662

and he yede streyt to my lord Chauncelere PASTON,II,60.266.7667

and Heydon here issewes +tat the shire of Suffolk wold paye no taxe ;

for what nedyth the Kynge for to have the taxe of hese pore puple
whanne he wyll not take hese issues of thoo ryche extorssioners and
oppressours of hese puple . PASTON,II,60.266.7669

short tyme have as meche for to do as they hadde for to kepe London
Brygge whanne +te Capteyn cam thedyr , PASTON,II,60.266.7670

And +terfor my mayster wold +tat the mayere shuld send for hym +tat he
be ther be tyme on +te Tuesday and +tat moo bille be made ayens
Tudenham and Heydon , what so euer falle . PASTON,II,62.266.7705

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WAYTE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_266:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
+Te Holy Gost have yow and youre in hese kepyng . PASTON,II,62.266.7706

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WAYTE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_266:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Wretyn atte Rougham +te Sonday nyte nest after New+gers Day , in hast
as it semyth . Be your seruaunt W. Wayte PASTON,II,62.266.7707

{ED:472._FROM_WILLIAM_WAYTE_1451,_9_JANUARY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WAYTE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_267:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
<font> To my ryght reuerent and ryght wurchepfull mayster , myn Mayster
Paston , in hast posybyll . </font> PASTON,II,62.267.7708

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WAYTE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_267:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Syr , lyke yt yow to know +tat my Lord Scalys sent hese purseuaunte
vn-to my mayster on the Twelthe Day +tat my mayster shuld mete with hym
atte Wynche aforn my lord of Oxenford on +te Thursday nest folwyng .
PASTON,II,62.267.7709

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WAYTE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_267:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And whanne my mayster cam +tedyr he delyuered my mayster a letter from
my lord Chauncheler , qwych my mayster wyll shewe yow atte Lenn .
PASTON,II,62.267.7710

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WAYTE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_267:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
I shuld send yow a copy +ter-of , PASTON,II,62.267.7711

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_267:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
but it is so longe +tat I had no leyser to wryte it .
PASTON,II,62.267.7712

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30

qwych I send yow a copy of . PASTON,II,62.267.7715

<P_II,64>

{ED:473._FROM_JAMES_GLOYS_1451,_1_MARCH}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_268:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
<font> To my right reuerente and wurchepfull mayster John Paston ,
esquyere , be this $deliuered {TEXT:deliued} in hast . </font>
PASTON,II,64.268.7752

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_268:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Right reuerent and wurchepfull ser , I recomand me to you , besechyng
you to wete that Wharles told me that Partrych seid that his lord knewe
wele that ye were entred pesibilly in the manere of Gresham ;
where-fore he seid thow the tenauntes and fermores pay you the rentes
and fermes the tyme that ye be in possession , his seid lord , thow he
entre ageyn , wuld neuer aske it them . PASTON,II,64.268.7753

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_268:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Item , the seid Partrych seid to Wharles that his lord wull come down
hym-self and entre in the seid maner with-in short tyme .
PASTON,II,64.268.7754

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_268:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Wharles wull not discharge your baly of xxvj s. and viij d. which he
toke the seid baly enseled in a purs . PASTON,II,64.268.7755

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_268:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
The seid Wharles told my Mayster John of Berney at the court that he
repented hym that he payd you any peny till he had be distreyned ,
PASTON,II,64.268.7756

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_268:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and he seid than pleynly that he wull nomore pay till he were
distreyned . PASTON,II,64.268.7757

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_268:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
I haue be there diuers tymes for to distreyn hym ,
PASTON,II,64.268.7758

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_268:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and I cowde neuer do it but if I wuld a distreyned hym in his moderes
hous ; PASTON,II,64.268.7759

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_268:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and there I durst not for here cursyng . PASTON,II,64.268.7760

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_268:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
The baly of the hundred told me that Wharles spake to hym in cas he had
be distreyned that he wold haue gete hym a replevy ,
PASTON,II,64.268.7761

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_268:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and the baly bad hym kete a replevy of his mayster and he wold serve it
. PASTON,II,64.268.7762

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_268:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Item , the maner londes at Gresham , with othre tenauntes londes that
be fallyn in your handes , ben letyn to ferme . PASTON,II,64.268.7763

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_268:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
I can gete no tenaunte to dwell in the maner hous .
PASTON,II,64.268.7764

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_268:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
And if the rede shuld be caryed thens the tenauntes shuld thynk that ye
fered sum new entre` PASTON,II,64.268.7765

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_268:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and it shuld sore discomfort hem , PASTON,II,64.268.7766

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_268:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
for thei whisshed whan it was caried to the manere that it had be leyd
there thus pesibly ij yere afore . PASTON,II,64.268.7767

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_268:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
$As $for {TEXT:Asfor} the obligacyon that ye shuld haue of the parson

you , and that he be-hested it you not till Fastyngong .
PASTON,II,64.268.7768

Mathy the Appostell , PASTON,II,64.268.7771

where-fore I rode thedere . PASTON,II,65.268.7772

<font> To my right reuerent and wurchepfull mayster John Paston ,
esquier , be this deliuered in hast . </font> PASTON,II,67.269.7867

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30

Right reuerent and wurchepfull ser , I recomand me to you , prayng you
to wete that I haue labored diuers men that ben enpaneld a-twix my
mastres your modere and Wymdham . PASTON,II,67.269.7868

Yeluerton , and ye , and John Damme shuld be endited in Kent for
mayntenaunce of the oyere determynere in Norffolk ,
PASTON,II,67.269.7872

moderes name PASTON,II,67.269.7875

{ED:475._FROM_THOMAS_DENYS_1451,_4_MARCH}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_270:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
<font> To my Maister Paston . </font> PASTON,II,69.270.7906

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_270:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Right wurshipfull ser and my right good maister , I recomaunde me to
yow . PASTON,II,69.270.7907

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_270:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
It is so that vp-on an hasty sodeyn warnyng I departid from London and
spake not with yow at my departyng , wherof I was full sory .
PASTON,II,69.270.7908

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_270:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
I pray yow neuerthelesse that ye wole eftsones speke to William White
with my lord Cardenall , PASTON,II,69.270.7909

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_270:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
for I desire his maistership and good will PASTON,II,69.270.7910

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_270:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and wole do to my power . PASTON,II,69.270.7911

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_270:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And as touchyng to that that he semith I haf don agayn hym , in good
feith I wole abide your rule or , by Seynt Kateryne , his own rule .
PASTON,II,69.270.7912

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_

{ED:476._FROM_THE_EARL_OF_OXFORD_NOT_AFTER_1451,_30_APRIL}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_271:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
<font> To oure ryght trusty and right welbeloued frend Johan Paston ,
esquier . </font> PASTON,II,70.271.7934

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_271:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
The Erle of Oxenford PASTON,II,70.271.7935

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_271:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
Right trusty and welbeloued frend , we grete you right hertily well .
PASTON,II,70.271.7936

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_271:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
And for asmuche as we be enformed that on Thomas Kecham , a seruaunt of
oure right welbeloued brothir Ser Richard de Veer , knyght , hath to
done with Ser Henry Inglos , knyght , in a certeyn matier in wich youre
good maisterschep may cause his singuler ease and a-vaile as anenst the
said knyght , as Thomas Kecham hath enformed vs , we pray you hertily
that at the reuerens of vs and this oure writyng ye woll take the
labour vpon you to speke vnto the said Ser Henry , conceyuyng a mene
and the weye of an ende to be had be-twix thaym of right , causyng the
said knyght to sease of hese malice and wrongful suette as a-nenst the
said Thomas . PASTON,II,70.271.7937

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_271:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
And ferthermore we pray you to see that the said knyght take no
benefeys ne prevayle nat as a-nenst the Gaoyler of the Castell of
Norwych for the suerte` of the said Thomas Kecham , as we verily trust
ye woll ; in wich feithfully doyng we shall kun you hertily thanke .
PASTON,II,70.271.7938

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_271:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
And right trusty and welbeloued , the Trinite` haue yow in hese kepyng
. PASTON,II,70.271.7939

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_271:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
Wreton at oure manoir of Weuenhoo the last day of Aprill .
PASTON,II,70.271.7940

vndere-shereff , it is your wyl he shuld send a man of hese for it ;

that he doth for yow or be your desyre , ye have offered hym , and wol
parformet , sufficient sewerte` for to save hym harmeles ,
PASTON,II,73.273.7969

AUTHOR:JOHN_OSBERN:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_

myght do for yow wyth-owte any joporte` . PASTON,II,73.273.7970

Lord Molyns is a gret lord , he myght sone cause hym to lese that and
meche mo . PASTON,II,73.273.7971

AUTHOR:JOHN_OSBERN:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_

from hese lyvelod ; PASTON,II,73.273.7972

AUTHOR:JOHN_OSBERN:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_

As me semyth it wold do goode and ye wold gete a comaundment of the

and not for to favour non seche ryottes , &c. ; PASTON,II,73.273.7976

AUTHOR:JOHN_OSBERN:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_273:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
for he seyde that he sent yow the letter +tat the Kyng sent hym ,
PASTON,II,73.273.7977

AUTHOR:JOHN_OSBERN:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_273:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and ye seyde a man shuld gete seche on for a noble .
PASTON,II,73.273.7978

AUTHOR:JOHN_OSBERN:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_273:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Item , I remembred hym of the promyses that he hath made to Temperley ,
and that if he wold make yow very trew promys ye wold rewarde hym as
meche as he wold desire , or any other resonable man for hym , and
<P_II,74> asmoche and more then any aduersary ye have wold gef hym .
PASTON,II,74.273.7979

AUTHOR:JOHN_OSBERN:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_273:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Than he seyde he toke neuer no mony of non of hem : alle there was
proferid hym at Walsyngham for the Lord Molyns xx nobles , he had not a
peny . PASTON,II,74.273.7980

AUTHOR:JOHN_OSBERN:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_273:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Moreouer I proferyd hym if he wold make yow promys that ye myght veryly
trust vpon hym ye wold geff hym in hande as he wold desire , or to leve
a summe if he wold a named it in a mene mannys hand , and seche as he
hath trust to . PASTON,II,74.273.7981

AUTHOR:JOHN_OSBERN:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_273:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
And then he seyde if he myght do for yow , or if he do any thyng for
yow , then he wol take yowre mony wyth a good wyl ;
PASTON,II,74.273.7982

AUTHOR:JOHN_OSBERN:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_

your good maistirship and fauour in such wyse +tat he may knowe he
farith +te bettir for this my writing , as my trust is in you .

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_276:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
as this day com writing both to my lorde and to my lady from London
that there be certein lettres directed to my lorde from my lady his
moder and diuerse other lordes for to haue Danyell <P_II,77> in his
fauour a-geyne , and as it is $supposed by the meanes of the Duc of
Somersette , PASTON,II,77.276.8013

AUTHOR:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_276:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
for he hath ben right conuersaunte with hym all this quarter of $this
yere . PASTON,II,77.276.8014

AUTHOR:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:30
LETTER:PASTON_276:M4:1451:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And also thei +tat sent this writing sayn playnly that the Lorde Skales
is gode lorde to hym and +tat he hath promysed hym to make Ser Thomas
Tudenham , Heydon , and hym accorded , and other mo in the cuntre` ,
and that he shall be suffred to entre in-to Brayston and kepe it to
+t'entente +tat the cuntre` shall thinke , and my lorde also , +tat he
hath grete fauour amonge the lordes of the Counsell and cause men to
fere hym +te more . PASTON,II,77.276.8015

{ED:484._RICHARD_DUKE_OF_YORK,_TO_PASTON_AMONG_OTHERS_1452,_9_FEBR
UARY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:RICHARD_OF_YORK:MALE:_:1411:41
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
LETTER:PASTON_277:M4:1452:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To oure right trusty and welbeloued {ED:BLANK} Pagraue ,
{ED:BLANK} Bokenham , John Wyndam , John Paston , William Calthorp ,
Thomas Gurney , William Norwich , and Nicholas Ovy , and to euery of
thaim . </font> PASTON,II,77.277.8026

AUTHOR:RICHARD_OF_YORK:MALE:_:1411:41
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
LETTER:PASTON_277:M4:1452:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
The Duc of York , &c . PASTON,II,77.277.8027

AUTHOR:RICHARD_OF_YORK:MALE:_:1411:41
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
LETTER:PASTON_277:M4:1452:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Right trusty and welbeloued , we grete you hertily wel ,
PASTON,II,77.277.8028

AUTHOR:RICHARD_OF_YORK:MALE:_:1411:41
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
LETTER:PASTON_277:M4:1452:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and wol ye wit that the reuerend fader in God , oure right trusty and
entierly welbeloued cousin the Bisshop of Ely , hath rapported vnto vs
this same day that Thomas Danyell vppon Tuesday last passed entred with
force in the manoir of Braydeston vppon Osborn Mountford and his son
being at Calais in the Kyng oure souuerain lordes seruice , and
dispoylled thaire goodes ; sayeng <P_II,78> and affermyng for
maintenance of his saide presumptueux and vnlawful entree that othre
lordes and we stode enfeffed in the saide manoir to +te vse of him and
of his wyf terme of thaire lyves , and +tat hit was the wille of +te
saide lordes and of vs +tat he shuld soo entre , and +te same lordes
and we forto assiste him in keping of his possession . Wherfore , in
somuch as the same suggestion and surmission toucheth oure honneur and
the pretense therof shuld yeve vs occasion of greet noyse and charge ,
we certifie vnto you and to euery of you for trouth +tat we knewe
neuere such feffement made , ner we consented neuere to such forcible
entree ; PASTON,II,78.277.8029

AUTHOR:RICHARD_OF_YORK:MALE:_:1411:41
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
LETTER:PASTON_277:M4:1452:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and we dysavoue hit by thees oure lettres signed with oure owne hande ,
to +t'entent +tat +te parties greeued may haue +taire accion yif thay
bee so aduised , and due processe of law to bee executed , as in such
caas hit is required . PASTON,II,78.277.8030

AUTHOR:RICHARD_OF_YORK:MALE:_:1411:41
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
LETTER:PASTON_277:M4:1452:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Right trusty and welbeloued , Oure Lord haue you in his keping .
PASTON,II,78.277.8031

AUTHOR:RICHARD_OF_YORK:MALE:_:1411:41
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
LETTER:PASTON_277:M4:1452:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Yeven vndre oure signet at London +te ix day of Feuerer .
PASTON,II,78.277.8032

AUTHOR:RICHARD_OF_YORK:MALE:_:1411:41
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
LETTER:PASTON_277:M4:1452:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
R. York PASTON,II,78.277.8033

{ED:486._FROM_JOHN_CLOPTON_1452,_1_APRIL}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
LETTER:PASTON_278:M4:1452:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> Vnto myn right worshipfull sire John Paston . </font>
PASTON,II,79.278.8034

AUTHOR:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
LETTER:PASTON_278:M4:1452:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Right worshipfull sire and myn good maister , I recomaund me vnto you ,
thankyng you of your gentilnesse chewed vnto me , praynge you of
contenuance as myn full trust is . PASTON,II,79.278.8035

AUTHOR:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
LETTER:PASTON_278:M4:1452:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Furthermore , and it please you to be atte a leyser vn Seynt Mark Day
next comyng , and to be at Thetford , myn brodir Tyrell and I wole
awayte vppon you ther for the matere ye woot of . PASTON,II,79.278.8036

AUTHOR:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
LETTER:PASTON_278:M4:1452:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And I praye you to hold me excused that I myght not kepe myn day in the
Passion Wike , PASTON,II,79.278.8037

AUTHOR:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
LETTER:PASTON_278:M4:1452:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for in good feight I was so occupied I myght not .
PASTON,II,79.278.8038

AUTHOR:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
LETTER:PASTON_278:M4:1452:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And , sire , yif this day may be hold I praye you sendith me woord ,
that I myght send warnyng to the todir party . PASTON,II,79.278.8039

AUTHOR:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
LETTER:PASTON_278:M4:1452:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Also , sire , I haue warned your atteynt accordyng to your comawndement
. PASTON,II,79.278.8040

AUTHOR:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
LETTER:PASTON_278:M4:1452:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Sir , the Kyng hath sent vnto me by Howard to be frendly to the Lord
<P_II,80> Moleyns . PASTON,II,80.278.8041

AUTHOR:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
LETTER:PASTON_278:M4:1452:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Not-with-stondyng myn seruice shall be redy at your comawndement in
that matere er any othir , by the grace of God , who preserue you body
and sowle . PASTON,II,80.278.8042

PASTON,II,80.278.8043

{ED:487._FROM_JOHN_OSBERN_1452,_14_MAY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_OSBERN:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
LETTER:PASTON_279:M4:1452:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
<font> To my right reuerent and worchepful Maister John Paston in the
Iner In of the Temple be this delyuered in hast . </font>
PASTON,II,80.279.8044

AUTHOR:JOHN_OSBERN:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
LETTER:PASTON_279:M4:1452:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Please it your maisterchep to wete that John Reynere and Nicholaus
Strecok of Sparham have gete a respyte of Nicholaus Byschop for the
distresse that the seid Byschop had take , as ye knowe wel , tyl seche
tyme as ye may speke wyth Symond Blake for the trought of the mater .
PASTON,II,80.279.8045

AUTHOR:JOHN_OSBERN:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
LETTER:PASTON_279:M4:1452:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Not wythstandyng this respite myght never be gete tyll that Byschop had
a reward of mony ; PASTON,II,80.279.8046

AUTHOR:JOHN_OSBERN:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
LETTER:PASTON_279:M4:1452:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
it is told me he toke viij d. for hese reward . PASTON,II,80.279.8047

AUTHOR:JOHN_OSBERN:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:31
LETTER:PASTON_279:M4:1452:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
The dryvers ought of the catell fro Sparham ground to Lyng grownd wasse
Hugo Sadde of Baldeswelle , Byschoppis man , Nicholaus Gatesend ,
Roberd Joye , Jacobus Baxter of Lyng . PASTON,II,80.279.8048

AUTHOR:JOHN_OSBERN:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_

owre , PASTON,II,80.279.8050

was ther whanne Briggeman was ded , and that this Briggeman owith yow
moche good at this tyme . PASTON,II,82.280.8084

PASTON,II,84.281.8099

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_281:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
And it is so , as ye know wele your-self , we haf and long tyme haf had
the seruice of Thomas Denyes , by contynuaunce wherof we wend to haf
had his attendaunce at oure lust . PASTON,II,84.281.8100

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_281:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
And neuer thelesse we haf so streitly $examynid his demenyng that we
fele and pleynly conceyve that the love and effeccion which he hath to
a gentilwoman not ferre from yow , and which ye be prevy to as we
suppose , causith hym alwey to desire toward your cuntre` rather than
toward suych ocupacion as is behovefull to vs . PASTON,II,84.281.8101

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_281:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
We write therfore to yow , prayng you hertly as ye love vs that it like
you to do that labour at our instaunce , be suych $mene as your wisdam
can seme , to meve that gentilwoman in our behalf for the wele of this
mater , vndirtakyng for vs that we wole shew our bounte` to thaym bothe
if it plese hir that this mater take effect , so that be reason she
shall haf cause to take it in gree . PASTON,II,84.281.8102

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_281:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
And if the comyng thider of our persone self shuld be to plesir of hir
, we wole not leve our labour in that ; wherfore we pray you that ye
wole do your part heryn as ye wole we do for yow in tyme comyng , and
that ye se vs in hast . PASTON,II,84.281.8103

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_281:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
The Holy Trinite` kepe yow . PASTON,II,84.281.8104

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_281:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
Wretyn at Weuenho the xvij day of May . PASTON,II,84.281.8105

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_

{ED:491._FROM_THOMAS_DENYS_1454,_20_MARCH;_CONCLUSION_LATER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_282:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To my right wurshipfull Maister John Paston . </font>
PASTON,II,85.282.8108

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_282:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Right wurshipfull and myn especiall good maister , I recomaund me to
you with all seruice and prayer to my power . PASTON,II,85.282.8109

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_282:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And like it you to wete that how be a ful straunge acte is passid agayn
me in the Higher Hous before the lordis , wherof I send you a copie ,
neuerthelesse I hope to God that it shal not passe in the Comoun Hous ;
PASTON,II,85.282.8110

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_282:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
but me is be-falle the most sorwfull infortune that euer pouer man had
, standyng in suych case as I do , PASTON,II,85.282.8111

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_282:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for my lordis the Cardenale and of Oxenford haf imprisoned my wif in
the countour , PASTON,II,85.282.8112

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_282:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and how thei shal guyde hir forth God knowith . Which standith to nygh
myn hert , if Goddis wille were , PASTON,II,85.282.8113

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_282:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
but wele I know that by thes vengeable malices don to hir and me thei
wole {ED:not} be content , PASTON,II,85.282.8114

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_282:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for Ingham lithe beside that to take awey my wyues doughter out of
Westminster to make an end of my wif if he can , and also to arest my
seruauntz , that I drede that she nor I shal haf no creature to attend
vs ne help vs ; PASTON,II,85.282.8115

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_282:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and suych malice haf I neuer herd of herbeforn . PASTON,II,85.282.8116

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_282:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And it is told me that beside that thei wole dispoil if ony good thei
can fynde of myn in Norwich or Norffolk , and imprisone my $seruauntz
there . Wherfore I lowly beseche your maistership for Our Lordis mercy
that ye vouchsauff to socour theym in this necessite` , and if ony
entree be made or shuld be made vpon myn $wifes place in Norwich that
ye vouchsauff to socour my seruauntz and do ther-jnne aftir your wisdam
, for Cristis love and seynt charite` . PASTON,II,85.282.8117

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_282:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Beside this a frend and $kynnesman of myn , oon Robert Clement of
Betele` , hath writen to me that he is arestid and like to be
imprisoned bi a writte of dette take agayn hym vpon an obligacion of c
li. in which he and I and other wer bounde to my lord of Oxenford xiiij
yeer agone , wherof <P_II,86> I haf many acquitaunces . Wherfore I pray
your good maistership to send to the shirreve that my seid kynnesman
may ben easid and no retourne made agayn hym , but that he may answer
the next tyme bi attourney ; PASTON,II,86.282.8118

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_282:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for truly that writte was take oute in the end of the terme aftir I was
arestid , and aftir it was aperid to . PASTON,II,86.282.8119

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_282:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
I pray your maistership for Goddis sake to be not displesid ne wery to
do for me in these maters of your charite` , PASTON,II,86.282.8120

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_282:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for I had leuer gif the said Robert suych good , litell if it be , as I
haf than he wer vndone for me or ony man ellis that euer ded for me ;
PASTON,II,86.282.8121

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_282:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA

hym harmles , and all other with Goddis mercy , euer prayng you of your
maistership and socour , for Goddis love , who euer kepe you for his
mercy . PASTON,II,86.282.8122

and socour to my seruauntz if such case falle . PASTON,II,88.283.8143

{ED:493._FROM_JOHN_CLOPTON_PERHAPS_ABOUT_1454;_IF_1454,_12_APRIL}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33?
LETTER:PASTON_284:M4:1454?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> Vn-to ryth reuerent ser and myn good mayster John Paston .
</font> PASTON,II,89.284.8151

AUTHOR:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33?
LETTER:PASTON_284:M4:1454?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Ryth wurthy and wurchypfull syr and myn ryth good maystyr , I
recomaunde me on-to you , thankyng you euermore of youre gret
jentylness and good maystyrhod shewyd on-to me at all tymys , and
specyally now , to myn herthys ease , qwyche on my part can nowt be
rewardyd , PASTON,II,89.284.8152

AUTHOR:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33?
LETTER:PASTON_284:M4:1454?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
but myn sympyll seruice is euyr redy at youre comaundement .
PASTON,II,89.284.8153

AUTHOR:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33?
LETTER:PASTON_284:M4:1454?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Ferthemore , as for +te matyr +tat ye wete of , I have laboryd so to
myn fadyr +tat youre entent as for +te joinitour xal be fulfellyd ;
PASTON,II,89.284.8154

AUTHOR:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33?
LETTER:PASTON_284:M4:1454?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and syr I besheche you , sethyn +tat I do myn part to fullefelle youre
wyll , +tat ye wolle shew me youre good maystyrhod in here chambyr , as
myn full trust js , jn so moche +tat jt xall nowth hurthe you nor non
of youris , and +te profite there-of xal be on-to +te avayle of myn
maystress youre suster and to me , and to non odyr creature .
PASTON,II,89.284.8155

AUTHOR:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33?
LETTER:PASTON_284:M4:1454?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And also myn maystress youre modyr xall nouth be charchyd wyth here
bourd aftyr +te day of +te mariage , but I to discharge here of here
persone , PASTON,II,89.284.8156

AUTHOR:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33?
LETTER:PASTON_284:M4:1454?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and to ease me +tat hat here chambyr may be non contradiccion .
PASTON,II,89.284.8157

AUTHOR:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33?
LETTER:PASTON_284:M4:1454?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And syr , I am redy and alwey wolle to parforme +tat I have seyd onto
you , &c . PASTON,II,89.284.8158

<P_II,90>

AUTHOR:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33?
LETTER:PASTON_284:M4:1454?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Ferthemore , lykyd you to wete I was a Thursday last passyd at
Cavendyche to delyvere an astate to Wentworth in +te londe +tat was myn
brothyr Cavendyche , as I tolde you wan I was last wyth you ,
PASTON,II,90.284.8159

AUTHOR:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_?

LETTER:PASTON_285:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and for the bounte' that ye shew to me in this troble I haf no spirite
to thank you as I shuld . PASTON,II,90.285.8175

parissh , my wif tellith me that she lefft thaym in a chest at Ovyes
shette ; PASTON,II,90.285.8176

wherto I beseche your maistership that ye wole se for the sauf and
secreet kepyng therof . PASTON,II,90.285.8178

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
