but as sone as I may know I shal write to you . Wherfore , <P_II,91>
sith it is thus , I beseche your maistership disdeigne not , but for
Our Lordes love ye vouchsauf to take it to you or to se that it be sauf
, if it plese you . And that ye wole send for John Maile ,
PASTON,II,91.285.8183

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_285:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for I conceyve hym right feithfull to me , PASTON,II,91.285.8184

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_285:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and I am enfourmed that he is gretly manasid for me ; and that ye
vouchsauf to do put hym in comfort that I lese not his good wille , and
that ye shew hym your good maistership and fauour that he be holpen and
not hurt for me . PASTON,II,91.285.8185

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_285:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Ferthermore , I wrote to you for such smal thynges as I had leid to
plegge to you for such good as that I borwid of you . Wheryn I beseche
your maistership that if my frendes pay you accordyng to my writyng ,
that ye than vouchsaf to do the said plegges be sent hider to me by
such conduyte as your wisdam like to avise , and that they myght be
here by iiij=to= die of the xv=cim= of Ester , PASTON,II,91.285.8186

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_285:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for than is my grettest jouparte` touchyng myn jmprisonement ;
PASTON,II,91.285.8187

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_285:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for sith myn enmyes coude not avail to send me to the castel of Bristow
, which was their purpose whan thei vndirstood the disposicion of the
Comoun Hous agayn their billes , euer sith they make a prevy labour to
haf me remevid , PASTON,II,91.285.8188

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_

Kynges Benche and abide ther , or remittid hider agayn .
PASTON,II,91.285.8189

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_285:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Neuerthelesse , jf I haf releve of such pouer godes as shuld be myn by
resoun , than I hope to do better and sumwhat to aquyte , wherby I hope
to put my frendes in gretter corage to do for me .
PASTON,II,91.285.8190

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_285:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And if I haf no releve than can I nomore , but all refere to God as I
do daily . Wherfore , if ye be not paied I pray you to councell my said
frendes to send me such mony as thei may gete of myn agayn that day ,
euer your maistership and wisdam seyng to the conduyte therof .
PASTON,II,91.285.8191

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_285:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
More-ouer I doute lest that Richard Davy of his vntrouth enfourme myn
enmys wher such pouer thyng as I haf is , to that jntent that thei may
riffel and dispoil all ; wherof if such case hapne I can no ferther ,
PASTON,II,91.285.8192

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33

town of Pagraue , for what cause I knowe not , wherfor I pray you +tat
+ge wyll make deliuerance ageyn of the said bestes ;
PASTON,II,92.286.8202

{ED:496._FROM_WILLIAM_WORCESTER_1454,_8_JUNE}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:39?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_287:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To my Maister Paston . </font> PASTON,II,92.287.8213

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:39?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_287:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Worshypfull ser and my gode maister , after dewe recommendacion wyth
alle my trew seruyce precedyng lyke you wete that when it fortune that
William Cole wolle or desyre comyn and hafe your gode avice yn the
mater ye wote off that ye wolle hald your hand well yn the seyd mater .
PASTON,II,92.287.8214

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:39?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_287:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
As to nouuelteez , &c. , the Prince shall be create at Wyndesouere
vppon <P_II,93> Pentecost Sonday , the Chaunceller , the Duc of
Bokyngham , and manye othyrs lordes off astate present wyth the Quene .
PASTON,II,93.287.8215

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33

thedre for execucion of justice vpon such as hafe offended yn cause

jnnocent and ryght clere yn that mater , as it ys well knowen .

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33

and he seyth , by hys seruauntes rapport , that he wolle not discharge
the godes of the marchauntes of thys land but so be that justice be don
vppon the Lord Bonevile , or ell that he be sent to hym to do justice
hym-sylf as he hath deserued , or satisfaccion be made to the value .

{ED:500._FROM_ELISABETH_CLERE_PROBABLY_BEFORE_1460,_25_MAY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_CLERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_289:M4:1450S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
<font> To my worchepful cosyn John Paston be +tis lettre delyuered in
hast . </font> PASTON,II,96.289.8251

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_CLERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_289:M4:1450S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Trusty and weelbelovyd cosyn , I comaunde me to yow .
PASTON,II,96.289.8252

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_CLERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_289:M4:1450S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Liketh it yow to wete +tat +ter hath be purchased of many sundry men of
old tyme a certeyn <P_II,97> pasture and whynground conteynyng be
estimacion an C=a= acres called N , lying in +te towne of N and longyng
to +te manere of +te same towne , except +tat certeyn persones have
withinne +te same pasture iiij acres in sundry smale parcelles +te
wheche arn ny almost ouer growe with whynnes at +tis daye , not
withstondyng +tei have for euery half acre a netes pasture goyng at
large al somere in +te seid pasture , payand for +te heerdyng of a best
iiij d . PASTON,II,97.289.8253

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_CLERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_289:M4:1450S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And in +te same pasture I do pasture my bestys and certeyn bestys +tat
I have take to takke and come not in +te comoun pasture of +te seid
towne for gret ese of my tenauntes . PASTON,II,97.289.8254

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_CLERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_289:M4:1450S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And now +tei seyn +tat it hath be vsed of old tyme +tat +te comoun
heerde of +te seide towne schuld bryng into +te seid pasture his
beestys on Lammesse Day to pasturen , PASTON,II,97.289.8255

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_CLERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_289:M4:1450S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and summe men seyn +tat he schuld pasturen +tere onys in a moneth after
+tat day , PASTON,II,97.289.8256

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_CLERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_289:M4:1450S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and summe seyn onys in a fourtnyght , PASTON,II,97.289.8257

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_CLERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_289:M4:1450S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and summe seyn onys in a weke , PASTON,II,97.289.8258

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_CLERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_289:M4:1450S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and summe seyn twyes or thries in a weke , PASTON,II,97.289.8259

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_CLERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_289:M4:1450S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and summe seyn as oftyn as +te heerde will ; so +tat be +tis mene aftyr
Lammesse I must put a-wey my takke and may not kepe +tere myn owen
bestys but if I schuld lese hem for defawt of mete ,
PASTON,II,97.289.8260

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_CLERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_289:M4:1450S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
for +te comoun bestys schulde ouer charge +te seide pasture .
PASTON,II,97.289.8261

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_CLERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_289:M4:1450S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And fro +tat tyme tyl Candelmesse thei seyn +tat +tei wil kepe +teron
here schepe . Wherfore I prey yow , cosyn , if ye vowche safe +tat +tis
matere may be comounde of among lerned men , +tat I may be in very
certeynte` how I may best be rewled in +tis mateer whan +tat ye come
hoom , PASTON,II,97.289.8262

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_CLERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_289:M4:1450S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
for as I am enfoormed thei will sette +teron al holly to-gederys to
kepe +tat comoun fro Lammesse Day forth now next folwyng .
PASTON,II,97.289.8263

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_CLERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_

. PASTON,II,97.289.8264

{ED:501._ELIZABETH_DE_VERE,_COUNTESS_OF_OXFORD_NOT_AFTER_1454,_7_A
UGUST}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_DE_VERE:FEMALE:_:1410?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_290:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
<font> Right trusty and welbeloued Jon Paston , esquier . </font>
PASTON,II,98.290.8269

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_DE_VERE:FEMALE:_:1410?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_290:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
Right trusty and intierly welbelouyd , I grete you wele , prayng you as
I specially trust you that ye wole be good frend to James Arblaster in
his mater touchyng the maner of Smalbergh , as I wote wele ye haf euer
be to hym ryght especiall frend ; PASTON,II,98.290.8270

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_DE_VERE:FEMALE:_:1410?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_290:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
and thogh it so be that the sayd James had gret trobles , losses , and
aduersite` herbeforn , neuerthelesse he shall not be so bare of frendys
ner goodys but that I wole se hym holpyn , with the mercy of God . In
performmyng wher-of the berer of this shal enfourme you of myn jnten
{ED:t} and disposicion more largely than I wole put in wrytyng .
PASTON,II,98.290.8271

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_DE_VERE:FEMALE:_:1410?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_290:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
And the Trinite` haue you in hys kepyng . PASTON,II,98.290.8272

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_DE_VERE:FEMALE:_:1410?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_290:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
Wretyn at Wefnow the vij day of August . PASTON,II,98.290.8273

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_DE_VERE:FEMALE:_:1410?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_290:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
Elizabeth Ver , Countes of Oxenford PASTON,II,98.290.8274

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_292:M4:1460S:COPY:OTHER
Right entierly welbeloued , I grete yow well , thankyng yow of the gret
jentylnesse that ye haue shewed vn-to my right welbeloued James
Arblaster , prayng yow of contynuaunse ; PASTON,II,99.292.8287

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_292:M4:1460S:COPY:OTHER
and if ther be any thyng that I may doo for yow or any of yowres , here
or in any othere place , I pray yow let me wete PASTON,II,99.292.8288

LETTER:PASTON_292:M4:1460S:COPY:OTHER
and I shall be redy to do it , with the grace of God , ho haue yow in
his kepyng . PASTON,II,99.292.8289

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_292:M4:1460S:COPY:OTHER
And I pray yow to be frendly vn-to my right welbeloued Agneys Arblaster
, wich is to me gret plesiere and hertes ease and ye so be .
PASTON,II,99.292.8290

<P_II,100>

AUTHOR:RICHARD_OF_YORK:MALE:_:1411:43
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_293:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
The Duc of York PASTON,II,100.293.8295

AUTHOR:RICHARD_OF_YORK:MALE:_:1411:43
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_293:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Right trusty and welbeloued , we grete yow hertily wel .
PASTON,II,100.293.8296

AUTHOR:RICHARD_OF_YORK:MALE:_:1411:43
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_293:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And of your beniuolence , aide , and tendre loue by yow , at
th'instance and at +te reuerence of vs , to our right trusty and
welbeloued in God the Priour and Comuent of the hows of Our Lady of
Walsingham , of our patronage , in suche materes as they had adoo for
certain lyvelood by thaim claymed to belonge vnto +te said hows ,
fauorably and tendrely shewd , as hertily as we can we thank yow
PASTON,II,100.293.8297

AUTHOR:RICHARD_OF_YORK:MALE:_:1411:43
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_293:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and desire and pray yow of your good continuance ; and as fer as right
lawe and good conscience wol to haue in fauorable recommendacion suche
personnes as been or shal bee committed to take possession and saisine
, in the name and to +te vse of our ful worshipful nepueu th'Erl of
Warrewic , in and of +te manoirs and lordeships of $Boulles and
Walcotes , with +t'appertenances , in Litel Snoring in +te countee of
Norffolk , as our grete trust is vnto yow . PASTON,II,100.293.8298

AUTHOR:RICHARD_OF_YORK:MALE:_:1411:43
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_293:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And God haue yow in his keping . PASTON,II,100.293.8299

Yeven vndre our signet at our Castel of Sandhall +te xix=e= day of
August . PASTON,II,100.293.8300

AUTHOR:RICHARD_NEVILLE:MALE:_:1428:26
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_294:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Worshipfull and my ryght trusty and welbeloued frende , I grete you
well . PASTON,II,100.294.8302

AUTHOR:RICHARD_NEVILLE:MALE:_:1428:26
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_294:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And for asmuch as I haue purchased of the worshipfull and my welbeloued
frende Priour of Walsyngham ij maners in Lityl Snoryng , with
th'appertenantz , in the counte` of Norffolk , which maners be cleped
Bowles and Walcotes , I desir and hertily praye yow that ye woll shewe
to me and my feoffe`z in my name your good will and fauour so that I
may by your frendship the more peasably reioy my forsaid purchase .
PASTON,II,100.294.8303

AUTHOR:RICHARD_NEVILLE:MALE:_:1428:26
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_294:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And more ouer I praye you to yeve credens in this mater to my
welbeloued <P_II,101> chapellayn Ser John Suthwell , berer of thes my
letter , and in the same mater to be my feithfull frende as my gret
trust is in you ; wherin ye shall do to me a singuler pleaser and cause
me to bee to yow right good lord , which sumtyme shall be to you
available by the grace of God , who preserve you and sende you welfare
. PASTON,II,101.294.8304

AUTHOR:RICHARD_NEVILLE:MALE:_:1428:26
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33

Aftyr dewe recomendacion wyth my simple seruice precedyng , please your
maistershyp to wete that as to such remembraunce that ye desyre me to
contynew forth to the vttermost , I shall wyth gode wille , so as my
maister wille licence me , as oft as I can , th'officer to hafe leyser
to be wyth me , PASTON,II,101.295.8309

<P_II,103>

{ED:508._FROM_JOHN_RUSSE_1454,_OCTOBER-NOVEMBER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_297:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Please youre maistirship to wete forasmych as the wryt directid to the
exchetour cam not tyl in the Vigil of Symond and Jude at viij of the
clocke at euyn , whyche coude in no wyse profit us that day ,
notwithstondyng we had a yeman of my lordys chambre and were at Cowhaw
, hauyng Bertylmev Elys wyth vs , and there was Long Bernard sytting to
<P_II,104> kepe a court . PASTON,II,104.297.8343

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_297:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And we at the firste Noy come in the court , PASTON,II,104.297.8344

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_297:M4:1454:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and Bertylmev hauyng this termys to Bernard , seying , ' Ser ,
forasmyche as the Kyng hathe grauntyd be hese letteres patentys the
wardship wyth the profitys of the londys of T. Fastolf duryng hese
noun-age to you and T. H. , wherfor I am comyn as ther styward be ther
comandement upon there pocession to kep court and lete , whiche is of
old custum vsyd upon thys day ; wherfor I charge you be the vertu
here-of to seas and kepe nouthir court nor lete ,
PASTON,II,104.297.8345

<P_II,104>

{ED:509._FROM_SIR_JOHN_FASTOLF_1454,_11_NOVEMBER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:76?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_298:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To the worshypfull and my ryght welbelovyd cosyn John Paston .
</font> PASTON,II,104.298.8366

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:76?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_298:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Worshypfull and ryght welbelovyd cosyn , I comaund me to yow .
PASTON,II,104.298.8367

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:76?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_298:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Lyke yow to wete that y have resseyved a lettre at thys tyme from John
Bokkyng wyth a copy of the patent concernyng the wardeshyp that ye wote
off , <P_II,105> by whych y vnderstand that ye have both wrought and
holpen by your grete wysdom to bryng thys matier aboute , whych y
desyred your frendshyp and gode avice for the seurtee of the seyd
waarde ; and for expedicion of whych y thank you ry+gt hertlye and pray
you to contynew foorth your gode labours in the same yn such wyse as it
may be made sure yn all wyse , they it cost me the more of my gode .
PASTON,II,105.298.8368

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:76?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_298:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And where as it ys remembred me by the seyd lettres that y shuld labour
to ghete the seyd ward yn-to my gouuernaunce , truely y can not see how
y coude do it to be doon , PASTON,II,105.298.8369

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:76?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_298:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for y have none acqueyntaunce in that contree that y coude trust too ,
wythoute the shyreve myght be my tender frende in thys cause , or othyr
such as ye thynk best . Wherfor y pray you hertlye to take thys mater
tenderly to hert , and that ye lyke seke a moyen of such frendys as ye
can best avyse and may verrayly trust vppon to gyde thys mater yn such
wyse as myne entent myght be sped for the possession of it ;
PASTON,II,105.298.8370

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:76?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_298:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for now that y have go so ferre yn the matier y wold not it faylled for
no gode but it preved well and toke to a gode conclusion .
PASTON,II,105.298.8371

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:76?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_298:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And where as y have vnderstand late by certeyn well-willers to you
warde whych have meoved me that yn case the seyd warde myght be had ,
that ye desyre an alliaunce shulde take atwyx a doughter of yourys and
the seyd waard , of whych mocion y was ryght glad to hyre off and wylle
be ryght well-wyllyng and helpyng that your blode and myne myght
increse yn alliaunce . PASTON,II,105.298.8372

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:76?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_298:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And yff it please yow that by your wysdom and gode conduyt that ye
wolde help beere owte thys mater substaunciallie ayenst my partie
contrarie and eville willers that y myght have myne entent , I ensure
you ye and y shuld appoynt and accorde yn such wyse as ye shuld hald
you ryght well plesed both-2 for the encresyng of your lynage and also
of myne . PASTON,II,105.298.8373

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:76?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_298:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And y pray you be ware whom ye make of your counsaille and myne yn thys
mater , and that it may be well bore owte or ye com thens and yn a sure
wey . PASTON,II,105.298.8374

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:76?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_298:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And yff y had knowe rathyr of your entent it shuld hafe cost me more of
my gode before thys , to hafe com to a gode conclusion , whych y
promysse yhyt shall bee , and the mater take , by the fayth of my bodye
. PASTON,II,105.298.8375

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:76?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_298:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Worshypfull and ryght welbelovyd cosyn , y pray God spede you yn thys
matier and sende you your gode desyrs . PASTON,II,105.298.8376

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:76?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_298:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Wreten at Castre the xj day of Nouember A=o= xxxiij=o= R. H. vj .
PASTON,II,105.298.8377

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:76?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_298:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Your cosyn John Fastolf PASTON,II,105.298.8378

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:76?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_298:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Item , cosyn , I pray yow when ye see tyme that my lord of Caunterbury
and my Lord Cromewell may be spoke wyth PASTON,II,105.298.8379

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:76?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_298:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for the godes of my Lord Bedford beyng yn dyuers men handz be compelled
to be brought ynne , as ye shall see more along of thys mater wyth the
wrytyngys that y have made mencion and left wyth John Bokkyng and
William Barkere . PASTON,II,105.298.8380

in haste . </font> PASTON,II,106.299.8381

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_299:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Wurshepfull and reuerent ser and my good maistyr , I recomavnd me to
+gow in as delygent wyse as {in}_P on my part aperteineth .
PASTON,II,106.299.8382

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_299:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And please yow to wete that my maistyr was right well pleasyd wyth
youre feithefull labour in fulfellyng the patent for the warrd of A. B.
C. , PASTON,II,106.299.8383

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_299:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and he wyll feithefully labour as ye haue avysed hym be wryting of John
Bookyng . PASTON,II,106.299.8384

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_299:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And putte my maistyr in more corage I meovyd to hym vpon myn hed that
encas {TEXT:be} the child were wyse that thanne it were a good maryage
be-twen my wyff youre doutir and hym ; PASTON,II,106.299.8385

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_299:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and , ser , my maistyr was glad when he herd that moyan , consetheryng
that youre doutyr is desendyd of hym be the modyr syde .
PASTON,II,106.299.8386

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_299:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And , ser , I haue enqweryd aftyr the seyd child ,
PASTON,II,106.299.8387

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_299:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and no dout of but he is lykly and of gret wyt , as I here be report of
sondre` personez . PASTON,II,106.299.8388

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_299:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And it is so , as I am credebly enformyd , that Jeffrey Boleyn maketh
gret labour for maryage of the seyd child to on of hese douterez .
PASTON,II,106.299.8389

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_299:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
I wold well to hym , but bettyr to yow . Wherfor that ye delygently
labour for expedecyon of this matere , that encas ye can fynde ony
moyan there to haue the seyd child , and we shal do feithefully oure
delygens in lyke wyse here , as ye avyse vs , &c .
PASTON,II,106.299.8390

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_299:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And , ser , as ye thynke wyth auyse of my Maistyr Yeleverton , Jenney ,
and otherez my maisterez counsell there , that the shereff may haue a
reward , and yef my seyd maisterez counsell thynke it be to don , that
thanne ye lyke to take an accyoun vpon an enteynt , wheche ye mvst wyth
them take vpon yow at this tyme in my maisterez absence ;
PASTON,II,106.299.8391

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_299:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for as ye do jn that matere he woll hold hym content ,
PASTON,II,106.299.8392

fore Wyllyam Barkere hathe an jnstruccyon of my maysterez jntent vpon

{ED:511._FROM_THOMAS_HOWES_1454,_18_NOVEMBER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_300:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
<font> To the wurshepfull and reuerent ser , my good maystir John
Paston , in all goodly haste . </font> PASTON,II,107.300.8398

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_300:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
Reuerent and wurshepfull ser and my good maistyr , I recomavnd me to
yow in as louly wyse as {in}_P on my part aperteineth .
PASTON,II,107.300.8399

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_300:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
And please yow to wete that my maistyr is fully purposed to sewe
ateynte , whereupon he wryteth a lettere directyd to yow and otherez ,
for the wheche I beseke yow to be my good maystyr in pursewyng the seyd
ateynte . PASTON,II,107.300.8400

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_300:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
And also my maistyr is agreed what reward ye geve the shereff he
holdeth hym content ; wherfor that youre reward may be the largere so
he woll there-vpon returne the panell for the seyd ateynte .
PASTON,II,107.300.8401

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_300:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
And thanne yef Jenney wold meove my lord of Norffolke that he wold be
my good lord , amyttyng me for hese chapeleyn , and Jhankyn Porter for
hese seruaunt , wheche is in hese chek roll , it shuld cause the matere
to haue the redyer expedecyon as well be the shereff as be the gret
jury . PASTON,II,107.300.8402

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_300:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
And yef the processe may haue so redy sped that it myght be had be-fore
my Maystyr Yelwerton in this vaccacyon tyme , it were a gret covnfort ,
&c . PASTON,II,107.300.8403

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33
LETTER:PASTON_300:M4:1454:COPY:OTHER
Beseking yow at the reuerence of God , and as euer my powere servyse
may be at youre comaundement , that ye effectualy laboure this matere
in the most spedfull wyse , as youre descrecyon , wyth Jenneyez avyse ,
thinketh most expedyent ; PASTON,II,107.300.8404

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:33

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

<font> To my right trusty and welbeloued cosyns Henre` Fylongley and
John Paston . </font> PASTON,II,109.301.8415

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:77?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_301:M4:1455:COPY:OTHER
Right trusty and welbeloued cosyns , I recomaunde me to yow .
PASTON,II,109.301.8416

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:77?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_301:M4:1455:COPY:OTHER
And please yow to wite that for as moche as I muste paie this terme in
the Kynges Eschequier for the patente concernyng the warde of Thomas
Fastolf xl li. as parte of payment of iiij=xx= li. or shal bere a grete
losse therby , and also othir grete paymentes must make there mountyng
cc li. or more , as ye knowe weel , and bicause I truste vpon redy
payment of my lord of Caunterbury , whose day of payment is longe
passid , I wole pray yow to speke with my seid lord recomaundyng me in
all humble wise to his good grace ; and that it may please his good
lordship to considre my grete chargis and costys that I bere in the
lawe for the seid warde as othirwise , and that I myght haue the rather
redy payment of my duete` soo as I may stande dischargid of the grete
processe that I and my frendis haue for me in the seid Eschequer as in
othir courtes in my causes , PASTON,II,109.301.8417

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:77?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_301:M4:1455:COPY:OTHER
for he is on of the lordis erthely that I moste triste vpon , trustyng
verily he wil tendre me the more consideryng the grete damage that I
bere for lakke of payment of the grete good the Kyng oweth me , and
othir diuerse lordis , to my grete discomforte and hevynesse , God
knowith , who for his mercy haue yow in gouernance .
PASTON,II,109.301.8418

you , thankyng youre good maystyrshep for youre good remembraunce for
the cherche of Stokysby ; wherupon I haue desyred my trusty frend
Wylliam Wurcestre to come be the Abot homward , besekyng you to
auertyse hym youre good avyse how he may be-haue hym best in this
matere to the seyd Abot , &c . PASTON,II,111.303.8438

Thursday next comyng , forasmyche as Maistyr Yelvyrton and Jenney
$shall $be {TEXT:shalbe} here , ye shuld do my maistir ryght gret

And lyke yow to wete +tat at this tyme I sende to yow myn welbeloved
frende and seruaunt Ser Thomas Howys , to have youre good councell and
advyse how and in what wyse he may best be demened there at this tyme
in his yeldyng to the sheref vpon his exigend , wheche is and $shall
$be {TEXT:shalbe} v tymes called as on Monday next comyng , as I
vnderstande ; and the same by good and discrete advyse concluded and
sette in a good weye by sewerte`s founde to appere at London the day of
the retorn of the wrytte PASTON,II,112.304.8449

LETTER:PASTON_304:M4:1455:COPY:OTHER
or otherwyse , that thenne if ye thenke hit be to don ye lyke to take
vpon yow to comon wyth myn lord of Norwyche recomaundyng me to hys good
and tender lordship and declaryng to hym how and in what wyse the seyd
Ser Thomas was demened in the oyer and determyner , and sethe how he
hath wrongously and wythought cause be vexed by John Andrews and other
and greetly

trowbled , whervpon this atteynt now is grownded , in suche wyse as ye
thenk best {in}_P to be don ; PASTON,II,112.304.8451

fauoure to any persone or persones on myn contrarye partye for any
synystre informacion geven other wyse than the trought in the mater
shal require , as he shal weel vnderstande by youre good reporte ,

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:34

I feele weele by hym that he is nought weele plesed wyth the swte ,
notwythstandyng that I haue enformed hym like as your maistreship
comaunded me to doo as weele as I gowde , &c . PASTON,II,113.305.8464

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_305:M4:1455:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
I schall take no distresse there vnto the tyme that I haue answere from
you wherther I shall do it or nought ; wherfore that it like you to
sende worde wether that I shall distreyne or nought .
PASTON,II,113.305.8465

{ED:523._FROM_SIR_JOHN_FASTOLF_1455,_28_MAY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:77?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_306:M4:1455:COPY:OTHER
<font> To my ryght welbelovyd cosyn John Paston . </font>
PASTON,II,116.306.8479

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:77?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_306:M4:1455:COPY:OTHER
Worshypfull ser and ryght welbelovyd cosyn , I comaund me to yow , and
hertly thankyng yow for the grete labours that ye have take for the
spedyng of my causys at London thys terme passed .
PASTON,II,116.306.8480

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:77?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_306:M4:1455:COPY:OTHER
And lyke yow to wete that forasmoch y vnderstand the shyreve of
Norffolkys officers be at Norwych , and now late the wrytt of the
atteynt ys sent home by Wylliam Barker , <P_II,_117> whych wryt y sende
now ayen that by your gode avice ye may comyn wyth the shyreve or hys
officers whate ought be doon there-ynne , and such aunsuer and retorn
to be made as by your grete wysdom shall best be concydered .
PASTON,II,_ID

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:77?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_306:M4:1455:COPY:OTHER
And assone as ye goodly may y may see yow . PASTON,II,_ID

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:77?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_306:M4:1455:COPY:OTHER
Both William Barker and Geffrey Spyrlyng ben now at Norwych ,
PASTON,II,_ID

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:77?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_306:M4:1455:COPY:OTHER
and one of hem yff nede bee shall wayte vppon yow . PASTON,II,_ID

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:77?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_306:M4:1455:COPY:OTHER
Y pray God have yow yn hys kepyng . PASTON,II,_ID

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:77?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_306:M4:1455:COPY:OTHER
Wreten at Castre xxviij day of Maij . PASTON,II,_ID

Your cosyn John Fastolf PASTON,II,_ID

{ED:524._FROM_ELEANOR_DUCHESS_OF_NORFOLK_1455,_8_JUNE}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:ELEANOR_MOWBRAY:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_307:M4:1455:COPY:OTHER
<font> To oure right trusti and welbelouid John Paston , esquier .
</font> PASTON,II,117.307.8489

AUTHOR:ELEANOR_MOWBRAY:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_307:M4:1455:COPY:OTHER
The Duchesse of Norffolk PASTON,II,117.307.8490

AUTHOR:ELEANOR_MOWBRAY:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_307:M4:1455:COPY:OTHER
Right trusti and welbelouid , we grete you hertili weel .
PASTON,II,117.307.8491

AUTHOR:ELEANOR_MOWBRAY:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_307:M4:1455:COPY:OTHER
And for as muche as it is thought right necessarie for diuers causes
+tat my lord haue at this tyme in the parlement suche persones as longe
vnto him and be of his menyall seruauntz , wherin we conceyve your good
will and diligence shal be right expedient , we hertili desire and pray
you that at the contemplacion of thise oure lettres , as oure special
trust is in you , ye wil geve and applie your voice vnto oure right
welbelouid cosin and seruauntz John Howard and Sere Roger Chambirlayn
to be knyghtes of the shire , exorting alle suche othir as be youre
wisdam shal mow be behovefull to the good exployte and conclusion of
the same . PASTON,II,117.307.8492

AUTHOR:ELEANOR_MOWBRAY:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_307:M4:1455:COPY:OTHER
And in your faithful attendaunce and trewe devoyre in this partie ye
shal do vnto my lord and vs a singuler pleasir , and cause vs heraftir
to thanke you therfore as ye shal holde you right weel content and
agreid , with the grace of God , who haue you euere in his keping .
PASTON,II,117.307.8493

AUTHOR:ELEANOR_MOWBRAY:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_307:M4:1455:COPY:OTHER
Wreten in Framlyngham Castel the viij day of Jun .
PASTON,II,117.307.8494

{ED:529._FROM_WILLIAM_WORCESTER_1455,_7_JULY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:40?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_310:M4:1455:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
<font> To my Maister Paston . </font> PASTON,II,121.310.8532

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:40?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_310:M4:1455:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Please your gode maistershyp to wete that as yerstenday came lettres
from London that the parson most nedys vp to London to safe the next
amerciement ; PASTON,II,121.310.8533

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:40?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_310:M4:1455:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and so ys forth to appiere , yff he nedys most , xv=a= Johannis , as ye
shall see by Barkeres lettre , PASTON,II,121.310.8534

LETTER:PASTON_310:M4:1455:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER

after thys , and he ryde . PASTON,II,121.310.8538

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34

all tresons , and Ser W. Oldhale ys processe yn the Kynges Bynche
reuersed ; PASTON,II,121.310.8539

wolle confesse who caused hym to do it , so that he may have hys lyve ,

<P_II,124>

{ED:532._FROM_JAMES_GLOYS_PROBABLY_1455,_25_JULY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_311:M4:1455:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
<font> To the rightwurchepfull ser and my goode mayster , my Mayster
John Paston , be this deliuered . </font> PASTON,II,124.311.8548

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_311:M4:1455:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Reuerent and right wurchepfull ser and my gode mayster , I recomaund me
to you , prayng you to wete that there is reysed a slandrows noyse in
this countre` vp-vn my Mayster Yeluerton and you and my Mayster
Alyngton , which I suppose is do to bryng you ought of the conceyte of
the pepyll , PASTON,II,124.311.8549

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_311:M4:1455:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
for at this day ye stand gretly in the countreys conceyte .
PASTON,II,124.311.8550

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_311:M4:1455:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
It is seyde be Heydon and his disciples that my Mayster Yeluerton and
ye and my Mayster Alyngton shuld haue do oon Ser John Tartyssale ,
parson of the Estchirche of Warham and chapeleyn to the Priour of
Walsyngham , to put in to the parlement a bille of diuers tresons don
be my lord of Norwich , Ser Thomas Tudenham , and John Heydon , and ye
shuld haue set to your seales ; PASTON,II,124.311.8551

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_311:M4:1455:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
and if that Heydon had be vj howres fro the parlement lengere than he
was there had be graunted an oyere determynere to haue enquere` of hem
, &c . PASTON,II,124.311.8552

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_311:M4:1455:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
This was told yester-day in right wurchepfull audience and a-mong the
thrifties men of this countre` ; PASTON,II,124.311.8553

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_311:M4:1455:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
and thei seyd right shrewedly , PASTON,II,124.311.8554

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_311:M4:1455:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
for my lord of Norwich hath so flatered the lay pepill as he hath redyn
a-bought his visitacion that he hath there hertes . Wherefore and it
please you to lete me haue knowlech what ye wuld I shuld sey to it
where as I here any such langage , I wull do my parte and haue do
heder-toward as I haue thought in my conceytes best .
PASTON,II,124.311.8555

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_311:M4:1455:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
And if there be any othere seruyce that ye wull comaund me , I am and
<P_II,125> wull be redy at yowre comaundment , with the grace of God ,
how euer haue you in his blyssed kepyng . PASTON,II,125.311.8556

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_311:M4:1455:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Wretyn at Wighton in hast vn Sent James Day . PASTON,II,125.311.8557

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_311:M4:1455:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Be your seruaunte James Gloys PASTON,II,125.311.8558

<P_II,127>

{ED:535._WILLIAM_WORCESTER_TO_PASTON_BOKKYNG_1455,_13_NOVEMBER}_CO DE

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:40?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_313:M4:1455:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
<font> To the ryght worshypfull ser , John Paston , and to my brothyr
John Bokkyng . </font> PASTON,II,127.313.8613

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:40?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_313:M4:1455:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Please it yow to have yn knowlege that y veele well my maister takyth
gretely to hert the materes whych he hath wryt to you vppon the
execucion of my lord of Bedforde ys godes , and in especiall for the
recuueryng of <P_II,128> hem aswell of Ser Andreu O. executours as of
Ser Robert Whytyngham , &c. , to th'entent that it myght be opynly
knowe yn hys lyve-tyme that they be not yn hys gouuernaunce no part of
it , and that hys factours after hym shuld not be troubled ne charged
for it . PASTON,II,128.313.8614

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:40?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_313:M4:1455:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And seth the seyd mater ys of so grete wyght and charge , and that he
takyth it so gretely to hert , puttyng hys grettist trust yn yow to
remembre thys seyd mater by avyse of hys councell lerned both
spirituell as temporell , that ye wolle not delay it but wyth all your
entencion remembred there as ye by your wysdoms shall thynk it moste
expedient , that som fruyt may grow of it . PASTON,II,128.313.8615

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:40?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_313:M4:1455:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
There ys y-nowgh whereoff , and it myght be recuuered .
PASTON,II,128.313.8616

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:40?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_313:M4:1455:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
John Bokkyng , ye know ryght moch yn thys mater , and mooste of my
maister ys entent hereynne . PASTON,II,128.313.8617

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:40?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_313:M4:1455:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And therfor for myne acquytaille y wryte to you to shew the chieff
wrytynges of the copies of endentures of Ser Robert Whytyngham and of
othyr wrytynges concernyng that to Maister Paston , that he may be more
rypelyer grounded yn the seyd mater when he shall comyn wyth my lordes
of Caunterburye , Cromewell , and wyth onye of my maister councell .
PASTON,II,128.313.8618

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:40?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_313:M4:1455:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And Our Lord kepe you . PASTON,II,128.313.8619

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:40?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_313:M4:1455:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
My maister carpyth so oft on it dayly PASTON,II,128.313.8620

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:40?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_313:M4:1455:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and that meovyth me to wryte to yow both . PASTON,II,128.313.8621

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:40?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:34
LETTER:PASTON_313:M4:1455:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Att Castre xiij day of Nouembere . PASTON,II,128.313.8622

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:40?

<P_II,133>

{ED:540._FROM_WILLIAM_WORCESTER_1456,_27_JANUARY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:41?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_315:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To the worshypfull ser , John Paston , escuire . </font>
PASTON,II,133.315.8648

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:41?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_315:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Worshypfull ser , aftyr dew recommendacion please your gode maistershyp
to wete that where-as my maister wrytith to yow so homelye of so manye
<P_II,134> materes to yow of hys , to be remembred vnto hys councell
lerned by mene of yow and of hys frendz and seruauntz there , y pray
yow and requyre yow not to wyte it me that y am the causer of it that
my seyd maister noyeth yow wyth so manye materes ;
PASTON,II,134.315.8649

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:41?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_315:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for , be God , hym-sylf remembryth the moste part of hem , albe it the
particuler rehersell of tho materes be fressher yn my remembraunce then
yn hys . PASTON,II,134.315.8650

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:41?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_315:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And , ser , yn trouth he boldyth hym to wryte to yow for the grete lofe
and singuler affeccion he hath yn yow before all othyr yn hys causes
spedyng , and that ye wille moste tendyrlye of ony othyr remembre hys
seruauntes aswell as othyrs to whom belongyth to spede tho materes .
PASTON,II,134.315.8651

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:41?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_315:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
He desyryth my lord Chaunceller shuld wryte to hym speciallye yff he
most nedys com vpp , and a bille to be made yn-to Parlement for
recuuere of my Lord Bedford godes . PASTON,II,134.315.8652

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:41?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35

, and yn hys absence to John Bokkyng and William Barkere . </font>
PASTON,II,135.316.8673

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_316:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And lyke yow to wete that y have a taylle wyth my cosyn Fenne of v=c=
marc and more for to be chaunged vppon such places as a man myght have
moste spedye payment , PASTON,II,135.316.8675

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_316:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and y pray yow hertlye to comyn wyth the seyd Fenne that y myght be
ensured of the seyd taylle to be eschaunged , PASTON,II,135.316.8676

LETTER:PASTON_316:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA

agree it . PASTON,II,135.316.8677

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_316:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Item , y desyre to know who ben the remenant of the coexecutours of the
Lord Wyllughbye , now the Lord Cromewell ys decesed , for thys cause :
PASTON,II,135.316.8678

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_316:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
hyt was so that there was dew to the Lord Wyllughbye and to me x m=l=
marc for a reward to be payd of my Lord Bedford ys godes for the takyng
of the Duc of Allauncon , PASTON,II,135.316.8679

and the seyd Lord Wyllughbye had but one thowsand marc payd and I m=l=
marc , PASTON,II,135.316.8680

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35

so viij m=l= levyth yhyt to pay , of whych somme iiij m=l= most grow to
the executours of the seyd Lord Wyllughby to dispose .
PASTON,II,135.316.8681

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_316:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA

in the Lord Wyllughby goodes may be comyned wyth , that they make
purseute for payment of the seyd iiij m=l= marc for hys part to be had
, and y shall make for my part . PASTON,II,135.316.8682

power or intrest to resseyve the Lord Wyllughby ys debtes , then he to
be laboured vn-too ; PASTON,II,135.316.8683

{ED:545._FROM_DAME_ALICE_OGARD_1456,_30_MARCH}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:ALICE_OGARD:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_318:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To my right worshipfull cosyn John Paston , esquyer . </font>
PASTON,II,138.318.8706

AUTHOR:ALICE_OGARD:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_318:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Ryght worshypfull and enterly belouyd cosyn , I comaund me to yow
hertyly , latyng yow wete that there ys a contraversie mevyd be-twix my
cosyn John Radeclyff off Attylburgh and me for the aduoweson of the
chirch of Attylburgh , the whech ys now voide , wheroff the title is
myn veryly , as God knowith , the whech shall be oppenyd vnto yow .
PASTON,II,138.318.8707

AUTHOR:ALICE_OGARD:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_318:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And vpon Thursday next atte Wymondham there shall be take an enquerre`
de jure patronatus afore Master Robert Popy and Master Symond Thornham
, atte whech day I may nought be my-selff , as God knowyth , and thow I
myght yt were not convenyent . PASTON,II,138.318.8708

<P_II,139>

AUTHOR:ALICE_OGARD:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_318:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And therfore , ryght trusty cosyn , consideryng that I am a wedowe ,
jmpotent as of body , tendyrly and hertily I pray you yf yt lyke yow to
be there assistyng my councell in my right as reson and lawe wille vpon
Thursday next be viij of the clokke ; PASTON,II,139.318.8709

AUTHOR:ALICE_OGARD:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_318:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and Fyncham , Spelman , and othir of my councell shall be than there
waytyng vpon yow . PASTON,II,139.318.8710

AUTHOR:ALICE_OGARD:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_318:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And , jentyll cosyn , haue me excusid thowh I wryte thus brefly and
homly to yow , PASTON,II,139.318.8711

AUTHOR:ALICE_OGARD:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_318:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for in trouth I do it of a syngulere trust and affeccion the wheche I
haue in yow , consideryng the goode name and fame of trouth , wysdom ,
and goode conducte the which I here of you . PASTON,II,139.318.8712

AUTHOR:ALICE_OGARD:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_318:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And therfor , and ye may to youre well , I beseche you hertyly to be
there , PASTON,II,139.318.8713

AUTHOR:ALICE_OGARD:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_318:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and ye shall nought lese therby , with the grace of Almyghty Jesu , the
wheche euyr preserue and promote you , gentill cosyn , in moche worship
to youre hertys ease . PASTON,II,139.318.8714

AUTHOR:ALICE_OGARD:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_318:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Atte Bokenham Castell on Teuysday in Pache Weke , in hast .
PASTON,II,139.318.8715

AUTHOR:ALICE_OGARD:FEMALE:_:_:_

{ED:548._FROM_JOHN_BOKKYNG_1456,_8_MAY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_319:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
<font> To my worshipful Maist. John Paston , squier . </font>
PASTON,II,141.319.8717

AUTHOR:JOHN_BOKKYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_319:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Sire , please it your maistership to wyte that on Wednesday the v day
of Maij I receyved a lettre from you by the prestis man of Walsyngham ,
PASTON,II,141.319.8718

AUTHOR:JOHN_BOKKYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_319:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
and the Ascencion Day in the mornyng I receyved a lettre from yow bi
the handis of John Frays , myn maisteris man , jn whiche bothe moche
+tinge is conteyned whiche all at +tis tyme I may nought answere vn-to
myn comyng +te nexte weke . PASTON,II,141.319.8719

AUTHOR:JOHN_BOKKYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_319:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
And as to our atteynte , the Chief Justice hathe sithe +tis day
seuenyght kept +te Gildehalle in London with all +te lordis and juges
sauf on in eche place . PASTON,II,141.319.8720

After humble and due recommendacion , please it your gode maistership
to vnderstand that $at $te {TEXT:atte} makyng of this my pour letter
ther were no noueltees with us but suche as yee vnderstode full well
afor your departyng , except the Kyng woll in-to Scotland in all maner
wyse of werre , and that my lord of Welteshire $shall $be {TEXT:shalbe}
made Chaunceller . PASTON,II,144.321.8804

and therfore be ye auised howe ye delyuer theym as tidynges .

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35?
LETTER:PASTON_321:M4:1456?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Also I wotte full well where I lefte you in suche matiers as it
pleassed you to make me of your counsell as touchyng oon matier
specially , and howe that ye said vnto me whenne I desired your goode
maistership to shewe favour in suche as {in}_P ye best myght yf any
thing shuld be shewed ad lumen , my Maister F. except , and howe that
ye answered and said as it pleassed you , that I was conquered ,
PASTON,II,144.321.8807

{ED:551._FROM_JOHN_RUSSE_1456,_1_JUNE}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_322:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To my Maister Paston yn haaste . </font> PASTON,II,146.322.8836

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_322:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Please youre good maistirship to wete that my lord of Norffolke yaf in
comaundement to Cristofre and to the balif of Colneise to laboure with
us acording to youre mocion . PASTON,II,146.322.8837

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_322:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And as to Skilly , fermour of Cowhaugh , we enteryd there
PASTON,II,146.322.8838

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_322:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and seyd we wold haue payment for the half yeer past and sewyrte` for
the half yeer comyng , or ellys we wold distreyne and put hym out of
pocesseon and put in a newe fermoure ; PASTON,II,146.322.8839

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_322:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and so oure demenyng was suche that we toke no distresse
PASTON,II,146.322.8840

But he spak with Wentworth sethyn , whiche yaf hym an vttyr rebuke , as
he swore to me , and seyd he wold haue hys payment of Skylly and sewe
hise oblygacion this next terme whiche he is bounden in to Wentworth
for the yeerly payment of the same ferme . PASTON,II,146.322.8846

Houses , we haue hym bonde in lyke wyse for the ferme of the seyd maner
from Michilmesse last past tyl Mychelmesse next comyng , jn an
oblygacion of x mark payabil at Michilmesse next comyng , without ony
condecyon ; PASTON,II,147.322.8866

{ED:552._FROM_JOHN_BOKKYNG_1456,_7_JUNE}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_BOKKYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_323:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
<font> To my right good maister John Paston , squier , at Norwiche in
haste . </font> PASTON,II,147.323.8883

<P_II,148>

AUTHOR:JOHN_BOKKYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_323:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Sir , please it your maistership to wyte I haue myn attachement
grauntid in open courte with helpe of Litelton and Hewe at Fen , and
was biden to make redy the names and to come to make an othe +tis same
day , at whiche tyme +te barons comond to-guydre and wolde nought
suffre me to make it , but +tat +te patente`s nedis must ;
PASTON,II,148.323.8884

AUTHOR:JOHN_BOKKYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_323:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
and I askid if on of +tem allone myght doo it , PASTON,II,148.323.8885

and Haltoft seid yea . Wherupon ye must come hider
PASTON,II,148.323.8886

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35

and soo Litelton avisith . PASTON,II,148.323.8887

Neuer+teles we be purposid to take owte a venire facias , wher-jnne we
shal alway haue distressis , and if +tei were retorned nil a capias ,
and we may haue , as Myldenhale seith , an latitat whider we wole .
PASTON,II,148.323.8888

+tis day of +te grete Counsail . PASTON,II,148.323.8906

{ED:553._FROM_SIR_JOHN_FASTOLF_PROBABLY_1456,_18_JUNE}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_324:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To the worshipfull and myn weelbeloved cosyn John Paston ,
squier . </font> PASTON,II,149.324.8926

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_324:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Worshypfull cosyn , I recomaunde me to yow . PASTON,II,149.324.8927

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_324:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And as for suche aduertysementes as ye sent to me by William Barker to
have myn advyse inne , ye know how that I have putte myn trust in yow
bothe for myn sowle helthe and also for the pursewt and diffence of
alle werdly maters towchyng myn person , prayng yow hertly to don in
youre aduertysementes and alle other maters as ye , by th'advyse of myn
lerned councell whan ye ben to-geders , shal advyse for myn weel ,
worship , and profyte . PASTON,II,149.324.8928

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_324:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
For ye knowe weel I am so vysyted by the hande of God that I may not
dele with suche trowblews maters with-ought hit shuld be to greet hurt
to my bodyly weelfare , wheche I trust ye wole not desyre , &c .
PASTON,II,149.324.8929

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_324:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And , cosyn , if ye may vnderstande that myn lady of York be disposed
to come to this pore place , I praye yow hertly that ye wole recomende
me to hyr noble ladyship and telle hir how hit is with me , so as I may
ben excused for this tyme , PASTON,II,149.324.8930

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_324:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for hit wold ben greet hevynesse to me to vnderstande hir ladyship here
PASTON,II,149.324.8931

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_324:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and I myght not receyve hir as I aught . PASTON,II,149.324.8932

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_324:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And if any thyng hir ladyship wold with me , hit may please hir to lete
yow vnderstande hit , by wheche she may have aunswer as weel as she
laboured ferther , if hit please hyre . PASTON,II,149.324.8933

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_324:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_325:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To the worshypfull ser and my ryght welbelovyd cosyn John Paston
. </font> PASTON,II,150.325.8937

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_325:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Worshypfull sir and cosyn , I recomaund me to yow .
PASTON,II,150.325.8938

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_325:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And lyke yow wete that thys day there was my cosyn Sir Mylys Stapulton
, Sir Simond Braylyes , Andreu Grygges hyr resseyuour , and Grymston
wyth me at Castre , and brought me the somme of ccliij marc and wold
hafe $made payment to me so that I had y-had th'obligacion heere .
PASTON,II,150.325.8939

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_325:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And therfor I sende a lettre wyth my trusty seruaunt Colyn how the seyd
Sir Simond and I be accorded for delyueraunce of it there yff ye thynk
it to be doon , and a lettre of the seyd Sir Simond and the marchauntes
that be bounden to resseyve my monney bye , or th'obligacion to be sent
hedre , as I wryte more playnlye yn a lettre speciallye for the seyd
cause apart . PASTON,II,150.325.8940

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_325:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And the seyd Sir Symond made manye strange mocions seyeng that the seyd
monney was payd before , as c marc by hys handes and c li. by
assignement to Clyffton , vppon whych y dyd aunsuer hym as y wryte more
pleynly apart by the seyd Colyn . PASTON,II,150.325.8941

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_325:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Item , that the xviij and xix day of thys month Long Bernard , wyth a
preest of Kent to the nombre of xvj horses , have {ED:ben}_BEN at
Nacton , Bentlay , and othyr places of F. and entred by colour of a
dede of feffement made to the Lady Roos and othyrs , and hafe ryght
proude langage to the fermours that they wille obteyn theyr entent .
PASTON,II,150.325.8942

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_325:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And Russe hath wryt more pleynlye by Nicholas Colman yerstenday of thys
matere , prayng yow to take thys mater to be remembred yn your speciall
remembraunce , PASTON,II,150.325.8943

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_325:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for it were to grete a losse and rebuke that and they shuld have theyr
entent , so grete cost , labour , and peyn as it hath taken .
PASTON,II,150.325.8944

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_325:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Item , I charge ryght gretely the mater of my lord of Bedford for my
discharge and for the recuuere of my lord ys godes ,
PASTON,II,150.325.8945

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35

and y pray yow hertly to comyn wyth my lord Chaunseller at a gode
leyser , and also wyth othyrs , whate remedyes ys best yn thys matere .
PASTON,II,150.325.8946

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?

LETTER:PASTON_325:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Item , as to the processe of Hykelyng that hath so manye yeeres and
<P_II,151> dayes be dryve off yn the lawe to my grete dammage , I pray
yow to remembre sadlye myne atturney Raulyns and my seriauntes to take
more tendernesse yn thys mater , PASTON,II,151.325.8947

<P_II,151>

{ED:555._FROM_SIR_JOHN_FASTOLF_PROBABLY_1456,_24_JUNE}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_326:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To the worshypfull and my ry+gt welbelovyd cosyn John Paston .
</font> PASTON,II,151.326.8953

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_326:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Fyrst , hyt ys to remembre that vppon Seynt John ys Day there was Sir
Symond Brayles , chappleyn of my lady of Suffolk , and yn presence of
Sir Mylys Stapulton and Edward Grymston , seyd that the ij=c=l marc was
payd before yn the Duc off Suffolk dayes , that ys to wete by the seyd
Sir Simond hand c marc and c li. by assignement made to Sir John
Clyffton , and that yn that wyse hyt was wreten vppon the bak of
th'obligacion . As to whych matere I seyd that y wold shew by
sufficient wrytyng and prevys that y was neuere payd before of that
somme , and redy to shew , and that y offred me to put it vppon my lord
Chaunceller and vppon one or two lordes of the Kynges councell as my
seyd lord Chaunceller wolle calle vnto hym , so as it may be knowen
whethyr my seyd lady ys wronged or I ; PASTON,II,151.326.8954

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_326:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and thys mocion ye may meove to the seyd Sir Symond .
PASTON,II,151.326.8955

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_326:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Item , to preffe that the c li. parcell of ccl marc was not payd by
assignement made to Clyffton , as Sir Simond alleggyth , y have
sufficient evidenses and record of men that be yhyt on lyve that were
prevye to the v=c= mark that I payd to Sir John Clyffton owte of my
coferes and by my resseyuours , as I have quytaunces and seeles to shew
, so that there neded not , ne I had no cause , to assigne Clyffton to
resseyve c li. of my lord of Suffolk ; PASTON,II,151.326.8956

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_326:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for and I had so don the Duc of Suffolk officers most shew an
acquytaunce of that somme vndre Clyffton ys sele , and a wrytyng vndre
my sele directed to my lord to pay to Clyffton yn my name c li. , or
ellys a lettre of myne to <P_II,152> the seyd Clyffton to resseyve it
of my lord ; PASTON,II,152.326.8957

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_326:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and none of all thys can be shewed . PASTON,II,152.326.8958

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_326:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And seth I payd the v=c= marc cleerly of my cofres and my resseyvours
that were speciallye made by me and commytted for that somme onlye to
pay , hyt had be a vayn dede to make onye assignement vppon that
obligacion the Duc of Suffolk was bounden ynne . PASTON,II,152.326.8959

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_326:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Item , the seyd Sir Simond seyd that the sewte was stole ayenst Sir
Thomas Tuddenham yn the Kynges court , and sodenly jugement yoven , and
yff the councell of my lady had knowen hyt one day before how
th'obligacion , as they surmitten , was rased , that I shuld neuere had
jugement . PASTON,II,152.326.8960

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_326:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And y vndrestand by the plee that it was not stolen ,
PASTON,II,152.326.8961

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_326:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for he , Sir Thomas Tuddenham , had respyt iij wekes day to geve
aunsuer to hys obligacion . PASTON,II,152.326.8962

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_326:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And ye see the record ye may know the sooth . PASTON,II,152.326.8963

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_326:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
The seyd Colyn , berere here-off , can tell yow more playnlye of myne
aunsuers ; PASTON,II,152.326.8964

yff ye thynk it to be doon . PASTON,II,152.326.8965

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_BRACKLEY:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_327:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Honorabili viro Johanni Paston armigero , ac confratri suo Willelmo
germano vterino . PASTON,II,153.327.8972

<P_II,154>

AUTHOR:JOHN_BRACKLEY:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_327:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Ryte reuerent syre , &c. , I am informyd credybily of a secrete frend
that S. T. T. and J. H. wyth J. A. and o+ter of cursyd covy wyl bryng
wyth hem many gentylmen of here bende to compleyn vp-on me at the next
chapitle , &c. ; PASTON,II,154.327.8973

AUTHOR:JOHN_BRACKLEY:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_327:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and there-fore , by the grace of God , I dispose me wyth help of +gour
good maysterschip and my Mayster Willyam +gowr bro+ter . Where-fore ,
at the reuerens of God , that +ge do speke wyth the clerk men clepyn
Brayn that kepyth the bokys of here inditementys at the oyer
determynere A=o= xxix=o= regni Regis , and that an extret or a copy
myte schortly be wrytyn owt of as many namys as dedyn indyte T. T. and
J. H. for trespas , extorsyonys , and oppressyonys done to o+ter men as
wele as to my Mayster Fastolf , &c. , that I may be redy to schew to my
ordre lyk a kalendere a legende of here lyvys and here rewlyng of the
cuntre` in destruccyon and gret myschef of the cuntre` in here dayes .
PASTON,II,154.327.8974

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35

Dedham , &c . PASTON,II,154.327.8975

{ED:559._FROM_WILLIAM_WORCESTER_ABOUT_1456}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:41?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_329:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Please yow to wete that , as for ease of my maister tenauntes in Dedham
, yff a lettre were devysed by Maister Geney yn my maister name or
youres to Thomas Higham , one of the justices of pease in Suffolk that
toke the veredyt , he my+gt do grete ease , as yn disavowyng of it or
yn wythdrawyng it owte of the bok . PASTON,II,156.329.9008

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:41?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_329:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Robert Dene , clerk of the pese , seyth that lete my maister councell
avyse that whych he may do vndammaged hym-sylf , and he wille wyth all
hys hert . PASTON,II,156.329.9009

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:41?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_329:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
John Bokkyng ys well remembred that my maister caused the seyd Thomas
Hygham , by Maister Geney mocion , to be one of the justice of pease ,
and one Jermyn of Suffolk also . Whych both Hygham and Jermyn hath
suffred my maister hafe , savyng your reuerence , tweyn shrewde tornys
seth that they my+gt hafe letted , as now the seyd Thomas Hygham my+gt
hafe letted the presentment or a moderated othyrwyse , &c .
PASTON,II,156.329.9010

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:41?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_329:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
At reuerence of God , beyth assone as ye may wyth my maister , to ease
hys spyryttes . PASTON,II,156.329.9011

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:41?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_329:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
He questioneth and desputyth wyth hys seruauntes here ,
PASTON,II,156.329.9012

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:41?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_329:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and wolle not be aunsuerd ne satisfyed som tyme but after hys
wylfullnesse , PASTON,II,156.329.9013

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:41?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_329:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for hyt suffysyth not our simple wyttes to appease hys soule .
PASTON,II,156.329.9014

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35

But when he spekyth wyth Maister +Geluerton , yow , or wyth William
Geney , and such othyrs as be autorised yn the law and wyth
haboundaunce of godes , he ys content PASTON,II,156.329.9015

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:41?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_329:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and haldeth hym pleased wyth your aunsuers and <P_II,157> mocions , as
reson ys that he be . PASTON,II,157.329.9016

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:41?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_329:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
So wold Jesus one of yow iij or som such othyr yn your stede my+gt hang
at hys gyrdyll dayly to aunsuer hys materes . PASTON,II,157.329.9017

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:41?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_329:M4:1456:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA

{ED:560._FROM_SIR_JOHN_FASTOLF_PROBABLY_1456,_31_JULY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_330:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER
<font> To my worshipful cousyn John Paston . </font>
PASTON,II,157.330.9020

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_330:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER
Right trusty and worshipful cousyn , I recomaunde me to yow .
PASTON,II,157.330.9021

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_330:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER
And like it yow to wyte myn attorny Raulyns hathe enformed me that the
jugis haue ruled processe to goo owte ayenst the Priour of Hikelyng of
distresse per omnia bona et catalla , of whiche the writte and o+ter ar
nought yet come fro London . PASTON,II,157.330.9022

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_330:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER
I trust whan +tei come be your good counsail and meane the shireve wil
doo his deuoir . PASTON,II,157.330.9023

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_330:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER
How be it , as I vnderstande , thei haue sente the Lord Scales all
there evidences PASTON,II,157.330.9024

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35

and he wil come and dwelle +tere hym-silf . PASTON,II,157.330.9025

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_330:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER
And I am also enformed for certeyn that the Bushop of Norwiche , for
all +te truste I hadde to hym +tat by his meane I shulde haue knowen
+tere fundacion , he hathe warned his officeres nought to haue a doo
+terjnne by-cause of the Lord Scales , &c . PASTON,II,157.330.9026

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_330:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER
Cousyn , I pray yow , in as moche as the matere by agrement was putte
in you and Fyncham , and how +tat ye for +te same cause specially kepte
your day at London and toke nought in there defaulte and nought myn ,
that ye wil soo in caas ye see Fyncham remembre , and to o+tere +tere
as ye seme it shulde profite to be knowen , and +tat yet neuertheles
myn sute soo ferforthe I wole yet as I wolde +tanne , and at all tymes
am redy . PASTON,II,157.330.9027

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_330:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER
And soo I wolde the Priour knewe , and all o+tere as weel his
weelwillers as o+teres , as the bringer herof shall declare you more
pleinly . PASTON,II,157.330.9028

Reuerent ser , &c. Please yow to wete that it {ED:is}_BEP so that my
maister of his owen frowardnes and of non othere mannys mevyng hat sent
a warent to Cristefore that he shuld delyuer me no mony tyll the
iiij=xx= li. where payed for Bokkyng and Wurcestre patent , and yf the
seyd Cristefore delyuered me any mony that he shuld take a sewerte` of
me therfor . PASTON,II,160.333.9051

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35?
LETTER:PASTON_335:M4:1456?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To my Maister Paston . </font> PASTON,II,162.335.9116

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:41?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35?
LETTER:PASTON_335:M4:1456?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Please yow to wete that I hafe remembred of the langage that I hafe
late lerned W. Barker had to yow and othyrs of hys accomptes apposyng ,
and that they be not hole bethyn ws , but yn diuision , &c .
PASTON,II,162.335.9117

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:41?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35?
LETTER:PASTON_335:M4:1456?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Ser , as I may sey yow , hyt was neuere othyrwyse ,
PASTON,II,162.335.9118

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:41?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35?
LETTER:PASTON_335:M4:1456?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
ne neuere ys lyke to be ; PASTON,II,162.335.9119

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35?
LETTER:PASTON_335:M4:1456?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for now they hafe do wyth Lowys , he that ys next shall be yn the same
as he was yn <P_II,163> gelosye . PASTON,II,163.335.9120

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:41?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35?
LETTER:PASTON_335:M4:1456?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
For when my maister commaundyth such as of force by reson of her
occupacion most be nere hym to do a message to hys felow , or question
of hym , hyt shall be ymagyned amonges our felyshyp that he doth make
maters to my maister ; PASTON,II,163.335.9121

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:41?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35?
LETTER:PASTON_335:M4:1456?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and so it ys ymagyned of me when I wryte lettres to London to Bokkyng
or Barker , that yn such materes as please hem not , then it ys my
doyng ; PASTON,II,163.335.9122

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:41?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35?
LETTER:PASTON_335:M4:1456?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
yff it take well to theyr entent , then it ys her doyng .
PASTON,II,163.335.9123

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:41?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35?
LETTER:PASTON_335:M4:1456?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And yn gode feyth so it was ymagyned of me and othyrs that wrote by my
maister commaundment to Castre , to the parson of Blofeld , Geffrey
Spyrlyng , and othyrs , that of such materes as was lykyng to hem and
coude be sped by help of my maister frendes as by theyr solicytyng ,
then it was seyd that it was theyr avice , labour , and doyng ;
PASTON,II,163.335.9124

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:41?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35?
LETTER:PASTON_335:M4:1456?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and yff the maters went not to my maister entent , ne that they coude
not bryng aboute the mater , then it was jmagyned and jangled that it
was my wrytyng and doyng . PASTON,II,163.335.9125

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35?
LETTER:PASTON_335:M4:1456?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and therfor I most be muet and suffre gretter losses but it <P_II,164>
be othyrwyse concydered . PASTON,II,164.335.9151

whiche is on Moneday come vij nyght ; at whiche tyme I trost ye wole be
here , PASTON,II,164.336.9157
