LETTER:PASTON_337:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To my worshipfull cosyn John Paston be this lettre delyuered .
</font> PASTON,II,165.337.9192

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_337:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Worshipful and my right trusty cosyn , I comaunde me to yow ,
PASTON,II,165.337.9193

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_337:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and pray yow that ye wil take the labour in the ende of the terme to
come homward by Dedham , and William Worcestre and Barker with yow ,
that ye may see +te accompt taken +tere of +te barly and suche
husbondrye as is vsed <P_II,166> there , for I drede that it farith
with me there as in o+ter places ; and that ye wil appoynte a day to be
+tere and lete me knowe it , that I may sende a man +tidre to mete with
yow with +te laste accomptes . PASTON,II,166.337.9194

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_337:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And as for Wighton in Yorkshire , Bokkyng hathe remembrid me how that
ye spake to me that my sone Scrope and hise fadre in lawe shuld haue
all +te lyuelode of my wifes in ferme , to whiche I am wele remembrid
+tat I was agreed ; and elles that +te Lord Vescy wolde haue Wighton ,
as he hadde sumtyme , to ferme for xxxiiij li. or +tereupon , whiche is
moche more money +tanne I make it worthe yerly . PASTON,II,166.337.9195

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_337:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And +terfore I pray yow doo +terjnne as ye +tinkyn moste to myn aduaile
. PASTON,II,166.337.9196

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_337:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
I hadde levest my sone Scrope hadde it , with suche suerte` founden as
ye cowde thinke sufficient for me in +tat bihalue . And if ye take noon
appoyntement with hym , +tat +tanne the Lord Vescy haue it , beyng
bounde to cherishe +te tenauntes and supporte +tem and meyntenyng ,
levyng it in as good plighte as {in}_P he shall receyve it , or bettyr
, as my right trusty frende and youres , John Grenefeld , mevid yow ;
PASTON,II,166.337.9197

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_337:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and this I wold the rather for his good mocion . PASTON,II,166.337.9198

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_337:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And I pray yow to +tanke hym on my parte for his good will in all my
materes , the whiche and all youres I pray God sende right good spede
and yow right wele to fare . PASTON,II,166.337.9199

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_337:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Youre cosyn J. Fastolf PASTON,II,166.337.9201

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_337:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Item , cosyn , I pray yow +tat ye will comon with William Worcestre to
see , by +te meane of myn lord of Caunterbury or o+terwise , +tat
Maister William Clyf and o+ter of +t'excecutours of John Wellis may be
spoken with for +te recouere of grete good +tat , as Worcestre knowith
weel , it may be preuid +tat +te seid Wellys ought me in his lyve , &c.
, +tat I myght knowe sum answere +terof in myn daies ; and +tat my lord
of Caunterbury may knowe and be prevy +tertoo . PASTON,II,166.337.9202

<P_II,167>

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_338:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And like it yow to wyte that I receyvid by Henre` Hansson on Thorsday
last passid at iiij after none certeyn lettres , amonges whiche I
receyvid on from William Barker writen of Lukettes hande , and ij
billes of supplicacions , of whiche on in the tenauntes names of Cotton
I sente as I wrote vn-to yow and my seruauntes there .
PASTON,II,167.338.9205

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_338:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Vp-on the sight of +te same lettre and billes John Russe with Geffrey
Sperlyng riden to Cotton to fulfille parte , or as moche as +tei myght
, of th'entente of +te same lettre touchyng +te first article ,
PASTON,II,167.338.9206

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_338:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and as thei spedde +tere +tei writen , as I vnderstande ,
PASTON,II,167.338.9207

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_338:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and sent vn-to yow from Cotton ; wherjnne I pray God spede yow ,
PASTON,II,167.338.9208

for me +tinkith the bille and the matier right good and weel spoken
accordyng to the trouthe of +teire riotous demenyng .
PASTON,II,167.338.9209

Wentworth , yonge Calthorp , and yonge Brews , amonge diuerse and many

LETTER:PASTON_338:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And as to the tretye , I knowe for certeyn ye wil nought demesne me in
+tat bihalve o+terwise +tanne as conscience requirith , doynge therjnne
as ye wolde for yowre-self , ayenst whiche I may nought be ,
consideryng +te grete truste I haue vn-to yow , but to holde me
contentid as ye doo , forsene in ony wise that I haue ayen +te manere
of Bradwell by sum meane as clere as I hadde it by-fore myn vnhappy
relees made . PASTON,II,167.338.9214

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_338:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for ye knowe weel howgh +te Chif Justice of England , as I am enformed
, rectid the matier in Parlement by-fore +te Lordes , where and what
tyme he declarid my wronge in +tat +tat +te office was soo vntrewly
founden that I shuld haue disseasid Ser Hue Fastolf of +te manere ,
where as I haue sufficent evidences preuyng a trewe saale and purchace
, how I hadde it of hym , as ye +tanne and by-fore ful plenly hadde
answerid for me more clerly +tanne I can write at +tis tyme , &c .
PASTON,II,167.338.9216

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?

LETTER:PASTON_338:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Item , cosyn , I pray yow in as moche as here hathe ben my lady of York
, and soore mevid me for +te purchas of Castre , that ye wil assay to
fynde the meanes how I myght beste be spedde for the licence of
morteisyng <P_II,168> certein lyuelode , as ye and I haue comound of
be-fore , to th'entente of +te fundacion of a college .
PASTON,II,168.338.9217

{ED:570._SIR_JOHN_FASTOLF_TO_PASTON_OR_BARKER_PROBABLY_1456,_18_NO
VEMBER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_339:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To the worshipful and my right welbeloued cosyn John Paston at
the Temple or to William Barker at Suthwerk be +tis deliuered . </font>
PASTON,II,168.339.9231

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_339:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Worshipful cosyn , I comaunde me to yow . PASTON,II,168.339.9232

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_339:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And where as I late wrote vn-to yow in a lettre by Henre` Hansson for
the fundacion of my college , I am soore sette therupon ;
PASTON,II,168.339.9233

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_339:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and that is the cause I write now to remembre yow agayn to meve my
lordes of Caunterbury and Wynchestre for the licence to be opteyned
that I myght haue the morteisyng , withowte ony grete fyne in
recompence of my longe seruise contynued and doon vn-to <P_II,169> the
Kyng and to his noble fader , whom God assoile , and neuere yette
guerdoonned or rewardid . PASTON,II,169.339.9234

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_339:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And now sithe I haue ordeyned to make the Kyng foundour and euere to be
praied for , and for his right noble progenitours , hise fader and
vncles , me thinketh I shuld nought be denyed of my desire , but the
rather to be remembrid and spedde . Wherfore , as I wrote vn-to yow , I
pray yow acqueynte me and yow , for +te rather spede here-of , with a
chapelleyn of myn lord of Caunterbure` that in your abcence may
remembre me , and in like wise with my lord Chaunceller ;
PASTON,II,169.339.9235

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_339:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for seyng the Kynkes disposicion , and also hise , vn-to the edifyeng
of God is seruice it myght in noo bettyr tyme be mevid , &c .
PASTON,II,169.339.9236

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_339:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Item , as for the mater of the warde , I receyvid a lettre on Thorsday
at nyght +tat come from William Barker , writen the xiiij day of
Nouembre , wherjnne in maner he arrettith a defaulte +tat the lettre of
my lord of Norffolk for the peticion of +te men of Cotton was nought
spedde . PASTON,II,169.339.9237

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_339:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
I dide +tat was most necessarie as me thought at +te tyme of his first
writyng , PASTON,II,169.339.9238

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_339:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for I sende as I wrote vn-to yow : PASTON,II,169.339.9239

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_339:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
vp-on +te sight of his lettre I sent Sperlyng and Russe to Cotton
PASTON,II,169.339.9240

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35
LETTER:PASTON_339:M4:1456:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and +tere toke of +te tenauntes suerte`s +tat +tei shuld aduowe and be
demesned in all sutes as I wolde , and what bestes were deliuered ayen
, PASTON,II,169.339.9241

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35

answere nore whethir it was wele doon or noo , ner what spede at +tis
tyme was in the tretyes or nought . PASTON,II,169.339.9242

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:78?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:35

It is soo that be-fore +te first writyng of +tis matere my lord was
remevid from Framlyngham on foote to goo to Walsyngham ,
PASTON,II,169.339.9243

Neuere +te lesse I haue now sente John Russe and a man of Cotton to

{ED:571._FROM_WILLIAM_WORCESTER_1457,_20_APRIL}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_340:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
<font> To my Maister Paston . </font> PASTON,II,170.340.9252

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_340:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Please yow to wete that , after dew recommendacion , hyt ys so that my
maister sendyth me to London for the mater of Rochestre , as for dyuers
of hys oune particuler maters whych concern not the lawe , &c .
PASTON,II,170.340.9253

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_340:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And I am lyke to tarye there till ye com , jn case ye com $wythynne iij
wekys . PASTON,II,170.340.9254

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_340:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Ser , at reuerence of God , seth my maister ys fully yn wille to renew
hys feffment , that it may be do be-tyme by the surest grounde that may
be had , PASTON,II,170.340.9255

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_340:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
for be it nevyr so suerly doon hyt shall be thought lytille ynowgh to
kepe hys lond owte of trouble ; and to spare for no councell ne cost to
make it sure , PASTON,II,170.340.9256

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_340:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
for a peny yn seson spent wille safe a pounde . PASTON,II,170.340.9257

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_340:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
I comyned wyth my bro+tere Spyrlyng , whych seyth he wille do hys
attendaunce and to kepe it ry+gt close of the namys .
PASTON,II,170.340.9258

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_340:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Taryeng drawyth parell . PASTON,II,170.340.9259

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_340:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And ye meved a gode matere to the parson and to me at your last beyng
at Castre , that my maister shuld be lerned whate hys housold standyth
vppon yerlye seth he kept it holye to-ghedre at one place , and that
don , then to see by the reuenues of hys yeerly lyfelode whate may be
leyd and assigned owte for that cause to meynteyn hys seyd housold ,
and over that whate may be assigned to beere owte hys plees and also to
pay for hys foreyn charges and dedes of almes to a conuenyent somme .
PASTON,II,170.340.9260

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_340:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And seth the grettist ordynarye charge most be hys housold kepyng , hyt
were moste exspedyent that ye wold note well to remembre specially my
maister to do hys audytours cast and make rollys of hys accomptes
concernyng the seyd housold seth he came yn-to Norffolk thys ij yere
and half , whych was nevyr so long to doo thys xl wyntere as ys now .
PASTON,II,170.340.9261

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_340:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And it ys pytee that hys audyt ys none othyrwyse yn that entended .
PASTON,II,170.340.9262

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_340:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Ye must nedys , yff ye wille my maister know how hyt stand wyth hym
yerly of hys charges , that thys be do fyrst , as it was allwey
acustomed . PASTON,II,170.340.9263

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_340:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
My maister wille acord it to be don , PASTON,II,170.340.9264

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_340:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
but it ys foryete throwgh negligence of men yoven to sensualite` , as
Thomas Vpton , me , and othyrs . PASTON,II,170.340.9265

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_340:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
My maister can not know whe+tere he go bakward or forward till thys be
doon . PASTON,II,170.340.9266

<P_II,171>

{ED:572._FROM_WILLIAM_WORCESTER_1457,_1_MAY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_341:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To the ryght worshypfull ser , John Paston , escuier , beyng in
Norwych , yn haste . </font> PASTON,II,171.341.9273

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_341:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Ryght worshypfull ser , aftyr dewe recommendacion please yow to wete
that I wrote a remembraunce to yow the day that I departed owte of
Norwich by Richard , the parson ys seruaunt of Blofeld , concernyng
certeyn materes to be remembred by your wysdom for my maister ys
avaylle , whych your grete wysdom can well vndrestand ys ryght nedefull
; as one thyng yn especiall , that Shypdam and Spyrlyng ought to labour
fyrst of onye thyng that belongyth to audyt the accomptes of the
resseyt and despenses of my maister housold at Castre seth he come last
in-to Norffolk , {TEXT:whych} aswell for the prouisyons that ys had of
hys oune growyng as in money payd . PASTON,II,171.341.9274

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_341:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
For till the seyd accomptes be made ordynatlye , whych be of a grete
charge yeerlye , wete ye for certeyn my maister shall neuere know
whethyr he goth bakward or forward . PASTON,II,171.341.9275

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_341:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And manye o+tere accomptantes that maken lyuere` of prouysyons of
cornys and catell to the household by the resseyuour and by the
bayllyfs can not approve theyr liberatz just tille the seyd housold
bokes be made vpp . PASTON,II,171.341.9276

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_341:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And seth it hath be kept ordynarylye seth my maister began to kepe
house thys 1 yeere almoste , and when he hath be absent beyond see ,
&c. , hyt ought be more redelyere {TEXT:be} doon and made vpp whyle he
ys present , and well the ra+tere that hys housold menye were not so
hole to-ghedre thys xl yere as be now at Castre .
PASTON,II,171.341.9277

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_341:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Also hys ministres of accomptes of hys chieff manere of Haylysdon for
iij yeere to make vpp and to examyn ; PASTON,II,171.341.9278

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_341:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and I ensure yow full simplye approwed hys wollys and hys fermys .
PASTON,II,171.341.9279

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_341:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And the iij=d= ys that so wold Jesus my maister audytours wold
faythfully <P_II,172> and playnlye enforme my maistre of the trouth of
the yeerly grete damage he beryth in debursyng hys money aboute shyppes
and botes , kepyng an house vp at Jermuth to hys grete harme and
resseyvyth but chaffre and waare for hys cornys and wollys , &c. , and
then most abyde a long day to make money of such chafre takyng .
PASTON,II,172.341.9280

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_341:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
He shall neuere be monyed , ne be aunsuerd clerly of hys reuenues
yeerly , but those thynges abofeseyd be amended be-tyme .
PASTON,II,172.341.9281

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_341:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Yn Lowys days xij yeere to-ghedre my maister was wont to ley vpp money
yeerly at London and Castre , and now the contrarye , de malo in pejus
. PASTON,II,172.341.9282

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_341:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
I dar not be know of thys bille , PASTON,II,172.341.9283

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_341:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
but ye may question and vele of the disposicion of thys maters of
o+teres , and $then vndrestand yff I wryt justlye or no ;
PASTON,II,172.341.9284

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:42?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_341:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and ye , as of your mocion for my maister worshyp and proffyt ,
exortyng hym , the stuard , Shypdam , and Spyrlyng to take a labour and
a peyn that thys be reformed . PASTON,II,172.341.9285

PASTON,II,172.341.9287

{ED:573._FROM_THOMAS_PLAYTER_PROBABLY_1457,_20_JULY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_342:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
<font> To my rygth reuerent and worchipfull Maister John Paston be this
dylyuered at London , and elles sent to hym to Norwich . </font>
PASTON,II,173.342.9304

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_342:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Rygth worchipfull ser and my rygth good maister , I recomend me to you
. PASTON,II,173.342.9305

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_342:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Lyke you to wete I have spoken wyth my lord Chaunceler and put the
bylle by-for hym and all the lordes vpon Wednesday at after non last
past , wenyng to me to haue an answer vpon Thursday .
PASTON,II,173.342.9306

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_342:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
And my lord Chaunceler told me that they sped no partycler mater yet
syn they cam , nor han no leyser to attend swych maters .
PASTON,II,173.342.9307

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_342:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
I haue spoken to my Lord Wylchyre , PASTON,II,173.342.9308

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_342:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
and he promysed to help forth that he can , and my Lord Beauchamp bothe
. PASTON,II,173.342.9309

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:36
LETTER:PASTON_342:M4:1457:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Fenyngley cam but on Thursday at evyn . PASTON,II,173.342.9310

<P_II,174>

{ED:574._FROM_HENRY_WINDSOR_PROBABLY_1458,_27_AUGUST}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:HENRY_WINDSOR:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:37
LETTER:PASTON_343:M4:1458:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
<font> To my full speciall gode maister John Paston . </font>
PASTON,II,174.343.9320

AUTHOR:HENRY_WINDSOR:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:37
LETTER:PASTON_343:M4:1458:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Worshipfull sir and my full speciall goode maister , after humble
recommendacion please it you to vnderstand that such seruice as I can
doo to your pleiser as to myn vnderstandyng I haue shewed my diligence
nowe this shorte season sithon your departyng , and in especiall aboute
suche a copie of a foundacion as your maistership commaunded me to gete
you a copie of ; of the which I sende vnto you at this tyme by my
broder William Worcestre iij copies writon by Luket , bycause I had no
leiser but somoch besenes in settyng forth of my Maister of the Rolles
<P_II,175> at this tyme . PASTON,II,175.343.9321

AUTHOR:HENRY_WINDSOR:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:37
LETTER:PASTON_343:M4:1458:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
And in all this Kynges deies ye can haue noon oder accordyng any thing
to your entent . PASTON,II,175.343.9322

AUTHOR:HENRY_WINDSOR:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:37
LETTER:PASTON_343:M4:1458:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
And as for the names of the Poles , William hath more writyng than ye
and I coude fynde , foundon by labour made by hym ande me .
PASTON,II,175.343.9323

AUTHOR:HENRY_WINDSOR:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:37
LETTER:PASTON_343:M4:1458:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
And also , sir , he hath caused me to examyn olde and mony recordes
writon by som Frenshman concernyng the manoir of Dedham , that was a
comberouse labour PASTON,II,175.343.9324

AUTHOR:HENRY_WINDSOR:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:37
LETTER:PASTON_343:M4:1458:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
for these copies were full defectif , as it apereth by the correctyng
of them . PASTON,II,175.343.9325

AUTHOR:HENRY_WINDSOR:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:37
LETTER:PASTON_343:M4:1458:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Item , sir , I mey sey to you that William hath goon to scole to a
Lumbard called Karoll Giles , to lern and to be red in poetre` or els
in Frensh , PASTON,II,175.343.9326

AUTHOR:HENRY_WINDSOR:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:37

for he hath byn with the same Karoll euery dey ij tymes or iij ,

son haue knolage . PASTON,II,175.343.9332

PASTON,II,175.343.9335

AUTHOR:HENRY_WINDSOR:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_

At this tyme nothyng els to your maistership , but and it please you to

shall stande as touchyng my preferryng to the Boreshed in Suthwerk .
PASTON,II,175.343.9336

AUTHOR:HENRY_WINDSOR:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_

Sir , I wold haue byn at a noder place , PASTON,II,175.343.9337

Bokkyng , and William Barker , and most specially to my maisters awun
remembraunce . PASTON,II,175.343.9338

without help of your maistership , vnto the which I vtterly submytte me
in this and all oder . PASTON,II,175.343.9339

{ED:575._FROM_RICHARD_SOUTHWELL_ABOUT_1458,_6_OCTOBER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:37
LETTER:PASTON_344:M4:1458:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To the right reuerent and worshippfull John Paston in haste .
</font> PASTON,II,176.344.9343

AUTHOR:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:37
LETTER:PASTON_344:M4:1458:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Right reuerent and worshippfull ser and my right trusti and welbelouid
cosin , I recomaund me vnto you , praiyng you hertily to remembre me
vnto my Master Radclyff so that by your gode meanes I shall mowe haue
his gode mastershipp , the whiche I haue effectuelly to $my powere
sewed fore this iij yere and neuer deserved the contrarye to my
knowlegge , by my trouth ; PASTON,II,176.344.9344

AUTHOR:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:37
LETTER:PASTON_344:M4:1458:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and if it can or may be founden that I haue I will obeye me , and offre
me to abyde the rewle of you and my cosin your brothir , &c .
PASTON,II,176.344.9345

AUTHOR:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:37
LETTER:PASTON_344:M4:1458:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Also , my lord of Caunterbury Master Waltier Blakette will help forthe
if nede be , PASTON,II,176.344.9346

AUTHOR:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:37
LETTER:PASTON_344:M4:1458:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and as to the remenaunt of the lordes , if the case require that ye may
vnderstand by your wysdam thei be displeased with me , as I trust to
God thei be not , I beseche you to remembre that I haue aforetyme $ben
accused vnto the Kinges highnesse and the Quenes for owyng my pouere
gode will and seruice vnto my lord of York and o+ter , &c . Wherof I
suppose that Thomas Bagham is remembred that I brought hym oones from
my lady a purs and v marc. therin , and to Ser Phelipp Wenteworth an
o+ter and a c s. therin for theire gode will and advise therin to my
lady and all vs that were appelled for that cause ; notwithstanding the
King wrote to my lord by the meanes of the Duc of Somersette that we
shuld be avoyded from hym , &c. , and within this ij yere we were in
like wise laboured a-geyns to the Quene , so that she wrote to my lord
to avoyde vs , saiyng that the King and she coude nor myght in no wise
be assured of hym and my lady as long as we were aboute hym , with
muche o+ter thing , as may be sufficiently preved by the Quenes writing
vnder herre own signett and signe manuell , the whiche I shewd to my
lord of Caunterbury and o+ter lordes , &c . PASTON,II,176.344.9347

<P_II,177>

AUTHOR:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:37
LETTER:PASTON_344:M4:1458:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
I prey you haue me excused that I encombre you with thees matiers at
this tyme , PASTON,II,177.344.9348

AUTHOR:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:37
LETTER:PASTON_344:M4:1458:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for me thinketh ye shuld will and desire me to do any thing to your
honour and pleaser at any tyme , wherto I shal be redy and welwilled
euer to my powere , by the grace of God , who haue you euer in his
keping , and all youres . PASTON,II,177.344.9349

AUTHOR:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:37
LETTER:PASTON_344:M4:1458:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Writon at Norwiche on Seint Feithes Day in haste .
PASTON,II,177.344.9350

AUTHOR:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:37

<font> To my Maister Paston . </font> PASTON,II,177.345.9352

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:37
LETTER:PASTON_345:M4:1458:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Ser , as I went to my horsward by Lyncoln Coke ys place hyt fortuned
that Wymondham and H. Fenne talked to-gedre and called me by my name ,
PASTON,II,177.345.9353

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:43?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:37
LETTER:PASTON_345:M4:1458:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA

LETTER:PASTON_345:M4:1458:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Then Fen desyred me abyde to see astate taked yn Lyncoln place by hym
boght of Markham . PASTON,II,177.345.9355

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:37
LETTER:PASTON_345:M4:1458:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
In the meene tyme the seyd Wymondham sent hys man to speke wyth hym

and yede yn talkyng of Ser Thomas , how he wille help labour to an ende
, PASTON,II,177.345.9357

, shewed to grete a malice to vndo a preest jnnocent yn such a cause ,
&c . PASTON,II,177.345.9359

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:37
LETTER:PASTON_345:M4:1458:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
After my takyng leefe he called me ageyn PASTON,II,177.345.9360

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:43?

LETTER:PASTON_345:M4:1458:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA

hafe affeccion to the chylde , &c . PASTON,II,177.345.9361

I aunsuerd , yff my maister had before the maryage be laboured hyt had
$be moch esyer to bryng aboute then now . PASTON,II,177.345.9362

wold hafe affeccion to hym all hys lyfedayes . PASTON,II,177.345.9363

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:37
LETTER:PASTON_345:M4:1458:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and yff it please my maister to sende for hym by Ser Thomas meene , &c.
I ensure yow by my soule I brake no mater to hym but of Ser Thomas
vndoyng and hys aduersaries neuere the better , whych to my power wold
help make it knowen to lordes and all othyrs of the cruell
amerciementes , <P_II,178> the cruell juge to be knowen as he ys ,
PASTON,II,178.345.9365

taken at Wycham Markette for the parsonage of Rendelesham for on
Mayster John Clerke , a chapeleyn of the Lady Roos ;
PASTON,II,179.346.9372

but by the endenture a-twyxt the wedewe and hym , &c .
PASTON,II,179.346.9384

LETTER:PASTON_346:M4:1459:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Myn mayster is as freshe as ever he was this ij yere , thanked be God .
PASTON,II,179.346.9385

{ED:579._FROM_SIR_JOHN_FASTOLF_1459,_3_JULY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:81?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38
LETTER:PASTON_347:M4:1459:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To my ryght welbelovyd cousyn John Paston . </font>
PASTON,II,180.347.9391

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:81?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38
LETTER:PASTON_347:M4:1459:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Hyt ys to remembre my cosyn John Paston that where as he desyred to
hafe the namys of the newe feffement of the maner of Dedham that
William Geney myght see to grounde such mater vppon as myght be for the
seurtee of the seyd maner , I sent a copy of the seyd feffement by John
Daunson the last weke . PASTON,II,180.347.9392

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:81?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38
LETTER:PASTON_347:M4:1459:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Item , as for that ye desyre to know of one Teynton yn whoos name the
fyrst entree yn Dedham was made , the auncetrie or som cosyn of that
Teynton was infeffed of trust yn the seyd maner bethyn thys xl yere ,
PASTON,II,180.347.9393

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:81?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38
LETTER:PASTON_347:M4:1459:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and hath delyuered such astate , wyth dyuers othyrs so enfeffed yn that
maner , hath enseled to me and othyr of my feffees as the dede of my
purchasse wille make mencion ; PASTON,II,180.347.9394

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:81?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38
LETTER:PASTON_347:M4:1459:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and yn London a man shall best inquyre of the seyd Teynton .
PASTON,II,180.347.9395

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:81?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38
LETTER:PASTON_347:M4:1459:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Item , as for the principall evidenses of Dedham , I hafe sent hem vpp
to yow by the seyd Daunson the last weke , wyth the copies of iij
relesses of the auncetrie of Poles , and also wyth a copy of the warde
late made by the Archebysshop of Caunterbury , the Bysshop of Norwich ,
Ser John Forscue and William Yeluerton , Justices .
PASTON,II,180.347.9396

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:81?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38
LETTER:PASTON_347:M4:1459:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Item , there as one Well Deen makyth moch a-doo for the clayme of my
beerehouses purchased of W. Southcotes , I hafe spoke of it to John
Bokkyng to labour and do by your avice that at may be vayllable for me
. PASTON,II,180.347.9397

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:81?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38
LETTER:PASTON_347:M4:1459:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And Elzabet the doughter of the Southcotes knouleged the relessyng of
all hyr ryght yn the seyd berehouses , wyth the appurtenaunces ,
to-fore William +Geluerton , Justice , at Seynt Bryde ys chyrch the
Trinite` terme A=o= xxix=o= r. r. H. vj . PASTON,II,180.347.9398

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:81?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38
LETTER:PASTON_347:M4:1459:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Item , as for Rauff Alygh , squyer , wyth my lord Chaunceller , that ye
hafe remembred to hafe hys patent for hys fee , I have do wrote it and
<P_II,181> enseled it PASTON,II,181.347.9399

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:81?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38
LETTER:PASTON_347:M4:1459:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and sendyth it now vpp to London to yow , whom I hafe graunted to hafe
xx s. a yere to be of my councell and supporter of my tenauntes yn
Southwerk , to by wyth-all a goune . PASTON,II,181.347.9400

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:81?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38
LETTER:PASTON_347:M4:1459:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Item , wher as Cristofre hath wryt to me that one Laurence Donne hath
do somond my tenement by Seynt Olof chyrch , of x li. of yerly value ,
to aunsuere at thys xv=a= Johannis , I pray you to ouersee well myne
evidenses of the seyd tenement and that ye hafe gode councell to avyse
the best remedies . PASTON,II,181.347.9401

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:81?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38

for the recuuere of certeyn evidenses that he hath yn kepyng of the
seyd place , PASTON,II,181.347.9402

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:81?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38

li. that the seyd Laurens Donne is obliged to , that he shall nevyr
clayme , vex , ne trouble the seyd londe . PASTON,II,181.347.9403

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38
LETTER:PASTON_348:M4:1459:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Walsham of Chauncery , that neuer made lesyng , told me that Bokkyng
was wyth my lord Chauncelere this terme , PASTON,II,185.348.9444

AUTHOR:JOHN_BRACKLEY:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_

LETTER:PASTON_348:M4:1459:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
but I askyd not how many tymys , &c . PASTON,II,185.348.9445

AUTHOR:JOHN_BRACKLEY:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38
LETTER:PASTON_348:M4:1459:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
As I haf wrytyn to +gow oftyn by-fore this , ' Facite vobis amicos de
mammona iniquitatis ' , quia de facto T. T. , J. H. , et J. W. , cum
ceteris Magistri Fastolff fallacibus famulis magnam gerunt ad vos
invidiam quod excelleretis eos in bonis , &c. Judas non dormit , &c. '
Noli zelare facientes iniquitatem quoniam tanquam fenum velociter
arescent et quem admodum olera herbarum cito per Dei graciam decident .
' PASTON,II,185.348.9446

AUTHOR:JOHN_BRACKLEY:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38
LETTER:PASTON_348:M4:1459:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA

pasceris in diuiciis eius , et delectare in Domino et dabit tibi
peticiones cordis tui . ' PASTON,II,185.348.9447

AUTHOR:JOHN_BRACKLEY:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_

PASTON,II,185.348.9448

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38

' Vtinam ' , inquit apostolus , ' abscindantur qui vos conturbant ' ,
&c. Et alibi , ' Cabete vos a malis et inportunis hominibus . '
PASTON,II,185.348.9449

AUTHOR:JOHN_BRACKLEY:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38

redemit , vos , vestros , et vestra graciose conseruet in prosperis et
graciosius dirigat in agendis . PASTON,II,185.348.9450

iste mundus malignus transiret et concupiscencia eius .
PASTON,II,185.348.9451

Seynt Benet , &c. , which he promittyd vp a certeyn mony , &c. , and
vndirtoke it , &c. , and fond that tyme no bonys in the matere , &c .

{ED:584._FROM_JOHN_BOKKYNG_TO_PASTON_OTHERS_1459,_7_DECEMBER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_BOKKYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38
LETTER:PASTON_350:M4:1459:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
<font> To my right worshipful maistris William Yeluerton , Justice ,
John Paston , and Herre` Filongley , and to eche of them . </font>
PASTON,II,187.350.9479

AUTHOR:JOHN_BOKKYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38
LETTER:PASTON_350:M4:1459:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Right worshipful seres , I recomaunde me to yow .
PASTON,II,187.350.9480

AUTHOR:JOHN_BOKKYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38
LETTER:PASTON_350:M4:1459:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
And like it yow to wete that my lord Chaunceller is right good and
tendre lord in all youre materes , and soo wil contynue , and my lord
Tresorier in like wise ; whiche bothen haue answerid Wyndham nought
aldermoste to hise plesir be-cause of his noiseful langage , seyng how
he myght haue no lawe and that my lord Chaunceller was nought made
excecutour but for meigntenaunce , with many othir woordis noo +ting
profitable ner furtheryng his entent . PASTON,II,187.350.9481

AUTHOR:JOHN_BOKKYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38
LETTER:PASTON_350:M4:1459:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
As for ony particuler materes , the parlament as yet abideth vpon the
grete materes of atteyndre and forfeture , PASTON,II,187.350.9482

AUTHOR:JOHN_BOKKYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38
LETTER:PASTON_350:M4:1459:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and soo +tere be many and diuerse particuler billes put jnne but noon
redde ner touchyng vs , as nygh as we can herken ; to whiche Playter
and I attenden daily , trustyng on my lordes aboveseid , my lord Priue`
Seall , and other good lordes , and many also of your acqueyntance and
owres , that and ony thing be we shall sone haue knowlege .
PASTON,II,187.350.9483

AUTHOR:JOHN_BOKKYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38
LETTER:PASTON_350:M4:1459:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
The Chief Justice is right herty PASTON,II,187.350.9484

AUTHOR:JOHN_BOKKYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38
LETTER:PASTON_350:M4:1459:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and seith ful weel and kyndely of my maister , whom Jesu for his mercy
pardonne , and haue yow in his blessid gouernaunce .
PASTON,II,187.350.9485

AUTHOR:JOHN_BOKKYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38
LETTER:PASTON_350:M4:1459:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT

PASTON,II,187.350.9486

Maister Filongley , PASTON,II,187.350.9487

AUTHOR:JOHN_BOKKYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_

{ED:587._SIR_JOHN_FASTOLF_TO_PASTON_YELVERTON_1455-9,_20_MARCH}_CO DE

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_351:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
<font> To the worshypfull and my welbelovyd cosyns John Paston and
+Geluerton . </font> PASTON,II,190.351.9503

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_351:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
Worshypfull sers and cousyns , y comaund me to yow ,
PASTON,II,190.351.9504

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_351:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
and y thank yow for your gode laboures abowte my processe spedyng of
the accion that y have take ayenst Thomas Fauconere ;
PASTON,II,190.351.9505

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_351:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
and seeyng that he ys ryght obstynate and hath wrought ayenst Byrkwod
ryght vniustlye to hys vndoyng , whych Fauconere payd me no maner somme
for the seyd Byrkwod as my resseyuours hafe enformed me , and the seyd
Byrkwod owyth greete money to dyuers credytours when he stode myne
officer that he hath take alloaunce for and not payd it , so it
standyth to me yn debt , whych hys obligacion ys parcell of that debt ;
wherfor y pray yow as ferre as y have ryght that ye wylle sew it owte
as ye thynkyth best by your grete wysdom . PASTON,II,190.351.9506

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_351:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
And when that y have my recuuere ayenst the seyd Fauconer and Byrkwod y
wolle yn reson be rewled and moderated by your discrecions , and as y
fynde the seyd Fauconer well demened as to the seyd Byrkwod .
PASTON,II,190.351.9507

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_351:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
And y pray God have yow yn hys kepyng . PASTON,II,190.351.9508

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_351:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
Wreten at Castre the xx day of Marche . PASTON,II,190.351.9509

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_

Your cosyn John Fastolf PASTON,II,190.351.9510

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_

And lyke yow wete that y sende to yow my seruaunt , berer hereoff , a
certeyn jnstruccion to be corrected by your avice , prayng yow to take
it tendyrly to hert ; and also a certeyn remembraunce concernyng
Walsyngham , whych y trust to God by your help shall be corryged .

passyng alle othyr mennys , whych y pray yow concyder after the case
shall requyre and as ye thynk by your wyse discrecion , yn trust to
hafe gode lordshyp . PASTON,II,191.352.9516

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_353:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
and thanke yow of youre greet peyn and laboures that ye daylye take for
me in alle myn causes , for wheche I am greetly holden to yow ,
PASTON,II,191.353.9522

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_353:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
God yelde hit yow . PASTON,II,191.353.9523

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_353:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
And , cosyn , hit is so , as I am enformed , that a fermoure of myn
maner in Saxthorp called John Bennes shuld come be-fore yow for to
appoynte for suche dewte` as he oweth to me vpon his ferme .
PASTON,II,191.353.9524

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_353:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
I sende to yow the bokes of his accompt , to th'entent that Spyrlyng
may awayte vpon yow at his comyng and declare hym his dewte` , wheche
as myn receyvoure seyth hit wole drawe to the summe of xlv li. , and
more money at Mihelmasse now <P_II,192> next comyng .
PASTON,II,192.353.9525

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_353:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
And the ferme is but xx li. yerly , by wheche ye may vnderstande that
he hath hadde greet fauoure in his payementes , to his weel and myn
greet hurt , as I reporte me to youre greet wysdom .
PASTON,II,192.353.9526

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_353:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
Neverthelesse , sethe hit is so that he hath hadde this advayle vpon me
I wold seen now that suche dewte` as shal ben dewly founde vpon hym by
accompt to be made at this day , that I may ther-of have payement in
hande , as reson wole , or of as moche as the day is ronne of ; and for
the resydewe to have greable sewerte` , that is to sey of xx li. growen
at Mihelmasse next comyng , to have payement +terof at the festes of
Seynt Andrew and the Annunciacion of Oure Lady next comyng by even
porcions , as in his endenture made of the seyd lees more playnly is
conteyned . PASTON,II,192.353.9527

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_353:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
And this don I am content that he goo at large , and ell that Spyrlyng
take a rekenyng of hym so as I may be aunswered accordyng to the
statute , &c . PASTON,II,192.353.9528

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_353:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
And , cosyn , that ouere this ye lyke to yeve credence to the brynger
her-of of that he shal declare yow in this be-half be mouth .
PASTON,II,192.353.9529

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_353:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
And Oure Lord kepe yow . PASTON,II,192.353.9530

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_353:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
Wreten in hast at myn manoir of Castre the Saterday next after Oure

AUTHOR:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:_

{ED:591._FROM_RICHARD_EARL_OF_WARWICK_PERHAPS_ABOUT_1459,_1_MARCH}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:RICHARD_NEVILLE:MALE:_:1428:31?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38?
LETTER:PASTON_355:M4:1459?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To myn right trusty and welbeloued John Paston , squyer .
</font> PASTON,II,193.355.9556

AUTHOR:RICHARD_NEVILLE:MALE:_:1428:31?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38?
LETTER:PASTON_355:M4:1459?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Right trusty and welbeloued , I grete yow well , desiryng and praying
yow hertily that at the reuerens of God and this my writyng ye wooll
shewe your good maistershep and tender frenshep vn-to the right trew
seruauntes of God , myn oratoures the Freres Menoures of the couent of
Norwich , in swich maters as my right welbeloued Doctour Brakley shall
enforme yow mor apleyn ; to whoom I praye yow yeue feith and full
credens in this bihalf , wherin ye shall aswell doo a meritory dede as
to me a singuler pleaser , and cause me to shewe yow my good lordshep
in tyme comyng , wherfor in thies ye ne faile , as my trust is in yow .
PASTON,II,193.355.9557

AUTHOR:RICHARD_NEVILLE:MALE:_:1428:31?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38?
LETTER:PASTON_355:M4:1459?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And Crist haue yow in his blissed kepyng . PASTON,II,193.355.9558

AUTHOR:RICHARD_NEVILLE:MALE:_:1428:31?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38?
LETTER:PASTON_355:M4:1459?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Youen vnder my signet at London the ferst day of March .
PASTON,II,193.355.9559

AUTHOR:RICHARD_NEVILLE:MALE:_:1428:31?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:38?
LETTER:PASTON_355:M4:1459?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Richard Erl of Warrewyk PASTON,II,193.355.9560

AUTHOR:THOMAS_SCALES:MALE:_:1399?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_356:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
and for certain maters that I haue for to do , for the whiche <em>
maters I </em> sende vn-to you a squier of myn called Elyngham ,
praying you to gefe hym faythful credence of that he shal declare you
on myn behalfe as for this tyme . PASTON,II,194.356.9564

AUTHOR:THOMAS_SCALES:MALE:_:1399?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_

Elizabeth to such appointement as the brynger of +tis letter shal
informe you of , and do your trewe dilligence in +tis mater as +ge wyll
I do for you in any thyng +ge may haue ado in +tis cuntre` , which I
$wul do with al my herte . PASTON,II,195.358.9577

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:THOMAS_SCALES:MALE:_:1399?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_359:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
<font> To my right trusty and wel be-loued frend Jhon Paston , squier .
</font> PASTON,II,195.359.9581

AUTHOR:THOMAS_SCALES:MALE:_:1399?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_359:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
Right trusty and welbeloued frend , I grete you wel , thankyng you
hertely for +te gentilnes and good wyll I haue founde in you at all
tymes . PASTON,II,195.359.9582

AUTHOR:THOMAS_SCALES:MALE:_:1399?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_359:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
And for as myche as I and other stonde feffed in the landes of Thomas
Canon , which is in vareaunce betwene you and hym , if +ge wyll do so
mych as for your part chese ij lerned men and +te said Canon shal chese
other ij , +tey to juge +tis mater as they shal seme of right and reson
. PASTON,II,195.359.9583

AUTHOR:THOMAS_SCALES:MALE:_:1399?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_359:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
And if so be +tat the said Canon wyll not do so , I wyll not lete you
to suye hym after the forme of the Kynges lawe . PASTON,II,195.359.9584

AUTHOR:THOMAS_SCALES:MALE:_:1399?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_359:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
And if +ge thinke it to many lerned men , <P_II,196> take +ge on and he
a no+ter , PASTON,II,196.359.9585

AUTHOR:THOMAS_SCALES:MALE:_:1399?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_359:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
and if +tey may not accorde +ge and I to be vmpere ,
PASTON,II,196.359.9586

AUTHOR:THOMAS_SCALES:MALE:_:1399?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_359:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
for we stande bo+te in lik cas . PASTON,II,196.359.9587

LETTER:PASTON_359:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER

and my cousyn Ser Miles betwex my cousyn Bryan Stapylton and Elizabeth
Clere , and +tat +ge wyll sende me the said awarde be the bringer herof
. PASTON,II,196.361.9599

{ED:599._FROM_WILLIAM_YELVERTON_NOT_AFTER_1459,_4_OCTOBER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_YELVERTON:MALE:_:1400?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_363:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
<font> To my ryght wurchepfull cosyn John Paston , esquier . </font>
PASTON,II,197.363.9610

<P_II,198>

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_YELVERTON:MALE:_:1400?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_363:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
Right worchepful cosyn , I recomaunde me to yow , thankyng yow as
hertyly as I kan for my-selff , &c. , and specially for +tat ye do so
moche for Oure Ladyes hous of Walsyngham , which I trust veryly ye do
the rather for +te grete love +tat ye deme I haue +terto ;
PASTON,II,198.363.9611

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_YELVERTON:MALE:_:1400?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_363:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
for trewly if I be drawe to any worchep or wellfare , and discharge of
myn enmyes daunger , I ascryve it vnto Our Lady ; preyng yow +terfore
+tat ye woln ben as frendly to Oure Ladyes hous as I wote well ye haue
alwey ben , and in especyall now +tat I myght haue of yow the report
certeynly be your letter of +tat that Naunton your cosyn informyd yow
and told yow be mouthe of all maters towchyng Oure Ladyes hous of
Walsyngham . PASTON,II,198.363.9612

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_YELVERTON:MALE:_:1400?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_363:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
For me thynkyth be +tat I haue herde be Oure Ladys prest of Walsyngham
, if I vnderstode weell +tat mater , +tat it shuld do moch to the gode
spede of the mater ; PASTON,II,198.363.9613

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_YELVERTON:MALE:_:1400?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_363:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
and dought yow not Our Lady shall quyte it yow , and here poer priour
here-aftyr as he may , &c . PASTON,II,198.363.9614

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_YELVERTON:MALE:_:1400?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_363:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
Preyng yow also , cosyn , and avysyng , for the ease of vs both and of
our frendes and of mony other , +tat ye be at London be tymes +tis
terme , PASTON,II,198.363.9615

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_YELVERTON:MALE:_:1400?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_363:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
and if we spede well now , all well all +tis yere aftir ;
PASTON,II,198.363.9616

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_YELVERTON:MALE:_:1400?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_363:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
for I knowe veryly +ter was neuyr made gretter labour +tanne shall be
made now . PASTON,II,198.363.9617

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_YELVERTON:MALE:_:1400?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_363:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
And +terfore I prey to Our Lady help vs and her blissid Sone , which
haue you in his holy kepyng . PASTON,II,198.363.9618

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_YELVERTON:MALE:_:1400?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_363:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
Wreten at your poer place of Bayfeld on Sent Fraunces Day in hast .
PASTON,II,198.363.9619

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_YELVERTON:MALE:_:1400?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_363:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
+Gour cosyn William Yeluerton , Justice PASTON,II,198.363.9620

{ED:600._FROM_ELISABETH_CLERE_NOT_AFTER_1460,_EASTER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_CLERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_364:M4:1450S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
<font> To my worschepful cosyn John Paston be this letter delyuered in
hast . </font> PASTON,II,198.364.9621

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_CLERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_364:M4:1450S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Wurchepful cosyn , I recomaunde me to you . PASTON,II,198.364.9622

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_CLERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_364:M4:1450S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Like it you to wete that Stywardesson cam to me on Esterne Even to
chirch and preide me to be his good mastras , and wold put hym-self in
my rewle to do as I wil bidde <P_II,199> hym ; trustyng , he seid ,
+tat I wold take hym to grace the rather for his submyssion , for if
Judas , he seid , wold an asked grace of God he schuld an had it , and
for his sake that I had receyved that day +tat I wold take his
submyssion . PASTON,II,199.364.9623

, and that is whan I sent to his place to $distreyn for my dute`s ,
where he hath seid vntrewly +tat he was bete , vp-on which vntrewe
langgage his maister hath take an <em> accion ageyn </em> me and my men

<R_JOHN_PASTON_I> <R-GENDER_MALE> <R-REL_FATHER-IN-LAW> <R-DOB_1421>

<P_II,217>

{ED:614._FROM_RICHARD_CALLE_PERHAPS_ABOUT_1460,_17_OCTOBER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:39?
LETTER:PASTON_366:M4:1460?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Plesith it your maystership to witte that I haue receyved your letter
weche ye send to Robert Boteler , Elys , and to me be Robert Lynne for
the hors letour , weche I haue delyuerd hym and all the harneys .
PASTON,II,217.366.9690

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:39?
LETTER:PASTON_366:M4:1460?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
And as for that ye write to me for to gete you a fermour to the maner
<P_II,218> londes at Mauteby , in good feyth sawyng your displesure I
can non geete therto in no wice ; wherfore I sende John Deye to you
that he may haue appoyntment how that he shall be rwled ,
PASTON,II,218.366.9691

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_?

LETTER:PASTON_366:M4:1460?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
for I can non other-wice feele be hym but that he wol not passe j combe
barly for an acre . PASTON,II,218.366.9692

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_?

LETTER:PASTON_366:M4:1460?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
but I suppose and ye wolde aggre` to pay from you vj li. in money for
the brekyng therof I can thynk I shuld fynd you iij men wold take it to
ferme for vij yere , so that they myght not pay no money the furst and
the ij=de= yere , and at the iij=de= yere to paye you for euery acre
xij d. , and so yerely xij d. for an acre duryng v of her laste yeres ,
weche shulde drawe clerely that schulde come to you xxiiij li. and the
seid vj li. payed to them . PASTON,II,218.366.9697

esquyer , in hast . </font> PASTON,II,219.367.9719

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:39
LETTER:PASTON_367:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Rygth worchipfull and my most speciall synguler good maister , I
recomend me to you , besechyng your maisterchip not to be dysplesed
with my long taryans and also to take it to no gref thou it were long
or I wrot to you , PASTON,II,219.367.9720

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:39
LETTER:PASTON_367:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
for in good feyth I wend my-self with jn sevenygth after Seynt
Feythesmesse to haue ben at London . PASTON,II,219.367.9721

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:39

&c. , I promysed hym so to do , and tarye tyll the Munday after Seynt
Feythesmesse or tyll the Tewysday sevenyth after at the ferthest .
PASTON,II,219.367.9722

<P_II,221>

{ED:617._FROM_FRIAR_JOHN_BRACKLEY_1460,_24_OCTOBER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_BRACKLEY:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:39
LETTER:PASTON_369:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
<font> To the rite worschipful esqwyre Jon Paston be this presentid .
</font> PASTON,II,221.369.9744

AUTHOR:JOHN_BRACKLEY:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:39
LETTER:PASTON_369:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Jesus , Maria , Johannes Baptista , Franciscus , cum sanctis omnibus ,
assistant vobis vestris in laboribus . Amen . PASTON,II,221.369.9745

AUTHOR:JOHN_BRACKLEY:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:39
LETTER:PASTON_369:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Worschipful and most interely bitrustid mayster and specyal frend ,
after dvte` of al lowly recommendacyon +ge schal conceyue that I
certefye +gow for trewthe I comonyd late wyth a worschipful and a wele
namyd , a good thrifty man of this cuntre` , whiche told me in secrete
wyse that he herd Doctowr Aleyn seyn after the parlement of Covintre`
that yf the lordys that tyme reynyng and now discessid myte haf standyn
in gouernauns , that Forteskv the Justise , Doctowr Moreton , Jon
Heydon , Thorp , and he schuld be made for evir ;
PASTON,II,221.369.9746

AUTHOR:JOHN_BRACKLEY:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:39
LETTER:PASTON_369:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and yf it turnyd to contrary wyse it schuld growe to here fynal
confusyon and vttyr destruccyon , for why , the parlyows writing and
the myschevous inditing was ymaginid , contrivid , and vtterly
concludid by here most vengeable labowr , &c. , and here most malicyows
conspiracye ayens the innocent lordys , knytis , gentilis , and comonys
, and alle here jssv perpetuel , &c . PASTON,II,221.369.9747

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:39
LETTER:PASTON_369:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And as I wrote last to +gowr maysterschip , the text of Jeremie c=o=
8=o= , ' Vere mendacium operatus est stilus mendax scribarum ' ;
PASTON,II,221.369.9748

which is Holy Scripture , &c. , as I wold do by-fore the Kyng and hise

that ther may be taken an axion in my feffe`s name and myn a-yenst
Jamys Catte as you semeth beest , and as hasty processe as may be had
a-yenst hym , with your goode avice ; PASTON,II,223.370.9759

PASTON,II,226.371.9781

<P_II,227>

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_371:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
Right trusty and right welbeloued , I grete you wele .
PASTON,II,227.371.9782

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_371:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
And I am enfourmed that William Mathew of Norwich , bocher , hath
brought an accyon of dette agayn Nicholas Hert , a tenaunt of myn ,
berer herof , and hath supposid by his accyon that my said tenaunt
shuld ow hym lxx s. for his hire of tyme that he shuld a ben seruaunt
to my said tenaunt ; wher it is said to me for trouthe that he was
aprentyce to my said tenaunt and neuer otherwise withholde but as
aprentice , and owith no mony to haf of hym . PASTON,II,227.371.9783

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_371:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
I send to yow my said tenaunt to gif yow clere informacyon of the mater
. PASTON,II,227.371.9784

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_371:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
And I pray you that ye wole calle the jurry before yow that arn
impanellid betwen thaym and opne thaym the mater at large at myn
instaunce , and desire thaym to do as concyens wole and to eschue
periury . PASTON,II,227.371.9785

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_371:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
And the Trinite` kepe yow . PASTON,II,227.371.9786

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_371:M4:1450S:COPY:OTHER
If ye take the mater in rule I pray therof PASTON,II,227.371.9787

{ED:626._FROM_THOMAS_DENYS_1461,_PROBABLY_APRIL-MAY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_373:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
<font> To my Maister Paston . </font> PASTON,II,230.373.9813

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_373:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
I lowly recomaund me to your maistership , thankyng you as a pouer man
may do his maister for socouryng my wyf , which I wote wele is wo
begone ; prayng you for love of Our Lord Jesu Criste to take no
displesir though <P_II,231> I not sent ne wrote to you herbeforn in
this troble that I haf ; PASTON,II,231.373.9814

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_373:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
for parde` ye may conceyve that I was besy j-nogh to shifft my-self til
now . PASTON,II,231.373.9815

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_373:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Truly the noise cam sodeynly PASTON,II,231.373.9816

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_373:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and I was with-ynne the walles of your cite` , PASTON,II,231.373.9817

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_373:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
God sauf the gouernour therof PASTON,II,231.373.9818

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_373:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
for he was besy to trappe me , more besy than he wole be a-know , et
per fenestram in sporta dimissus sum per murum , et sic effugi manus
eius ; PASTON,II,231.373.9819

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_373:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
but he shal abye , by God , if I lyf , for serchyng myn house .
PASTON,II,231.373.9820

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_373:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And , ser , as for the fals noise , sauf your reuerence , that he leyth
on me and on tweyn seruauntz of myn , he lyeth falsly , your reuerence
savid ; PASTON,II,231.373.9821

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_373:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
for I may haf an c persones notable and thriffty , whan tyme comyth ,
that wole prove and make good by euery meane that my seruauntz which he
nameth wer that same our at Brisle` , which is thens more than xvj myle
, and that the same our and the same day and a greet space bothe beforn
and afftir . PASTON,II,231.373.9822

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_373:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER

to do my wif help and comfort in hir dissese ; PASTON,II,231.373.9823

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_373:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
for if she wer not , God knowith , I shuld soone shyfft ,
PASTON,II,231.373.9824

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40

maister and comfort to hir . PASTON,II,231.373.9825

boy that is hurt dey to meve your tenauntz in that hundrid wher he was
bete to do for me and myn ; PASTON,II,231.373.9827

{ED:628._FROM_THOMAS_PLAYTER_1461,_EARLY_MAY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_374:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
<font> To my rigth reuerent and worchipfull John Paston , esquyer , or
to my maystres his wyf . </font> PASTON,II,233.374.9845

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_374:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
After my most special recomendacion , lyke your maisterchip wete that
the mater for you and my maistrez your moder ayens Powtrell and Tanfeld
hath ben called vppon as dylygently and as hastely this terme as it
mygth be , and al-way dayes yoven hem by the court to answer ;
PASTON,II,233.374.9846

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_374:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and than thei toke smale excepcions PASTON,II,233.374.9847

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_374:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and trifeled forth the court , PASTON,II,233.374.9848

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_374:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and al-wey excused them by-cause the bylle is long and his councell had
no leyser to se it . PASTON,II,233.374.9849

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_374:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
And they prayed heryng of the testament of my maister your fader ,
PASTON,II,233.374.9850

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_374:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and ther-of made a no+ter mater PASTON,II,233.374.9851

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_374:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and argued it to putte hem fro it be-cause they had emparled to vs
by-fore ; PASTON,II,233.374.9852

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_374:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and than Hyllyngworth , to dryve it over this terme , allegged varians
be-twyx the bille and the testament , that John Damme was named in the
testament John Dawne , jn whiche cas now the court must have sigth of
the said testement . Where-fore ye must send it vp the be-gynnyng of
the next terme , or ell we schall haue no sped in the mater .
PASTON,II,233.374.9853

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_374:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
And ther-for , maistres , if my maister be not com hom and ye haue not
the sayd testament jn your kepyng , that than it plese you to speke
vn-to my maistres your moder jn lawe for the sayd testament , that I
mygth redely haue it here and that it be sealed jn a box and sent to me
, PASTON,II,233.374.9854

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_374:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and I schall kepe it safe , with Goddys grace . PASTON,II,233.374.9855

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40

Wylchir is hed is sette on London Brigge . PASTON,II,233.374.9856

{ED:629._FROM_THOMAS_DENYS_1461,_MAY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_375:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
<font> To my Maister Paston . </font> PASTON,II,234.375.9864

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_375:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Right wurshipfull and myn especiall good maister , I recomaund me to
yow with all my seruice , besechyng you hertily at the reuerence of God
to help me now in the grettest extremite` that I cam at sith my greet
trobil with Ingham . PASTON,II,234.375.9865

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_375:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
It is not oute of your remenbraunce how Twyer jn Norffolk vexith me
bothe-3 by noise and serchyng myn hous for me so that theer I can not
be in quyete ; PASTON,II,234.375.9866

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_375:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and all that , I am verrily acerteyned , is by Heydons crafft .
PASTON,II,234.375.9867

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_375:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And heer in the Kynges house annenst Howard , wher I had hopid to a
relevid my-self , I am supplanted and cast oute from hym by a clamour
of all his seruauntes at onys ; PASTON,II,234.375.9868

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_375:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and ne wer oonly that his disposicion acordyth not to my pouer conceyte
, which makith me to gif lesse force , PASTON,II,234.375.9869

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_375:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
be-cause I desire not to dele ther bribery is like to be vsid ,
PASTON,II,234.375.9870

AUTHOR:THOMAS_DENYS:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_375:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
ellis by my trouth this vnhappy vnkyndenes wold I trow a killed me .
PASTON,II,234.375.9871

and pray yow , as owre trust is in yow , that if ye or any of yowre men
here that Howard purposith hym to make any aray at owre manor of Wynche
that ye woll lete John Keche , owre kepere ther-of , haue wetyng by
tymes ; PASTON,II,235.376.9892

{ED:631._FROM_THOMAS_PLAYTER_1461,_JUNE}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_377:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
<font> To my rigth good maister John Paston in all hast . </font>
PASTON,II,235.377.9896

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_377:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
After my most special recomendacion , please your maisterche {ED:p}
wete the Kyng , be-cause of the sege a-boute Carelylle , chaunged his
day of coronacion to be vppon the Sunday nexst after Seynt John
Baptyste , to th'entent to spede hym northward in all hast ;
PASTON,II,235.377.9897

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_377:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and how be it , blyssed be God , that he hath now good tytyngges that
Lord Mountagu hath broken the sege and slayn of Scottes vj m=l= and ij
knygthes , wherof Lord Clyffordes brother is on , yet not wythstandyng
he wol be crowned the sayd Sunday . PASTON,II,235.377.9898

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_377:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
And John <P_II,236> Jeney enfourmed me , and as I haue verely lerned
sethen , ye arn jnbylled to be made knygth at this coronacion .
PASTON,II,236.377.9899

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_377:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Wheder ye haue vnderstandyng before hand I wot not ;
PASTON,II,236.377.9900

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_377:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
but and it lyke you to take the worchip vppon you , consyderyng the
comfortable tytynges a-fore sayd , and for the gladnesse and plesour of
al your welwyllers and to the pyne and dyscomfort of all your
jlle-wyllers , it were tyme your gere necessarye on that by-halfe were
purveyd fore . PASTON,II,236.377.9901

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_377:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
And also ye had nede higth you to London , PASTON,II,236.377.9902

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_377:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
for as I conceyve the knygthes schuln be made vppon the Saterday by-for
+te coronacion . PASTON,II,236.377.9903

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_377:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
And as moche as may be purveyed for you in secrete wyse withouten cost
I schall by-speke for you if nede be , a-yens your comyng , jn trust of
the best . PASTON,II,236.377.9904

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_377:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT

litel councel and seide ye were straungely disposed ,
PASTON,II,236.378.9914

and so he sent me worde that an answere schulde be made be Sothwell to
the Kyng , seyng that ij or iij eyers had ben with my lorde and shewed
her evidence and delyuerd it to my lorde , seyng +tey haue had gret
wrong , besechyng my lorde +tat it myght be reformed ; werfore he
comaunded me that I shulde go hom , PASTON,II,237.378.9926

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_378:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
So I aboode vppon Sothwell to a know my lordes answer to the Kyng ,
weche answere Sothwel tolde me was +tat he writeth to the Kyng that
certeine pointes in your letteres be vntrew and that he schal preue
suche tyme as he cometh be-for the Kyng , besechyng the Kyng to take it
to no displesur , PASTON,II,237.378.9928

with his Highnesse , PASTON,II,237.378.9929

and Ser William Chamberleine was ther ij dayes a-fore I come thider , I
can thynke for the same mater . PASTON,II,237.378.9934

wherfore me semeth it were right wele don , savyng your better advice ,
to come hom and sele vp your evidence and haue hem with you to London ,
to proue his titill noght . PASTON,II,237.378.9936

{ED:637._JOHN_BERNEY_OF_WITCHINGHAM_TO_PASTON_WILLIAM_ROKEWODE_146
1,_10_JULY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:KIN:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:KIN:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_381:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_OTHER
<font> To the worshipfull John Paston and Wylliam Rokewode , squyeris ,
and to euerych of them . </font> PASTON,II,241.381.9984

AUTHOR:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:KIN:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:KIN:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_381:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_OTHER
Right worshipfull cosynes , I recummaund me to +gow .
PASTON,II,241.381.9985

AUTHOR:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:KIN:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:KIN:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_381:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_OTHER
And for as mech as that I am credybilly informyd how that Sir Mylis
Stapylton , knyght , with other yll dysposyd persones , defame and
falsly noyse me in morderyng of Thomas Denys the crowner , and how that
I intend to make jnsurrexcyones contrari vnto the lawe ; and that the
seyd Stapylton fer+termore noyseth me with gret robries ; jn whech
defamacyones and fals noysynges the seyd Stapylton &c. in that his
saying he is fals , that knowith God . PASTON,II,241.381.9986

AUTHOR:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:KIN:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:KIN:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_381:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_OTHER
And for my playn acquetayll , yf he or any substancyall gentylman wyll
say it and avow it , I say to it contrari and by lisens of the Kyng to
make it good as a gentylman . PASTON,II,241.381.9987

AUTHOR:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:KIN:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:KIN:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_381:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_OTHER
And in this my playn exskeus I pray +gow to opyn it vnto the lordes
that the seyd Stapylton &c. makyn gret gaderynges of the Kynges
rebelyones , lying in wayte to mordre me . PASTON,II,241.381.9988

AUTHOR:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:KIN:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:KIN:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_381:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_OTHER
And in that I may make opyn proff , &c . PASTON,II,241.381.9989

AUTHOR:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:KIN:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:KIN:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_381:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_OTHER
Wretyn in hast the x day of July A=o= r. r. E. iiij j=o= .
PASTON,II,241.381.9990

AUTHOR:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:KIN:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:KIN:1421:40

John Berneye PASTON,II,241.381.9991

PASTON,II,241.381.9992

{ED:638._JOHN_BERNEY_OF_WITCHINGHAM_TO_PASTON_ROKEWODE_1461,_16_JU LY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:KIN:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:KIN:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_382:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_OTHER
<font> To the worshipfull John Paston and to my cosyn Wylliam Rokewode
, squyer , with my lord of Cauntyrburi . </font> PASTON,II,242.382.9993

AUTHOR:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:KIN:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:KIN:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_382:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_OTHER
Right worshipfull sir , I recummaund me to +gow , praying +gow hertyli
to labur for that the Kyng may wryte vnto me gevyng me thankyng of +te
good wyll and servyse that I haff doo vnto hym and in beyng with hym
a-+gens his aduersaries and rebelyones as well in the North as in this
cuntre` of Norffolk . PASTON,II,242.382.9994

AUTHOR:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:KIN:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:KIN:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_382:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_OTHER
And in that the Kyng shold please the comynnes in this cuntre` ,

hold at Wysbyche , and had ben delyuered nor had Fraunceys Costard a
taken suerte` of pees of hym ; PASTON,II,245.384.10021

LETTER:PASTON_385:M4:1460S:COPY:OTHER

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_SR:MALE:_:1408?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_385:M4:1460S:COPY:OTHER
And where as it is not <P_II,246> vnknowen to yow that we wrot a bille
to Maister Brakle` and yaf hym in comaundement to delyuer yow a bille
jndentyd of x mark owyng to John of Fen , as it apperith by a bille
jndentyd vnder the seall of Robert Reppes , jentylman , wich by the
will of John of Fen is due vn-to vs , wher-of the sayd Robert shuld
paye v mark by his owne jnstaunce at Lammesse next comyng ; we pray yow
that ye woll receyve the forsayd money for vs and delyuer it vn-to
Maister Brakle` as we trust yow . PASTON,II,246.385.10034

the tenure of whych was how ye were entretyd there .

comendyd gretly and seyd that he stood well in conseyt and dayly shuld
increse , and he was well in aqueyntaunce and be-louyd with jentilmen
aboute the Kyng . PASTON,II,247.386.10051
