RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_387:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
<font> To my right worshipfull master John Paston the older , squier .
</font> PASTON,II,247.387.10066

AUTHOR:JOHN_PAMPYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_387:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Please yowr mastirship to wete that I haue be at Cotton and spoke wyth
Edward Dale , PASTON,II,247.387.10067

AUTHOR:JOHN_PAMPYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_387:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and he told me that Yeluerton and Jenney were there on Friday and toke
a distresse of xxvj or more bullokkes of the seid <P_II,248> Edwardes
in the park and drofe hem to a town therby ; PASTON,II,248.387.10068

AUTHOR:JOHN_PAMPYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_387:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and a neyghbore there , vndirstandyng the bestes were Edward Dalis ,
and bond hym to pay the ferme or ellis to bryng in the bestes be a day
. PASTON,II,248.387.10069

AUTHOR:JOHN_PAMPYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_387:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
And whan the seid Edward vndirstod the takyng of the seid bestes he
went to Yeluerton and Jenney PASTON,II,248.387.10070

AUTHOR:JOHN_PAMPYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_387:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and bond hym in an obligacion of x li. to pay hem his ferme at
Mighelmes , whech I told hym was not well do ; PASTON,II,248.387.10071

LETTER:PASTON_387:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
for I told hym ye had be abill to saue hym harmeles .
PASTON,II,248.387.10072

other-wise do . PASTON,II,248.387.10073

<P_II,249>

{ED:645._FROM_JAMES_GLOYS_1461,_24_SEPTEMBER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

<P_II,250>

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_388:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Right reuerent and wurchepfull ser , I recomand me to your gode
maystershep , prayng you to wete +tat I was at Blakkes and spake with
his wiffe , and she seth he was not at home this iij wekes , he ridith
vp +te countre` to take accomptes of balys , and +tat +tis day
sevennyght he shuld haue sotyn in Caystre by you vp-on accountes and
fro thens he shuld haue redyn to Lynne , and +tat he shall be at home
vn Monday at nyght next comyng ; wherefore I haue left my heraund with
here , PASTON,II,250.388.10111

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_388:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
but she seth +tat he shall not mown comyn to you
PASTON,II,250.388.10112

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_388:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
for my lady haue sent for hym in gret hast bothyn be a letter and be a
tokyn to comyn to here as hastly as he may . PASTON,II,250.388.10113

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_388:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Notwithstandyng she shall do the herand to hym .
PASTON,II,250.388.10114

AUTHOR:JAMES_GLOYS:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_388:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
$As $for {TEXT:Asfor} Yeluerton , I dede a gode fele to enquere of
Yemmys Skynner whan +te seid Yeluerton shuld go to London .
PASTON,II,250.388.10115

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_388:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT

LETTER:PASTON_388:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
he cowde not tell what day till he had spokyn with his son .
PASTON,II,250.388.10117

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_388:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Hes sone shuld come to hym or his master shuld ridyn .
PASTON,II,250.388.10118

LETTER:PASTON_388:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT

{ED:646._FROM_HENRY_WINDSOR_1461,_4_OCTOBER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:HENRY_WINDSOR:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_389:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
<font> To my full worshipfull and speciall gode maister John Paston ,
squyer , abidyng at Norwich . </font> PASTON,II,250.389.10136

<P_II,251>

AUTHOR:HENRY_WINDSOR:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_389:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Right worshipfull ser and some tyme my moost speciall gode maister , I
recommaunde me vnto your gode maistership with all my pour seruice if
it mey in any wise suffice . PASTON,II,251.389.10137

AUTHOR:HENRY_WINDSOR:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_389:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
And furthermore , ser , I beseche you , nowe beyng in your countre`
where ye mey deily call vnto you my maister Ser Thomas Howys , ones to
remembre my pour mater , and by your discrecions to take suche a
direccion theryn and so to conclude as mey be to your discharge and to
my furtherance , accordyng to the will of hym that is passed vnto Gode
, whose soull I pray Jesu pardone ; PASTON,II,251.389.10138

AUTHOR:HENRY_WINDSOR:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_389:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
for truly , ser , thar was in hym no faute , but in me onely , yf it be
not as I haue remembred your maistership affore thy {ED:s} tyme .
PASTON,II,251.389.10139

AUTHOR:HENRY_WINDSOR:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_389:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
For truly , ser , I dar sey I shuld haue had as speciall and as gode a
maister of you as any pour man , as I am , withyn England shuld haue
hadd of a worshipfull man , as ye ar , yf ye had neuer medulled the
godez of my Maister F. , and asmoche ye wold haue done and labored fore
me in my right if it hadde byn in the handez of any oder man than of
your-self onely . PASTON,II,251.389.10140

AUTHOR:HENRY_WINDSOR:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40

$shall $be {TEXT:shalbe} content with . PASTON,II,251.389.10141

Paston . </font> PASTON,II,253.390.10161

<P_II,254>

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_

LETTER:PASTON_390:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Plesith it your maystreschip to witte that Maystre John and I , with
other mo , haue ben at Cotton on Friday last passed , and there Jenney
had do warned the corte there to be the same Friday , and he was at Eye
at the cescions the Thorsday be-fore . PASTON,II,254.390.10162

corte there , PASTON,II,254.390.10163

desired to put your matre in a trety , in so moche that Maystre John
Bolleman tolde to my Maystre John Paston diuerse of your elmees had
labored to my lorde to haue a trety if he cowde brynge it a-boute , &c
. PASTON,II,254.390.10169

that ye woll safe hem harmeles ; PASTON,II,254.390.10186

for they sey there that my lorde of Cauntyrbury and other lordes woll
relese to hem , notwithstandyng +tat I haue enformed hem other-wice .
Wherfore , savyng your better advice , me semethe it were ryght weele
doo that ye had a letter of my lorde of Cauntirbury and other to the
tenauntes <P_II,255> of Cotton that it is her wyll and entent that ye
schulde haue the rwle and gouernaunce and receyue the money of that
maner and other that were Ser John Fastolff , on whom God haue mercy ;
PASTON,II,255.390.10194

{ED:649._FROM_RICHARD_CALLE_1461,_5_NOVEMBER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_391:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
<font> To my moost reuerent and wurshipfful mastre , my Mastre John
Paston of the Enner Temple , this be delyuerd . </font>
PASTON,II,256.391.10200

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_391:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Plesith your maystreship to vndrestande that as for the ferme that
Cheseman had in Boyton , that is to sey xl acre lond erable , j medwe ,
and other smale parcelles , payng yerly for it iiij li. , {TEXT:weche}
I can not lete the xl acre lond a-bowe xl comb barly or xl s. , and ye
to bere al charges of the reparaucion and fense aboute the place ,
weche shulde be gret cost . PASTON,II,256.391.10201

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_391:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
The londe is so out of tylthe that a-nedes any man wol geve any thyng
for it . PASTON,II,256.391.10202

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_391:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Ther can no man lete it to the walwe that {to}_P it was lete be-fore ,
PASTON,II,256.391.10203

LETTER:PASTON_391:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and that I reporte me to my maystre Ser Thomas Howys not be gret gold .
PASTON,II,256.391.10204

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:40

Wherfore I wol not do therin vnto the tyme that I haue answere from
your mastreship , weche I beseche you it may be in hast .
PASTON,II,256.391.10205

PASTON,II,256.391.10207

that I departed from you last iiij li. and ij s. , with the weche money
I haue bought lenen clothe for schetes , schertes , and smokkes , and
sent it thedre like as ye comaunded me to do . PASTON,II,257.392.10212

LETTER:PASTON_392:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
He goude not sey nay be-fore me and other men of Wynterton , but that
the mone` whas taken hym to this entent . Wherfore pleace it your
mastrechip and my Mastre Clement to se som remedy , that the pore man
loce it nought . PASTON,II,258.392.10239

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_

Plese your mastreschip to remembre the letter weche I send you the last
weke , &c . PASTON,II,258.392.10240

{ED:651._FROM_SIR_JOHN_HEVENINGHAM_1461,_12_DECEMBER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_HEVENINGHAM:MALE:_:1577:-116
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_393:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
<font> To myn ryght worchipffull cosyn John Paston the elder , esquyer
, be this letter deliuered in hast . </font> PASTON,II,258.393.10243

AUTHOR:JOHN_HEVENINGHAM:MALE:_:1577:-116
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_393:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Ryght worchipfull cosyn , I recomaunde me to you in as hertely wyse
{in}_P I can , desyryng euer to here off youre welffare , whiche I
beseche oure Lord Jesu to preserue to youre hertes pleaser , &c .
PASTON,II,258.393.10244

AUTHOR:JOHN_HEVENINGHAM:MALE:_:1577:-116
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_393:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Ser , ye sent me a letter off atorney to reseyue and to ocupye in youre
name +te maner called Burnevyles in Nakton . PASTON,II,258.393.10245

AUTHOR:JOHN_HEVENINGHAM:MALE:_:1577:-116

LETTER:PASTON_393:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Ser , as for that ocupacion I can litil skylle on ,
PASTON,II,258.393.10246

LETTER:PASTON_393:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
ne I wel not take <P_II,259> vp-on me non suche ocupacionis ; wherffore
I beseche you holde me excused , PASTON,II,259.393.10247

for it is no werd for me to take suche ocupacionis .

PASTON,II,259.393.10251

mersyffull kepyng . PASTON,II,259.393.10252

{ED:653._FROM_RICHARD_CALLE_1461,_29_DECEMBER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_394:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
<font> To my ryght reuerent and my moost wurschipfull maystere , my
Maystre John Paston . </font> PASTON,II,261.394.10254

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_394:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Right wurshipfull and my mooste reuerent mastre , I recomaunde me vnto
your goode maystreship . PASTON,II,261.394.10255

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_394:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Like you to witte on Childremasse Daye there were moche people at
Norwich at the shire , be-cauce it was noyced in the shire that the
vndresheriff had a writte to make a newe aleccion ; wherfore the people
was greved be-cauce they had labored so often , seyng to the sherif
that he had the writte and pleynly he shulde not a-wey vnto the tyme
the writte were redd . PASTON,II,261.394.10256

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_394:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
The sherif answerd and seyd that he had no writte , nor west who had it
. PASTON,II,261.394.10257

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_394:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Hervppon the people peacyd and stilled vnto the tyme the shire was
doone , PASTON,II,261.394.10258

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_394:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and after that doone the people called vppon hym , ' Kylle hym ,
PASTON,II,261.394.10259

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:40

heede hym ! ' PASTON,II,261.394.10260

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_394:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and kept fast the dores vnto the tyme the meyer was sent fore , and the
sherif , to strenght hym and to convey hem a-wey , or ell he had be
slayne . Wherfor diuers of the $thrifty men come to me desiryng that I
shulde writte vnto your maistreship to lete you haue vndrestandyng of
the gidyng of the people , for they be full sory of this trowble ; and
that it plese you to sende hem your advice how they shal be gided and
rwled , PASTON,II,261.394.10265

{ED:654._FROM_THOMAS_PLAYTER_1461,_DECEMBER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_395:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
<font> To John Paston the older in hast , and if he be not at London
than to be delyuered $to Clement Paston in hast . </font>
PASTON,II,262.395.10280

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_395:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Lyke your maisterchip wete that at the last cessyons Erpyngham hundred
and o+ter hundredys ther-aboute were not warned , and the schreff
excused hym be-cause he cowde not knowe who was officer there .
PASTON,II,262.395.10281

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_395:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Item , Yeluerton lete the pepoll vnderstand that the Kyng wold haue his
lawes kept , and that he was dysplesed with the maner of ther gaderyng
and that he wold haue it amendyd ; PASTON,II,262.395.10282

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_395:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
for he conceyveth that the hole body of the shire is well dysposed and
that the ille dysposed pepoll is but of a corner of +te hole shire ,
and yet that ther mysdoyng growyth not of ther owyn dysposysyon but of
+te abbettement and steryng of sum ille dysposed persones whiche is
vnderstand and knowe to +te Kynges Hygthnesse . PASTON,II,262.395.10283

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_395:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Item , he lete hem wete that +te Kyng had commandyd hym to sey if ther
were ony man , pore or ryche , that had cause to complayne of ony
person that he schuld put vp his bylle to the shref and hym , and they
schuld set a reule be-twyx hem ; PASTON,II,262.395.10284

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_395:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and if he wold not a-byde ther reule they schuld delyuer the sayd bylle
of compleynt to +te Kynges Hignesse PASTON,II,262.395.10285

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_395:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and he schuld set rewle and suche dyreccion that the party compleynaunt
or deffendaunt schuld be punysshed for his dysobeysauns of the said
rewle if the case requyred . PASTON,II,262.395.10286

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_395:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
And also more-ouer , if ther were ony person that put vp ony suche
bylle and it mygth apere to them by ther examinacion or o+ter-wyse fals
or vntrewe , or ell be-cause of malyce , that than suche compleynauntes
schuld sharpely be punysshed . PASTON,II,262.395.10287

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_395:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
And than whan he had seyd this and moche more in dyscoragyng to +te
pepoll to put bylles , as after my conseyt , he reported hym to +te
schref ther present that +te Kyng thus commanded hem thus to sey ,
desyreng +te said schref if ony thyng of +te <P_II,263> Kynges
commaunded were be-hynd vnspoken by hym-self that he wold remembre and
help forth to telle it . PASTON,II,263.395.10288

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_395:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
And than the schref said lyke as he rehersed the Kyng commanded , and
more-ouer that the Kyng named ij men , by name Tudenham and Haydon ,
PASTON,II,263.395.10289

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_395:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and if ony man wold put ony bylles a-yens them he said in feythfull
wyse he wold help hem and forther +te mater to +te Kynges Higthnesse .
PASTON,II,263.395.10290

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40
LETTER:PASTON_395:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
And for his demenyng there euery man thougth hym rigth wel dysposed ;
PASTON,II,263.395.10291

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:40

{ED:656._JOAN_KETERYCHE,_ABBESS_OF_DENNY_ABOUT_1461-2,_31_JANUARY} _@

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOAN_KETERYCHE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_396:M4:1462:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To +te right worschipfull jentilman Paiston , executure to Syr
John Fostolff . </font> PASTON,II,265.396.10311

AUTHOR:JOAN_KETERYCHE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_396:M4:1462:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Iesus PASTON,II,265.396.10312

AUTHOR:JOAN_KETERYCHE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_396:M4:1462:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Reuerent and worschipfull syr , aftyre due recomendacoun premisyd ,
plesythe +gou at +te reuerens of owre spouse Iesu , to qwom we be
wilfully professyd , to here gracyousely owre humble petyscioun , as
nowe compellyd eythere to compleyn vs eythere ellez to suffre owre
devout place falle and perysche in owre dayis , qwyche hathe been so
longe tyme wrongffully oppressid be plee for owre beste and moste
substancyal lyuelode ; so +tat owre goode and holsom modyre +tat was
abbesse is so weriyd and brokyn wyth thowt +tat sche is ouere-throwyn
wyth daily seeknes , vn-habill to occupie +te offyz , and we compellyd
a+gens owre wille , +gif it myht odyrvyse a been , to chese anodyre ,
be +te qwyche eleccioun aftyre owre custume we muste paye to +te
Bischope of Lyncolne xx marke and to +te Bischope of Norwyche as myche
. PASTON,II,265.396.10313

AUTHOR:JOAN_KETERYCHE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_396:M4:1462:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And as to +te payment of +te Bischope of Lyncolne we be so streytly
boundyn +tat +te seyde lord may streyne owre goodys of +te qwyche we
haue owre nescessary sustenaunce ; PASTON,II,265.396.10314

AUTHOR:JOAN_KETERYCHE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_396:M4:1462:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and nowt only we be thuse putte in discomforte and hevynesse ,
PASTON,II,265.396.10315

AUTHOR:JOAN_KETERYCHE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_396:M4:1462:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
but also owre jeuellys , qwyche were ordeynid of owre fyrste fundacoun
to araye owre chyrche and to stere vsse and provoke othere to worschipe
God and to haue owre benefactoris in more fresche remembraunz , are now
for nede leyde in morgage and summe loste for euere , ande othere in
haste lyke to be loste , PASTON,II,265.396.10316

AUTHOR:JOAN_KETERYCHE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_396:M4:1462:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and +terto owre placys besyde alle +tis misery are so far decayde be
noun-reparacoun +tat we may <P_II,266> nowt weel repayre +tem a+geen ,
PASTON,II,266.396.10317

AUTHOR:JOAN_KETERYCHE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_396:M4:1462:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and so owre tenauntys are +te more pore PASTON,II,266.396.10318

and +te wersse +tei mey paye to vs +te deute`z of +teire fermes ;
PASTON,II,266.396.10319

AUTHOR:JOAN_KETERYCHE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_396:M4:1462:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and , reuerent syr , I beynge ful symple and +gonge of age and chosyn
to be $abbesse of +tis wrongfully oppressyd place , God knowyth ful
myche a+gens my will , jn my compleynt makyng to God I was put in mynde
of +te goodys +tat been in +goure handys , and also of +goure holsom
and goode disposiscoun ; qwyche +gaue me a gret corage to make my
petyscoun to +gou for +te recouere of owre pore place , besechynge
+goure goodenesse to consydre how we be closyd wyth-jnne +te ston
wallys and may non odyrvyse speke wyth +gou but only be wrytynge , and
+te ratheere socoure vs for Owre Lordys loue wyth sweche goodys as we
may contynue stylle +te servaunt of Iesu , and odyre aftyre vs in lyke
vyse ; +te qwyche we wolde thynke to vs as a newe fundacoun .
PASTON,II,266.396.10320

AUTHOR:JOAN_KETERYCHE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_396:M4:1462:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And so in owre suffragys we wolde annexe +te soule of +tat worthi knyht
Syr John Fastolff and swyche odyre as +ge will desyre vn-to +te soule
of owre blyssid foundatrice ; PASTON,II,266.396.10321

AUTHOR:JOAN_KETERYCHE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_396:M4:1462:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and , worschipful syr , it is more esy as +geet to releve vs vp a+geen
+tan to belde a newe place , qwyche I truste veryli +ge wolde doo +gif
+ge knewe +te blyssid dispocissioun of my weel disposyd modris and
sustris ; be qwos goode conuersacoun I trust in Iesu to haue of +gou
summe socoure and comfort now at my moste hevy begynnynge .
PASTON,II,266.396.10322

truste verily to God we schulde haue +gou and +gouris euere aftyre in

experience of alle owre jnportable hurtys before rehersyd , +te qwyche
trewly was +te cause +tat he wold of his owne coostis be messangere .
PASTON,II,266.396.10324

is this , that ther was made an exchaunge be the graunsyre of my
husbondys Mundeford , vn hose sowle God haue mercy , of the maner of
Gressenale with the aunsetrys of Rows for the maner of Estlexham , the
qwych is parte of my juntor ; PASTON,II,267.397.10330

and at the tyme of the exchaunge made the tayles and evydens of bothe
for-seyd manerys were delyuered vn-to the partyes indeferently , be the
avyse of men lernyd . Qwerfor I beshech you that it plese you to take
the grete labor vpon you to informe my lordys good lordchep of the
trowthe in the forme a-bowyn wreton , and that it plese you to
vndyrstande qwedyr that my lord wyll a-byde be the feffment made to hym
or not ; and that it shall plese my lord that I may haue right as lawe
requeryt , PASTON,II,267.397.10338

, beshechyng you to pardon me of my symple wrytyng ,

<R_JOHN_PASTON_I> <R-GENDER_MALE> <R-REL_FATHER-IN-LAW> <R-DOB_1421>

<P_II,271>

{ED:661._FROM_RICHARD_CALLE_PROBABLY_1462,_1_FEBRUARY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_398:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
<font> To the ryght reverent and my mooste $wurschipful maistre , my
Maistre John Paston , in the Inneer Tempyll . </font>
PASTON,II,271.398.10345

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_398:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Plesith it your maistreschip to witte that I haue been at Burnewylles
in Nacton to receyve the rentes and fermys of the tenauntes .
PASTON,II,271.398.10346

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_398:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
And I vndrestande be them and be Robert Goordon that Mastre Jenney whas
there and helde a coorte on the Mondaye next aftre Tlwelthe , and
warned the tenauntes that they schulde pay no money to no man onto the
tyme they had worde from hym , seyng that he whas on of the feffeys of
the same maner and that he whas feed with Ser John Fastolff , of weche
fee he was be-hynde for ij yere ; wherfore he desired the tenauntes
that they schulde not be redy in payement onto the tyme they had word
from hym , but that he myght be payed of hes seide fee lyke as the
wylle of the deede was . Wherfore I can gete no money of them vnto the
tyme they haue knowleche how it stond be-twyx your mastreship and
Mastre Jenney ; PASTON,II,271.398.10347

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_398:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
for withoute Jenney write to hem , or come homward that wey and haue
the tenauntes to-gether and lete hem witte that ye ought to haue the
rentes and fermes of the seid maner , I can not see that ye be like to
haue but litell money there withoute ye wol do distreyne throuout all
the lordeschip . PASTON,II,271.398.10348

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_398:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
I haue sette dayes to purvey her money a-yenst the first weke of Cleene
Lenton , PASTON,II,271.398.10349

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_398:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
and than they shul haue an answere who shal receyve it ; wherfore that
it plese your maistreship to remembre to speke to Mastre Jenney .
PASTON,II,271.398.10350

{ED:662._FROM_THOMAS_HOWES_1462,_FEBRUARY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_399:M4:1462:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To the ryght worshipfull sere and mayster , myn Mayster John
Paston , squier . </font> PASTON,II,272.399.10357

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_399:M4:1462:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Ryght worshipfull sere and mayster , I recomaunde me to yow .
PASTON,II,272.399.10358

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_399:M4:1462:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And please yow that the chirche of Drayton is or shal be resynged in
hast in-to the Bysshoppys handes by Ser John Bullok , desyryng yow
hertly +tat ye lyke I may have the presentacion of the next avoydaunce
for a newew of myn callyd Ser Reynold Spendelove , whiche I trust yowre
maystership wole agree to make in yowre name and myn , as was last , &c
. PASTON,II,272.399.10359

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_399:M4:1462:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And , ser , please yow also +tat I have hadde diuerse comunicacions
with Worcestre sethe Crystmesse , PASTON,II,272.399.10360

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_399:M4:1462:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and I fele by hym vtterly that he wole not appoynt in other fourme than
to have the londes of Feyrechildes and other londes in Drayton to the
summe of x marc of yow proprely , by-syde that +tat he desyreth of myn
mayster , whom God assoyle ; whiche mater I remytte to yowre noble
discrecion . PASTON,II,272.399.10361

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_399:M4:1462:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And as for aunswere of the bylles +tat I have , I have ben so sekelew
sethe Crystmasse that I myght not yette don hem ,
PASTON,II,272.399.10362

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_399:M4:1462:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
but I shal in alle hast , wherinne ye may excuse yow by me , if ye
please , tyl the next terme , at whiche tyme alle shal be aunswered ,
be Goddes grace , who preserue yow and send yow th'accompljshement of
yowre desyres , &c . PASTON,II,272.399.10363

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_399:M4:1462:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Item , sere , please yowre maystership hit was leten me wete in ryght
secrete wyse +tat a pyssaunce is redy to aryve in thre partyes of this
londe , by the meane of Kyng Herry and the Quene +tat was and by the
Dewk Somercete and others , of vj=xx= m=l= men ;
PASTON,II,272.399.10364

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_399:M4:1462:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and here day , if wynde and weder hadde seruyd theym , shuld a ben here
sone vpon Candelmasse . PASTON,II,272.399.10365

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_399:M4:1462:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
At Trente <P_II,273> to London-wardes +tei shuld a ben by Candelmasse
or sone after , on parte of theym , and another part comyng from Walys
and the thredde from Yernessey and Garnesseye . Wher-fore it is weel
don ye enforme myn Lord Warwyk , +tat he may speke to the Kyng +tat
good provysion be hadde $in withstandyng there malicyous purpose and
evyl wylle , whiche God graunt we may overcome theym ;
PASTON,II,273.399.10366

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_399:M4:1462:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and so we shuld , I dought not , if we were alle oon .
PASTON,II,273.399.10367

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWES:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_399:M4:1462:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA

officers , &c. , for +te whiche declaracion +te Kyng tooke hym by +te
hand and seid he cowde hym grett thanke , and preyed hym so to do in
+tis cuntre` , &c . PASTON,II,274.400.10386

<P_II,276>

{ED:666._FROM_JOHN_RUSSE_1462,_BEFORE_14_APRIL}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_402:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
<font> To the right reuerent and wurshipfull ser , my right honourable
Maystyr John Paston . </font> PASTON,II,276.402.10416

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_402:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Right wurshipfull ser and my right honourable maistir , I recomaunde me
to you in my most humble wise . PASTON,II,276.402.10417

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_402:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And plese it youre good maistirshyp to wete that it is seyd here that
my Lord Wurcestre is lyk to be Tresorer , with whom I truste ye stonde
right wel in conseit , with whiche God contynwe . Wherfor I beseke
youre maistirshyp that if my seid lord haue the seid office that it
lyke you to desyre the nomynacion of on of the officez eythyr-8 of the
countroller ore serchorshyp of Jernemuth for a servaunt of yowrez ,
PASTON,II,276.402.10418

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_402:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and I shuld so gyde me in the office as I trust shuld be most profit to
my seyd lord . PASTON,II,276.402.10419

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_402:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And if youre maistirshyp lyked to gete graunt thereof , that than it
plesyd you to lycence on of youre servauntez to take out the patent of
the seyd office , PASTON,II,276.402.10420

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_402:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and if it cost v or vj or viij marke I shal trewly contente it ageyn ;
PASTON,II,276.402.10421

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_402:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and yeerly as longe as I myght haue the officez , or ony of hem , I
shal geue my maister youre sone v marke toward an haukeney .
PASTON,II,276.402.10422

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_402:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
It shuld be to me right a good mean to stondyn as well in the trust as
in the conseyt amongez marchauntez , with whom and with alle men I
calle my-self a servaunt of yourez , and soo wil do , if it plese you ,
which boldyth me the more to calle upon youre right wurshypful
maistyrshyp in this matere , where-in I beseke you to forgeue me my
boldnesse in thys behalue . PASTON,II,276.402.10423

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_402:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And if I knew that my lord shuld haue the office in serteyn , than I
wold wayte upon youre good maystyrshyp there to opteyne the patent , if
it plesyd youre good maystirship to gete me the graunt , &c .
PASTON,II,276.402.10424

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_402:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Nomore on-to you , my right honourable maistir , at thys tyme , but
Jesu I beseke sende you a good conclucyon in all youre materez and
graunt you euer youre hertez desyre . PASTON,II,276.402.10425

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_402:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Youre contynwal servaunt and bedeman John Russe PASTON,II,276.402.10426

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_403:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER

the court and lete on Hokmonday , as hit hath ben of olde tyme
accostomed ; PASTON,II,277.403.10429

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_BARKER:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_403:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_403:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_BARKER:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_403:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
for as I here seyn he bydeth but a tyme +tat he myght gete a summe of
money to-geders of myn ladyes lyflode and to gon ther-with with a love
of his soiornyng as yette in Hokehold . PASTON,II,277.403.10434

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_BARKER:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_403:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
She hath ben dreven fro town to town for his sake .
PASTON,II,277.403.10435

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_BARKER:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_403:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Hit is wele don ye aduertyse myn lady , if she be in that cas +tat she
hath gouernaunce of hir owen londes , that she do no thyng to that
lyflode ner non other in Norffolk with-ought advyse of theym that have
vysyted and overseen theym , PASTON,II,277.403.10436

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_BARKER:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_403:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
for ther hath ben straunge rewle bothe-2 in woodsales and sales of
londes holde at wylle for fre rent , as ye shal knowe here-after .
PASTON,II,277.403.10437

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_BARKER:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_403:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Thoresby , a man that was generall attorney for myn Lord Oxenford +tat
was , told me that the Kynge hadde made Keche generall receyvoure by
prive`seale of alle londes that were the Erle of Oxenford and Dame
Elyzabet , ecept tho that Howard hadde entered and Lanham and an other
graunted to Wykes , and certeyn lyflode in Kent that was assigned to
the tresorer of howshold of the Kynges hows ; PASTON,II,277.403.10438

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_BARKER:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_403:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and she shuld have be Keches hande v=c= mark , ij=c= and l mark to ben
payed at this Estern and the remulant at Mihelmasse .
PASTON,II,277.403.10439

Please you to have knowlage on +te Friday at after-noon next after
Seynt Peter there was at +te taueran in London old Debnam and yong
Debnam , Thomas Edmondys and I ; PASTON,II,278.404.10453

AUTHOR:JOHN_DAUBENEY:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_404:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and ther the seyd Thomas Edmondys fell jn communicacion with old Debnam
PASTON,II,278.404.10454

AUTHOR:JOHN_DAUBENEY:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_404:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and seyd that my lord Tresorere had put hym to a gret charge for the
vetelyng of <font> Mary Talbot </font> , seyyng to old Debnam that he
hard sey +tat he had a c bullokys to selle , the wyche +te seyd
Edmondys wolle bey so +tat they may a-cord of +te price .
PASTON,II,278.404.10455

AUTHOR:JOHN_DAUBENEY:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_404:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Than the seyd old Debnam answerd ageyn PASTON,II,278.404.10456

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_404:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and seyd he wold , so +tat he myght have good payment or ellys +te seyd
Edmondys to be bound in abligacion to pay hym at suche dayys as they
myght a-cord . PASTON,II,278.404.10457

AUTHOR:JOHN_DAUBENEY:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_

, I pray you +tat ye wolle take avisment of this mater tille to-morowe
, PASTON,II,278.404.10458

AUTHOR:JOHN_DAUBENEY:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_

LETTER:PASTON_404:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT

of your bullokys for the vetelyng of the <font> Barge of Yermothe
</font> , and I shall fynd you sufficiant suerte` for +te payment
therof for Edmondys . PASTON,II,278.404.10459

<font> To my ryght reuerunt and wurschipfull my Mastre John Paston .
</font> PASTON,II,280.405.10492

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_

Plesith it you to witte that , where as ye wolde haue vndrestondyng and
knowleche of how moche malte ye haue at Castre , I can be in no
certeynte` verely PASTON,II,280.405.10493

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_

for the malters haue not moten all vp yette ; PASTON,II,280.405.10494

but be estimacion ye haue of newe malte of this yere at Castre cccc
quarters and of olde malte of Castre and Mauteby viij=xx= comb , wherof
schall be spent be estimacion in your housold be Halloumesse xl quartre
. PASTON,II,280.405.10495

olde xl quartre ; PASTON,II,280.405.10496

and as for the pris here , at Yermouthe j quartre euery busschell
streken in the combes is wurthe ij s. ij d. and no better now .

<P_II,281>

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_406:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Plesith your maistreschip to wit that I whas at Scole and spake with
Alblastre , John Sadeler , and with other good yomen of the contre` to
$vndrestand how they were gided for the vetelyng of the <font> Barge of
Yermouth </font> . PASTON,II,281.406.10508

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_406:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
And I vndrestande be them that there hundred haue payed ;
PASTON,II,281.406.10509

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_

LETTER:PASTON_406:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
neuertheles it is but litell . PASTON,II,281.406.10510

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_406:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Ther was gatherd in that hundred xviij s. and certein corn , and som
other hundred vj marc. and corne , PASTON,II,281.406.10511

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_406:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and so they haue payed in all the hundredes and townys here a-boute ,
that is to sey Est Flegge and West Flegge and vp to Blofeld , Tunsted ,
and vp to Stalom , I vndrestand , be the comiscion that Debenham hath .
PASTON,II,281.406.10512

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_406:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
It is more large thanne Maistre John is , as ye schall vndrestand ,
wherof I send you a copy , weche causeth me that I labour no ferther
therin . PASTON,II,281.406.10513

{ED:671._FROM_JOHN_RUSSE_NOT_BEFORE_1462,_15_JULY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_407:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
<font> To the right <em> wurshypfull and </em> my right honourabyl
$Maystyr John Paston . </font> PASTON,II,281.407.10517

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_407:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Right wurshipfull ser and my right honourabill maistir , I recomaund me
to you jn my most humble wise . PASTON,II,281.407.10518

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_407:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And please youre <em> maistirship ... </em> is on Thomas Chapman , an
evyl disposyd man al-wey ayens you , as I haue jnformyd youre
maistirship many tymes , and <em> ... </em> labouryd to my lord
<P_II,282> Tresorere to subplante me , and brought down wryghting from
the Kyng and my lord Tresorere ; PASTON,II,282.407.10519

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_407:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
but ore hise wryting cam Wydwell fond the meanys , be the supportacion
of Maistir Feen , that we had a discharge fore hym out of the Chauncery
. Wherfore the seyd Chapman purposyth to be at London in all haste and
to auertise the Kyng and my lord Tresorere ageyn me to the grettest
hurt he can jmagyne . Wherfore I beseke youre maystirship , consedryng
is evyl disposecion to yow and also the rathere at my pore jnstaunce ,
that ye lyke that my lord Tresorere myght vndyrstonde that the seyd
Chapman is of no reputacion , but evyl disposyd to brybory of
straungerys and be coloure of hise office of supervisor of the serche
shal gretly hurte the port . PASTON,II,282.407.10520

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_407:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
The seyd Chapman supportorys is Blakeney , clerk of the sygnet , and
Auerey Cornburght , yoman of the Kyngys chaumbre .
PASTON,II,282.407.10521

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_407:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
He hath here of Auereyes xxiiij tune wyn , wherof at the long wey he
shal make the seyd Auerey a lewd rekenyng . PASTON,II,282.407.10522

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_407:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
The seyd Chapman louyth not you nore no man to yow wardys , &c .
PASTON,II,282.407.10523

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_407:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Ser , I prey God $bryng you onys to regne amongys youre cuntre`-men in
love , and to be dred . PASTON,II,282.407.10524

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_407:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
The lengere ye contynwe there the more hurt growyth to you .
PASTON,II,282.407.10525

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_407:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Men sey ye will neythere-1 folwe the auyse of youre owyn kynred nore of
youre counsell , but $oonly youre owyn wylfullnesse , whiche but grace
be shal be youre distrucion . PASTON,II,282.407.10526

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_407:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
It is my part to enfourme youre $maistirshyp as the comown voyse is .
PASTON,II,282.407.10527

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_407:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
God betir it PASTON,II,282.407.10528

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_407:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and graunt yow onys hertys ease , PASTON,II,282.407.10529

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_407:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
fore it is half a deth to me to here the generall voyse of the pepyll ,
whiche dayli encreasyth , &c . PASTON,II,282.407.10530

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_407:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Ser , I beseke youre maistirshyp to remembre my maystresse fore the
lytil syluir whiche fore serteyn thyngys delyuerid to youre vse is dewe
to me . PASTON,II,282.407.10531

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_407:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
I haue nede of it now . PASTON,II,282.407.10532

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_407:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
I haue bought salt and othere thyngys whiche hathe brought me out of
myche syluir . PASTON,II,282.407.10533

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_407:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
I wold trust , and I nedyd to borwe xx li. , youre $maistirshyp wold
ease me fore a tyme , PASTON,II,282.407.10534

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_

but thys that I desyre is myn owyn dute` . PASTON,II,282.407.10535

{ED:672._JOHN_MOWBRAY,_FOURTH_DUKE_OF_NORFOLK_1462-3,_31_AUGUST}_C ODE

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_MOWBRAY_JR:MALE:_:1444:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_408:M4:1460S:COPY:OTHER
<font> To oure right trusty and entierly welbelouid seruaunt John
Paston th'elder . </font> PASTON,II,283.408.10543

AUTHOR:JOHN_MOWBRAY_JR:MALE:_:1444:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_408:M4:1460S:COPY:OTHER
The Duc of Norffolk PASTON,II,283.408.10544

AUTHOR:JOHN_MOWBRAY_JR:MALE:_:1444:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_408:M4:1460S:COPY:OTHER
Right trusty and entierly welbelouid seruaunt , we grete you hertily
well , PASTON,II,283.408.10545

AUTHOR:JOHN_MOWBRAY_JR:MALE:_:1444:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_408:M4:1460S:COPY:OTHER
and specially prayng you that ye will be with vs at Framlyngham on
Sonday next comyng , that we may comon with you there and haue youre
sadde advise in suche matiers as concernyth gretly to oure weel ,
wheche shall be mynestred vnto you at youre comyng ;
PASTON,II,283.408.10546

AUTHOR:JOHN_MOWBRAY_JR:MALE:_:1444:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_408:M4:1460S:COPY:OTHER
prayng you that ye fayle not herof , as our speciall trust is in you .
PASTON,II,283.408.10547

AUTHOR:JOHN_MOWBRAY_JR:MALE:_:1444:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_408:M4:1460S:COPY:OTHER
And Our Lord preserue you in his keping . PASTON,II,283.408.10548

AUTHOR:JOHN_MOWBRAY_JR:MALE:_:1444:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_408:M4:1460S:COPY:OTHER
Written at Framlyngham the xxxj day of August . PASTON,II,283.408.10549

Heylesdon be-syde Norwiche , in hast . </font> PASTON,II,283.409.10551

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_409:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Please your maisterchip wete that Cristofer Hanson is ded and beryed ;
PASTON,II,283.409.10552

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_409:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and as for executor or testement , he mad non . PASTON,II,283.409.10553

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_409:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
And as for +te tenauntes , <P_II,284> Mydsomer quarter is owyng and for
Esterne quarter ful lytyll owyng or non en effect ;
PASTON,II,284.409.10554

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_409:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
but as for al +tat was owyng +te day of his deth , I schall make a
bylle of ther names and +te summa and send it you ;
PASTON,II,284.409.10555

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_409:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and also I schall gadre as moche as I may . PASTON,II,284.409.10556

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_409:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Item , ser , Maister Scrop hath don sought you ofte tymes , and sent
you a lettre and hertely prayed me to send it you , and that ye wold
send an answer ther-of . PASTON,II,284.409.10557

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_409:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
And I wote wel after suche tyme as he supposeth +te lettre schuld come
to you he wol neuer fayle day to send to me to here of an answer ;
PASTON,II,284.409.10558

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_409:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
for he told me Maister Byngham said to hym that he schuld not fayle of
his mony at his comyng to London , wheruppon he told me feythfully that
in trust of your payment he promysed o+ter men to qwhom he is endette
to lyke dayes , and taryeth in London and schall do tyl he haue answer
fro you . PASTON,II,284.409.10559

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_409:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
He wend that Cristofer had wretyn to you for this mater long a-goo .
Wherfor , if it please you ser , that ye wol wryte sum goodly answer to
hym +tat I may be avoyde of his often sendyng , PASTON,II,284.409.10560

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_409:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
for I se wel he hath hast after it . PASTON,II,284.409.10561

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_409:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
And as for to make ony schyft of your tenauntes here , I can not see
ony redy payment ; PASTON,II,284.409.10562

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_409:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
but what I can gadre I shall leve it with Wesenham , except suche
costes as I haue leyd ougth +tis terme . PASTON,II,284.409.10563

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_409:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Item , ser , Scrop prayed me to wryte to you for certeyn evydences of a
no+ter mannys whiche he toke you to ouer-see and to wryte ougth copyes
of them , and that ye wold send hem to hym if ye had don with hem , or
ell of an answer . PASTON,II,284.409.10564

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_

Bysshop of Dereham , and o+ter go in-to Scotlond of jnbassat .
PASTON,II,284.409.10565

{ED:675._FROM_JOHN_RUSSE_1462,_SEPTEMBER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_411:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To my right honourabil and wurshypfull maistre , my Maister
Paston . </font> PASTON,II,285.411.10587

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_411:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Please it youre wurshipfull maistyrshyp to wete that it is informyd me
thys day secretly that there is dyrectyd out a comyssyon to Maystyr
Yelwyrton and Maistyr Jenney , which shal tomorwyn syttyn be vertu of
the same at Seynt Oloffez . PASTON,II,285.411.10588

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_411:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And the substaunce of jentilmen and yemen of Lodynglond be assygnid to
be afore the seyd commesyonerez , PASTON,II,285.411.10589

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_411:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and it is supposyd it is fore my maisterez londez ;
PASTON,II,285.411.10590

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_411:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
fore as the seyd persone informyd me the seyd <P_II,286> commesyonerez
haue ben at Cotton and there entryd and holdyn a court .
PASTON,II,286.411.10591

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_411:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
I can not informe youre maystyrshyp that it is thus in serteyn ,
PASTON,II,286.411.10592

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_411:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
but thus it was told me and desyrid me to kepe it secret ;
PASTON,II,286.411.10593

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_411:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
but be-cause I conseyue it is ageyn youre maistyrshyp it is my part to
geue you relacion there-of . PASTON,II,286.411.10594

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_411:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
I sende you a lettere which cometh from Wurcestyr to my maistyr youre
brothyr . PASTON,II,286.411.10595

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41

<font> To my right honourabyl and wurshypfull maistir , my Maistir John
Paston . </font> PASTON,II,286.412.10610

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_412:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Plese youre wurshypfull maistirship to wete , here is a ship of Hith
wiche seith that John Cole cam from the west cost on Wednysday last
past , PASTON,II,286.412.10611

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_412:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and he seyth that the fleet of shyppis of this londe met with lx seile
of Spanyardys , Brettonys , and Frenshemen , and there tok of hem l ,
wherof xij shyppys were as gret as the <font> Grace de Dewe </font> ;
PASTON,II,286.412.10612

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:41
LETTER:PASTON_412:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and there is slayn on thys partyez the Lordys Clynton and Dakyr and
many jentilmen , Ince and othyr , the <P_II,287> noumbre of iiij m=l= .
PASTON,II,287.412.10613

. PASTON,II,287.412.10614

{ED:677._FROM_THOMAS_PLAYTER_1463,_JANUARY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:42

<font> To his rigth good maister John Paston , squyer , at +te Tempyll
in hast . </font> PASTON,II,287.413.10636

<P_II,288>

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:42
LETTER:PASTON_413:M4:1463:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Please your maisterchip wete that as for my lord of Norwich cosyn deth
, Thomas Gurnay man hath confessed that he slewe hym by comaundement of
his maister , and confessed ouer that +te same dager he slew hym wyth
he kest it in a sege , whiche is founden and taken vp al to-bowyd ,
PASTON,II,288.413.10637

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:42
LETTER:PASTON_413:M4:1463:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
for he cowde not breke it ; PASTON,II,288.413.10638

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:42

and in preson is bothe he and his maister . PASTON,II,288.413.10639

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:42

man woot ; PASTON,II,288.413.10640

to haue wrytyng or word fro you of your helth and welfare and your
o+ter besynes , and especiall wheder ye tarye be-cause of ony
comaundement , &c. , or ell for the sped of your maters .

PASTON,II,288.413.10654

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:42
LETTER:PASTON_413:M4:1463:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Item , my Maistres Clere besecheth you that syth here bro+ter , &c. ,
Edmund Clere is ougth of +te bylle of atteyndre that sche mygth haue a
wrytyng of dyscharge fro the Kyng , to schewe it to suche personez as
wold , be ony old comaundement or ell by ony newe commandement gader vp
the ferme from hens forth as Croppell ded , PASTON,II,288.413.10655

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:42
LETTER:PASTON_413:M4:1463:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
for sche dredeth lesse than suche wold com here-after and lette her to
take pesebly the profytez . PASTON,II,288.413.10656

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:42
LETTER:PASTON_413:M4:1463:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Sche wold I schuld haue don this erand in lyke wyse to Maister William
and Hewe Fen if I had spoken wyth hem , PASTON,II,288.413.10657

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_

he had wrytyng fro me on my maistres byhalfe to do +te erand to hym ,
&c . PASTON,II,288.413.10658

AUTHOR:THOMAS_PLAYTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_

Item , I be-seche you that these articles be-fore may be answered in
your wrytyng , if ony make you to me , PASTON,II,288.413.10659

{ED:678._FROM_RICHARD_CALLE_1463,_FEBRUARY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:42
LETTER:PASTON_414:M4:1463:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
<font> To my ryght reuerent maystre , my Maystre John Paston , in the
Ynner Temple at London . </font> PASTON,II,289.414.10668

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:42
LETTER:PASTON_414:M4:1463:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Plesith your goode maystrechip to witte that there comen doune to the
vndrescheryff of Norwiche a writte to a-tache Maistre John P. the
yongere , wherof I sende you a copy closed herin , but they woll not
a-reeste hym within Norwich ; PASTON,II,289.414.10669

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:42
LETTER:PASTON_414:M4:1463:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
but I vndrestande ther is comen an other writte to the vndrescheryff of
Norffolk bothe for hym and me and for all thoo that ben jndyghted .
Wherfore I purpose me to ride to Hoonyng to the scheryff thys day to
vndrestande how he is disposed and to desire hym to shewe favour to
your pore tenauntes ; PASTON,II,289.414.10670

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:42
LETTER:PASTON_414:M4:1463:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
and as I feele hym disposed I schall sende your maystreschip answer .
PASTON,II,289.414.10671

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:42
LETTER:PASTON_414:M4:1463:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
And as for tidynges here in this contre` , we haue noon but that ther
be many Frenchemen vpon the see and do moche answer vpon the coostes .
PASTON,II,289.414.10672

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:FATHER_IN_LAW:1421:42
LETTER:PASTON_414:M4:1463:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Maistre Yeluerton knewe of the comyng vp of the teste within ij dayes
after they were goon , &c . PASTON,II,289.414.10673

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_

LETTER:PASTON_414:M4:1463:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
My ryght reuerent and wurschipful maystre , the Blissed Trinite`
precerue and kepe and forther you in all your maters .
PASTON,II,289.414.10674

and for dowte +tat I supposed that my maistres your wyf had not be
remembred of +te day , it caused me accordyng to your informacion to
wryte +te vttermest day for here remembrans . PASTON,II,291.415.10684

Kyngges Benche by your counsell in lettyng of +te iugement ,

byll of John Boteler weche speketh of your heygh at Heylesdon and of
your <P_II,297> barly in other places , but I vndrestand not what ye
wold I schulde do therin . PASTON,II,297.417.10741

Item , as for tidynges , the sescions schal be at Thetford on Wednesday
next comyng , where I vndrestande Mastre Berney wol be wyth moche
people , be-cauce ther is come to hym a prevy seale that he schuld be
wyth the Kyng wyth-in vj dayes that the prevy seale whas delyuerd hym ,
weche he can not doo for the vj day is to-morwe .
PASTON,II,297.417.10746

LETTER:PASTON_418:M4:1464:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
The effect was , as it was told me , that the Kyng will that justise be
had , and that all risers ayens the pees and oppressers of the pepill
be chasteised , letyng hem wete that he was late in Cambriggeshire and
that there such as had offendid askyd grace , whech thei had , savyng
such as were rewlers whom he will somwhat see punysshid , purposyng to
be in this contry abought Estern , &c . PASTON,II,298.418.10792

<font> To my ryght wurschipfull my Mastre John Paston be this delyuerd
in haste . </font> PASTON,II,299.419.10794

Plesith it youre goode maistrechipp to witte that I haue be wyth my
Mastre Calthorppe for the matre ye wrote to hym fore , wherin I haue
founde hym ryght weele disposed and favorably . PASTON,II,299.419.10795

and haue ben of hes councell this ij yere in all hes matres towchyng
the lawe ; PASTON,II,299.419.10796

and wrote a lettre to +te vndrescheryff of Norffolk that he schuld take
suerte` sufficient to save hym harmeles , and that done to write a
letter to the vndrescheryff of Suffolk and lete hym witte that he hathe
taken suerte` that ye schall appere in the Crastino Animarum vpon the
exigentes returnable , or ell to bryng a super-sedias laufful be-fore
that daye , chargyng hym that he do sece the callyng of the writtes and
to retorne that ye appered the furst day ; weche suerte` is taken and a
letter wreten to the vndrescheryff of Suffolk accordyng herto .
PASTON,II,299.419.10799

{ED:688._FROM_JOHN_RUSSE_1465,_6_MAY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:44
LETTER:PASTON_420:M4:1465:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
<font> To the right wurshypfull ser , my right honourabyll Maistir John
Paston , at London . </font> PASTON,II,306.420.10816

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:44
LETTER:PASTON_420:M4:1465:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Right wurshipfull ser and my right honourabyll maistir , I recomaund me
to you jn the most humble wise . PASTON,II,306.420.10817

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:44
LETTER:PASTON_420:M4:1465:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And please youre maistirship to wete that my maistresse hathe dyuerse
tymez spokyn to me to helpe to purvey a marchaunt fore sum of youre
malt , but in good feyth I can gete no man that wyll geue at the most
more than xxij d. fore a quarter , PASTON,II,306.420.10818

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:44
LETTER:PASTON_420:M4:1465:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
fore soo men selle dayli at the moste , and sumtyme xx d. a combe .
PASTON,II,306.420.10819

AUTHOR:JOHN_RUSSE:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:44
LETTER:PASTON_420:M4:1465:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
My maistresse is right heuy therfore , PASTON,II,306.420.10820

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:44
LETTER:PASTON_420:M4:1465:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
but I can not remedy it . PASTON,II,306.420.10821

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:44
LETTER:PASTON_420:M4:1465:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
If ony good marchaunt were there , after my sympil conseyt it were good
to take hym , PASTON,II,306.420.10822

Me semyth of ij hurtys the leste is $most <em> ... </em> well the dayli
<P_II,307> contynewyng maleyse of youre insessiabyll enemyes , how they
contryue and seke occacionis to <em> ... </em> $infourmyd more wyll doo
euery foot of grownd wyth-jnne fewe dayez , and rathere to geue it awey
fore nowght <em> than ... </em> it . PASTON,II,307.420.10831

seke to you fore peas . PASTON,II,308.420.10871

exspence of the good so onprofitably in the lawe ,

the Mastre Philip and the balyf of Cossey , wyth othere of my lorde of
Suffolk men , PASTON,II,310.421.10886

ccc men forto haue entred , notwythstandyng they sayde they come not
for to entre , PASTON,II,310.421.10887

{ED:700._FROM_RICHARD_SOUTHWELL_NOT_AFTER_1466}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_I}

AUTHOR:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_422:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
<font> To my right reuerent and worshippfull John Paston , esquier , in
hast . </font> PASTON,II,324.422.10946

AUTHOR:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_422:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Sire , I recomaunde me vnto you PASTON,II,324.422.10947

AUTHOR:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_422:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and thanke you as I may of your grete and feithfull labour for me to
the meire and recordour as for the apperaunce of certein persones
before them at theire sessions , like as I wrote vnto you from
Walsyngham . PASTON,II,324.422.10948

AUTHOR:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_422:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Howe beit I vnderstande by a letter the whiche I sende you that Thomas
Wolvesby and Colyns make grete labour to the vtter vndoyng of the
pouere men with-oute your speciall gode mastershipp vnto them in
labouring and exorting the meire and the recordour to haue $pite` vppon
them and consideracion to theire trouble at Walsingham , the whiche
thei might in no wise avoyde PASTON,II,324.422.10949

AUTHOR:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_422:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
for thei were prisoners in this matiere . PASTON,II,324.422.10950

AUTHOR:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_422:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
I require and beseche you , as euer I may do you seruice , to comon
with the meire in as shorte tyme as {in}_P ye godely may and can be
your wisdam entrete hym to be sewere of hym , that I might haue redy
worde from you of his entent ; and that ye will pardon me of my
male-aperte writing vnto you and bolde calling vppon you to your grete
labour . PASTON,II,324.422.10951

AUTHOR:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_422:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And if there be any thing that I can or may do for you I am bounden to
be and $will $be {TEXT:wilbe} at your comaundement , by the grace of
God , whom I beseche to haue you euer in his blessid gouernaunce .
PASTON,II,324.422.10952

AUTHOR:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_422:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Writon at Thetford on Sherethursday in haste . PASTON,II,324.422.10953

Your own Richard Suthwell PASTON,II,324.422.10954

vn-to you , PASTON,II,325.423.10956

AUTHOR:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_423:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and as hertily as I can thanke you of your right gentill and kynde
remembraunce that I consceyve weell by your late writyng that ye haue
tomewardes , vndeserved in dede but not in will , so God helpe me , as
ye shuld weell knowe if my powere might accorde with my will .
PASTON,II,325.423.10957

AUTHOR:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_423:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And , cosin , in the mater that it liked you to remembre me in ,
bothe-3 to my worshipp and pleaser , I feere me that nouthere my pouere
doughter nor pouere purs can nor may be to his pleaser .
PASTON,II,325.423.10958

AUTHOR:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_

LETTER:PASTON_423:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and I shuld take me right neere to his pleaser , savyng my-self , I
ensure you by my trouth . PASTON,II,325.423.10960

AUTHOR:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_423:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And howe to vnderstand his pleaser and disposicion therin I see no mean
as thus advised , PASTON,II,325.423.10961

AUTHOR:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_423:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
but if it might please you by your wisdam to attempte it forthere as ye
seme moste conveniente , and theruppon I to be guyded by your gode
advise as the cas shall require ; wherin ye shall bynde me herefter to
do that may be to your pleaser to my powere , and yette with no better
will than I haue had , so God help me , who haue you euer in his keping
and sende you your hertes desire to his pleaser .
PASTON,II,325.423.10962

AUTHOR:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_423:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And if it please you to remembre furthere in the premisses I trust ye
shall leese no labour on my pouere parte ; PASTON,II,325.423.10963

AUTHOR:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_423:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
howe be it I fere me sore , as I be-gan , bothe-2 of my pouere doughter
and purs . PASTON,II,325.423.10964

AUTHOR:RICHARD_SOUTHWELL:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_I:MALE:_:1421:_
LETTER:PASTON_423:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Writon at Woderysyng the morn efter Oure Lady Day in haste .
PASTON,II,325.423.10965

and +te reparacion of the berne , &c. , as ye shall se by the papir of
the court . PASTON,II,327.424.10969

executourys fro fals terrauntys and alle tribulacyonys , amen .

meny and here hors in Our Ladyes place , &c. , on Satyrday at evyn

and tyre , &c . PASTON,II,332.425.11004

And there was not for+getyn non vnkyndnesse of my maystyr J. P. +gowr
bro+tyr , of sleyng of hise man Wormgey , and of mariage of hise
dowghtyr whiche now schal solempnely be maryed to Conerys , a knytys
sone , &c . PASTON,II,333.425.11016

AUTHOR:JOHN_BRACKLEY:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1436:24
LETTER:PASTON_425:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And now last at Seynt Benettys , where he so worschipful a justise and
as kunnyng in lawe as evyr was +gowr fadyr , &c. , as alle men knowyn ,
&c . And +gowr bro+tyr J. P. brokyn owt be occasyon of +gowr langage ,
and takyn wytnesse of Malmysbury , a man of my lord of Cauntyrbury
whiche hath spokyn wyth the seyd justise the last terme in Westmystyr
Halle . PASTON,II,333.425.11017

that evyr I spake wyth +gowr lordchip ' , &c. , PASTON,II,333.425.11018

<P_II,339>

{ED:711._FROM_ALICE_CRANE_PERHAPS_ABOUT_1455,_29_JUNE}

{COM:TO_MARGARET_PASTON}

AUTHOR:ALICE_CRANE:FEMALE:FRIEND:_:_?
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:FRIEND:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_426:M4:1455?:AUTOGRAPH:FRIEND_CODE_METADATA
<font> To my cosyn Margeret Paston be this letter delyuered . </font>
PASTON,II,339.426.11077

AUTHOR:ALICE_CRANE:FEMALE:FRIEND:_:_?
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:FRIEND:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_426:M4:1455?:AUTOGRAPH:FRIEND_CODE_METADATA
Ryght worshipfull cosyn , I recomaund me vn-to you , desyryng to here
of youre welfare ; PASTON,II,339.426.11078

AUTHOR:ALICE_CRANE:FEMALE:FRIEND:_:_?
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:FRIEND:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_426:M4:1455?:AUTOGRAPH:FRIEND_CODE_METADATA
and if it like you to here of my welfare , at the makyng of this letter
I was in good hele , loved be God . PASTON,II,339.426.11079

AUTHOR:ALICE_CRANE:FEMALE:FRIEND:_:_?
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:FRIEND:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_426:M4:1455?:AUTOGRAPH:FRIEND_CODE_METADATA
The cause of my wrytyng to you at this tyme is this , prayng you to
send me word of youre welfare and how ye do of youre seknesse and if
the medycyn do you ony good that I send you wrytyng of last ; thankyng
you of the grete frenship that ye haue do to my moder with all my hert
. PASTON,II,339.426.11080

AUTHOR:ALICE_CRANE:FEMALE:FRIEND:_:_?
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:FRIEND:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_426:M4:1455?:AUTOGRAPH:FRIEND_CODE_METADATA
Also I pray you that ye wyll be good meyn to my cosyn youre husbond
that he wyll se that my fader be well ruleyd in his lyvelode for his
worship and his profett ; also prayng you to hold me exschusyd that I
haue wryton no ofter to you , PASTON,II,339.426.11081

AUTHOR:ALICE_CRANE:FEMALE:FRIEND:_:_?
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:FRIEND:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_426:M4:1455?:AUTOGRAPH:FRIEND_CODE_METADATA
for in good feth I had no leysir PASTON,II,339.426.11082

{ED:719._FROM_JOHN_PAMPYNG_PROBABLY_1463}

{COM:TO_MARGARET_PASTON}

AUTHOR:JOHN_PAMPYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_?
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_430:M4:1463?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
<font> To my right worshipfull mastres , my Mastres Margret Paston , at
Caster . </font> PASTON,II,346.430.11132

AUTHOR:JOHN_PAMPYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_?
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_430:M4:1463?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Please it your good mastresship to wete +tat a fieri facias is come out
of the Eschequir for Hue Fen to the shireff of Norffolk to make levy of
cc mark of the propir goodes and catels of my masters , as executor of
Ser John Fastolff ; of whech fieri facias we sent my master word ,
whech sent us word ayen by Berney +tat we shuld lete the shiref
vndirstand that my master neuir toke vpon hym as executor , and so for
+tat cause +tat writte was no warant to take my masters goodes ; and
also +tat my master mad a dede of gift of all his goodes and catels to
Master Prowet and Clement Paston and other , so that my master hath no
goodes wherof he shuld make levy of the forseid somme ; and if the
shireff wold not take this for non answere , that thanne my master wold
he shuld be lettid in Master Prowetes and Clement Paston name .
PASTON,II,346.430.11133

AUTHOR:JOHN_PAMPYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_?
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_430:M4:1463?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Neuirthelesse we spak wyth the shireff this day PASTON,II,346.430.11134

AUTHOR:JOHN_PAMPYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_?
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_430:M4:1463?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and lete hym vndirstand the causes aforeseid , PASTON,II,346.430.11135

AUTHOR:JOHN_PAMPYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_?
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_430:M4:1463?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and he agreid , so that he myght haue suerte` to safe hym harmeles , to
make such retorne as my master or his counsell coud devise .
PASTON,II,346.430.11136

AUTHOR:JOHN_PAMPYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_?
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_430:M4:1463?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
And because my master wrote by Berney +tat he wold not fynd the shireff
no suerte` , we wold not apoynt wyth hym in +tat wise .
PASTON,II,346.430.11137

AUTHOR:JOHN_PAMPYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_?
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_430:M4:1463?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
And so we toke avise of Thomas Grene , PASTON,II,346.430.11138

AUTHOR:JOHN_PAMPYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_?
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:_:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_430:M4:1463?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and by-cause the vndirshiref <P_II,347> shall be on Monday at Hygham by
Bastewyk brigge , he and we thought that it was best that Master Prowet
shuld mete wyth the shireff there and require and charge hym that by
colour of the forseid fieri facias that he make no levy of any goodes
and catels of the seid Master Prowettes and Clement Pastons ayens the
seid John Pastons , letyng hym wete that such goodes as the seid Paston
had be now the seid Prowettes and Clement Pastons by vertu of a dede of
gift mad to hem almost ij yere agoo ; and if the shireff woll be besy
aftir +tat to take any catell +tat he be lettid in Master Prowettes
name and Clement Pastons by Daubeney and other , whech besines of the
shireff shall be on Tuisday or Wednesday , and as we vndirstand at
Heylesdon . Wherfore ye must send thedir Daubeney wyth Pecok , and the
may gete hym here more felaship by the avise of Master Ser John Paston
and James Gresham . PASTON,II,347.430.11139

maystresshyp . PASTON,II,347.431.11141

RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_431:M4:1465:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Please it you to wyte that my mayster youre hosbond , my maystres youre
modere , my maystere Ser John , Mayster Wyllyam , Mayster Clement , and
all there men were in gode helth when thys lettere was wryten , thankyd
be Jesu ; PASTON,II,347.431.11142

passed , whiche I sende to yow bi Rogier , seruaunt with +te parson of
Thorp , as ye comaunded me bi +te seid Rogier ; besechyng yow to haue
an acquitaunce +terof bi +te seid Rogier . PASTON,II,348.432.11157

{ED:722._FROM_JOHN_DAUBENEY_1465,_PROBABLY_SEPTEMBER}

{COM:TO_MARGARET_PASTON}

AUTHOR:JOHN_DAUBENEY:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_433:M4:1465:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
<font> To my Mestresse Margaret Paston by thys letter dd . </font>
PASTON,II,349.433.11181

AUTHOR:JOHN_DAUBENEY:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_433:M4:1465:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Please your good mastreschep to have knowlage that as thys day was
Master Stevyn of Norwich at Caster , and ther he told me he was
yesterday at Hoxhon wyth +te Byschop of Norwych .
PASTON,II,349.433.11182

AUTHOR:JOHN_DAUBENEY:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_433:M4:1465:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
And ther he seythe +tat ther is gret labore mad be Master Phylyp and be
+te baly of Cossey ; in so moche ther is mad a comission on-to Master
John Salet and Master Robert Ipyswell for an jnquerry that +te parson
+tat my master mad last at Drayton ys deed , as they sey , and jn so
moche they purpose to put in +te parson of Felthorp , as he hard sey ,
for +te Duk of Suffolk ; PASTON,II,349.433.11183

AUTHOR:JOHN_DAUBENEY:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_433:M4:1465:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
and thes he thynkyth it ware a gret vrt to my master tytyll .
PASTON,II,349.433.11184

AUTHOR:JOHN_DAUBENEY:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_433:M4:1465:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
And also another jnquerry howe ys patorn of +te seyd chyrche ,
PASTON,II,349.433.11185

AUTHOR:JOHN_DAUBENEY:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_433:M4:1465:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
and thys is leke to come in revelicion but yf ther be gret labore mad
to-morowe be tymys and +tat ye have a man at Hoxhon in all hast for a
newe comicion ; PASTON,II,349.433.11186

AUTHOR:JOHN_DAUBENEY:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:_:_:_

and in +tat commysion Master Stevyn wold +tat ye shuld have Master John
Salet , Master Symond Thornaham , Master Nicholl Stanton , and that it
be mad be +te avice of Master Jon Bulman , PASTON,II,349.433.11187
