{ED:723._FROM_SIR_JOHN_HEVENINGHAM_NOT_AFTER_1466,_7_MAY}

{COM:TO_MARGARET_PASTON}

AUTHOR:JOHN_HEVENINGHAM:MALE:_:1577:_
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_434:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
<font> To myn ryght worchipfull cosyn Margarete Paston be +tis letter
deliuered . </font> PASTON,II,350.434.11197

AUTHOR:JOHN_HEVENINGHAM:MALE:_:1577:_
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_434:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Ryght worchippffull and welbeloued cosyn , I comaunde me to you as
herteli as I can , thankyng you off your goode chere +te last tyme I
was with you . PASTON,II,350.434.11198

AUTHOR:JOHN_HEVENINGHAM:MALE:_:1577:_
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_434:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And , worchippffull cosyn , please yt you to calle vn-to youre
remembrauns I wrote vn-to you for myn cosyn Anneys Loveday to haue ben
in your seruice , PASTON,II,350.434.11199

AUTHOR:JOHN_HEVENINGHAM:MALE:_:1577:_
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_434:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and I reseyued from you a letter that youre wyll was goode but durst
not to in-to +te tyme ye hadde spoke with myn cosyn youre husbonde .
PASTON,II,350.434.11200

AUTHOR:JOHN_HEVENINGHAM:MALE:_:1577:_
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_434:M4:1460S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Worchippffull cosyn , I haue labored for hire in othir placez ,
PASTON,II,350.434.11201

AUTHOR:JOHN_HEVENINGHAM:MALE:_:1577:_

purveyed for hire , I pray you ther-off , PASTON,II,350.434.11202

And as for my litel cosyn your sone is a faire childe and a mery ,
blissed be God . PASTON,II,351.435.11215

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_CLERE:FEMALE:FRIEND:_:_?
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:FRIEND:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_435:M4:1466?:AUTOGRAPH:FRIEND_CODE_METADATA
Cosyn , +te cause of my writyng at this tyme is for certeyn evidences
of Frethorp +tat I delyuered my cosyn your husbonde for to a mad awarde
betwix Rammesbury and me , and j boke of papeer of +te customs of
Ormesby , and j rolle called domysday and other certeyn evidences
longyng to +te seide maner , and j dede of a tayle of Reynthorp +te
whiche I delyuerid hym , and certeyn evidences of Cleydon and of Burgh
. PASTON,II,351.435.11216

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_CLERE:FEMALE:FRIEND:_:_?
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:FRIEND:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_435:M4:1466?:AUTOGRAPH:FRIEND_CODE_METADATA
And also , cosyn , your faderlawe was of councell bothe-1 with my moder
and my moderlawe , wherfore I sopose +ter myght be lefte som evidences
or copies of evidences of my liflode , +tat is to seye Tacolneston ,
Therston , Reynthorp , Rusteynes in Wymondham , Kesewik , and $Stratton
, with hym . Wherfore , cosyn , I beseche you hertily +tat whanne ye
loke among your evidences +tat ye wolde ley hem a-parte for me , as my
very truste is +tat ye $will , PASTON,II,351.435.11217

mony , whiche is ix li. xvj s. viij d. now . PASTON,II,352.436.11226

vp . PASTON,II,352.436.11227

{ED:728._FROM_RICHARD_CALLE_PROBABLY_1472,_27_NOVEMBER}

{COM:TO_MARGARET_PASTON}

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_?
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:MOTHER_IN_LAW:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_437:M4:1472?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
<font> To the ryght reuerent and worshipffull my Mastres Margaret
Paston in haste . </font> PASTON,II,356.437.11252

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_?
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:MOTHER_IN_LAW:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_437:M4:1472?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Plesith it you to wete that I haue receyued your letter , wherin I
conceyve ye wolde vndrestonde how I do with the sale of Sporle wode .
PASTON,II,356.437.11253

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_?
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:MOTHER_IN_LAW:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_437:M4:1472?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
It is so that I haue be-gonne to felle asshe at the townesende for to
sette the contre` on werke , PASTON,II,356.437.11254

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_?
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:MOTHER_IN_LAW:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_437:M4:1472?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
and be that I shall vndrestonde how the remnaunt wol doo .
PASTON,II,356.437.11255

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_?
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:MOTHER_IN_LAW:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_437:M4:1472?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
I haue sette suche a classe be-fore here jen ther that they are madde
vpon it , so that I truste be Ester to make of money , what with the
barke and with the asshe at the leeste l marke for to retayle the wode
oure-selfe , and be Cristemas next after that other l marke , and so
yerely l marke at Cristemesse as longe as the wode lasteth , to the
some that I tolde you and I truste more ; PASTON,II,356.437.11256

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_?
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:MOTHER_IN_LAW:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_437:M4:1472?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
and to this I durste be bounde . PASTON,II,356.437.11257

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/SON_IN_LAW:_:_?
RECIPIENT:MARGARET_PASTON[N.MAUTBY]:FEMALE:MOTHER_IN_LAW:_:_?
LETTER:PASTON_437:M4:1472?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Neuertheles I am a-bowte to selle it all a <P_II,357> grete and to
brynge it to all moste {TEXT:to} as goode proffe as thowe we retayled
it oure-silffe , PASTON,II,357.437.11258

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_II}

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:BROTHER_IN_LAW:1442:19
LETTER:PASTON_439:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
<font> To the ryght worschipfull ser and mastre , John Paston junior ,
esquyer . </font> PASTON,II,369.439.11300

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/BROTHER_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:BROTHER_IN_LAW:1442:19
LETTER:PASTON_439:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Ryght worschipfull ser , I recomaunde me vnto your mastreschip ,
certifiyng you that Jenney and Yeluerton hathe certified vup in-to the
Kynges Benche $jnssurecions $and congregacions a-yenste me , whervpon
they haue sente to the scheryff a writte chargyng hym in peyne of c li.
to brynge me in-to the Kynges Benche the morwe aftre Sein Marteyn .
PASTON,II,369.439.11301

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/BROTHER_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:BROTHER_IN_LAW:1442:19
LETTER:PASTON_439:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
And this daye the seide Jenney hathe sent doune to the scheryff
an-other writte called an habeas corpus , retournable crastino
Annemarum , weche $shall $be {TEXT:schalbe} on Tuesday next comyng ,
be-cauce they were in dought and in greete feere that I schulde haue
ben aquytte of the jnditement of fellony now at this gayle delyuerye .
PASTON,II,369.439.11302

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/BROTHER_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:BROTHER_IN_LAW:1442:19
LETTER:PASTON_439:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
And also my maistre hathe sente an-other writte for me , retournable at
the seide crastino Animarum , PASTON,II,369.439.11303

LETTER:PASTON_439:M4:1461:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
and so I am like to ride to London warde to-morwe .
PASTON,II,369.439.11304

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_II}

LETTER:PASTON_440:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
<font> To my Maistre John Paston $the yonger be this delyuerd . </font>
PASTON,II,371.440.11354

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/BROTHER_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:BROTHER_IN_LAW:1442:20
LETTER:PASTON_440:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Sere , I haue receyved your lettre , wherin I vndrestand that my
maistre desirid that my maistre your $brother myght haue the gidyng and
governaunce of the <font> Barge of Yermouthe </font> .
PASTON,II,371.440.11355

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/BROTHER_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:BROTHER_IN_LAW:1442:20
LETTER:PASTON_440:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
As to that , and men of Yermouthe had knowen my maistre entend a
fornyght a-goo he had ben swer of it , PASTON,II,371.440.11356

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/BROTHER_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:BROTHER_IN_LAW:1442:20
LETTER:PASTON_440:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
but nough it is so that Debenham hathe a comyscion of the Kyng
expressed oonly for that schip named in hes comyscion , and he hathe
ben here at Yermouthe and spoken with the balyffes and with the owners
of the seide schip , and takyn suche a direccion that they may graunted
it no man but hym . PASTON,II,371.440.11357

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/BROTHER_IN_LAW:_:_

LETTER:PASTON_440:M4:1462:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
And moreouer he hathe endented with the owners of the schip what daye
it $shall $be {TEXT:schalbe} redy as wele vetaylled as manned ,
PASTON,II,371.440.11358

priours and gentlemen in this contre` to helpe hym and assiste hym to
vetayle and manne the seide schip , PASTON,II,371.440.11359

<P_II,372> were at wordes at London and that Debenham schuld haue
streken hym had nought Howard a beene , &c. , wherof I am ryght sory ,
&c . PASTON,II,372.440.11365

{ED:739._FROM_THE_ABBOT_OF_LANGLEY_1463,_4_SEPTEMBER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_II}

AUTHOR:NAME_UNKNOWN_13:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:21
LETTER:PASTON_441:M4:1463:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To +te ryght worcheppful Sere John Pastoon , knyght , be +tis
delyuered . </font> PASTON,II,372.441.11368

AUTHOR:NAME_UNKNOWN_13:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:21
LETTER:PASTON_441:M4:1463:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Ryght worchepful sere and tendyrly belouyd in Oure Lorde God , I comend
me to you , sendyng you knowyng +tat I dede youre erand to my bro+ter
the persoon of Blofeeld on Wednysdaye was seuenyght after +te
vndyrstandyng +tat I had of you and from you be +tis bryngere , whech
man I felte ryght wele and fauorabelye dysposyd to you ward , and more
fauorable wole be +tan to ony o+ter jentylman levand , the wylle of +te
dede performyd and his conscyens sauyd ; and more +tinges seyd
fauorabely for yow , which I entytelyd in a scrowe to a certyfyed to
your seruaunt Calle yf he had come as ye sent me woord he xuld a do ,
and xuld as ye behestyd me a browte me oure ferme for Heylesdon ; which
not don causeth me to wryte , prayng your jantylnesse +tat I send no
more +terfore , PASTON,II,372.441.11369

AUTHOR:NAME_UNKNOWN_13:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:21
LETTER:PASTON_441:M4:1463:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for it is vnpayed for +te +geere a-fore the Halwemesse +tat my mayster
Fastolff deyed , and for the same +gere +tat he deyed in , and sythen
for ij +gere , and v s. vnpayed of a +gere , PASTON,II,372.441.11370

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:21

lordshyp of the entre` that was made at Haylesdon in the Duk of Suffolk
name . PASTON,II,373.443.11393

{ED:742._FROM_JOHN_WYKES_1466,_17_FEBRUARY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_II}

AUTHOR:JOHN_WYKES:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:24
LETTER:PASTON_444:M4:1466:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA

be thys letter delyueryd . </font> PASTON,II,374.444.11416

AUTHOR:JOHN_WYKES:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:24
LETTER:PASTON_444:M4:1466:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Ryght wyrshypfull and my especyall gode maystere , I recomaund me vnto
youre gode maystershyp , letyng you wyte that the berour herof told me
that ye had grete mervyll that I send to you no word ne letter of
awnswere of the letters that ye had send to me to London .
PASTON,II,374.444.11417

AUTHOR:JOHN_WYKES:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:24
LETTER:PASTON_444:M4:1466:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
As for on lettere ye send to <P_II,375> me by Rychard , Playtourys man
, and therof I send you an awnswere in a lettere by a man of the Priour
of Bromholm ; PASTON,II,375.444.11418

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:24
LETTER:PASTON_444:M4:1466:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
and at euery tyme that I mete wyth hym he askyth of me when hys hors
shuld com and when I here any word from you . Wherfore I pray you send
me word in a lettere how he shall be awnswerd , and yf the hors shall
com lette me knowe when ; PASTON,II,375.444.11421

{ED:743._JOHN_DE_VERE,_THIRTEENTH_EARL_OF_OXFORD_PROBABLY_1466,_31
_JULY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_II}

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:23?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:24?
LETTER:PASTON_445:M4:1466?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To our hertly welbilouyd John Paston , knyght . </font>
PASTON,II,375.445.11438

<P_II,376>

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:23?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:24?
LETTER:PASTON_445:M4:1466?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Right hertly welbilouyd , I grete you wele . PASTON,II,376.445.11439

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:23?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:24?
LETTER:PASTON_445:M4:1466?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And where Sir John Howard , knyght , Sir Gilberde Debenham , knyght ,
gederith grete feloship of men , purposyng on Monday next commyng to
take stresses of the Lady Roos , and I deme that they vndre the coloure
of the same entende to set on Coton and to gete it if they may , I
therfor councelle you to sende downe a certeine of your men or elles
come your-silfe for the save-garde of the said Coton . Also +tat ye
yeve credence vn-to the brynger herof . PASTON,II,376.445.11440

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:23?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:24?
LETTER:PASTON_445:M4:1466?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And Our Lorde kepe you . PASTON,II,376.445.11441

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:23?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:24?
LETTER:PASTON_445:M4:1466?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Writyn at +te lodge in Lauenham the last day of Juyll .
PASTON,II,376.445.11442

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:24?

Oxynford PASTON,II,376.445.11443

LETTER:PASTON_446:M4:1466?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
And thei seid that whan ye were there last ye govyn them day till
Candilmesse , so that thei myght malt there corn and brynge it to the
best preffe ; where-fore I cowde gete no mony , though I wuld haue
takyn all there catell with-ought thei had be otherewyse warned be-fore
. PASTON,II,376.446.11449

Tuesday next be-fore Sent Edmond the Kyng , PASTON,II,376.446.11450

fynde hym disposid weele ; PASTON,II,380.447.11506

that schulde be preiudice or hurte to your mater ,

<P_II,381>

{ED:747._JAMES_GRESHAM_TO_SIMON_DAMME_FOR_JOHN_PASTON_II_PROBABLY_
1467,_2_JULY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_II}

<font>

AUTHOR:JAMES_GRESHAM:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:25?
LETTER:PASTON_448:M4:1467?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
To my worshipfull cosyn Symond Damme $at Lyncoln Inne at London $be
this delyuered . </font> PASTON,II,381.448.11536

AUTHOR:JAMES_GRESHAM:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:25?
LETTER:PASTON_448:M4:1467?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Right worshipfull ser and as in my trost my verray speciall good
maister , I recomande me to you with al the seruyce {with}_P I can and
may . PASTON,II,381.448.11537

AUTHOR:JAMES_GRESHAM:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:25?
LETTER:PASTON_448:M4:1467?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Lyke it you to wytte that I haue do my bysynes to enquere for suyche
dedes as ye wrot fore on-to me , PASTON,II,381.448.11538

AUTHOR:JAMES_GRESHAM:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:25?
LETTER:PASTON_448:M4:1467?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
and so God me helpe I can not wytte where I shuld spede to haue ony
suyche dedes . PASTON,II,381.448.11539

AUTHOR:JAMES_GRESHAM:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:25?
LETTER:PASTON_448:M4:1467?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
I spak to a persone +tat is your good lover , the whiche tolde me that
+ter was a gret plee bytwene my lord of Suffolk and Ser John Fastolf
for the maner of Drayton , for whiche matier William Wysetre was sent
to enquere for euydencez touchyng the Pooles lyvelond in suyche places
as thei were lordes of in their dayes . PASTON,II,381.448.11540

AUTHOR:JAMES_GRESHAM:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:25?
LETTER:PASTON_448:M4:1467?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
And +te seid Wysetre fonde euydencez that touched a maner called
Mundham Maner , sumtyme longyng to the Pooles that were owenneres of
Drayton , the whiche euydences eased meche Ser John Fastolf .
PASTON,II,381.448.11541

AUTHOR:JAMES_GRESHAM:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:25?
LETTER:PASTON_448:M4:1467?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
But +te seid persone that enfourmed me of this can not telle the armes
, ne what euydencez tho shuld be in certeyn , sauyng he thynkyth
indoubted +tat William Worsetre shuld not be vnremembred of this .
Wherfor it is thought to +te same persone +tat enfourmed me of this ,
and by me also , that it shuld be expedyent for you to commune of +tis
matier by your <P_II,382> wysdam with +te same William Wysetre , now
beyng at London , PASTON,II,382.448.11542

{ED:753._FROM_CECILY_DAUNE_1463-8,_3_NOVEMBER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_II}

AUTHOR:CECILY_DAUNE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:_
LETTER:PASTON_450:M4:1460S:COPY:OTHER
<font> To the right worshipfull sir and with my faithful hert and
seruice full entyerly beloued gode maistir Sir John Paston . </font>
PASTON,II,389.450.11588

<P_II,390>

AUTHOR:CECILY_DAUNE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:_
LETTER:PASTON_450:M4:1460S:COPY:OTHER
Right worshipfull sir , and with my faithfull herte and seruice full
entierly beloued gode maistir , jn my most humble wyse I recommaund me
vnto your goode maistership . PASTON,II,390.450.11589

AUTHOR:CECILY_DAUNE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:_
LETTER:PASTON_450:M4:1460S:COPY:OTHER
Pleace it the same to wite that I thenke right longe to I haue verrey
knolege of your welfare , the which vndirstonde wil be to me right
grete comfort . PASTON,II,390.450.11590

AUTHOR:CECILY_DAUNE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:_
LETTER:PASTON_450:M4:1460S:COPY:OTHER
And +tat causeth me to write vnto you as nowe ; and also to late you
wite +tat I herde reperte ye shulde be wedded vnto a doughtir of the
Duchez of Somirset , which matir and I spake with you I couth enforme
your maistirship +tat were to longe to write as nowe .
PASTON,II,390.450.11591

AUTHOR:CECILY_DAUNE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:_
LETTER:PASTON_450:M4:1460S:COPY:OTHER
But I shal and do pray God dayly to sende you such one vnto your
worldes make +tat wil drede and faithfully vnfeyned love you a-boue
alle othir erthely creatures . PASTON,II,390.450.11592

AUTHOR:CECILY_DAUNE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:_
LETTER:PASTON_450:M4:1460S:COPY:OTHER
For +tat is most excellent richesse in +tis worlde , as I suppose ;
PASTON,II,390.450.11593

AUTHOR:CECILY_DAUNE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:_
LETTER:PASTON_450:M4:1460S:COPY:OTHER
fore erthely goodes bene transsitory , PASTON,II,390.450.11594

AUTHOR:CECILY_DAUNE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:_
LETTER:PASTON_450:M4:1460S:COPY:OTHER
and wedding contynues for terme of lyfe , which with som folke is a
full longe terme . PASTON,II,390.450.11595

AUTHOR:CECILY_DAUNE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:_
LETTER:PASTON_450:M4:1460S:COPY:OTHER
And therfore , sire , savyng your displeasire , me semez wedding wolde
haue goode avysement . PASTON,II,390.450.11596

AUTHOR:CECILY_DAUNE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:_
LETTER:PASTON_450:M4:1460S:COPY:OTHER
Moreouir , sir , like it your maistirship to vndirstond +tat wyntir and
colde weders draweth negh , and I haue but fewe clothez but of your
gift , God thanke you . Wherefore , sir , and it like you I besech your
gode maistirship that ye will vouchsafe to remembre me your seruaunte
with som lyuerey such as pleaseth you ayens this wyntir , to make me a
gown to kepe me from the colde wedders ; and +tat I myght haue it , and
such answare as ye pleace in the premisses , sente vnto me be the
bringere herof . PASTON,II,390.450.11597

AUTHOR:CECILY_DAUNE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:_
LETTER:PASTON_450:M4:1460S:COPY:OTHER
And I schal contynuwe youre oratrix and pore seruaunte , and hertely
pray to God for your prosperite` , whom I besech haue you , right
worshipfull sir , and with my faithful herte and seruice full entierly
beloued gode maistir , in his blessed gouernaunce .
PASTON,II,390.450.11598

AUTHOR:CECILY_DAUNE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:_
LETTER:PASTON_450:M4:1460S:COPY:OTHER
Writen at Hellowe the iij=de= day of Nouembre . PASTON,II,390.450.11599

AUTHOR:CECILY_DAUNE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:_
LETTER:PASTON_450:M4:1460S:COPY:OTHER
Cicile Daune PASTON,II,390.450.11600

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:26?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:27?
LETTER:PASTON_451:M4:1469?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To the worshipfull and with alle myn hert right entierly bilouyd
Sir John Paston , knyght , this lettre be deliuered . </font>
PASTON,II,390.451.11601

<P_II,391>

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:26?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:27?
LETTER:PASTON_451:M4:1469?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Th'Erle of Oxinford PASTON,II,391.451.11602

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:26?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:27?
LETTER:PASTON_451:M4:1469?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Right hertly welbilouyd , I grete you wele . PASTON,II,391.451.11603

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:26?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:27?
LETTER:PASTON_451:M4:1469?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And where I am for trowth enfourmyd that the Duchesse of Suffolk wolle
hold a court on Monday next commyng at Coton , to th'entent +tat she
wolle fynde the maner of th'Empnals holde of hir by knyghtes seruice
and they +tat ben possessioners of the same shulde payle certeine of
the parke of Weverston , and by-cause this is nat parfourmyd nor don
thoo that ben possessioners shall at the said court be amersid .
PASTON,II,391.451.11604

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:26?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:27?
LETTER:PASTON_451:M4:1469?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And it is agreed that Sir William Yeluerton , Sir Thomas Hoo , shalle
be at the said court and wolle pay the amercyment and to deliuer the
said Duchesse possession of the said seruice and palyng , and so by
this meane to be-come tenauntes to the said Duchesse .
PASTON,II,391.451.11605

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:26?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:27?
LETTER:PASTON_451:M4:1469?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And what wolle be-falle more herof I kan nat sey . Wherfor me thinkith
it were welle don ye were at the said court with your councell , and to
do therin as they wolle avise you . PASTON,II,391.451.11606

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:26?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:27?
LETTER:PASTON_451:M4:1469?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Also , as ye come to the said court take your wey by the said Duchesse
to th'entent +tat ye come to se hir welfare , &c .
PASTON,II,391.451.11607

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:26?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:27?
LETTER:PASTON_451:M4:1469?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Do herin as your councell wolle avyse you . PASTON,II,391.451.11608

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:26?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:27?
LETTER:PASTON_451:M4:1469?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
I wolde ye dud welle , PASTON,II,391.451.11609

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:26?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:27?
LETTER:PASTON_451:M4:1469?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and to my power I wolle help you . PASTON,II,391.451.11610

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:26?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:27?
LETTER:PASTON_451:M4:1469?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And Our Lorde kepe you . PASTON,II,391.451.11611

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:26?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:27?
LETTER:PASTON_451:M4:1469?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Writyn at Tatyngston the vij day of Januer . PASTON,II,391.451.11612

{ED:759._FROM_RICHARD_CALLE_1469,_22_MAY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_II}

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/BROTHER_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:BROTHER_IN_LAW:1442:27
LETTER:PASTON_452:M4:1469:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
<font> To my ryght reuerent and worshipfull master Ser John Paston ,
knyght . </font> PASTON,II,395.452.11613

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/BROTHER_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:BROTHER_IN_LAW:1442:27
LETTER:PASTON_452:M4:1469:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Plesith it your gode masterschip to wete that , wher as ye mervell +tat
I was not with you vpon the Sonday next be-fore the Assencion Day , I
had no suche comaundement from yow nor no man spake to me therof ,
PASTON,II,395.452.11614

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/BROTHER_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:BROTHER_IN_LAW:1442:27
LETTER:PASTON_452:M4:1469:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
and if ther hadde I had not fawted to haue been ther with you .
PASTON,II,395.452.11615

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/BROTHER_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:BROTHER_IN_LAW:1442:27
LETTER:PASTON_452:M4:1469:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Ferthermore , as for my day of the suerte` of peas Henry Wheler tolde
me my day was xv=a= Trinitatis , PASTON,II,395.452.11616

LETTER:PASTON_452:M4:1469:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
and therof he made me a bille . PASTON,II,395.452.11617

LETTER:PASTON_452:M4:1469:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
He is fowle to blame to serue me so . PASTON,II,395.452.11618

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/BROTHER_IN_LAW:_:_

LETTER:PASTON_452:M4:1469:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Neuertheles I am moche bounde to your masterschip for the gret labour
and besynes weche ye had for the saf garde of my swertees and me , &c .
PASTON,II,395.452.11619

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/BROTHER_IN_LAW:_:_

LETTER:PASTON_452:M4:1469:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
$Moreouer like your masterschip to haue knowlege what money I haue payd
son the tyme +tat I departed from your masterschip last at London .
PASTON,II,395.452.11620

Frust , delyuerd to my mastres parte of her c s. weche sche lent for
Maryot mater to me , lxvj s. viij d . PASTON,II,395.452.11621

with xxx s. receyued of the fermour of the deyre` , xj li. xj s. iiij d
. PASTON,II,395.452.11622

and I haue receyued of your lyflod son I com from London but xviij li.

laste tyme I was ther . PASTON,II,395.452.11626

Spoorle , and Sneylewell , and xxvj s. weche I had at Techewell -
PASTON,II,396.452.11636

Item , where as ye write +tat Mariot hath be with you at London and
+tat he had of you x s. , and +tat ye wolde I schulde reken with hym
and to see +tat he had an estate in the maner of Bekham , sere , I
vndrestonde not what appoyntment ye haue taken with hym ,
PASTON,II,396.452.11651

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/BROTHER_IN_LAW:_:_

for withoute ye had taken an other direccion with hym then I vndrestod
+tat ye haue do , me semyth it were not weele don to geue hym an estate
; PASTON,II,396.452.11652

and also , though I scholde geue hym astate I cowde not ,

the levery of the same lond out of the Kynges hande , weche most furst
be executed or any astate be made . PASTON,II,396.452.11654

<P_II,398>

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT/BROTHER_IN_LAW:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:BROTHER_IN_LAW:1442:27
LETTER:PASTON_453:M4:1469:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA
Plesith it youre goode mastership to wette +tat I haue ben at Bekham
and haue aggreed with Mariot dettours and haue discharged Mariot of the
dette of xvj li. , and haue dayes of the payment for a yere and more ,
and haue for-geuenes of c s. of the seide xvj li. , weche is to your
avauntage and not to Maryottes . PASTON,II,398.453.11674

LETTER:PASTON_453:M4:1469:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT_CODE_METADATA

to your desire . PASTON,II,398.453.11675

PASTON,II,398.453.11681

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:27
LETTER:PASTON_454:M4:1469:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Right worshipfull and my especiall true-hertid frende , I commaunde me
vn-to you , praying you to ordeyne me iij horsse harneys as godely as
ye <P_II,399> and Genyn kan devyse , as it were for your-silfe ; and
+tat I may haue theyme in all hast . PASTON,II,399.454.11693

my moost lowly wise . PASTON,II,401.455.11706

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:28

my felaship as ye comaundid , wretyn in a bille closid herin .
PASTON,II,401.455.11707

AUTHOR:JOHN_PAMPYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:28

disposed to goo hoom to his faders , wherof ye were pleasid and wold he
shuld do so . PASTON,II,401.455.11708

LETTER:PASTON_455:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and said to me he was right glad that ye wold send to hym for any
servaunt ye had , saying that if he coud do any thyng for yow and for
any servaunt of yours he wold do it feithfully .
PASTON,II,401.455.11719

AUTHOR:JOHN_PAMPYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:28
LETTER:PASTON_455:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
And also he said he wold not fayle yow whill he levid in that he coud
and myght do , trustyng heraftir to haue your help and favour in that
he shall haue a do . PASTON,II,401.455.11720

AUTHOR:JOHN_PAMPYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:28
LETTER:PASTON_455:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
And he told me and Stompis bothe whanne so evir he come he shuld be
welcome , and that he wold do aswell to hym as to fewe servauntes he
had for yowre sake , and that he wold kepe hym for yow .
PASTON,II,401.455.11721

As for my-self , my mastres saith she woll geve me mete and drynk for a
season . PASTON,II,401.455.11722

AUTHOR:JOHN_PAMPYNG:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:28
LETTER:PASTON_455:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
for it is told me that ther is processe out vpon the appele ayens me
and other . Wherfore I beseche yow that that mater may be take heed to
as ye may , that we myght haue knowlech if any processe ther be , that
we may be ware ; PASTON,II,401.455.11724

lymebrenner for lyme xiij s. iiij d. , he callith vpon me for it ; and

</font> PASTON,II,406.456.11738

AUTHOR:JOHN_OSBERN:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:30

AUTHOR:JOHN_OSBERN:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:30
LETTER:PASTON_456:M4:1472:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Please it your mastereschep to knowe that Johon Shawe and I haue goten
a carpenter fro Walsyngham to Sporle to valewe your wod , the wheche
carpentere hese costis there Sondaye at nyght next before the Assencion
off owre Lord Jesu Cryst , Mondaye , Tewesdaye , Wednesdaye , Assencion
Daye , Frydaye , and Saterdaye , and for hese labour , iij s. iiij d .
PASTON,II,406.456.11740

AUTHOR:JOHN_OSBERN:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:30
LETTER:PASTON_456:M4:1472:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
And vpon the syte off your seid wode he hath valewid the launde wythin
the dykes xij fote inward fro the cop of the dyke and wythowte at liiij
li. vij s. x d . And wythin the wode xij fote wythin alle the dykes
vj=xx= li. vij s. vijj d . PASTON,II,406.456.11741

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:30
LETTER:PASTON_456:M4:1472:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
The valewe off the dykes abowte the woode fro xij fote fro $wythin
owtewardis arn prysid at x li. grete chepis ; the valew off the trees
in the maner and in the closes a+gens the seid manor toward Swaffham xx
marc. gret chepe . PASTON,II,406.456.11742

<Q_PAS_C_1473_T_WHASTINGS> <L_PASTON_457> <A_WILLIAM_HASTINGS>
<A-GENDER_MALE> <A-REL_---> <A-DOB_1430?> <R_JOHN_PASTON_II>
<R-GENDER_MALE> <R-REL_---> <R-DOB_1442>

<P_II,410>

{ED:770._WILLIAM_LORD_HASTINGS_TO_SIR_JOHN_MIDDLETON_AND_PASTON_14
73,_16_SEPTEMBER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_II}

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_HASTINGS:MALE:_:1430?:43?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:31
LETTER:PASTON_457:M4:1473:COPY:OTHER
<font> To my right hertily beloued frendes and felaws Sir John of
Middelton and Sir John Paston , knightes . </font>
PASTON,II,410.457.11773

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_HASTINGS:MALE:_:1430?:43?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:31
LETTER:PASTON_457:M4:1473:COPY:OTHER
After herty recommendacion I thank you of the gode attendancez that ye
yeue vnto the Kinges counsail at Calais , and the gode and effectuelle
deuoirs that ye putte you in to assiste my depute` Sir John Scot in
alle suche thinges as mowe concerne the saulfgarde of my charge there ;
lating you wite that if ther be any thing that I can and may do for you
I shal with right gode wil perfourme it to my power .
PASTON,II,410.457.11774

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_HASTINGS:MALE:_:1430?:43?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:31
LETTER:PASTON_457:M4:1473:COPY:OTHER
And I preye you to recommaunde me to my Lady Howard , my Lady
Bourgchier , and alle othre ladies and gentilwommen of the saide towne
; and in like wise to the Mayre , Lieutenant , and felaship of the
Staple , my felawes the souldeours , and alle othre suche as {to}_P ye
shal seme gode . PASTON,II,410.457.11775

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_HASTINGS:MALE:_:1430?:43?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:31
LETTER:PASTON_457:M4:1473:COPY:OTHER
And Oure Lord sende you your desirs . PASTON,II,410.457.11776

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_HASTINGS:MALE:_:1430?:43?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:31
LETTER:PASTON_457:M4:1473:COPY:OTHER
Writen at Notyngham the xvj day of Septembre . PASTON,II,410.457.11777

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_HASTINGS:MALE:_:1430?:43?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:31
LETTER:PASTON_457:M4:1473:COPY:OTHER
Sir Jon Paston , I pray yov to yeve credens to svche +ting as my
depute` shall shew yov fro me , and conforme yov to +te same .
PASTON,II,410.457.11778

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_HASTINGS:MALE:_:1430?:43?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:31
LETTER:PASTON_457:M4:1473:COPY:OTHER
Your felaw Hastynges PASTON,II,410.457.11779

wretyn that I chuld send you mony that I haue receyvid at Paston .

<P_II,413>

{ED:773._FROM_SIR_THOMAS_BREWS_1477,_8_March}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_II}

AUTHOR:THOMAS_BREWS:MALE:KIN:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:KIN:1442:35
LETTER:PASTON_459:M4:1477:COPY:FAMILY_OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To my ryght wurschypfull cosyn Syr Jhon Paston , knyght , be
this lettur delyuered , &c . </font> PASTON,II,413.459.11803

AUTHOR:THOMAS_BREWS:MALE:KIN:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:KIN:1442:35
LETTER:PASTON_459:M4:1477:COPY:FAMILY_OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Ryght wurschypfull and my hertely welebelouyd cosyn , I recommande me
vn-to +gowe , desyryng to here of +gowr welefare , whech I pray God may
be as contynuall good as I wolde hafe myn own . PASTON,II,413.459.11804

AUTHOR:THOMAS_BREWS:MALE:KIN:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:KIN:1442:35
LETTER:PASTON_459:M4:1477:COPY:FAMILY_OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And , cosyn , the cause of my wryting vn-to yowe at thys tyme is , I
fele wele be my cosyn John +gowr broder +tat +ge hafe vndyr-stondyng of
a mater whech is jn comynicacyon tochyng a maryage wyth Goddys grace to
be concluded betwyx my saide cosyn +gowr broder and my doghtur Mergery
, wheche is fare commonyd and not +gyt concluded , nere noght schall
nere may be tyll I hafe answere from +gowe agayn of +gowr good will and
asent to the seyd mater , and also of the obligacyon weche +tat I sende
+gowe herewyth ; PASTON,II,413.459.11805

AUTHOR:THOMAS_BREWS:MALE:KIN:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:KIN:1442:35
LETTER:PASTON_459:M4:1477:COPY:FAMILY_OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for , cosyn , I wold be sory to se awthere my cosyn +gowr broder or my
doghtur dryvyn to leve so meane a lyffe as +tei schuld do yf the vj=xx=
li. schuld be payde of there maryage money . PASTON,II,413.459.11806

AUTHOR:THOMAS_BREWS:MALE:KIN:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:KIN:1442:35
LETTER:PASTON_459:M4:1477:COPY:FAMILY_OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And , cosyn , I hafe takyn my-selfe so nere in leuyng of the saide
vj=xx= li. +tat wher as I hade leyde vpp an c li. for the maryage of a
+gonger doghtur of myn , I hafe nowe lent +te saide c li. and xx li.
ouer that to my cosyn +gowr broder , to be paide ageyn be suche esy
days as +te oblygacyon weche I sende +gowe herewyth specyfyes .
PASTON,II,413.459.11807

AUTHOR:THOMAS_BREWS:MALE:KIN:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:KIN:1442:35
LETTER:PASTON_459:M4:1477:COPY:FAMILY_OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And , cosyn , I were ryght lothe to bestowe so mech vppon on doghtur
+tat the o+ter hyr susters schuld fare the wars ; wherfor , cosyn , yf
+ge wyll +tat thys mater schall take effect vndyr suche forme as my
cosyn +gowr broder hath wretyn vn-to yowe , I pray +gowe put +terto
+gowr good wylle , and sum of +gowr coste , as I hafe done of myn more
largely +ten euer I purpose to do to any tweyn of hyr susters , as God
knowyth myn entent , whom I besech to send +gowe +gowre levest hertys
desyre . PASTON,II,413.459.11808

AUTHOR:THOMAS_BREWS:MALE:KIN:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:KIN:1442:35
LETTER:PASTON_459:M4:1477:COPY:FAMILY_OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Wretyn at Topcroft the viij day of Merch , &c . Be +gowr cosyn Syr T.
Brews , Knyth PASTON,II,413.459.11809

Thesse arn +te menys namys of Wynterton : Robert Parker of West
Somerton , John Longyard of Wynterton , Thomas Goodknape of <P_II,423>
+te same , Will Wrantham and John Curteys of +te same Wynterton , +tat
caryid of youre seuerel grownd xxij carte ful of stuffe , viij=xx=
bowestauis , iij=xx= and vij waynescottys , xiiij=c= clapalde , v
barell tere , iiij copil oris , and gret plente` of wreke of +te
schyppe +tat is worth meche mony , as ye chal vnder-stonde +te trowth
after this . PASTON,II,423.461.11881

<P_II,423>

{ED:780._FROM_WILLIAM_WORCESTER_PROBABLY_1478,_1_MARCH}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_II}

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:63?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:36?
LETTER:PASTON_462:M4:1478?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To the ryght worshypfull sir , Sir John Paston , cheualier ,
logged at the signe of the George next to Poulys Wharf , or to lefe
thys letter at a barbourys house ovyr the seyd George to delyuer yt to
Sir John Paston . </font> PASTON,II,423.462.11892

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:63?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:36?
LETTER:PASTON_462:M4:1478?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Plese your gode maistershyp to wete that I herd thys day how a man wend
that a jugement ys passed ayenst your entent yn the ende of the last
terme - yt was not of verray certeyn tolde me but as a dreme - yn the
Kynges Chauncerye . PASTON,II,423.462.11893

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:63?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:36?
LETTER:PASTON_462:M4:1478?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
I coude gefe none aunsuer thertoo . PASTON,II,423.462.11894

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:63?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:36?
LETTER:PASTON_462:M4:1478?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
I pray God alle be well . PASTON,II,423.462.11895

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:63?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:36?
LETTER:PASTON_462:M4:1478?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Hyt wold ease som of your frendes hertys yff they coude vndrestond ony
gode comfort . PASTON,II,423.462.11896

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:63?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:36?
LETTER:PASTON_462:M4:1478?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Sir , as for Robert I wold pray and requyre your maistershyp that he
may for hys lernyng be abydyng wyth your cousyn of Lyncoln Inne , as yt
<P_II,424> was promysed , and to be occupyed vnder a drede of displeser
vndre subieccion , wyth erly rysyng accustomed ,
PASTON,II,424.462.11897

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:63?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:36?
LETTER:PASTON_462:M4:1478?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for slouth ys the moder and noryssher of all vices .
PASTON,II,424.462.11898

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:63?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:36?
LETTER:PASTON_462:M4:1478?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
He hath cost me moch good and labour , PASTON,II,424.462.11899

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:63?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:36?
LETTER:PASTON_462:M4:1478?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and now he ys vppon hys makyng by vertues gouernaunce or vndoyng to the
contrarye ; PASTON,II,424.462.11900

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:63?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:36?
LETTER:PASTON_462:M4:1478?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and yn especyalle to be not conuersaunt ne neere amonges wommen , as I
was kept froo her company xxx yeres or ony such were of my councelle ,
I thank God of yt . PASTON,II,424.462.11901

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:63?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:36?
LETTER:PASTON_462:M4:1478?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Sir , and ye wryte to me as ye lust let no name be wythynne wryt whens
yt com , and that yt be sent by a sure comere to delyuer yt me ,
PASTON,II,424.462.11902

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:63?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:36?
LETTER:PASTON_462:M4:1478?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for yt ys better brent then founde . PASTON,II,424.462.11903

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:63?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:36?
LETTER:PASTON_462:M4:1478?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Also your discrecion ought not loth <paren> to take the cost and labour
wolle not be grete nether jmportune </paren> for to sende a man of
purpose to my lord of Bysshop Waltham and to hys councell lerned , ye
wete to whom , for redy serch to be made for the bille of half lefe of
paper , quantite` of my hand , I faythfully delyuered to Maister T.
Danvers for to ovyrsee , of the fyrst appoyntment ye wote off , that ye
desyre so hertly to see , as of othyr manyfolde wrytynges belongyng to
yow and to me . PASTON,II,424.462.11904

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:36?

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:63?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:36?
LETTER:PASTON_462:M4:1478?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Item , sir , I comyned wyth Doctor Yotton at Camebrygge late , because
there ys no dyvyne service seyd yn the free chapelle at C. that he wold
hafe a grete concience yn yt , and to depart wyth an honest preste
called Sir John Brykkys that ys now duellyng wyth a ry+gt lovyng
kynnesman of yowres ; the seyd doctour gevyng me to aunsuer he wold
comyn wyth yow by Pasch , and the rather wyth your gode wylle wold
depart to such one ye owe affeccion vntoo . PASTON,II,424.462.11909

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:63?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:36?
LETTER:PASTON_462:M4:1478?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Sir , I wold as I dar take vppon me to owen your affeccion to the seyd
John Brickys , that he may wyth more help of your cellary hafe the
better to lyve and serf God there to abyde and do yow service also .
PASTON,II,424.462.11910

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:63?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_II:MALE:_:1442:36?
LETTER:PASTON_462:M4:1478?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA

<P_II,430>

{ED:784._JOHN_MOWBRAY,_FOURTH_DUKE_OF_NORFOLK_1465,_12_OCTOBER}_CO DE

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_III}

AUTHOR:JOHN_MOWBRAY_JR:MALE:_:1444:21
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:21
LETTER:PASTON_463:M4:1465:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To owre trusty and enterly beloved servaunt John Paston ,
esquyre . </font> PASTON,II,430.463.11925

AUTHOR:JOHN_MOWBRAY_JR:MALE:_:1444:21
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:21
LETTER:PASTON_463:M4:1465:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
The Deuke of Norffolk PASTON,II,430.463.11926

AUTHOR:JOHN_MOWBRAY_JR:MALE:_:1444:21
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:21
LETTER:PASTON_463:M4:1465:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Ryght welbeloved servaunt , y grete yow hertly welle , sertefyng that
we shulle be at fulle age on Fryday nexst comyng . Wherffor , wele
consayled be the lordes off owre consayle and oder off owre consayle ,
that ye , on off owre servauntes off howsholde , with oder , be with vs
at London an Fryday or Saterday nexst comyng at the furdest , too
a-companye vs thann too owre wurshyp ; PASTON,II,430.463.11927

AUTHOR:JOHN_MOWBRAY_JR:MALE:_:1444:21
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:21
LETTER:PASTON_463:M4:1465:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for we shull have thann levery off owre landes and offyces .
PASTON,II,430.463.11928

AUTHOR:JOHN_MOWBRAY_JR:MALE:_:1444:21
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:21
LETTER:PASTON_463:M4:1465:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And that ye fayle vs not , as ye woll have owre good lordeshyp in tyme
comyng ; PASTON,II,430.463.11929

AUTHOR:JOHN_MOWBRAY_JR:MALE:_:1444:21
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:21
LETTER:PASTON_463:M4:1465:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and also that ye doo warne owre feede men and servauntes , soche as be
nye too yow , that they be ther thann in owre leverey .
PASTON,II,430.463.11930

AUTHOR:JOHN_MOWBRAY_JR:MALE:_:1444:21
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:21
LETTER:PASTON_463:M4:1465:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Y-wreton the xij day off October . PASTON,II,430.463.11931

<P_II,431>

{ED:786._THE_DUKE_OF_NORFOLK:SAFE-CONDUCT_TO_THE_DEFENDERS_OF_CAIS
TER_1469,_26_SEPTEMBER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_III}

AUTHOR:JOHN_MOWBRAY_JR:MALE:_:1444:25
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:25
LETTER:PASTON_464:M4:1469:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
The Duc of Norffolk PASTON,II,431.464.11934

AUTHOR:JOHN_MOWBRAY_JR:MALE:_:1444:25
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:25
LETTER:PASTON_464:M4:1469:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Where John Paston , esquier , and other diuers persones haue , ageyn
the peas , kepte the manoir of Caster with force ageyne the wille and
entent of vs the Duc of Norffolk , to oure grete displeaser , whiche
notwithstanding at the comtemplacion of the writing of the moost
worshipfull and reuerent fadir in God the Cardenall of Englond and our
moost trusty <P_II,432> and entierly belouid vnkel the Archebisshop of
Cauntirbury , the right noble prince my lord of Clarence , and other
lordes of oure blood , and also at the grete labour and enstaunce of
our moost dere and singler belouid wiffe , we be agreed that the seid
John Paston and his seid fellasship beyng in the seid manoir shall
depart and goo out of the seid manoir without delay , and make therof
deliueraunce to suche persones as we will assigne , the seid fellasship
hauyng their lyves and goodes , horsse and harneys , and other goodes
beyng in the keping of the seid John Paston , except gonnes ,
crosse-bowes , and quarelles , and alle other hostelmentes to the seid
manoir annexed and belonging ; and to haue xv dayes respyte aftir their
seid departing out to goo in-to what place shall like theim , without
any accions or quarell to be taken or made by vs or in our name to
theim or any of theim , within our fraunchise or without , duryng the
seid tyme . PASTON,II,432.464.11935

AUTHOR:JOHN_MOWBRAY_JR:MALE:_:1444:25
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:25
LETTER:PASTON_464:M4:1469:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Youen vndir our signet at Yermouth the xxvj day of Septembre the ix=te=
yere of King Edward the iiij=th= . PASTON,II,432.464.11936

AUTHOR:JOHN_MOWBRAY_JR:MALE:_:1444:25
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:25
LETTER:PASTON_464:M4:1469:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Norffolk PASTON,II,432.464.11937

{ED:789._FROM_DAME_ELIZABETH_BREWS_1476-7}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_III}

<font> To my wurschypfull cosyn John Paston be thys bill delyuered , &c
. </font> PASTON,II,434.465.11938

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_BREWS:FEMALE:MOTHER_IN_LAW?:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:SON_IN_LAW?:1444:33
LETTER:PASTON_465:M4:1477:COPY:FAMILY_OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Ryght wurschypfull cosyn , I recommande me vn-to yowe , thankyng +gowe
hertely for the grette chere +tat +ge made me +te last tyme +tat +ge
were wyth me at Norwych , &c . PASTON,II,434.465.11939

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_BREWS:FEMALE:MOTHER_IN_LAW?:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:SON_IN_LAW?:1444:33
LETTER:PASTON_465:M4:1477:COPY:FAMILY_OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And , cosyn , as for the mater +tat was put in my nowncle Hastynges and
Herry Heydon , I vndyrstond be myn vncle +tat +ter was made non ende
+terin , whech I am ryght sory for . PASTON,II,434.465.11940

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_BREWS:FEMALE:MOTHER_IN_LAW?:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:SON_IN_LAW?:1444:33
LETTER:PASTON_465:M4:1477:COPY:FAMILY_OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Cosyn , +ge be remembred what +ge promysed me , +tat and so were +tat
myn vncle and Herry Heydon made non ende +terin +tat +ge wold put the
mater in me ; PASTON,II,434.465.11941

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_BREWS:FEMALE:MOTHER_IN_LAW?:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:SON_IN_LAW?:1444:33
LETTER:PASTON_465:M4:1477:COPY:FAMILY_OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and if it please +gowe so for to do , jn good faith , cosyn , I schall
goo as wele and as ryghtfully and consciensly as I can for both the
partyes . PASTON,II,434.465.11942

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_BREWS:FEMALE:MOTHER_IN_LAW?:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:SON_IN_LAW?:1444:33
LETTER:PASTON_465:M4:1477:COPY:FAMILY_OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And , cosyn , if it please +gowe to com to Topcroft , and poynt +ge
what dey when +ge will com , I schall sende for my cosyn to be +ter the
same day . PASTON,II,434.465.11943

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_BREWS:FEMALE:MOTHER_IN_LAW?:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:SON_IN_LAW?:1444:33
LETTER:PASTON_465:M4:1477:COPY:FAMILY_OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And , cosyn , I pray +gowe to sende me worde agayn be the brynger of
thys lettur howe +ge will do , &c . PASTON,II,434.465.11944

LETTER:PASTON_466:M4:1477?:COPY:FAMILY_OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and broght me wurde +tat suche a chance fell +tat he myght not com at
the day +tat was set , as I schall let +gowe vndyrstond more pleynly
when I speke wyth +gowe , &c . PASTON,II,435.466.11959

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_BREWS:FEMALE:MOTHER_IN_LAW?:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:SON_IN_LAW?:1444:33?
LETTER:PASTON_466:M4:1477?:COPY:FAMILY_OTHER_CODE_METADATA
But , cosyn , and it wold please +gowe to com agayn what dey +tat +ge
will set , I dar vndyrtake +tat they schall kepe the same day ;
PASTON,II,435.466.11960

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_BREWS:FEMALE:MOTHER_IN_LAW?:_:_?

for I wold be glad +tat and myn husbond and +ge myght acorde in thys
maryage +tat it myght be my fortune to make and ende in thys mater
betwene my cosyns and +gowe , +tat yche of +gowe myght love o+ter in
frendely wyse , &c . PASTON,II,435.466.11961

same . PASTON,II,436.468.11977

{ED:793._FROM_WILLIAM_LOMNOR_1479,_28_NOVEMBER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_III}

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_LOMNOR:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:35
LETTER:PASTON_469:M4:1479:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To the ryght worchypfull John Paston , sqvyer , yn hast .
</font> PASTON,II,437.469.11990

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_LOMNOR:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:35
LETTER:PASTON_469:M4:1479:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
My Master Paston , I recomaunde me to yow , preyyng God to haue mercy
on my master your brothere sowle , to whom ye ar heyre , and also to my
mastras your grauntdam . Wherfore be th'auyse of my mastras your carful
modere , your brothere Edmond on Sunday next before Sent Andrew rod to
Marlyngforth , and before alle the tenauntez examyned on James , kepere
there for Will Paston , where he was the weke next before Sent Andrew ;
PASTON,II,437.469.11991

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_LOMNOR:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:35
LETTER:PASTON_469:M4:1479:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and there he seyd that he was not at Marlyngforth from the Monday vnto
the Thorday at eveyn , PASTON,II,437.469.11992

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_LOMNOR:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:35
LETTER:PASTON_469:M4:1479:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and soo there was no man there but your brothers man at the tyme of his
decese . PASTON,II,437.469.11993

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_LOMNOR:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:35
LETTER:PASTON_469:M4:1479:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
So be that your brothere dyyd sesid , and your brothere E. bad your man
kepe possession to your behoffe and warned the tenauntez to pay noo man
til ye hadde spoke them . So $me $semyth {TEXT:mesemyth} +tat is a
remyttire to your old taylyd titell ; comon with your concell .
PASTON,II,437.469.11994

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_LOMNOR:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:35
LETTER:PASTON_469:M4:1479:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA

, PASTON,II,437.469.11995

{ED:795._FROM_WILLIAM_LORD_HASTINGS_PROBABLY_1483,_26_APRIL}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_III}

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_HASTINGS:MALE:_:1430?:53?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:39?
LETTER:PASTON_470:M4:1483?:COPY:OTHER
<font> To my right trusty and welbeloued seruaunt John Paston , squier
. </font> PASTON,II,439.470.12022

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_HASTINGS:MALE:_:1430?:53?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:39?
LETTER:PASTON_470:M4:1483?:COPY:OTHER
John Paston , I recommaunde me vnto you . PASTON,II,439.470.12023

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_HASTINGS:MALE:_:1430?:53?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:39?
LETTER:PASTON_470:M4:1483?:COPY:OTHER
And where as I appointed and desired you to goo ouer vnto Guysnes to
yeue youre attendaunce and assistence vpon my brothre Ser Rauf
Hastinges in all suche thinges as concerne the suretie and defense of
the castell of Guysnes during his infirmyties , it is shewed vnto me
that ye haue full truely and diligently acquyted you vnto my saide
brothre in all his besynesses sithe youre commyng thider , whereof I
thanke you hertly . PASTON,II,439.470.12024

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_HASTINGS:MALE:_:1430?:53?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:39?
LETTER:PASTON_470:M4:1483?:COPY:OTHER
And as I conceiue to my grete comfort and gladnesse , my saide brothre
is wele recouered and amended , thanked be God ,
PASTON,II,439.470.12025

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_HASTINGS:MALE:_:1430?:53?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:39?
LETTER:PASTON_470:M4:1483?:COPY:OTHER
and soo I truste he may nowe spare you . Wherupon I haue writen vnto
him , if he may soo doo , to licence you to come ouer vnto me ayen ;
wherefore I woll and desire you , th'assent of my saide brothre had ,
to dispose you to come ouer in all goodly haste , aswele for suche
grete maters as I fele by youre frendes ye haue to doo here as to yeue
youre attendaunce vpon me . PASTON,II,439.470.12026

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_HASTINGS:MALE:_:1430?:53?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:39?
LETTER:PASTON_470:M4:1483?:COPY:OTHER
And youre retourne {TEXT:ye} shall be to me welecome .
PASTON,II,439.470.12027

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_HASTINGS:MALE:_:1430?:53?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:39?
LETTER:PASTON_470:M4:1483?:COPY:OTHER
From London the xxvj day of Aurill . PASTON,II,439.470.12028

as vppon Monday but only for Howre Lady Day ; PASTON,II,444.473.12047

for a servant of myne browt to me the sertente` . Werfor I pray yow
that +ge met with me at Bery , for be the grace of God I purposse $to
lye at Bery as vppon Tewsday nyght , and that +ge brynge with yow seche
company of tall men as +ge may goodly make at my cost and charge ,
be-syd that +ge have promysyd the Kyng ; PASTON,II,444.473.12049

{ED:802._ELIZABETH_COUNTESS_OF_SURREY_PROBABLY_1485,_3_OCTOBER}_CO DE

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_III}

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_HOWARD[N.TILNEY]:FEMALE:_:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:41?
LETTER:PASTON_474:M4:1485?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To myn ryght worshiepfull cosyn John Paston , esqvyer . </font>
PASTON,II,444.474.12053

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_HOWARD[N.TILNEY]:FEMALE:_:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:41?
LETTER:PASTON_474:M4:1485?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Myn ryght worshipfull cosyn , I recomawnde me hertly to you , thankyng
you of your greet kyndnes and lovyng disposicion towardys myn lord and
me at all tymes , which I pray God I may leve to see the acquytell
ther-of to your plesure , prayeng you of your good continuauns .
PASTON,II,444.474.12054

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_HOWARD[N.TILNEY]:FEMALE:_:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:41?
LETTER:PASTON_474:M4:1485?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Cosyn , I shewyd you myn mynde that I wolde have myn shildern to Thorp
, wher-in , God yelde you , it pleasyd you to sey that I shulde have
hors of you to help to conveye them thyder ; PASTON,II,444.474.12055

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_HOWARD[N.TILNEY]:FEMALE:_:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:41?
LETTER:PASTON_474:M4:1485?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
but now I vndirstonde myn Lord FitzWalter hath dischargyd myn lordys
seruauntys thens , affermyng vp-on them that they shulde have had
vnsittyng langage of the Kyngys Grace . PASTON,II,444.474.12056

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_HOWARD[N.TILNEY]:FEMALE:_:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:41?
LETTER:PASTON_474:M4:1485?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Cosyn , I trust that ye and all the jentilmen of the shire which have
had knowleche of myn lordys seruauntys kan sey that her-to-for they
have <P_II,445> not ben of that disposicion to be lavas of theyr tvngys
whan they had moore cause of booldnes than they have nowe .
PASTON,II,445.474.12057

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_HOWARD[N.TILNEY]:FEMALE:_:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:41?
LETTER:PASTON_474:M4:1485?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
I wolde not have thowght myn Lord FitzWalter wolde have takyn so
ferforth displeasure for the keepyng of x or xij men at Thorp ;
PASTON,II,445.474.12058

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_HOWARD[N.TILNEY]:FEMALE:_:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:41?
LETTER:PASTON_474:M4:1485?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
I woot weell ther exceded not iij mees meet , good and bad .
PASTON,II,445.474.12059

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_HOWARD[N.TILNEY]:FEMALE:_:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:41?
LETTER:PASTON_474:M4:1485?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
I trust all thow I weer a soel wooman to mayntene so many at the leeste
, what so evyr I dyde moore . PASTON,II,445.474.12060

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_HOWARD[N.TILNEY]:FEMALE:_:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:41?
LETTER:PASTON_474:M4:1485?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
I trustyd to have fowndyn myn Lord FitzWalter better lord to me , seyng
whan I was wyth myn lord of Oxenforth vp-on myn desyre and request at
that tyme made vn-to hym he promysed me to be good lord to myn lord and
me , wher-of I praye you to put hym in remembrauns , trustyng yit be
the meene of you to fynde hym better lord to me her-aftyr .
PASTON,II,445.474.12061

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_HOWARD[N.TILNEY]:FEMALE:_:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:41?
LETTER:PASTON_474:M4:1485?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
I have fownde myn lord of Oxenforth singuler very good and kynde lord
to myn lord and me , and stedefaste in hys promys , wher-by he hath
wonne myn lordys service as longe as he leevyth and me to be hys trewe
beedwoman terme of myn lyve ; PASTON,II,445.474.12062

<P_II,445>

{ED:803._FROM_JOHN_DE_LA_POLE,_DUKE_OF_SUFFOLK_1485,_20_OCTOBER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_III}

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_LA_POLE:MALE:_:1442:43
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:41
LETTER:PASTON_475:M4:1485:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To our trusty and welbeloued John Paston , shiriff of Suffolk
and Norffolk . </font> PASTON,II,445.475.12071

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_LA_POLE:MALE:_:1442:43
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:41
LETTER:PASTON_475:M4:1485:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
The Duc of Suffolk PASTON,II,445.475.12072

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_LA_POLE:MALE:_:1442:43
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:41
LETTER:PASTON_475:M4:1485:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Right welbeloued , we grete you well . PASTON,II,445.475.12073

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_LA_POLE:MALE:_:1442:43
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:41
LETTER:PASTON_475:M4:1485:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And for asmuche as the King our souereigne lord hath late addressed his
lettres of comission vndre his seale vnto vs , reciting by the same
that his Highnesse vndrestondith certayn his rebells associate to his
old enmys of Scotlond , entending not only to <P_II,446> trowble his
peax , the nobles and subiectes of $this Realme to distroy , their
goodes and possessions to spoyll and reward at thair liberties , but
also the <em> lawes of this </em> lond and Holy Chirche to subuert .
Our said moost drad souerayn lord , as a Cristen <em> prince ... of
</em> his said enmys and rebels to resist , hath assigned and comaunded
vs to do all maner <em> ... </em> and otheres defensible able to labour
, aswell archers as hobbyllers , to come before vs and charge them ,
<em> ... </em> armed and arayed euery man aftre his degre` and power ,
to attend vppon his person and vppon vs to do him $seruice in defence
aswell of the Chirche as of the said nobles and subiectes of this
Realme against his said enmys and rebels . PASTON,II,446.475.12074

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_LA_POLE:MALE:_:1442:43
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:41
LETTER:PASTON_475:M4:1485:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
We therfore wull , and in our said souereigne lordes name straitly
charge and comaunde you , that in all possible hast ye do this to be
proclamed ; and that all maner men able to do the King seruice , aswell
knightes , esquiers , and gentilmen as townships and hundredes , aswell
within franchesse and liberte`s as without , within the counties of
Suffolk and Norffolk , and that thay be charged to be redy at all tymes
, vppon an howre warnyng , and ordered according to the last comission
afore this , to attend vppon his Grace and vppon vs to do him seruice
whan so ever thay $shall $be {TEXT:shalbe} comaunded ; not failing
herof as ye wull answer at your perile . PASTON,II,446.475.12075

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_LA_POLE:MALE:_:1442:43
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:41
LETTER:PASTON_475:M4:1485:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA

{ED:805._FROM_MARGARET_COUNTESS_OF_OXFORD_1486,_19_MAY}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_III}

AUTHOR:MARGARET_DE_VERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:42
LETTER:PASTON_476:M4:1486:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To my right trusti and welbeloued John Paston , shrieve of
Norffolk and Suffolk . </font> PASTON,II,447.476.12079

AUTHOR:MARGARET_DE_VERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:42
LETTER:PASTON_476:M4:1486:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Right trusti and welbiloued , I recommaund me vnto you .
PASTON,II,447.476.12080

AUTHOR:MARGARET_DE_VERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:42
LETTER:PASTON_476:M4:1486:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And for as moche as I ame credebly enfourmed that Fraunceis , late
Lorde Lovell , is now of late resorted into the Yle of Ely to the
entente , by alle lykelyhod , to finde the waies and meanes to gete him
shipping and passage in your costes , or ellis to resorte ageyn to
seintuary if he can or maie , I therfor hertily desire and praie you ,
and neuerthelesse in the Kinges name streitly chargie you , that ye in
all goodly haste endevoire yourself that suche wetche or othir meanes
be vsed and hadde in the poortes , crekes , and othre places wher ye
thinke nescessary by your discrecion to the letting of his seid
<P_II,448> purpose ; and that ye also vse all the waies ye can or maie
by your wisedom to the taking of the same late Lorde Lovell .
PASTON,II,448.476.12081

AUTHOR:MARGARET_DE_VERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:42
LETTER:PASTON_476:M4:1486:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And what pleasur ye maie doo to the Kinges grace in this matier I am
sure is not to you vnknowen . PASTON,II,448.476.12082

AUTHOR:MARGARET_DE_VERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:42
LETTER:PASTON_476:M4:1486:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And God kepe you . PASTON,II,448.476.12083

AUTHOR:MARGARET_DE_VERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:42
LETTER:PASTON_476:M4:1486:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Wretyn at Lauenham the xix day of Maij . PASTON,II,448.476.12084

AUTHOR:MARGARET_DE_VERE:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:42
LETTER:PASTON_476:M4:1486:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Margaret Oxynford PASTON,II,448.476.12085

{ED:806._FROM_JOHN_LORD_FITZWALTER_1486,_19_SEPTEMBER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_III}

AUTHOR:JOHN_RADCLIFFE:MALE:_:1452?:34?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:42
LETTER:PASTON_477:M4:1486:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To my right wurshipfull cosyn John Paston , esquyer . </font>
PASTON,II,448.477.12086

AUTHOR:JOHN_RADCLIFFE:MALE:_:1452?:34?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:42
LETTER:PASTON_477:M4:1486:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Right wurshipfull cosyn , I recomaunde me to you , certifyeng you that
, where as I vnderstond ye haue distreyned Richard Caus of Hyngham for
issuez ronne vppon hym in th'Escheker to the summe of iiij li. and odde
syluer , I pray you that ye wull the rather for my sake shewe hym the
favour that ye may doo , savyng youre sylfe , and that ye wull not be
harde vppon hym but if ye kan by th'aduys of councell this next terme
fynde the meanes for youre discharge vppon youre acompte in th'Escheker
that than ye wull lete hym be so in reste and peas withoute more
paymentz for that cause ; the which I prey you to tendre the rather
because I fynde the seid Richard Caus at all tymez my trewe seruaunt ,
and I shall be as redy to the acomplyshment of all youre resonable
desirez , with Goddis grace , who kepe you . PASTON,II,448.477.12087

AUTHOR:JOHN_RADCLIFFE:MALE:_:1452?:34?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:42
LETTER:PASTON_477:M4:1486:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
At Attelburgh this Tuesday next before Seint Mathuz Day .
PASTON,II,448.477.12088

AUTHOR:JOHN_RADCLIFFE:MALE:_:1452?:34?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:42
LETTER:PASTON_477:M4:1486:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
+Gowr cosyn and frend J. Sieur FytzWauter PASTON,II,448.477.12089

moste content ther-for now in Marcce , son , in good faith it is so I
shal receyve no money of the revenowse of my lyvelode afor Mydsomour ;

so that I can not be of power to content ther-for , for the which I ame
right sory , PASTON,II,456.479.12102

were reson to leuey it vpon hym than ther where as is noon auctorite`
to leuey it vpon . Wherfore , cosyn , I pray you to be good mastire for
my sake to thies pore men which be the Kingz tenauntz , and to shew
them the fauour that ye may . PASTON,II,456.480.12117

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:45?
LETTER:PASTON_482:M4:1489?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And acording to the Kyng our souerayne lordis commaundemente late to me
addressid , I desire and pray you that ye woll in all godely haste upon
the sighte herof prepare youre-selfe to be in a redinesse with as many
personnes as ye herbyfore grauntid to do the Kyng seruyce in my company
diffensibely arayed , and therupon so to resorte vnto me in all godely
haste possyble upon a day warnyng , horsid and harnessid , to be at the
Kynges wayges . PASTON,II,459.482.12137

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:45

<font> To the right worshipfull and my right welbeloued Ser John Paston
, knyght . </font> PASTON,II,459.483.12141

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:46
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:45
LETTER:PASTON_483:M4:1489:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Right worshipfull and right welbeloued , I comaunde me to you .
PASTON,II,459.483.12142

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:46
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:45
LETTER:PASTON_483:M4:1489:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And for asmoche as it is certeinly vnto the Kynges grace shewed that my
lord of Northumberland , havyng the auctorite` to se the Kynges money
levied in <P_II,460> the north parties , had knowleche that certeyne
persones of comvnes wer assembled at Topclif and at a nother lordship
of his nygh to the same , sayng that they wolde pay no money , my seid
lord of Northumberland heryng therof , and that they wer but naked men
, addressed hym-self towardes theym withoute eny harneys in pesible
maner , trustyng to haue appeased theym . PASTON,II,460.483.12143

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:46
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:45
LETTER:PASTON_483:M4:1489:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Howe be it as hit is seid that he is distressed , and that they haue
taken hym or slayne hym , whiche the Kyng entendeth to punysshe . I
therfore desire and hertely pray you in all godely haste to be with me
at Hedyngham , there for to knowe more clierly the Kynges plesir in
this behalue . PASTON,II,460.483.12144

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:46
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:45
LETTER:PASTON_483:M4:1489:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Writen at Hertford the last day of Aprile . PASTON,II,460.483.12145

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:46
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:45
LETTER:PASTON_483:M4:1489:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Also I send to you a comyssion of licence to shepp corne , which I pray
you to do to be proclaymed in all haste . PASTON,II,460.483.12146

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:46
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:45

John Paston , knyght . </font> PASTON,II,460.484.12148

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:46
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:45
LETTER:PASTON_484:M4:1489:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Right worshipfull and right welbeloued counceilour , I comaunde me to
you . PASTON,II,460.484.12149

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:46
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:45
LETTER:PASTON_484:M4:1489:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And where as I vnderstand by your wrytyng that a grete shippe is
perisshed with you in thoo parties , and that ye haue ben gretely
occupied aboute the savyng of the goodes of the same , and that the
merchauntes therof ben disposed to put their wynes to sale , of the
whiche ye may by a ton for c s. and litel more ; I may by in this
cuntrey for iiij li . Wherfore if ye may by there eny better chepe , I
pray you to purveye for me such as ye seme neccessary .
PASTON,II,460.484.12150

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:46
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:45
LETTER:PASTON_484:M4:1489:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And for somoche as ye may nat be here with me at this tyme , I desire
and pray you to prepare and ordeyne your-self with as many men in
harneys as {with}_P ye godely may , to do the Kyng seruice in my
company at the Kynges charge and costes , so as ye and they may be with
me at Cambrige vpon Tewesday next comyng ; and that ye faile nat herof
, as my right especial trust is in you . PASTON,II,460.484.12151

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:46
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:45
LETTER:PASTON_484:M4:1489:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Writen at my castell of Hedyngham the vj day of May .
PASTON,II,460.484.12152

Oxynford PASTON,II,460.484.12153

<font> To my rytth worchupfull son Ser Jon Paston be thys byll delyvyrd
jn hast . </font> PASTON,II,461.485.12154

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_BREWS:FEMALE:MOTHER_IN_LAW?:_:_

LETTER:PASTON_485:M4:1490S?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_OTHER
Ryth worchupfull son , I recommend me on-to +gow and to my lady +gowyr
wyff , and thank-yng +gow harttyly for the grett labyr thatt +ge had on
Thorysday for me , and for +gowyr kynd-nes ; PASTON,II,461.485.12155

LETTER:PASTON_485:M4:1490S?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_OTHER
for and odyr had don asse +ge ded I had had my purpos , qwer-for I prey
God do be them asse they do be me . PASTON,II,461.485.12156

Son , I must prey +gow to hawe a dosseyn men in harnes wyth bowyss and
wepyn convenyent for them , thatt I may feche my stres ageyn .

me hartely to you . PASTON,II,462.486.12163

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:48?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:47?
LETTER:PASTON_486:M4:1491?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And forasmoche as for certayne especiall causes moving there be
sessions appoynted to be holden at Gyppiswiche the Friday sevenyght
aftre Estre , which shall be the xv day of Aprile , where I purpose
then certaynly to be , and to haue aswell the matere by-twene Ser
Edmounde Benyngfeld and Yelverton there to be harde and commenyd as
diuerse othre grete maters in that contrey necessary to be had in
comynycacion , I therfor desire and pray you that ye fayle nat to be
there the same day , bryngyng with you the forseide Yelverton ,
trusting that then suche direccion <P_II,463> shall be takyn in that
matere as can be thought resonable and to the weale of the parties ;
nat doubting but that Ser Edmound Benyngfeld shall be there in like
wise . PASTON,II,463.486.12164

LETTER:PASTON_487:M4:1491?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And where as I late receyued your wrytyng beryng date the xxvj day of
this present monthe , by the whiche I vnderstand that one Richard Calle
toke certeyne men of werre roovyng vpon the coste there ; and in
somoche as I vnderstand that they be vnder the obeissaunce of the Kyng
of Denmarke , I wolle and desyre you that ye delyuer theym vnto the
seid Richard Calle to take his avauntage of theym as prisoners , seyng
my dutee reserued in euery thyng , as my trust is in you .
PASTON,II,463.487.12170

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_III}

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:48?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:47?
LETTER:PASTON_488:M4:1491?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To the right worshipfull and my right intierly welbelouyd
councellour Ser John Paston , knyght . </font> PASTON,II,467.488.12174

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:48?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:47?
LETTER:PASTON_488:M4:1491?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Right worshipfull and right intierly welbelouyd councellour , I comaund
me to you . PASTON,II,467.488.12175

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:48?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:47?
LETTER:PASTON_488:M4:1491?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And where as I vndirstond by your writing to me delyuerid by this berar
, the roborye and dispoyling of certayn corvers of Holond and Selond
done by the shipp callyd the <font> Foole </font> , wherof Robert
Spenser was maister , aswell in herryng , vitayle , and takelyng , as
ye be enfourmyd by iij personnys of the same shippe , and of th'entent
and disposicion of the master and feleshyp of the same , whiche shewe ,
as ye write , that Barkeley , aswell with that shipp as with a prise
that he hathe bought late takyn of the Frenchemen , were disposid and
determenyd to do myche harme , wherupon ye haue indevorid you to breke
the same ; how be hit that the seid Barkeley hath be late with me and
found suertie in a c li. to answer to all suche demeanyng when he shall
be callyd , and therupon I wrote to you to suffre hym , his men , and
shippis to departe at libertie . Yet neuyrtheles , concidering your
large writing , I can nat be content in my mynde to suche tyme as I may
here bothe you and Barkeley to-geder ; PASTON,II,467.488.12176

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:48?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:47?
LETTER:PASTON_488:M4:1491?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
willing <em> therfore ... </em> kepe the shippys and goodys in suertie
and to be with me your-selfe <em> ... </em> well may , bryngyng with
you suche iij personnys as <em> haue ... certaynte` </em> of this mater
. PASTON,II,467.488.12177

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:48?

LETTER:PASTON_488:M4:1491?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA

gode , that ye then cause one of <em> ... </em> to shewe and clayme
ther owne . PASTON,II,467.488.12182

<P_II,468>

{ED:828._FROM_THE_EARL_OF_OXFORD_ABOUT_1491,_28_OCTOBER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_III}

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:48?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:47?
LETTER:PASTON_489:M4:1491?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To the right worshipfull and my right welbeloued counceilour Ser
John Paston , knyght . </font> PASTON,II,468.489.12183

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:48?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:47?
LETTER:PASTON_489:M4:1491?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Right worshipfull and right welbeloued counceilour , I comaunde me to
you , certifieng you that I wolde haue be right glad to haue had you ,
the iij persones that enfourmed you of Berkeleys demenyng , and
Berkeley togeder , to th'entent that I myght haue had ripe knowleche of
their demenyng , to haue shewed the Kynge at my comyng vnto his Grace .
PASTON,II,468.489.12184

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:48?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:47?
LETTER:PASTON_489:M4:1491?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Neuertheles , sith I vnderstand by your late wrytyng , to me brought by
the seid Berkeley the xxviij day of this present monthe , beryng date
the Monday next before Seynt Symond Day and Jude , that ther is nat so
grete defaute in the same Berkeley as ye by your former writinges to me
sent wend ther had be , and that the defaute , if eny be , is in one
Spenser , maister of the shippe belongyng to the seid Berkeley , and
that ye thynke also that such suretee as I haue take of the same
Berkeley is sufficient jnogh , better or more than nedeth for that
cause , and that in your mynde ye thynke he woll be of gode guydyng and
demenyng in tyme comyng , I woll and desire you that ye delyuer hym his
shippes , men , and goodes , accordyng to my first wrytyng to you sent
in that behalue . PASTON,II,468.489.12185

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:48?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:47?
LETTER:PASTON_489:M4:1491?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And Almyghty God kepe you . PASTON,II,468.489.12186

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:48?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:47?
LETTER:PASTON_489:M4:1491?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Writen at my castell of Hedingham the xxviij day of Octobre .
PASTON,II,468.489.12187

recommaund me to you . PASTON,II,472.490.12190

AUTHOR:JOHN_RADCLIFFE:MALE:_:1452?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:_
LETTER:PASTON_490:M4:1490S?:COPY:OTHER
And forasmoche as ther was appoynted a day that ye and my cousyn Heydon
, Ser Robert Brandon , the Kynges Attorney , and other of the
worschippfull of this schyre should haue mett her before this tyme of
Estren , jt was so longe or the Kynges Attorney was commen in-to +te
contre` , and the tyme so shorte , that it hathe ben thowght there
myght be non couenable tyme affore this ; wherfor they be agreed that
they and ye should mete her on Thursday next commyng .
PASTON,II,472.490.12191

AUTHOR:JOHN_RADCLIFFE:MALE:_:1452?:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:_
LETTER:PASTON_490:M4:1490S?:COPY:OTHER
Praying yow therfor that ye $will $be {TEXT:wolbe} her at that tyme ,
trustyng to Godes mercy that a right good wey $shall $be {TEXT:shalbe}
hadde betyx yow that all grugges and rancores $shall $be {TEXT:shalbe}
layd a-parte . PASTON,II,472.490.12192

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:_

And therfor , cousyn , I praye yow that ye wol not fayle for to be her
, PASTON,II,472.490.12193
