{ED:835._ELIZABETH_DUCHESS_OF_NORFOLK_TO_SIR_WILLIAM_KNYVETT,_SIR_
JOHN_PASTON,_AND_OTHERS_1495-6,_14_SEPTEMBER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_III}

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_MOWBRAY:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:52
LETTER:PASTON_491:M4:1496:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
<font> To my right entyerly and welbelovid frendys Sere William
Knevette , Sere <P_II,475> John Paston , Sere Robert Clere , knyghtys ,
the Kyngys Attorney , Phelippe Calthorpe , Richard Suthwell , and
Robert Suthwell , squyers , and to yche of theym . </font>
PASTON,II,475.491.12197

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_MOWBRAY:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:52
LETTER:PASTON_491:M4:1496:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Elizabeth Duchesse of Norffolk PASTON,II,475.491.12198

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_MOWBRAY:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:52
LETTER:PASTON_491:M4:1496:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Right entyerly welbelovyd frendys , I comaunde me to you .
PASTON,II,475.491.12199

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_MOWBRAY:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:52
LETTER:PASTON_491:M4:1496:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And for as moche as I vnderstande that Sere Harry Grey , that is the
verry owner and possessioner of the maner of Ketryngham , is nowe in
gret age and , as it is seide , of right seekely disposicion , and that
after his deceasse the right and title therof shall of right belonge to
my right welbelovid seruaunt Thomas Martyn and his nevewe and heyre of
blood and his eyre therof by reason of entaylys , what the seid Sere
Harry entendith to do therin I knowe not , PASTON,II,475.491.12200

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_MOWBRAY:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:52
LETTER:PASTON_491:M4:1496:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
but it rennyth in reporte that he is in purpose to disherite the seid
Thomas Martyn therof , contrary to all right and good conscience . In
eschuenge wherof I desire and pray you as hertely as I can that it wull
leeke you to be so good maistyrs to the seid Thomas as by your wisdams
and discrecion the seid Sere Harry by you or some of you may be moued
of conscience and of kyndenesse to his blood to haue regard to the seid
right , and not to do eny thyng +tat shuld be disheryson to his seid
nevewe , and to haue the more tender consideracion to your mocion for
that the seid Thomas is to dyuerse of you of kynne and aliaunce and to
many o+ter gentilmen within the shere in leeke cas .
PASTON,II,475.491.12201

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_MOWBRAY:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:52
LETTER:PASTON_491:M4:1496:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And for the consideracion +tat I haue that the seid Sere Harry and
Thomas his nevewe were of my lordys nere blode , whoes soule Jesu
pardon and assoyle , jt were to gret a pete` to see hym by disheryson
to falle to penury and pouerte wher by your good exortacion in
consideracion of the premissis , and mo odir by your wisdamys to be
remembred in the lif of the seid Sere Harry , suche inconveniences may
be better remadyed ; wherin ye shall not only do an almas dede and a
gret pleasir to God , but also to me for that blodys sake a singuler
pleasir , and cause me heraftir the rather to considir thynge that
shall concerne your resonabill pleasir , with Goddys grace , who euer
kepe you . PASTON,II,475.491.12202

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_MOWBRAY:FEMALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:52
LETTER:PASTON_491:M4:1496:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
At Erle Soham this xiiij=ne= day of Septembyr . PASTON,II,475.491.12203

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_III}

<font>

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_MOWBRAY:FEMALE:_:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:52?

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_MOWBRAY:FEMALE:_:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:52?
LETTER:PASTON_492:M4:1496?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Elizabeth Duches of Norffolk PASTON,II,476.492.12205

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_MOWBRAY:FEMALE:_:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:52?
LETTER:PASTON_492:M4:1496?:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
I commaunde me to you , thankyng you as hartely as I can for your
labour and substancyall serching owte of Thomas Martynz matyr , preing
you of contenuance and of your best aduyse therin how he shall breke
the matyr so as by your helpe and wysdam a frendely comunycacion may be
hadde , so as the matyr may be had in examynacion by suche gentylmen as
$shall $be {TEXT:shalbe} named by th'assent of bothe parties suche as
tendyr and love the wele of bothe parties and also the pees and
tranquyllyte` of the cuntre` , and loue to eschewe variaunce and
parties in the contre` ; wherin ye shall not only do a grete pleasure
to me but a grete dede of charyte` for the profight and ease of bothe
parties , and also a pleasure to God , who haue you in keping .
PASTON,II,476.492.12206

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_MOWBRAY:FEMALE:_:_:_?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:52?

peace in the shires of Norffolk and Suffolk , and also to the sheryff
of the same , forto put hym in possible possescion in such certayn
landes of his accordynge to the Kynges writt , I pray you therefor
hertely and of my blyssynge charche you that at this my poure request
and desire ye wole pute you in your faythfull devour , with o+tere
justices associete with you , to see the execuscion doon and
performyede accordynge to the saide writt . PASTON,II,477.493.12212

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_III}

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:56
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:55
LETTER:PASTON_494:M4:1499:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA

$knight , and Ser $Rauff $Shelton , knight , and <em> to either </em>
of them . </font> PASTON,II,477.494.12216

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:56
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:55
LETTER:PASTON_494:M4:1499:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Right trusty and welbeloued councellours , I comaunde me to you .
PASTON,II,477.494.12217

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:56
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:55
LETTER:PASTON_494:M4:1499:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And where the Kynges grace is lately acertennyed that th'Erl of Suffolk
is departid owt of this his realme , hys Grace hath commaundid me to
wryte vnto you that ye incontynent vppon the sight of this my writing
endeovour you to enquyre aswell of such persones as be departid ouer
with the seid Erle as of theim that accompanyed hym in his repayre to
the see and retournyd ageyn , or in any wyse were prevy to the same ;
and theruppon , in as goodly hast as {in}_P ye kan , to put them and
euery of them in suertie savely to be kept , and therof t'acerteyn me
to th'entent ye maye knowe his further pleasure in the same .
PASTON,II,477.494.12218

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:56
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:55
LETTER:PASTON_494:M4:1499:COPY:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And if ye $shall at any tyme herafter perceyue any suspect person nyghe
vnto the see costes which $shall seme vnto you to be of the same
affynyte` , than his Grace will that ye put them in lyke suertie .
PASTON,II,477.494.12219

<P_II,478>

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:56

And Almighti God haue you in his keping . PASTON,II,478.494.12220

{ED:842._THOMAS_HOWARD,_EARL_OF_SURREY_NOT_BEFORE_1490_OR_AFTER_15
04,_24_APRIL}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_III}

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWARD_I:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:_
LETTER:PASTON_495:M4:1490S?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
<font> To my right wourshipfull cousine Ser John Paston , knyght .
</font> PASTON,II,480.495.12223

<P_II,481>

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWARD_I:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:_
LETTER:PASTON_495:M4:1490S?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Right wourshipfull cousine , in right harty wyse I commaunde me vnto
you . PASTON,II,481.495.12224

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWARD_I:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:_
LETTER:PASTON_495:M4:1490S?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And wher I vnderstand by Thomas Hartforde , a bower of Norwiche , berer
herof , hath been putt to grete vexacion and trouble by oon Thomas
Hogan , scomaker of Norwiche , and +tat I perceyue ye haue hard the
matier depending in trauers bitwixt the saide parties , I $therfore
desire you +tat in the right of the forsaid Thomas Hartford ye $will
$be {TEXT:wolbe} vnto hym gode maistir , and the bettir for this myn
jnstaunce , as my singler trust is in you . PASTON,II,481.495.12225

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWARD_I:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:_
LETTER:PASTON_495:M4:1490S?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And wher I conceyue also +tat the same Thomas is noysed in Norffolke
for a Scotesman borne , ye shall vnderstande that I perceyue wele by
suche honest folkes as I haue hard speke within the citie of York that
the saide Thomas was bourne their , and his fathir +tere jnhabityng ,
and his godfathirs and mothers , +te which bee right honest persones ;
PASTON,II,481.495.12226

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWARD_I:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:_
LETTER:PASTON_495:M4:1490S?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and for that this is true and not feyned , ye shall vnderstand the
maiour of the citie of York and his brethern hath made grete jnstaunce
vnto me to writ for the saide Thomas , for whom I must nedes do because
+taye arr my nye neighbours , as Our Lord knoweth , who haue you in his
blissid saufegard . PASTON,II,481.495.12227

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:_
LETTER:PASTON_495:M4:1490S?:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Written in the castell of Shirefhoton the xxiiij=th= day of Aprill .
PASTON,II,481.495.12228

And where as Edmond Stanhawe , late baillif of Horford in +te countie
of Norffolk , owghte me at +te tyme of his disceas xxxvij li. x s. ,
<P_II,482> cousine , I desire and praye you to shewe you of good wille
and toward disposicion in +tis matier so +tat +te rather by your mean I
of +t'executours to +te Testament of +te said Edmond may in +tis
bihalue haue contentacion , and +tat it woll like you to yeue credence
touching +te premisses vnto my seruaunt and conseillour Thomas Jenney .
PASTON,II,482.496.12233

me as I am of you , to whom I biseche God to send good fortunes .
PASTON,II,482.496.12234

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWARD_I:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:_

and now at his comyng to me ye haue at your greate coste sent him to me
dressid in suche wise as is veray necessary for me to haue {in}_P men
apparailid . For the whiche your kindnesse I think my-selfe right moche
beholdin to do you a $pleasire and it moght lye in my power , whiche I
wuld right gladly do , as knowith Our Lord , whom I beseche to send you
moche hartis pleasire . PASTON,II,482.497.12240

LETTER:PASTON_498:M4:1490S?:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Ser , it is so that John Bakton graunted to John Trovy hes sone inlawe
hes mese with all the londes and tenementes , &c. , takyng of the seide
John Trovy viij marke of annuyte` yerly , terme of hes lyf ; wherupon
endentures were made and astate delyuerd . Vpon the weche I bargeyned
with Trovy , payng to hym for hes parte c marke and x , wherof he hadde
in hande iiij li. vj s. viij d. , PASTON,II,483.498.12244

and xv li. xiij s. iiij d. shulde be payd at such tyme as I had a
lawfull astate , weche was apoynted before Michelmes last past ; weche
is not yet don , wherfore he hath forfeted an obligacion of xl li. +tat
he was bounde in to me for the same astate . PASTON,II,483.498.12245

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:61
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:60
LETTER:PASTON_499:E1:1504:COPY:OTHER
Right worshipfull and right intierly belouyd , I commaund me hartely to
you . PASTON,II,486.499.12270

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:61
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:60
LETTER:PASTON_499:E1:1504:COPY:OTHER
And where as your broder William , my seruaunte , ys so troubelid with
sekenes and crasid in his myndes that I may not kepe hym aboute me ,
wherfor I am right sory , and at this tyme sende hym to you ; prayng
especially that he may be kepte surely and tendirly with you to suche
tyme as God fortune hym to be bettyr assurid of hym-selfe and his
myndes more sadly disposid , whiche I pray God may be in shorte tyme ,
PASTON,II,486.499.12271

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:61
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:60
LETTER:PASTON_499:E1:1504:COPY:OTHER
and preserue you longe in gode prosperite` . PASTON,II,486.499.12272

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:60

{ED:849._FROM_THE_EARL_OF_OXFORD_NOT_AFTER_1503,_15_SEPTEMBER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_III}

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:_
LETTER:PASTON_500:E1:1500S:COPY:OTHER
<font> To my righte trusty and righte welbelovyd counceillours Ser
Rauff Shelton and Ser John Paston , knyghtis . </font>
PASTON,II,486.500.12275

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:_
LETTER:PASTON_500:E1:1500S:COPY:OTHER
Righte trusty and righte welbelouyd counceillours , I commaunde me to
you . PASTON,II,486.500.12276

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:_
LETTER:PASTON_500:E1:1500S:COPY:OTHER
And forasmoche as one Thomas Charlys of Norwiche late hathe presentid
vnto me a bille of complaynte agaynste Symonde White , gentylman ,
dwellyng in Shotesham , shewing by the same suche wrongis as the saide
Symonde hathe done and daily dothe to the saide Thomas , as by the
saide bille , whiche I sende you with this , more playnely apperith ; I
therfor desire and pray you that ye woll do calle the saide parties
byfore you and <P_II,487> upon due examinacion had upon the mater
conteyned in the saide bille ye take suche direccion as may acorde with
righte and gode consciens , so as the saide Thomas Charlis heraftur
haue no cause to resorte to me complaynyng . PASTON,II,487.500.12277

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:_
LETTER:PASTON_500:E1:1500S:COPY:OTHER
And Almightie God kepe you . PASTON,II,487.500.12278

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:_
LETTER:PASTON_500:E1:1500S:COPY:OTHER
Writen at my castelle of Hedingham the xv daye of Septembre .
PASTON,II,487.500.12279

RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:_

<P_II,487>

{ED:850._FROM_THE_EARL_OF_OXFORD_NOT_AFTER_1503,_22_SEPTEMBER}

{COM:TO_JOHN_PASTON_III}

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:_
LETTER:PASTON_501:E1:1500S:COPY:OTHER
<font> To the right worshipfull and my right intierly welbelouyd
councellour Ser John Paston , knyght . </font> PASTON,II,487.501.12281

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:_
LETTER:PASTON_501:E1:1500S:COPY:OTHER
Right worshipfull and right intierly welbelouyd councellour , I comaund
me to you PASTON,II,487.501.12282

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:_
LETTER:PASTON_501:E1:1500S:COPY:OTHER
and hartely thanke you for your hawkes and also for your storkes whiche
I vndirstond that ye haue sent vnto me to my right great pleasure ,
acertenyng you that I wolde be right glad to se you in these parties .
PASTON,II,487.501.12283

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:_
LETTER:PASTON_501:E1:1500S:COPY:OTHER
Neuyrtheles I trust in short tyme , doing my pilgrimage to Walsingham ,
to se you in tho parties , and than to thanke you for your right gode
and louyng remembraunce whiche I well vndirstond by these and diuerse
otherys nat owt of your mynde ne forgotyn , whiche shall nat be in my
behalue forgotyn , by the grace of God , who haue you in keping .
PASTON,II,487.501.12284

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:_
LETTER:PASTON_501:E1:1500S:COPY:OTHER
Wretin at my castell of Hedingham the xxij day of Septembre .
PASTON,II,487.501.12285

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_PASTON_III:MALE:_:1444:_
LETTER:PASTON_501:E1:1500S:COPY:OTHER
Oxynford PASTON,II,487.501.12286

<P_II,491>

{ED:854._FROM_THE_EARL_OF_OXFORD_1486-9,_7_APRIL}

{COM:TO_EDMOND_PASTON_II}

<font>

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:EDMOND_PASTON_II:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_502:M4:1480S:COPY:OTHER
To my right welbiloued Edmond Paston , esquier . </font>
PASTON,II,491.502.12287

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:EDMOND_PASTON_II:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_502:M4:1480S:COPY:OTHER
Right welbiloued , I grete you wele . PASTON,II,491.502.12288

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:EDMOND_PASTON_II:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_502:M4:1480S:COPY:OTHER
And where as certein landes which late were the Lord Scales by title of
enheritaunce be discendid to me and to my welbiloued cousin William
Tyndale , it is accordid bitwixt me and my said cousin that the
profites of the said landes shall neither be taken by my resceiuour nor
his , but that an indifferent persone shall take and resceiue the same
profittes to the vse of vs bothe till suche tyme as a resonable
particion may laufully be made in that behalf ; wherfore aswele I as my
said cousin , hauyng speciall confidence and trust in you , desire and
hertly pray you to take the laboure and peyn atte oure costes and
charges to take and resceiue the profites of all the said landes to
oure vse and behofe , deliueryng alwey the oon moyte` of your resceites
to my resceiuoure and the other moitee to my said cousin Tyndale whan
so euer the said profites by you so shall be taken and resceiued ;
yeuyng you full auctorite` and powere by this my writyng to execute the
same . PASTON,II,491.502.12289

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:EDMOND_PASTON_II:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_502:M4:1480S:COPY:OTHER
Written atte Newe Market the vij=th= day of Aprill .
PASTON,II,491.502.12290

AUTHOR:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:EDMOND_PASTON_II:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_502:M4:1480S:COPY:OTHER
Oxynford PASTON,II,491.502.12291

<A-GENDER_MALE> <A-REL_HUSBAND> <A-DOB_---> <R_MARGERY_CALLE[N.PASTON]>

<P_II,498>

{ED:861._FROM_RICHARD_CALLE_1469}

{COM:TO_MARGERY_PASTON}

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:HUSBAND:_:_
RECIPIENT:MARGERY_CALLE[N.PASTON]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_503:M4:1469:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
Myn owne lady and mastres , and be-for God very trewe wyff , I wyth
herte full sorowefull recomaunde me vnto you as he that can not be mery
nor nought $shall $be {TEXT:schalbe} tyll it be otherwice wyth vs
thenne it is yet ; PASTON,II,498.503.12292

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:HUSBAND:_:_
RECIPIENT:MARGERY_CALLE[N.PASTON]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_503:M4:1469:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
for thys lyff +tat we lede nough is nowther-2 plesur to Godde nor to
the worlde , concederyng the gret bonde of matrymonye +tat is made
be-twix vs , and also the greete loue +tat hath be , and as I truste
yet is , be-twix vs , and as on my parte neuer gretter . Wherfor I
beseche Almyghty Godde comfort vs as sone as it plesyth hym ,
PASTON,II,498.503.12293

AUTHOR:RICHARD_CALLE:MALE:HUSBAND:_:_
RECIPIENT:MARGERY_CALLE[N.PASTON]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_503:M4:1469:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
for we +tat ought of very ryght to be moost to-gether ar moost asondre
; PASTON,II,498.503.12294

RECIPIENT:MARGERY_CALLE[N.PASTON]:FEMALE:WIFE:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_503:M4:1469:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_NUCLEAR
me semyth it is a m=ll= yere agoo son +tat I speke wyth you .
PASTON,II,498.503.12295

LETTER:PASTON_503:M4:1469:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_NUCLEAR

<P_II,502>

{ED:864._FROM_THOMAS_EARL_OF_SURREY_NOT_AFTER_1513,_4_DECEMBER}

{COM:TO_WILLIAM_PASTON_IV}

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWARD_I:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_IV:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_504:E1:1510S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
<font> To my cousyne William Pastone , esquier . </font>
PASTON,II,502.504.12362

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWARD_I:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_IV:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_504:E1:1510S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Cousyn Paston , I recommaunde $me vnto you . PASTON,II,502.504.12363

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWARD_I:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_IV:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_504:E1:1510S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And where as this somer ther was a hulke of Humborowe peryshed before
Wynterton , and be-cause that the men of the same was saved I myght not
clayme the same as a wrake but commaunded myn officers to restore the
owners to their shippe and goodes belongyng to the same , and sens that
tyme , as I ame enformed , Thomas Clere and Richard Palmer of Yermouthe
bought the hull and mastes with all other tacle and tymbre belongyng to
the said shippe ; after wiche tyme with a ragyng tyde parte of the said
shippe was cast on lande on your grownde at Castre , wiche ye withold
claymyng the same to be youres as a wrake on your grownde . <P_II,503>
Cousyn Paston , I mervaill ye so do , PASTON,II,503.504.12364

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWARD_I:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_IV:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_504:E1:1510S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
for $as $for {TEXT:asfor} wrake ye cane prove it none ,
PASTON,II,503.504.12365

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWARD_I:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_IV:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_504:E1:1510S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and if ye colde it ought to be myne and not yours ,
PASTON,II,503.504.12366

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWARD_I:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_IV:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_504:E1:1510S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
for I ame assuered ye haue no graunt of the Kyng nor of none of his
antecessours kynges of Englande to haue wrake on your owne grownd ,
wherfore in claymyng and witholdyng the saide goodes ye do not only
wrong vnto the owners of the same but vnto me , vnto whome all wrakes
of right appertayneth onles the owners of the grownde wher it commyth
on lande haue wrake graunted vnto tham by the Kynges lettres patentes .
Wherfore , cousyn , I require you to restore the saide Thomas and
Richard vnto thair goodes accordyng to right , so that they haue no
further cause to complayne vnto me for the same .
PASTON,II,503.504.12367

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWARD_I:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_IV:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_504:E1:1510S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And thus Our Lorde kepe you . PASTON,II,503.504.12368

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWARD_I:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_IV:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_504:E1:1510S:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Written at Kenyngale the iiij=th= daie of December .
PASTON,II,503.504.12369

AUTHOR:THOMAS_HOWARD_I:MALE:_:1443:_
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_PASTON_IV:MALE:_:_:_

T. Surrey PASTON,II,503.504.12370

<P_II,519>

{ED:873._ROBERT_HUNGERFORD_LORD_MOLEYNS_TO_WILLIAM_WAINFLEET,_BISH
OP_OF_WINCHESTER_1448,_13_JUNE}

AUTHOR:ROBERT_HUNGERFORD:MALE:_:1431:17
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WAINFLEET:MALE:_:1400?:48?
LETTER:PASTON_505:M4:1448:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
<font> To the worschpful fadyr in God and my ryth $gode lord the
$Bysshop of Wynchestyr . </font> PASTON,II,519.505.12371

AUTHOR:ROBERT_HUNGERFORD:MALE:_:1431:17
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WAINFLEET:MALE:_:1400?:48?
LETTER:PASTON_505:M4:1448:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Worshypful fadyr yn God and my rythe gode lord , as hertely as y canne
y recomaund me to your gode lordschyp , to the wyche plese hyt to wyt
<P_II,520> that y have resayvyd your letter ; by the wyche y
oundyrstond the dayely sute to your lordschyp as of Pastun as for the
mater betwyx hym and me , wer-yn also y fele that he ys wyllyd that
comynycasyon and trete` schold be had betwyxt hys counsayle and myne
now at Mydsomer ; to the wyche , my lord , y am at the reverens of your
lordschyp wel agreyd , and have send to my counsayle at Loundon aftyr
the seyng of thys your last letter as for the trete` by-twyxt hym and
me , and that thay schold yeve ful attendauns to the end of the mater
$by-twene the sayde Pastun and me as thow y were present wyth hem .
PASTON,II,520.505.12372

AUTHOR:ROBERT_HUNGERFORD:MALE:_:1431:17
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WAINFLEET:MALE:_:1400?:48?
LETTER:PASTON_505:M4:1448:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And , my lord , hyt were to grete a thyng , and hyt laye yn my pouer ,
PASTON,II,520.505.12373

AUTHOR:ROBERT_HUNGERFORD:MALE:_:1431:17
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WAINFLEET:MALE:_:1400?:48?
LETTER:PASTON_505:M4:1448:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
but y wold do at the reverens of your lordschyp yn las than hyt schold
hurt me to gretly , wyche y wote wel your lordschyp wol nevyr desyr .
PASTON,II,520.505.12374

AUTHOR:ROBERT_HUNGERFORD:MALE:_:1431:17
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WAINFLEET:MALE:_:1400?:48?
LETTER:PASTON_505:M4:1448:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And God for hys mercy have you , rythe worschypful fadyr yn God and my
rythe gode lord , yn hys blessyd kepyng . PASTON,II,520.505.12375

AUTHOR:ROBERT_HUNGERFORD:MALE:_:1431:17
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WAINFLEET:MALE:_:1400?:48?
LETTER:PASTON_505:M4:1448:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Wrytyn wyth my noune Chaunsery hond yn hast the xiij daye of June at
Teffaunt . PASTON,II,520.505.12376

<Q_PAS_C_1450_TC_WYELVERTON> <L_PASTON_507> <A_WILLIAM_YELVERTON>

<P_II,523>

{ED:877._WILLIAM_YELVERTON_TO_SIR_JOHN_FASTOLF:COPY_1450,_NOVEMBER }

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_YELVERTON:MALE:FRIEND:1400?:50?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:FRIEND:1378?:72?
LETTER:PASTON_507:M4:1450:COPY:FRIEND
My moste worshypfull and best betrusted maister , I recommaund me to
yow , thankyng yow for manye grete gentlenesse and kyndnesse that ye
hafe shewed vnto me and for the grete ease that I had of your man and
your horsys also . PASTON,II,523.507.12387

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_YELVERTON:MALE:FRIEND:1400?:50?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:FRIEND:1378?:72?
LETTER:PASTON_507:M4:1450:COPY:FRIEND
As for tydyngys owte of thys contree , here ys a merveyllous disposed
contree and manye evylle wylled peple to Ser Thomas Tuddenham and
Heydon , PASTON,II,523.507.12388

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_YELVERTON:MALE:FRIEND:1400?:50?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:FRIEND:1378?:72?
LETTER:PASTON_507:M4:1450:COPY:FRIEND
and but yff they been putt in comfort there by the meene of a gode
shyreve and vndreshyreve they may hafe remedye now by the ordre of lawe
, PASTON,II,523.507.12389

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_YELVERTON:MALE:FRIEND:1400?:50?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:FRIEND:1378?:72?
LETTER:PASTON_507:M4:1450:COPY:FRIEND
and ellys grete $jnconueniences arn lyke for to folowe there-off .
PASTON,II,523.507.12390

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_YELVERTON:MALE:FRIEND:1400?:50?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:FRIEND:1378?:72?
LETTER:PASTON_507:M4:1450:COPY:FRIEND
Therfor , ser , for the weele of all our gode contree meovyth the Kyng
, my lord Chaunceller and all othyr lordes as ye thynk best for thys
mater on thys behalf . PASTON,II,523.507.12391

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_YELVERTON:MALE:FRIEND:1400?:50?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:FRIEND:1378?:72?
LETTER:PASTON_507:M4:1450:COPY:FRIEND
Also , ser , yff they noyse me by thee meene of my Lord Scalys or by
onye othyr meene , or by onye bylle sewed by Brygg or by onye othyr man
by her crafft , that it please yow to sey for me yn savacion of my pore
worshyp , whych I wote well they may not hurt but they doo me wrong ,
to the Kyng , my lord $Chaunceller , my lord of Wynchestre , my Lord
Cromewell , and yn othyr places as ye semyth , that no credence be
yoven to myne hurt yn myne absence . PASTON,II,523.507.12392

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_YELVERTON:MALE:FRIEND:1400?:50?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:FRIEND:1378?:72?
LETTER:PASTON_507:M4:1450:COPY:FRIEND
Also , ser , that William Geney and Brayn , the clerk of the sessyons ,
ben hastyed hedreward aswell as they may . PASTON,II,523.507.12393

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_YELVERTON:MALE:FRIEND:1400?:50?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:FRIEND:1378?:72?
LETTER:PASTON_507:M4:1450:COPY:FRIEND
And , ser , my cousyn Paston and my brothyr Cleere can tell yow moch
more thyng that I shuld wryte off to yow and I had leysere ,
PASTON,II,523.507.12394

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_YELVERTON:MALE:FRIEND:1400?:50?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:FRIEND:1378?:72?
LETTER:PASTON_507:M4:1450:COPY:FRIEND
but I shall wythynne short tyme sende yow more tydyngys owte of thys
contree , by the grace off God , whych hafe yow yn hys holye kepyng .
PASTON,II,523.507.12395

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_YELVERTON:MALE:FRIEND:1400?:50?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:FRIEND:1378?:72?
LETTER:PASTON_507:M4:1450:COPY:FRIEND
By your old seruaunt William Yeluerton , Justice
PASTON,II,523.507.12396

<Q_PAS_C_1450_T_WYELVERTON> <L_PASTON_508> <A_WILLIAM_YELVERTON>
<A-GENDER_MALE> <A-REL_---> <A-DOB_1400?> <R_JOHN_BOKKYNG>
<R-GENDER_MALE> <R-REL_---> <R-DOB_--->

<P_II,524>

{ED:878._WILLIAM_YELVERTON_TO_JOHN_BOKKYNG:COPY_1450,_NOVEMBER}_CO DE

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_YELVERTON:MALE:_:1400?:50?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_BOKKYNG:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_508:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER
Worshipfull and right welbeloued cosyn , I comaunde me to you , prayng
you to recomaunde me to my Maistir Fastolf and thank hym in my name
hertily for his man and his hors ; and also for to meve hym for that we
may haue a good shereve and a good vndershereve that neythir for good
fauore no fere wol returne for the Kyng ne betwix partie and partie non
othir men but such as are good and trewe and in no wyse will be
forsworne , PASTON,II,524.508.12397

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_YELVERTON:MALE:_:1400?:50?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_BOKKYNG:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_508:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER
for the pepil here is loth to compleyne til thei here tidynges of a
good shereve . PASTON,II,524.508.12398

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_YELVERTON:MALE:_:1400?:50?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_BOKKYNG:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_508:M4:1450:COPY:OTHER

Thomas Denys ben hastid hydirward as fast as thei may ,
PASTON,II,524.508.12399

RECIPIENT:JOHN_BOKKYNG:MALE:_:_:_

<P_II,524>

{ED:879._THOMAS_LORD_SCALES_TO_THOMAS_GNATYSHALE_PERHAPS_1448-51,_
14_AUGUST}

AUTHOR:THOMAS_SCALES:MALE:_:1399?:_
RECIPIENT:THOMAS_GNATYSHALE:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_509:M4:1450S?:COPY:OTHER
<font> To Thomas Gnateshale . </font> PASTON,II,524.509.12411

<P_II,525>

AUTHOR:THOMAS_SCALES:MALE:_:1399?:_
RECIPIENT:THOMAS_GNATYSHALE:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_509:M4:1450S?:COPY:OTHER
Thomas Gnateshale , I wul +ge wite it was oute of my remembrance that
Paston hade put in my determinacion the discort betwene you and hym .
PASTON,II,525.509.12412

AUTHOR:THOMAS_SCALES:MALE:_:1399?:_
RECIPIENT:THOMAS_GNATYSHALE:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_509:M4:1450S?:COPY:OTHER
I was the more fauourable to your entent , PASTON,II,525.509.12413

AUTHOR:THOMAS_SCALES:MALE:_:1399?:_
RECIPIENT:THOMAS_GNATYSHALE:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_509:M4:1450S?:COPY:OTHER
but in so mych as I had forgete +tat beforesaid I praye you that +ge
suffre the cornes in mene hand til +tat I haue determined the mater
betwene you too be the aduis of lerned men whech han knowelich in such
causses ; the which thing I wul do in as short tyme as {in}_P may ,
wherof +ge shal haue knowelich . PASTON,II,525.509.12414

AUTHOR:THOMAS_SCALES:MALE:_:1399?:_
RECIPIENT:THOMAS_GNATYSHALE:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_509:M4:1450S?:COPY:OTHER
Writen at Myddelton the xiiij day of August . PASTON,II,525.509.12415

AUTHOR:THOMAS_SCALES:MALE:_:1399?:_
RECIPIENT:THOMAS_GNATYSHALE:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_509:M4:1450S?:COPY:OTHER
The Lord Scales PASTON,II,525.509.12416

<Q_PAS_C_1452_T_JCLOPTON> <L_PASTON_510> <A_JOHN_CLOPTON>
<A-GENDER_MALE> <A-REL_---> <A-DOB_---> <R_HENRY_TUDOR_VI>
<R-GENDER_MALE> <R-REL_---> <R-DOB_1421>

<P_II,530>

{ED:882._FROM_JOHN_CLOPTON_TO_THE_KING_AND_COUNCIL:COPY_1452,_MAY}

AUTHOR:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:HENRY_TUDOR_VI:MALE:_:1421:31
LETTER:PASTON_510:M4:1452:COPY:OTHER
To the Kyng and the lordes of his Councell PASTON,II,530.510.12417

AUTHOR:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:HENRY_TUDOR_VI:MALE:_:1421:31
LETTER:PASTON_510:M4:1452:COPY:OTHER
I John Clopton , shereffe of Norffolk , certifie that where oon John
Falyate and othre were take with-in the hundred of Blofeld in the seid
shire and led to the castell of Framlyngham in the counte` of Suffolk ,
I the forseid shereffe be the comaundment of my lord of Norffolk the
last day of Aprill receyved at the seid castell a bille of diuers
knowlech and confessyons which were enformyd me shuld haue be mad in
the presens of my seid lordes councell be Roger Chirch and othre ,
which the seid John Falyate , as it was enformed me , shuld haue
confessid to haue be trewe . After which bille receyved and be me red
and vnderstand , callyng be-for me the seid John Falyate and alle othre
that where examyned except the seid Rogere <P_II,531> Chirch in the
presens of diuers of my lordes councell there , I red to the seid John
Falyate the tale comprised in the seid bille seid be the seid Rogere
Chirch , demawndyng hym of the trought here-of ; wherto he answerd and
seid that he wust wele there was no wey with hym but deth and
there-fore as he wuld answere a-fore God he wuld sey the trought , and
seid that the substaunce of the tale told be the seid Rogere Chirch was
vntrewe and feyned and jmagyned be the same Chirch , and that he neuer
had knowleched that tale to be trewe . PASTON,II,531.510.12418

AUTHOR:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:HENRY_TUDOR_VI:MALE:_:1421:31
LETTER:PASTON_510:M4:1452:COPY:OTHER
Neuerthelesse he seid that he was with a felesshep gadered vnder
Possewykwode be the prokeryng of the seid Chirch , which feleshep whan
thei were all to-gedere passid not the nombre of xv persones ; and that
the seid Chirch was the furst that euer mevid hym for to come theder ,
seyng that he shuld haue feleshep j-nowe and do goode , for he was
balyffe of the hundred and be colour of his office he shuld send in men
j-now , and that he knew a gode name for here capteyn , that shuld be
John A-mend Alle . PASTON,II,531.510.12419

AUTHOR:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:HENRY_TUDOR_VI:MALE:_:1421:31
LETTER:PASTON_510:M4:1452:COPY:OTHER
More-ouer I the seid shereffe asked the seid Falyate if thei whan thei
were to-geder spoke of Paston and othre gentilmen named in the seid
bille to haue assisted hem , PASTON,II,531.510.12420

AUTHOR:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:HENRY_TUDOR_VI:MALE:_:1421:31
LETTER:PASTON_510:M4:1452:COPY:OTHER
and he seid pleynly nay , but that thei and othre thrifty men were
noysid be the seid Chirch and be his councellores sith the tyme of the
gaderyng of the seid feleshep , and neuer was spokyn of there .
PASTON,II,531.510.12421

AUTHOR:JOHN_CLOPTON:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:HENRY_TUDOR_VI:MALE:_:1421:31
LETTER:PASTON_510:M4:1452:COPY:OTHER
In like wyse seid othre that were examyned in the seid bille .
PASTON,II,531.510.12422

there he had the tenauntes before hym and toke astate and seison yn the
feffe` namys acordyng to the dede to your behofe .
PASTON,II,531.511.12425

and I shall hafe it of my suster yff I may . PASTON,II,533.511.12456

<P_II,533>

{ED:884._WILLIAM_WORCESTER_TO_SIR_JOHN_FASTOLF_1458,_PROBABLY_EARL
Y_MARCH}

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:1415?:43?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:80?
LETTER:PASTON_512:M4:1458:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
<font> To my ryght worshypfull maistere Ser John Fastolf . </font>
PASTON,II,533.512.12457

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:1415?:43?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:80?
LETTER:PASTON_512:M4:1458:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Ryght worshypfull ser , after dew recommendacion wyth all lowly
obeissaunce , please you to wete that ye shall know the gouuernance
here at Maister Paston commyng to yow more speciallyere then I can
wryte . PASTON,II,533.512.12458

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:1415?:43?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:80?
LETTER:PASTON_512:M4:1458:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
As to the Kyng , he ys to Berkamstede remeved , PASTON,II,533.512.12459

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:1415?:43?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:80?
LETTER:PASTON_512:M4:1458:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and it ys seyd my lordes Somerset , Exceter , Clyfford , and Egremond ,
that rode vppon Thursday last to the Kyng , they commen ageyn to London
; PASTON,II,533.512.12460

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:1415?:43?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:80?
LETTER:PASTON_512:M4:1458:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and the Lord of Northhumberland ys com to the Kyng at thys tyme after
the lordes departyng owte of London wyth iij m=l= or iiij m=l= peple ,
as it ys seyd , PASTON,II,533.512.12461

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:1415?:43?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:80?
LETTER:PASTON_512:M4:1458:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
but all toke to a gode pease , and reconysaunces made to kepe the pease
yn gret sommes tille Myghellmasse , that yn the meene tyme to make a
throw pease fynall , by meene of all the lordes .
PASTON,II,533.512.12462

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:1415?:43?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_FASTOLF:MALE:_:1378?:80?

{ED:888._FROM_WILLIAM_WORCESTER_TO_JOHN_BERNEY_1460,_JANUARY}

RECIPIENT:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:_:_:_

<font> To the ryght worshypfull John a Bernaye , scuier , at Castre
beyng . </font> PASTON,II,538.513.12475

<P_II,539>

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:45?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_513:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Ryght worchypfull ser , I recommaund me to yow .
PASTON,II,539.513.12476

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:45?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_513:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And the cause of my commyng and taryeng yn London ys forasmoch as I
obliged me by my lettre to be here now and to reken wyth all the
credytours that I caused my maister frendes , God blesse hys soule , to
be suertee for me for the cloth I made be bought for my maister
entierment . PASTON,II,539.513.12477

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:45?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_513:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
I dyd but hald the candell amonges you yn Norffolk ,
PASTON,II,539.513.12478

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:45?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_513:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
for I was not put yn fauour ne trust to commaund and yeve yn my maister
name and for hys sake a goune cloth to none of hys frendes , seruauntes
, or almesfolk , PASTON,II,539.513.12479

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:45?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_513:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
but most beg and pray as I were a straunger . PASTON,II,539.513.12480

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:45?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_513:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Yff I caused Maister Paston and myne oncle the parson that they hafe
such autorite` as they hafe , they ought be the fayner and desyrouse of
the contynaunce of myne autorite` , that ys as grete as theyrs or
gretter , whate so evyr Frere Brakle` or they sey ,
PASTON,II,539.513.12481

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:45?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_513:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and so it ys to opynly knowen of record . PASTON,II,539.513.12482

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:45?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_513:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Ser , I am the same man as ye left me , vpryght and yndyfferent for to
wille and do for my maister asmoch as my symple power may ,
PASTON,II,539.513.12483

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:45?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_513:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and hafe made no promysse to no man , PASTON,II,539.513.12484

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:45?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_513:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
ne thus avysed shall not tille I speke wyth the parson myne oncle ,
that myne affeccion ys to sey my hert moste vntoo rather then to such
as wold straunge me from my maister ys frendes and from the gode wille
and fauour of my gode maisters . PASTON,II,539.513.12485

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:45?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_513:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Tho that I hafe holp to be cherysed wyth my maister be now myne
aduersaryes ; PASTON,II,539.513.12486

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:45?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_513:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
there shewyth no gentlenesse of blode ne noble condicion yn that poynt
namely , &c . PASTON,II,539.513.12487

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:45?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_513:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Ser , who ought more halde wyth me yn reson more then my wyfys oncle yn
all maner causes be reson of myne alliaunce wyth hym , and namely yn my
maister cause that he ys bounde to me and I to hym for the trouth we
owe to our maister and the grete trust he hath put yn hym and me , and
obliged ws by othe ? PASTON,II,539.513.12488

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:45?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_513:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
A , allas that he or onye such shuld be so nakedly disposed to me where
I nevyr gafe cause . PASTON,II,539.513.12489

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:45?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_513:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
All myne aduersyte` , trouble yn my spyryttes , thought , and hevynesse
that I susteyn , ye know well whom I do and may wyte it .
PASTON,II,539.513.12490

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:45?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_513:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Suppose ye that such yefftes and grauntes my maister made to me for my
relieffe yn recompense of my seruyce , that I wille let it passe , and
my maister seruauntes , wyth hys pore kynnesfolk , so symplye rewarded
? PASTON,II,539.513.12491

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:45?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_513:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
I shall be for hem to my symple power as my maister charged me .
PASTON,II,539.513.12492

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:45?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_513:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Ser , at reuerence of God , and for the verray and faythfull lofe ye
hafe to my maister yn the yeeres and dayes that ye dyd hym seruyce yn
the werres , suffred prysonment and manye a sherp day for hys sake not
<P_II,540> rewarded , yhyt meove ye myn oncle the parson , and othyrs
havyng autorite` wyth hym , to peyn hem to do that at ys moste nede for
the helth of my maister soule and for the relieve of all Cristen soules
, and namely for the sustenaunce and encresyng of a comyn weelle .
PASTON,II,540.513.12493

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:45?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_513:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Hyt ys not a comyn proffyt to gefe manye blak gounys to such as nede
none of yeft , and namely yff they be yoven to my maister ennemyes as
som seyn there been , &c . PASTON,II,540.513.12494

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:45?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_513:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
I confesse me to yow , &c . PASTON,II,540.513.12495

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:45?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_BERNEY:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_513:M4:1460:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
As to tydynges here , I sende som of hem wreten to you and othyrs , how
the Lord Ryuers , Ser Antonye hys son , and othyrs hafe wonne Calix be
a feble assault made at Sandwych by Denham squyer wyth the nombre of
viij=c= men on Twyesday betwene iiij and v at clok yn the mornyng ;
PASTON,II,540.513.12496

<P_II,540>

{ED:889._THE_ABBOT_OF_LANGLEY_TO_MASTER_JOHN_STOKES_1460,_8_MAY}_C ODE

<font>

AUTHOR:NAME_UNKNOWN_13:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_STOKES:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_514:M4:1460:COPY:OTHER
To the ryght worchepfull sere , Mayster John Stokes . </font>
PASTON,II,540.514.12509

AUTHOR:NAME_UNKNOWN_13:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_STOKES:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_514:M4:1460:COPY:OTHER
Ryght wurshypful sere , I recomaund me to yow . PASTON,II,540.514.12510

AUTHOR:NAME_UNKNOWN_13:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_STOKES:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_514:M4:1460:COPY:OTHER
And for asmyche as it is informyd me +tat it was appoynted +tat alle
the executores of the wurshepfull knyght Sere John Fastolf , whos soule
God asoyle , shuld be at London as on Monday next comyng , of wheche
executores I am namyd for on , as I ondyrstond , wherfore , in as myche
as ye be ordenary and on of +te same <P_II,541> executores , I prey yow
tendre my laboure wyth-oute my comyng , be youre dyscrecyon , myght be
more profyt to the dede ; PASTON,II,541.514.12511

AUTHOR:NAME_UNKNOWN_13:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_STOKES:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_514:M4:1460:COPY:OTHER
for I conseyue it shuld be but charge to +te dede and lytell avayleable
, consyderyng +tat John Paston , squyere , and Thomas Howys , parson of
Blofeeld , schall come vp at +tis tyme , wheche were +te persones
a-boue all other +tat +te seyd Sere John Fastolf put in hys most
sengulere loue and trust and wold they shuld haue +te kepyng and
dysposecion of hys goodes as wele in hys lyue as after hys deseas to
dyspose for +te well of hys soule , and +tat non other namyd hys
executores but only they tweyn shuld haue ony kepyng or dysposyng of
ony part of hese goodes duryng ther lyues , and that alle other namyd
executores shuld supporte them and geue them to +te seyd John Paston
and Thomas Howys here good avyse in parformyng of hys desyre in that
behalue . Wherfor +tat it lekyth yow in ony thyng ye desyre me to do in
thys cause or matere to geue yowre feyth and credence to +te seyd John
Paston and Thomas Howys ; PASTON,II,541.514.12512

AUTHOR:NAME_UNKNOWN_13:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_STOKES:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_514:M4:1460:COPY:OTHER
and so desyred me +te seyd knyght feythefully to do , that knowyth God
, whom I be-seke preserue yow from alle aduersite` .
PASTON,II,541.514.12513

AUTHOR:NAME_UNKNOWN_13:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_STOKES:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_514:M4:1460:COPY:OTHER
Wretyn in +te Abbey of Langeley the viij day of +te monyth of May the
yeere of Oure Lord m=ll=cccclx . PASTON,II,541.514.12514

AUTHOR:NAME_UNKNOWN_13:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_STOKES:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_514:M4:1460:COPY:OTHER
Youre preest , Abbot of Langeley PASTON,II,541.514.12515

<P_II,570>

{ED:903._WILLIAM_COTYNG_TO_JOHN_COOK_FOR_RICHARD_CALLE_1469,_9_JAN
UARY}

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_COTYNG:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_COOK:MALE:_:_:_

<font> To John Cook , drapier of Norwich , and +tat he delivere or
sende +tis bille to Richard Kalle in all goodly hast , for +te matier
is of substaunce , &c . </font> PASTON,II,570.515.12516

<P_II,571>

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_COTYNG:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_COOK:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_515:M4:1469:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Welbelovid and trusted frend , I comaunde me to yow
PASTON,II,571.515.12517

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_COTYNG:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_COOK:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_515:M4:1469:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
and lete yow vnderstonde +tat this day in +te grey mornyng iij men of
my lord of Norffolk , as thei seide , with longe sperys haue take and
led awey iij good hors fro John Poleyn , on of your fermores at
Tichewell , and ledde hem a-wey , and haue bode hym come and trete with
my lord of Norffolk . PASTON,II,571.515.12518

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_COTYNG:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_COOK:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_515:M4:1469:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
It is gret pete` +tat ther is non other ordenaunce .
PASTON,II,571.515.12519

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_COTYNG:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_COOK:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_515:M4:1469:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
Thise pouere fermores are liche to be vndo ; wherfore atte vertu of God
sende tidynges in hast what we shall do , PASTON,II,571.515.12520

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_COTYNG:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_COOK:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_515:M4:1469:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
for swiche an opyn wrong vnremedied knewe I never , ne good and trewe
$men so vnkyndely vexed . PASTON,II,571.515.12521

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_COTYNG:MALE:_:_:_
RECIPIENT:JOHN_COOK:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_515:M4:1469:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER_CODE_METADATA
And ye helpe not this matier PASTON,II,571.515.12522

RECIPIENT:JOHN_COOK:MALE:_:_:_

for yow . PASTON,II,571.515.12523

<Q_PAS_A_1470_T_WWORCESTER> <L_PASTON_516> <A_WILLIAM_WORCESTER>
<A-GENDER_MALE> <A-REL_---> <A-DOB_1415?> <R_WILLIAM_WAINFLEET>

<P_II,583>

{ED:912._WILLIAM_WORCESTER_TO_WILLIAM_WAINFLEET,_BISHOP_OF_WINCHES
TER_1470,_17_MAY}

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WAINFLEET:MALE:_:1400?:70?
LETTER:PASTON_516:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
<font> To the ryght reuerent fader yn God my full worshypfull Lord
Bysshop of Wynchestre , and yn hys absence to my maisters Hervye and
Danvers . </font> PASTON,II,583.516.12526

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WAINFLEET:MALE:_:1400?:70?
LETTER:PASTON_516:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Please your gode lordshyp to wete that accordyng to your commaundment
and wrytyng I was at the maner of Tychewell , that standyth destitut of
a fermour , for to leete yt to ferme or ell to sett a man to approwe yt
to the best availle . PASTON,II,583.516.12527

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WAINFLEET:MALE:_:1400?:70?
LETTER:PASTON_516:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And at my commyng thedre , havyng a comunicacion wyth the olde fermours
and wyth the cheff tenauntys of that towne , they ne none othyr wold
take yt to ferme ne medle to occupye there tille vnto tyme that they
hafe your $wrytyng and a writyng vnder Ser John Paston ys seale
promyttyng and warauntyng that neyther the seyd Ser John Paston ne none
yn hys behalf , nother that none othyr havyng a rule late therebefore ,
shall not distreyn her catell and godes . PASTON,II,583.516.12528

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WAINFLEET:MALE:_:1400?:70?
LETTER:PASTON_516:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And as for Ser William Yeluerton or onye yn hys behalf I seyd I wold
vndretake and warant that none vexacion ne distreyneng shuld be made .
PASTON,II,583.516.12529

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WAINFLEET:MALE:_:1400?:70?
LETTER:PASTON_516:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Item , the seyd tenauntys seyd vnto me that because they were not
ensured to have yt yn ferme at Cristmasse last , or thereaboute , they
coude not make the londes redye yn erthes and tylyeng to do her
husbondrye vppon theyr londz to beere corn , hyred her londez to herye
and sowen yn othyr townes one myle $or ij myle from hem .
PASTON,II,583.516.12530

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WAINFLEET:MALE:_:1400?:70?
LETTER:PASTON_516:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Item , they seyden that they had delyuered vpp the culettys of chepe
and beestes for doubt of distreynyng that they had ghedered to pasture
vppon the mershes , and were bestowed vppon othyr pasturys yn othyr
lordshyppys , that they coude hafe no culettys to lay the pasture wyth
beestys . PASTON,II,583.516.12531

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WAINFLEET:MALE:_:1400?:70?
LETTER:PASTON_516:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Item , I seyd vnto hem that and theyr beestys breke and feede hem vppon
the maner londz the oweners of hem be lyke to be sewed and make amendys
for the trespasse , yn deffaut they wille not take the pastures to
ferme . PASTON,II,583.516.12532

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WAINFLEET:MALE:_:1400?:70?
LETTER:PASTON_516:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Item , yt was promysed that one called Bloy the yonger , late fermour
of that lordshyp , wold come to your lordshyp for remedye yn thys
behalf , whych owyth ix li. of money for ferme and most pay yt at
Pentecost next <P_II,584> by appoyntment made at Norwych at thys Pasch
, or to the assignees of Maister William Yeluerton , yonger , beyng
hym-sylf present , and to the assigne` of Ser John Paston .
PASTON,II,584.516.12533

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WAINFLEET:MALE:_:1400?:70?
LETTER:PASTON_516:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Item , my lord , a wrytyng wold be sent to the tenauntys from Ser John
Paston , knyght , that he ne none yn hys name make no distreynyng ne
manassyng or jnquietyng none tenaunt ne person that occupyeth the
londes ne pastures . PASTON,II,584.516.12534

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WAINFLEET:MALE:_:1400?:70?
LETTER:PASTON_516:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And as for my maister Ser William Yeluerton , I sent word to hys
maistershyp to hafe hys gode avyse , PASTON,II,584.516.12535

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WAINFLEET:MALE:_:1400?:70?
LETTER:PASTON_516:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and he ensured that none for hym shuld not vex , distreyn , ne jnquyet
hem from hens forward ; PASTON,II,584.516.12536

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WAINFLEET:MALE:_:1400?:70?
LETTER:PASTON_516:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and so I seyd pleynlye to hem . PASTON,II,584.516.12537

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WAINFLEET:MALE:_:1400?:70?
LETTER:PASTON_516:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Item , my lord , the costys and chargys that I hafe born thys x yere
day yn London and yn rydyngys when I awayted vppon the jnfynyte
processe of the decysyng of my Maister Fastolf testamentys yn the Court
of Audience that I am so yndebted and so vnpurveyed of goode to lyven
that I may not ryde ne contynew yn London , but am fayn to wythdrawe me
for my pore solasse to Cambrygge , that ys but a day jorney from my
pore frendes , and to eschew gretter costys to abyde there tille I may
be purveyed of a competent lyveng for me and such as I am constreyned
to kepe and fynde . PASTON,II,584.516.12538

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WAINFLEET:MALE:_:1400?:70?
LETTER:PASTON_516:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Hyt was promysed me and graunted xxv mark lyfelode o Ser John Paston ys
behalf of my Maister Fastolf londz , xx mark for evyr besyde v mark of
fee terme of lyfe ; PASTON,II,584.516.12539

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WAINFLEET:MALE:_:1400?:70?
LETTER:PASTON_516:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and I hafe not clerely viij mark . PASTON,II,584.516.12540

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WAINFLEET:MALE:_:1400?:70?
LETTER:PASTON_516:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And ovyrthat was promysed me xl li. worth lond yn fee for evyr , yn
acquytyng me yn the decysyng and tryeng of the varyeng of testamentys
before specyfyed ; PASTON,II,584.516.12541

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WAINFLEET:MALE:_:1400?:70?
LETTER:PASTON_516:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and whate I hafe do there-ynne I rapport me to the grete boke of the
processe yn the Court of my lord Cardynalle ys Audyence , and by hys
desyre vndre the fauor and supportacion of hys gode grace to abyde the
vtmost of the processe yn hys hygh Court to be determyned , as I wrote
to yowr lordshyp yn a papier in articles late before Pasch .
PASTON,II,584.516.12542

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WAINFLEET:MALE:_:1400?:70?
LETTER:PASTON_516:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And besechyng the Blysfull Trinite` yow preserf yn prosperous helth
long to contynewe . PASTON,II,584.516.12543

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WAINFLEET:MALE:_:1400?:70?
LETTER:PASTON_516:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Wryt at Cambrygge the xvij day of Maij A=o= Cristi .
PASTON,II,584.516.12544

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:WILLIAM_WAINFLEET:MALE:_:1400?:70?
LETTER:PASTON_516:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Yowr humble soget W. Wyrcestre PASTON,II,584.516.12545

<P_II,584>

{ED:913._WILLIAM_WORCESTER_TO_A_SERVANT_OF_WAINFLEET:DRAFT_1470,_J UNE}

<P_II,585>

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_11:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_517:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Forasmoch as because of your long taryeng that I came now to London ,
and vndrestand by my lord ys lettre that hys lordshyp ys purposed to
sende a man of hys yn-too Norffolk yn short tyme . I therfor desyre of
my lord to wete the day of hys rydyng , and whate day he wille ryde by
Cambrygge and so to Tychewell to approwe yt . PASTON,II,585.517.12546

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_11:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_517:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Item , hyt were exspedyent that Ser John Paston wryte an opyn letter ,
seled vndre hys sele knowen , to all the tenauntys and othyrs yn
generalle that he ne none yn hys behalf wille not distreyn , noye , ne
vex none tenaunt , fermour , officer , baylly , that fermyth , haldyth
, or occupyeth the maner of Tychewelle ne no part of yt , pastures
aswell as herable londz ; PASTON,II,585.517.12547

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_11:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_517:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and thys lettre wille make the men to be better ensured that the
tenauntys and fermours shall occupye her londz yn rest .
PASTON,II,585.517.12548

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_11:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_517:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Item , that an opyn letter be wryt yn my lord ys name to the seyd
tenauntys and fermours , officers , or mynistrours yn my seyd lord ys
name to warnty and vndretake that Ser William Yeluyrton ne none yn hys
behalf shall not distreyn , trouble , ne vex the seyd personys , &c. ,
ne none othyr , but and ony so doo my lord wille deffend yt laufully .
PASTON,II,585.517.12549

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_11:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_517:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And yff thys be doo , yn case the tenauntys wille not take the lordshyp
to ferme , then my lord ys man most for the best avaylle lete yt to
othyr men to ferme . PASTON,II,585.517.12550

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_11:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_517:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Item , that a waraunt be made to help shyt vpp and make the see bankys
before the pasturys of Tychewell that at hye spryngys the see brekyth
yn to the pasturs and destroyeth the pasture and also bryngyth the salt
sandes amongys the gras and makyth yt bytter , that the chepe wille not
feede hem vppon yt . PASTON,II,585.517.12551

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_11:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_517:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And the waraunt most be to the somme of iiij mark or v mark .
PASTON,II,585.517.12552

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_11:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_517:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Item , yn case my lord desyryth or thynkyth gode and exspedient that
hys seruaunt shall speke wyth Ser William Yeluerton yn that cuntree at
thys seson , as I can vndrestand he most be at Norwych before the feast
of Seynt John Baptiste . PASTON,II,585.517.12553

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_11:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_517:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And he can enforme best whate ys to be don ; PASTON,II,585.517.12554

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_11:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_517:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
yn case he hath gefe my lord ys avyce yn thys mater and yn othyrs
thyngys concernyng thys , so moch the bettere . PASTON,II,585.517.12555

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_11:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_517:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Item , ye may sey to my lord that Frere Geffrey Westvale shall be creat
doctor yn theologye at thys fest of Seynt John , whych was longyng to
my Maister Fastolf xx yer passed , of Iermuth conuent then .
PASTON,II,585.517.12556

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_11:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_517:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And Ser Thomas Howys promysed to help hym , the month before hys decese
, wyth my Maister F. godes . PASTON,II,585.517.12557

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_11:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_517:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
And the seyd frere wold hafe com from Cambrygge to my lord yn trust of
hys almes , PASTON,II,585.517.12558

RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_11:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_517:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
and I hafe letted yt for thys tyme . PASTON,II,585.517.12559

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_11:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_517:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
As yt please my lord here-ynne ye may bryng me word .
PASTON,II,585.517.12560

<P_II,586>

AUTHOR:WILLIAM_WORCESTER:MALE:_:1415?:55?
RECIPIENT:NAME_UNKNOWN_11:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_517:M4:1470:AUTOGRAPH:OTHER
Item , Maister Briston yn lyke wyse , Maister Spicer , and Maister
Stevyn trustyn vppon me , and dyuers othyrs , to speke to my lord for
relyeve , as ye know well ; and Thomas Fastolf , Milcent Fastolf , and
manye othyrs that make me noyed and werye . PASTON,II,586.517.12561

<P_II,595>

{ED:918._MEMORANDUM_BY_JOHN_WYKES_NOT_BEFORE_1473}

AUTHOR:JOHN_WYKES:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:UNKNOWN_RECIPIENT_5:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_518:M4:1470S:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Memorandum to enquere where +tat Will Cofe were enfeffed in Rothnall
Halle or in the lond purchased . PASTON,II,595.518.12562

AUTHOR:JOHN_WYKES:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:UNKNOWN_RECIPIENT_5:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_518:M4:1470S:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
To enquere of Tylerd ho was confersaunte wyth Will Cofe of Northcofe
a-fore the day of hys deth ij yere , j yere , di. , or a quarter , and
whethere ony of thoo knwe where any labour was to hym for to make any
astate therof , or of any othere londys , and what tyme and to wham ,
PASTON,II,595.518.12563

AUTHOR:JOHN_WYKES:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:UNKNOWN_RECIPIENT_5:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_518:M4:1470S:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
and yf they remembre non than I to remembre E. S.
PASTON,II,595.518.12564

AUTHOR:JOHN_WYKES:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:UNKNOWN_RECIPIENT_5:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_518:M4:1470S:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Item , what seale he vsyd in hys days , and in especyall iij yere
a-fore hys deth . PASTON,II,595.518.12565

<P_II,596>

AUTHOR:JOHN_WYKES:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:UNKNOWN_RECIPIENT_5:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_518:M4:1470S:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Item , yf Tylerd wer not a-boute hym to comen wyth Gernyngham and suche
as were a-boute hym . PASTON,II,596.518.12566

AUTHOR:JOHN_WYKES:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:UNKNOWN_RECIPIENT_5:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_518:M4:1470S:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Item , in case +tat it cann be vndere-stond that he made non astate ,
than lete Wodesyde goo to Robert Prymer in hys owyn name , sayng that
John P. ys hys gode mayster in hys mater and +tat he hath comaundyd to
gyte som gode thryfty man in Lovenlond or Metteford that my+gt enquere
and help in the mater , &c. , and that Wodesyde truste no man so well
$as hym . PASTON,II,596.518.12567

AUTHOR:JOHN_WYKES:MALE:FAMILY_SERVANT:_:_
RECIPIENT:UNKNOWN_RECIPIENT_5:MALE:_:_:_
LETTER:PASTON_518:M4:1470S:AUTOGRAPH:FAMILY_SERVANT
Item , to knowe yf Tylerd owe Wyll Bondys gode well or no+gt , and yf
he be endefferent then to breke of the mater that longe to G. H.
PASTON,II,596.518.12568

<P_II,611>

{ED:927._FROM_QUEEN_ELIZABETH_TO_THE_EARL_OF_OXFORD_1467,_25_JUNE}

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_YORK[N.WOODVILLE]:FEMALE:_:1437?:30?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:24
LETTER:PASTON_519:M4:1467:COPY:OTHER
<font> To oure right trusty and enterly beloued cosyn th'Erll of Oxn' .
</font> PASTON,II,611.519.12569

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_YORK[N.WOODVILLE]:FEMALE:_:1437?:30?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:24
LETTER:PASTON_519:M4:1467:COPY:OTHER
By the Quene PASTON,II,611.519.12570

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_YORK[N.WOODVILLE]:FEMALE:_:1437?:30?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:24
LETTER:PASTON_519:M4:1467:COPY:OTHER
Ryght trusty and entierly beloued cosyn , we grete you well , lattyng
you wete hou it is commen vn-to oure knowlege that where as +ge newly
entred vpon oure welbeloued Symon Blyant , gentilman , into the maner
of Hemnals in Cotton , descended and belongyng vnto hym by right of
enheritaunce , as it is seid , +ge ther-vpon desired the same Symon to
be agreable for hys part to put all maters of variaunce thenne
dependyng atwene hym and oon Sir John Paston , knyght , pretendyng a
title vn-to the seid maner , in-to th'award and jugement of two lenerd
men by you named and chosen as arbritrours atwene them ; and in case
that the same arbritrours of and vpon the premisses neither yaue oute
nor made suche awarde be-for the brekyng vp of Pasch terme nowe last
passed , +ge of your owne offre graunted and promysid vn-to the seid
Symon , as we be enformed , to restore hym forwyth <P_II,612>
there-vpon vnto hys possession of the seid maner . And how it be that
the same Symon at youre mocion and for the pleasir of youre lordshyp ,
as he seith , aggreed vn-to the seid compromyse , and ther-vpon brought
and shewed hys evydence concernyng and sufficiently provyng hys ryght
in the seid maner vn-to the seid arbritrours , and that they haue not
made nor yolden out be-twene the seid parties any suche award ;
PASTON,II,612.519.12571

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_YORK[N.WOODVILLE]:FEMALE:_:1437?:30?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:24
LETTER:PASTON_519:M4:1467:COPY:OTHER
yet haue not +ge restored the same Symon vnto hys possession of the
seid maner , PASTON,II,612.519.12572

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_YORK[N.WOODVILLE]:FEMALE:_:1437?:30?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:24
LETTER:PASTON_519:M4:1467:COPY:OTHER
but contynuelly kepe hym owt of the same , wich yf it so be is not only
to hys right grete hurt and hinderaunce but also oure mervaile .
Wherfore we desire and pray you ryght affectueusly that +ge woll the
rather , at the contemplacion of thees oure lettres , shew vnto the
said Symon in hys rightffull interesse and title in the seid maner all
the fauorable lordshyp that +ge goodely may , doyng hym to be restored
and put in-to hys lawfull and peasible possession of the same asfer as
reason , equite` , and good conscience shall require , and youre seid
promise , jn suche wyse that he may vndyrstond hym-selfe herynne to
fare the better for oure sake , as oure verray trust is in you .
PASTON,II,612.519.12573

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_YORK[N.WOODVILLE]:FEMALE:_:1437?:30?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:24
LETTER:PASTON_519:M4:1467:COPY:OTHER
Yeuen vnder oure signet at my lordes palois of Westmynstre the xxv day
of Juyn . PASTON,II,612.519.12574

AUTHOR:ELIZABETH_YORK[N.WOODVILLE]:FEMALE:_:1437?:30?
RECIPIENT:JOHN_DE_VERE_JR:MALE:_:1443:24
LETTER:PASTON_519:M4:1467:COPY:OTHER
Subskrybyd with +te Quenys hand . PASTON,II,612.519.12575
